original: gnas bsrung ba dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud las stong phrag gcig gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnas bsrung ba dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud las stong phrag gcig gsungs pa /
translated: The root tantra, which has one thousand chapters, explains the protection of the site, the accumulation of the collection of merit, and the accumulation of the collection of wisdom.

original: bsdus pa'i rgyud 'di'i le'u bzhi pa'i cha gcig gis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rgyud 'di'i le'u bzhi pa'i cha gcig gis bshad pa yin no //
translated: This condensed tantra explains it in one part of the fourth chapter.

original: de ltar rgyud 'bum pa'i stong phrag bcu rgyud 'di'i le'u phyed dang bzhis bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar rgyud 'bum pa'i stong phrag bcu rgyud 'di'i le'u phyed dang bzhis bshad do //
translated: Thus, the ten thousand chapters of the tantra are explained in four and a half chapters of this tantra.

original: le'u bzhi pa nas nyi shu'i bar gyi le'u bcu bdun gyis rtsa ba'i rgyud 'bum pa'i stong phrag bcu bdun gyi 'khor lo bshad do //
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa nas nyi shu'i bar gyi le'u bcu bdun gyis rtsa ba'i rgyud 'bum pa'i stong phrag bcu bdun gyi 'khor lo bshad do //
translated: The seventeen chapters from the fourth to the twentieth explain the retinue of the seventeen thousand chapters of the root tantra.

original: le'u bzhi pa'i de kho na nyid kyi man ngag gis rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang / le'u bcu bzhi pa rim pa bzhi pa bsgom pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang / le'u nyi shu rtsa lnga ba thig le bsgom pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa @120b gsum gyis rgyud 'bum pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim ba stong phrag gsum shad do //
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa'i de kho na nyid kyi man ngag gis rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang / le'u bcu bzhi pa rim pa bzhi pa bsgom pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang / le'u nyi shu rtsa lnga ba thig le bsgom pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa @120b gsum gyis rgyud 'bum pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim ba stong phrag gsum shad do //
translated: The perfection stage is explained by the instructions on reality in the fourth chapter, the perfection stage of meditation on the four stages in the fourteenth chapter and the perfection stage of meditation on the drops in the twenty-fifth chapter.

original: de de ltar na stong phrag sum cu tham pa bsdus rgyud 'di'i le'u nyi shu man chad kyis bshad do //
analyzed: de de ltar na stong phrag sum cu tham pa bsdus rgyud 'di'i le'u nyi shu man chad kyis bshad do //
translated: Thus the thirty thousand topics of the tantra in a hundred thousand lines are explained by the twenty chapters of this Condensed Tantra.

original: le'u nyi shu rtsa gcig pa nas le'u bdun cu'i bar gyis rgyud 'bum pa'i stong phrag lnga bcu bsdus rgyud 'di'i le'u lngas bshad do //
analyzed: le'u nyi shu rtsa gcig pa nas le'u bdun cu'i bar gyis rgyud 'bum pa'i stong phrag lnga bcu bsdus rgyud 'di'i le'u lngas bshad do //
translated: The fifty thousand topics of the tantra in a hundred thousand lines from the twenty-first chapter to the seventieth are explained by the five chapters of this Condensed Tantra.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na rgyud 'bum pa'i stong phrag brgyad cu ni bsdus pa'i rgyud nges par brjod pa'i rgyud bla ma 'dis bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na rgyud 'bum pa'i stong phrag brgyad cu ni bsdus pa'i rgyud nges par brjod pa'i rgyud bla ma 'dis bsdus pa yin la /
translated: Thus the eighty thousand topics of the tantra in a hundred thousand lines are included in this Condensed Tantra, the Uttaratantra, the Supreme Tantra of Esoteric Precepts.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang / las tshogs ni rgyud 'di dang phyi ma'i bshad pa'i rgyud rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang / sgyu ma chen mo dang / he ru ka 'byung ba dang / rig pa rgyu mtsho'i rgyud bzhis stong phrag nyi shu bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang / las tshogs ni rgyud 'di dang phyi ma'i bshad pa'i rgyud rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang / sgyu ma chen mo dang / he ru ka 'byung ba dang / rig pa rgyu mtsho'i rgyud bzhis stong phrag nyi shu bshad pa yin no //
translated: The completion stage of the root tantra and the ritual activities are explained in the four explanatory tantras of this and later tantras: the Vajraḍāka, the Great Illusion, the Origin of Heruka, and the Ocean of Spells Tantra.

original: de ltar na bshad pa'i rgyud kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud stong phrag brgya bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bshad pa'i rgyud kyis rtsa ba'i rgyud stong phrag brgya bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the explanatory tantras explain the root tantra in twenty thousand [verses].

original: rjod byed kyi rgyud de rnams kyi brjod bya'i rgyud ni gsum ste /
analyzed: rjod byed kyi rgyud de rnams kyi brjod bya'i rgyud ni gsum ste /
translated: The subject matter of those explanatory tantras is threefold:

original: rgyu'i rgyud dang / thabs kyi rgyud dang 'bras bu'i rgyud do //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyud dang / thabs kyi rgyud dang 'bras bu'i rgyud do //
translated: the causal tantra, the method tantra, and the resultant tantra.

original: rgyu'i rgyud ni gsum ste /🔽bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa dang / bskyed rdzogs gnyis ka bsgom pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyud ni gsum ste / bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa dang / bskyed rdzogs gnyis ka bsgom pa dang gsum mo //
translated: The causal tantra is threefold:🔽the cultivation of the creation stage, the cultivation of the completion stage, and the cultivation of both the creation and completion stages.

original: thabs kyi rgyud ni gnyis te bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi rgyud ni gnyis te bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The method tantra is twofold: the creation stage and the completion stage.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni gsum ste /
translated: The resultant continuum is threefold:

original: chos dang longs spyod dang sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: chos dang longs spyod dang sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: the dharmakāya, the sambhogakāya, and the nirmāṇakāya.

original: rgyud kyi don gsum po thos bsam gyis khong du chud pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi don gsum po thos bsam gyis khong du chud pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is to understand the three topics of the tantra through hearing and contemplating.

original: bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis bskyed rdzogs kyi don mngon du grub pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis bskyed rdzogs kyi don mngon du grub pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: The secondary purpose is to actualize the meaning of the generation and completion stages through the wisdom of meditation.

original: 'brel ba ni brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi rgyu las dgos pa'i shes pa bskyed pas de nyid las 'brel pa log shig na med do //
analyzed: 'brel ba ni brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi rgyu las dgos pa'i shes pa bskyed pas de nyid las 'brel pa log shig na med do //
translated: The connection is that the understanding of the purpose is generated from the cause of the expressed and the expresser. If that is absent, the connection is lost.

original: de ltar dgos pa'i don bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar dgos pa'i don bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the purpose in that way,

original: bsdus pa'i don ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni bzhi ste /
translated: the concise meaning is fourfold:

original: gleng gzhi dang gleng bslang ba dang rgyud 'byung ba'i le'u gsum dang / rgyud dngos so //
analyzed: gleng gzhi dang gleng bslang ba dang rgyud 'byung ba'i le'u gsum dang / rgyud dngos so //
translated: the nidāna, the introduction, the chapter on the origin of the tantra, and the actual tantra.

original: dngos la lnga ste /🔽le'u bzhi nas nyi shu'i bar ni dngos grub bsgrub pa'i 'khor lo bcu bdun no //
analyzed: dngos la lnga ste / le'u bzhi nas nyi shu'i bar ni dngos grub bsgrub pa'i 'khor lo bcu bdun no //
translated: The actual tantra is fivefold:🔽The chapters from the fourth to the twentieth are the seventeen wheels of accomplishing siddhis.

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig pa nas sum cu bdun gyi bar gyis ni dngos grub sna tshogs kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig pa nas sum cu bdun gyi bar gyis ni dngos grub sna tshogs kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The chapters from the twenty-first to the twenty-seventh are the various wheels of siddhis.

original: le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pa nas bzhi bcu rtsa bdun gyi bar gyis ni dngos grub kyi yan lag tshogs kyi 'khor lo bshad do //🔽le'u bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa nas drug cu rtsa gsum gyi bar gyis le'u bcu @121a * //
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pa nas bzhi bcu rtsa bdun gyi bar gyis ni dngos grub kyi yan lag tshogs kyi 'khor lo bshad do // le'u bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa nas drug cu rtsa gsum gyi bar gyis le'u bcu @121a * //
translated: Chapters 38 through 47 explain the feast-circle, which is a branch of power.

original: drug gis thun mong gi 'khor lo bshad do //
analyzed: drug gis thun mong gi 'khor lo bshad do //
translated: Chapters 48 through 63 explain the common circle in sixteen chapters.

original: drug cu rtsa bzhi pa nas le'u bdun cu'i bar gyis phrin las rnam bzhi'i khyad par gyi 'khor lo bshad do //
analyzed: drug cu rtsa bzhi pa nas le'u bdun cu'i bar gyis phrin las rnam bzhi'i khyad par gyi 'khor lo bshad do //
translated: Chapter 64 through 70 explain the special circle of the four activities.

original: de ltar bsdus pa'i don bshad nas /🔽yan lag gi don bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar bsdus pa'i don bshad nas / yan lag gi don bshad pa ni /
translated: Having explained the summarized meaning in that way,🔽the explanation of the branch meanings is as follows.

original: yan lag gi don bshad pa ni /
analyzed: yan lag gi don bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the branch meanings is as follows.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
translated: This is taught by “Thus have I heard,” and so on.

original: 'di'i bshad pa'i rgyud kyi le'u bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi pas bshad pa ni de nyid dang sbyar gyi 'dir mi blang ngo //
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa'i rgyud kyi le'u bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi pas bshad pa ni de nyid dang sbyar gyi 'dir mi blang ngo //
translated: The explanation of this tantra in forty-four chapters is applied to that, but it is not taken here.

original: lcang lo can gyi pha brang du sdud pa po lag na rdo rje la bla gos lnga brgya gdan du bting nas /
analyzed: lcang lo can gyi pha brang du sdud pa po lag na rdo rje la bla gos lnga brgya gdan du bting nas /
translated: In the palace of Alakavati, he spread out five hundred upper robes for the compiler Vajrapani and

original: 'phags pa kun du bzang phos ches kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i mdo //
analyzed: 'phags pa kun du bzang phos ches kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i mdo //
translated: turned the wheel of the Dharma of the sutra of the noble Samantabhadra.

original: bde bar gshegs pas gang du gsungs /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas gang du gsungs /
translated: Where was the sutra of the Dharma wheel turned by the sugata taught?🔽You of great wisdom, speak!🔽You who hold the vajra, speak!

original: shes rab chen po khyod smros shig / rdo rje 'chang ba khyod smros shig / ces gsol ba btab pa dang / sdud pa pos gleng bslang ba'i tshigs 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab chen po khyod smros shig / rdo rje 'chang ba khyod smros shig / ces gsol ba btab pa dang / sdud pa pos gleng bslang ba'i tshigs 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus he was entreated, and the compiler said, Thus have I heard.

original: de la 'di skad ni lag na rdo rje'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la rgyud kyi tshig dang sgro 'dogs dang skur 'debs bral bar snang ba la ae wam zhes bya'o //🔽bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag kho nas thos kyi brgyud pas sam /🔽'khor las sam sprul pa las sam /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ni lag na rdo rje'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la rgyud kyi tshig dang sgro 'dogs dang skur 'debs bral bar snang ba la ae wam zhes bya'o // bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag kho nas thos kyi brgyud pas sam / 'khor las sam sprul pa las sam /
translated: In this context, thus refers to the words of the tantra appearing free from exaggeration and denigration in the mental consciousness of Vajrapani, which is called evam.🔽As for I, it means I alone heard it, eliminating the four possibilities of having heard it through a lineage, from the retinue, from an emanation,

original: phrin gtang ba las ni ma yin no zhes bzhi gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: phrin gtang ba las ni ma yin no zhes bzhi gcod pa yin no //
translated: or from a messenger.

original: thos pas ni rang gis rtogs nas byas ba ma yin gyi sangs rgyas kyis gsungs nas thos pas gzhan dbang yin par ston to //
analyzed: thos pas ni rang gis rtogs nas byas ba ma yin gyi sangs rgyas kyis gsungs nas thos pas gzhan dbang yin par ston to //
translated: It is not that one has understood and acted on one's own, but that one has heard what the Buddha has said, and so one is dependent on others.

original: yang 'khor rnams kyis dus gang gi tshe thos /
analyzed: yang 'khor rnams kyis dus gang gi tshe thos /
translated: Again, the retinue asks, at what time was it heard?

original: ston pa gang las thos /🔽gnas ngag du thos /
analyzed: ston pa gang las thos / gnas ngag du thos /
translated: From what teacher was it heard?🔽In what place was it heard?

original: 'khor su dang lhan cig tu thos /
analyzed: 'khor su dang lhan cig tu thos /
translated: With what retinue was it heard?

original: bshad pa'i chos ci thos she na /
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos ci thos she na /
translated: What Dharma was explained and heard?

original: dri ba lnga'i lan du rgyud kyi gleng gzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: dri ba lnga'i lan du rgyud kyi gleng gzhi gsungs te /
translated: The reply to these five questions is the introduction to the tantra.

original: dus gcig na ni kun rdzob tu lan cig 'di thos la /
analyzed: dus gcig na ni kun rdzob tu lan cig 'di thos la /
translated: At one time, conventionally, this was heard once,

original: dus gzhan gyi tshe ni gzhan dag kyang thos so //
analyzed: dus gzhan gyi tshe ni gzhan dag kyang thos so //
translated: and at another time, other things were heard.

original: des na thos pa mang bar ston to //
analyzed: des na thos pa mang bar ston to //
translated: Thus, it shows that one has heard much.

original: don dam par na rgyud kyi don rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtha' yas pas dus kyi mtha'i skad cig ma gcig la rtogs te /
analyzed: don dam par na rgyud kyi don rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtha' yas pas dus kyi mtha'i skad cig ma gcig la rtogs te /
translated: Ultimately, the meaning of the tantra is realized in a single instant at the end of time through the infinite doors of liberation.🔽As it is explained:

original: de yang / blo gros chen pos mthong rnams kyi //
analyzed: de yang / blo gros chen pos mthong rnams kyi //
translated: The great intellect sees

original: rnam pa thams cad cig car des //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad cig car des // zhes bshad do //
translated: all aspects simultaneously.

original: bcom ldan 'de ni bdud bzhi bcom pas sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'de ni bdud bzhi bcom pas sam /
translated: The Bhagavān is the one who has conquered the four māras.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa drug dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa drug dang ldan pas so //
translated: because they possess the six qualities of sovereignty and so forth.🔽🔽

original: gang du thos pa'i gnas ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes pa phyogs thams @121b cad kyi dus thams cad ye shes lnga'i snang ba rigs lnga'o //🔽de'i 'khor lo rdo rje khro ba'i mkha' 'gro ni dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gang du thos pa'i gnas ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes pa phyogs thams @121b cad kyi dus thams cad ye shes lnga'i snang ba rigs lnga'o // de'i 'khor lo rdo rje khro ba'i mkha' 'gro ni dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The place where it was heard is “in the maṇḍala of all tathāgatas,” the appearance of the five pristine consciousnesses of all directions and all times, the five families.

original: mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni dpa' mo sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni dpa' mo sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The retinue there is the twenty-four heroes and the thirty-seven heroines.

original: de la rdo rje ni zag med kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de la rdo rje ni zag med kyi ye shes so //
translated: The vajra there is uncontaminated pristine consciousness.

original: khro bo ni zhi bas mi 'dul ba la mngon spyod kyi sku'o //
analyzed: khro bo ni zhi bas mi 'dul ba la mngon spyod kyi sku'o //
translated: The wrathful one is the wrathful body for those not subdued by peace.

original: mkha' 'gro ni zhi gnas kyi nam mkha' bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med bzhi'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ni zhi gnas kyi nam mkha' bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med bzhi'o //
translated: The ḍākinī is the space of śamatha, the four meditative concentrations and the four formless [absorptions].

original: lhag mthong gi nam mkha' ni sa bcu gcig gi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi nam mkha' ni sa bcu gcig gi stong pa nyid do //
translated: The space of vipaśyanā is the emptiness of the eleventh stage.

original: de ltar rtogs shing 'gro bas na mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma zhes btags so //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs shing 'gro bas na mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma zhes btags so //
translated: Since one goes by realizing that, it is called a ḍāka and a ḍākinī.

original: de'i dri ba ni mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs bye ba khrag khrig 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i dri ba ni mkha' 'gro dang mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs bye ba khrag khrig 'dus pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The retinue is the mandala of a billion hosts of dakas and dakinis.

original: gsang ba'i snying po ni 'dzam bu'i gling grub gsum ste /
analyzed: gsang ba'i snying po ni 'dzam bu'i gling grub gsum ste /
translated: The secret essence is the three continents of Jambudvipa.

original: nyan thos dang rnga rgyal ba dang / tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug la sogs pas mi rtogs pas na gsang ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rnga rgyal ba dang / tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug la sogs pas mi rtogs pas na gsang ba'o //
translated: It is secret because it is not realized by shravakas, brahmins, Vishnu, Brahma, and so on.

original: snying po ni longs sku las sprul pa'i sku'i dpa' bo dang dpa' mo bskyed pa'i gnas yin pas snying po'o //
analyzed: snying po ni longs sku las sprul pa'i sku'i dpa' bo dang dpa' mo bskyed pa'i gnas yin pas snying po'o //
translated: The essence is the essence because it is the place where the heroes and heroines of the nirmanakaya are generated from the sambhogakaya.

original: bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni lan cig de na bzhugs kyi dus gzhan gyi tshe na gzhan dag na yang bzhugs pas gcig gi tshig dang sdud pa po'i dus los lkog tu gyur pa 'das pa'i tshig tu bstan to //
analyzed: bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni lan cig de na bzhugs kyi dus gzhan gyi tshe na gzhan dag na yang bzhugs pas gcig gi tshig dang sdud pa po'i dus los lkog tu gyur pa 'das pa'i tshig tu bstan to //
translated: Abiding is the word for one time, and since it abides in other places at other times, the word once is taught as the word for the past, which is hidden from the compiler.

original: 'khor ni rgyud nyan pa'i ched du gsol ba 'debs pa'i 'khor te /
analyzed: 'khor ni rgyud nyan pa'i ched du gsol ba 'debs pa'i 'khor te /
translated: The retinue is the retinue of supplicants who listen to the tantra.

original: gnas der bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed thams cad kyi 'khor 'dus nas /
analyzed: gnas der bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed thams cad kyi 'khor 'dus nas /
translated: In that place, all the bhagavān tathāgatas as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges River gathered in the retinue.

original: ston pa po bcom ldan 'das sprul pa'i sku 'bras bu'i he ru ka thog ma skye ba dang tha ma 'jig pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings las byung ba'i dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la gsol ba btab po //
analyzed: ston pa po bcom ldan 'das sprul pa'i sku 'bras bu'i he ru ka thog ma skye ba dang tha ma 'jig pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings las byung ba'i dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la gsol ba btab po //
translated: The teacher, the bhagavān nirmāṇakāya Heruka of the result, supplicated glorious Vajrasattva, who arose from the dharmadhātu, which is without a beginning or end.

original: chos gang gi ched du gsol ba 'debs she na /
analyzed: chos gang gi ched du gsol ba 'debs she na /
translated: For what purpose did he supplicate?

original: kye bcom ldan 'das zhes bos nas /
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das zhes bos nas /
translated: Having addressed the Bhagavān,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug gi rdo rje khro bo'i mkha' 'gro nye shu rtsa bzhi tha dad pa dang dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug gi mkha' 'gro mang po'i dra ba'i tshogs rgyud 'bum pa'i stong phrag brgyad cu
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug gi rdo rje khro bo'i mkha' 'gro nye shu rtsa bzhi tha dad pa dang dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug gi mkha' 'gro mang po'i dra ba'i tshogs rgyud 'bum pa'i stong phrag brgyad cu
translated: the retinue supplicated the Bhagavān to explain the root tantra, which is the root of the tantras of the 84,000 dharmaskandhas, the 56 maṇḍalas of all the tathāgatas of the five families, the 24 different vajra-ḍākinīs of the wrathful ones, and the 84,000 dharmaskandhas of the net of many ḍākinīs of the 56 maṇḍalas.

original: gsal zhing nges par brjod pa rtsa ba'i rgyud bla ma ste /
analyzed: gsal zhing nges par brjod pa rtsa ba'i rgyud bla ma ste /
translated: The root tantra is the clear and definitive explanation.

original: 'jig rten pa'i gnyen po zhi gnas dga' ba bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin bla ma dang lhag mthong sgyu ma 'od gsal zung 'jug ston pa ni bla ma'i bla ma ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gnyen po zhi gnas dga' ba bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin bla ma dang lhag mthong sgyu ma 'od gsal zung 'jug ston pa ni bla ma'i bla ma ste /
translated: The mundane antidote is the concentration of the four joys of tranquil stillness, and the transcendent antidote is the illusion, clear light, and union taught by the guru.

original: de sems @122a * //
analyzed: de sems @122a * //
translated: The mind

original: can gyi rgyud la bskyed pa'i gnas yin pas ni snying po'o //
analyzed: can gyi rgyud la bskyed pa'i gnas yin pas ni snying po'o //
translated: is the essence because it is the basis for generating the transcendent path in the mindstream of a sentient being.

original: gsang ba ni rgyud 'bum par bshad pa byas slar snying po ngos mi zin pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni rgyud 'bum par bshad pa byas slar snying po ngos mi zin pa'o //
translated: The secret is that the explanation in the Hundred Thousand Tantra is not recognized as the essence.

original: bshad du gsol ni rtsa ba'i rgyud 'di nyid du bsdus nas bshad du gsol zhes 'khor phun sum tshogs pas gsol ba 'debs pas zhar la rgyud kyi mtshan bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad du gsol ni rtsa ba'i rgyud 'di nyid du bsdus nas bshad du gsol zhes 'khor phun sum tshogs pas gsol ba 'debs pas zhar la rgyud kyi mtshan bshad pa yin no //
translated: Please explain means please explain by condensing this very root tantra. The request by the excellent retinue is the explanation of the name of the tantra.

original: chos phun sum tshogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: chos phun sum tshogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The excellent dharma is the Bhagavān’s statement:

original: kye lag na rdo rje khro bo chen po'i bdag po ni sangs rgyas kyi sdud pa po khro bo'i cha lugs 'chang ba rnam par thar pa'i sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa ston pa'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: kye lag na rdo rje khro bo chen po'i bdag po ni sangs rgyas kyi sdud pa po khro bo'i cha lugs 'chang ba rnam par thar pa'i sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa ston pa'i bdag po'o //
translated: “O Vajrapāṇi, the lord of great wrath is the compiler of the buddhas, who wears the attire of wrath, and is the lord who teaches the inconceivable door of liberation.”

original: 'khor rnam pa sna tshogs ni rdo rje gtsug tor dang rdo rje mdzod spu la sogs pa rdo rje rtse mo'i rgyud las rdo rje 'chang nyi shu rtsa drug bshad pa dang bcas pa nyon cig ces bod pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor rnam pa sna tshogs ni rdo rje gtsug tor dang rdo rje mdzod spu la sogs pa rdo rje rtse mo'i rgyud las rdo rje 'chang nyi shu rtsa drug bshad pa dang bcas pa nyon cig ces bod pa'o //
translated: The retinue is of various kinds, including the Vajra Uṣṇīṣa, the Vajra Urṇa, and so forth, together with the twenty-six Vajradharas explained in the Vajraśekhara Tantra.

original: ci mnyan zhe na /
analyzed: ci mnyan zhe na /
translated: What is to be listened to?🔽The Dharma Body of display, the Enjoyment Body of emanation, and the Emanation Body of radiation.🔽Listen well, abandoning non-realization like a vessel turned upside down.

original: rnam par rol pa chos kyi sku dang / rnam par 'phrul pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / 'phro ba sprul pa'i sku bshad kyis snod kha sbubs pa lta bu'i mi rtogs pa spongs la legs par nyon cig / snod zhabs rdo lta bu'i log rtogs spongs la rab tu nyon //
analyzed: rnam par rol pa chos kyi sku dang / rnam par 'phrul pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / 'phro ba sprul pa'i sku bshad kyis snod kha sbubs pa lta bu'i mi rtogs pa spongs la legs par nyon cig / snod zhabs rdo lta bu'i log rtogs spongs la rab tu nyon //
translated: Listen well, abandoning wrong understanding like a vessel with a hole in the bottom.

original: snod dri ma can lta bu'i the tshom spangs la la zung shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: snod dri ma can lta bu'i the tshom spangs la la zung shig ces pa'o //
translated: Listen well, abandoning doubt like a dirty vessel.

original: sde ltar gleng gi phun sum tshogs pa lnga bshad nas /
analyzed: sde ltar gleng gi phun sum tshogs pa lnga bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the five perfections of the introduction,

original: de la rgyud 'chad par skabs 'byed pa ni //
analyzed: de la rgyud 'chad par skabs 'byed pa ni //
translated: the request to explain the tantra is as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'khor thams cad kyis legs so zhes gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'khor thams cad kyis legs so zhes gsol te /
translated: All the retinues said, Excellent! to the Bhagavān.

original: lag na rdo rje 'khor rdo rje gtsug tor la sogs pa dang bcas pa thal mo sbyar nas 'dud pa la /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje 'khor rdo rje gtsug tor la sogs pa dang bcas pa thal mo sbyar nas 'dud pa la /
translated: Vajrapani, together with the retinue of Vajrosnisa and so forth, joined his palms in supplication.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin no zhes mtshams sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin no zhes mtshams sbyar ro //
translated: The Bhagavat spoke.

original: le'u dang po'i rgyud kyi dgos 'brel gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: le'u dang po'i rgyud kyi dgos 'brel gsungs pa ni /
translated: The purpose of the tantra of the first chapter is stated:

original: de nas gsang ba bshad bya ba ni 'khor gyi bsam pa la ltos pa'i de nas so //
analyzed: de nas gsang ba bshad bya ba ni 'khor gyi bsam pa la ltos pa'i de nas so //
translated: Then, the secret to be explained is the “then” in terms of the thought of the retinue.

original: gsang ba ni bskyed rdzogs gnyis kyi brjod pa mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni bskyed rdzogs gnyis kyi brjod pa mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The secret is the brief indication of the expression of the two, creation and completion.

original: bshad bya ni slob mas khong du chud par bya sgra'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: bshad bya ni slob mas khong du chud par bya sgra'i dgos pa'o //
translated: The “to be explained” is the purpose of the words to be understood by the disciples.

original: mdor bsdus pa ste rgyas min ni le'u 'bum pa las mdor bsdus nas shlo ka 'bum pa las bskyungs pas na rgyas par ma yin pa ste rjod byed bstan to //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ste rgyas min ni le'u 'bum pa las mdor bsdus nas shlo ka 'bum pa las bskyungs pas na rgyas par ma yin pa ste rjod byed bstan to //
translated: The “brief” and “not extensive” is the brief summary from the one hundred thousand chapter, since it is extracted from the one hundred thousand shlokas, it is not extensive. The expression is indicated.

original: brjod bya'i rgyas bshad ni dpal he ru ka yang dag sbyor te /
analyzed: brjod bya'i rgyas bshad ni dpal he ru ka yang dag sbyor te /
translated: The extensive explanation of the expressed is the glorious Heruka’s perfect union.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i he ru ka longs sku dang sprul sku'i zlos gar bsgom pa dang / rdzogs pa'i @122b rim pa chos kyi sku'i he ru ka'i zlos gang bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i he ru ka longs sku dang sprul sku'i zlos gar bsgom pa dang / rdzogs pa'i @122b rim pa chos kyi sku'i he ru ka'i zlos gang bsgom pa'o //
translated: The yoga of the creation stage is the meditation on the emanation of the heruka of the enjoyment body and the emanation of the heruka of the emanation body.🔽The yoga of the completion stage is the meditation on the emanation of the heruka of the truth body.

original: yang dag sbyor ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yul lha mo'i gzugs dang / las kyi phyag rgya dang chos kyi phyag rgya dang dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams so //
analyzed: yang dag sbyor ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yul lha mo'i gzugs dang / las kyi phyag rgya dang chos kyi phyag rgya dang dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams so //
translated: The yoga of union is the object of the creation stage, the form of the goddess, the action seal, the doctrine seal, and the pledge seal.

original: rdzogs rim chos kyi sku ye shes kyi yul sgyu ma'i dpe brgyad phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: rdzogs rim chos kyi sku ye shes kyi yul sgyu ma'i dpe brgyad phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: The yoga of the completion stage is the object of the truth body, the pristine awareness, the great seal, the eight examples of illusion.

original: yang dag sbyor ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbus nyi khri chig stong drug brgya bkag /'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam par rtog pa rang bzhin brgyad cu bkag nas bsam gtan dang zag med kyi sngom pa bde ba mchog la sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag sbyor ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbus nyi khri chig stong drug brgya bkag /'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam par rtog pa rang bzhin brgyad cu bkag nas bsam gtan dang zag med kyi sngom pa bde ba mchog la sbyor ba ni /
translated: The yoga of union is the union with the supreme bliss, the cessation of the twenty-one thousand six hundred desires of the desire realm, and the cessation of the eighty natural thoughts of the desire realm.

original: bde mchog gi rnal 'byor te gsang ba'o //
analyzed: bde mchog gi rnal 'byor te gsang ba'o //
translated: The yoga of union is the supreme bliss, the supreme secret.

original: 'dod pa'i don kun gyi ni bsod nams kyi las kyi 'bras bu 'dod khams kyi mi lha dang 'khor los sgyur ba 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don kun gyi ni bsod nams kyi las kyi 'bras bu 'dod khams kyi mi lha dang 'khor los sgyur ba 'grub pa'o //
translated: The result of the karma of meritorious action is the accomplishment of the human and divine states of the desire realm, and of the universal emperors.

original: thun mong gi dngos grub ni mi gyo ba'i las kyi 'bras bu mngon bar shes pa lnga'o //
analyzed: thun mong gi dngos grub ni mi gyo ba'i las kyi 'bras bu mngon bar shes pa lnga'o //
translated: The common spiritual powers are the five superknowledges, the result of the karma of unshakable action.

original: mchog gi dngos grub ni zag med kyi las kyi 'bras bu sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mchog gi dngos grub ni zag med kyi las kyi 'bras bu sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes so //
translated: The supreme spiritual powers are the gnosis of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the result of the karma of the undefiled state.

original: de ltar rgyud kyi dgos 'brel bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar rgyud kyi dgos 'brel bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the purpose and connection of the tantra in that way,

original: mtshan bshad pa ni bla ma ni bla ma zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi bla ma las lhag mthong gi bla ma khyad par du gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan bshad pa ni bla ma ni bla ma zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi bla ma las lhag mthong gi bla ma khyad par du gyur ba'o //
translated: the explanation of the title is as follows: Guru is a guru who is superior to a guru of shamatha.

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sngom ba ni rtsa'i 'khor lo dang / rlung gi 'khor lo dang / sems kyi 'khor lo gnyis kyi tshogs ni dra ba'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sngom ba ni rtsa'i 'khor lo dang / rlung gi 'khor lo dang / sems kyi 'khor lo gnyis kyi tshogs ni dra ba'o //
translated: The dakini’s net is the assembly of the two wheels of the nadis and the wheel of the prana, which is the net.

original: sngom pa ni bsam gtan dang zag med kyi sngom pa ste /
analyzed: sngom pa ni bsam gtan dang zag med kyi sngom pa ste /
translated: The vow is the vow of dhyana and the undefiled vow.

original: rtsa dang rlung dang sems las bde ba mchog 'grub pas na mkha' 'gro ma dra ba'i sngom pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa dang rlung dang sems las bde ba mchog 'grub pas na mkha' 'gro ma dra ba'i sngom pa'o //
translated: Since the supreme bliss is accomplished from the channels, winds, and mind, it is the binding of the dakini net.

original: don de dang ldan pa'i mtshan bshad pa'o //
analyzed: don de dang ldan pa'i mtshan bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the name endowed with that meaning.

original: de ltar mtshan bshad nas rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi gleng gzhi bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan bshad nas rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi gleng gzhi bshad pa ni /
translated: Having explained the name in that way, the explanation of the nidana of the root tantra is as follows:

original: gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na //🔽zhes pa ni gnas te gsang ba ni dga' ba'i gnas so //🔽mchog ni mchog dga'i gnas so //
analyzed: gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na // zhes pa ni gnas te gsang ba ni dga' ba'i gnas so // mchog ni mchog dga'i gnas so //
translated: In the place of supreme bliss,

original: dgyes pa ni lhan cig skyes dga'i gnas te 'dzam bu'i gling gru gsum na bzhugs ba'o //
analyzed: dgyes pa ni lhan cig skyes dga'i gnas te 'dzam bu'i gling gru gsum na bzhugs ba'o //
translated: the place is the place of joy, the supreme place of supreme joy, and the place of innate joy, abiding in the triangular Jambudvipa.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ni 'khor te /
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ni 'khor te /
translated: The retinue is the nature of all,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ris dang / rdo rje'i rigs dang / rin po che'i rigs dang / padma'i rigs dang / las kyi rigs te thams cad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ris dang / rdo rje'i rigs dang / rin po che'i rigs dang / padma'i rigs dang / las kyi rigs te thams cad do //
translated: the Tathagata family, the vajra family, the jewel family, the lotus family, and the action family, all of them.

original: bdag nyid ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid ni bzhi ste /
translated: The nature is fourfold:

original: drag po 'jigs byed gdul bya'i 'khor dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyan pa'i 'khor dang / dpa' bo dang dpa' mo sprul pa'i 'khor dang / lcang lo can gyi bdag po sdud pa po'i 'khor dang @123a * //
analyzed: drag po 'jigs byed gdul bya'i 'khor dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyan pa'i 'khor dang / dpa' bo dang dpa' mo sprul pa'i 'khor dang / lcang lo can gyi bdag po sdud pa po'i 'khor dang @123a * //
translated: and the compiler’s retinue is the lord of Aṭam.

original: bzhi'o // rtag tu ni dus te gdul bya 'dul bya 'dul ba rnams rdzogs pa dus de'i bar ro //
analyzed: bzhi'o // rtag tu ni dus te gdul bya 'dul bya 'dul ba rnams rdzogs pa dus de'i bar ro //
translated: “Always” is time; the time is the completion of taming those to be tamed.

original: bzhugs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhugs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ston pa yin no //
translated: “Abiding” is the teacher in the buddhafield.

original: ston pa dang sbyar ba na dbang mdzad pas bzhugs /
analyzed: ston pa dang sbyar ba na dbang mdzad pas bzhugs /
translated: When applied to the teacher, he abides as the one who has power.

original: longs spyod pas bzhugs /
analyzed: longs spyod pas bzhugs /
translated: He abides as the one who enjoys.

original: thim pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thim pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He abides as the one who dissolves.

original: sprul pa'i sku'i ston pa ni mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'i ston pa ni mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ste /
translated: The teacher of the nirmāṇakāya is the hero who is the nature of all ḍākinīs.

original: 'bras bu'i he ru ka zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i he ru ka zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The result is the heruka with four faces and twelve arms.

original: de la mkha' ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi nam mkha'o //
analyzed: de la mkha' ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi nam mkha'o //
translated: In that, “space” is the space of śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: 'gro ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sa bcu gcig pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sa bcu gcig pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Moving” is the realization of the eleventh stage of śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: kun gyi ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang / thugs kyi 'khor lo dang / gsung gi 'khor lo dang / sku'i 'khor lo dang / dam tshig gi 'khor lo dang / dur khrod brgyad kyi 'khor lo ste drug gi dbus na sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du 'bras bu'i he ru ka skyed byed kyi gtso bo yin pas na dngos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun gyi ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang / thugs kyi 'khor lo dang / gsung gi 'khor lo dang / sku'i 'khor lo dang / dam tshig gi 'khor lo dang / dur khrod brgyad kyi 'khor lo ste drug gi dbus na sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du 'bras bu'i he ru ka skyed byed kyi gtso bo yin pas na dngos zhes bya'o //
translated: The “actual” is so called because it is the principal creator of the resultant Heruka, like a magician, in the center of the six wheels: the wheel of gnosis of all, the wheel of mind, the wheel of speech, the wheel of body, the wheel of commitment, and the wheel of the eight charnel grounds.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba'i mchog ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku te rgyu'i he ru ka'o / rdo rje ni stong pa nyid kyis ye shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba'i mchog ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku te rgyu'i he ru ka'o / rdo rje ni stong pa nyid kyis ye shes so //
translated: “ Vajrasattva, supreme bliss” is the enjoyment body, the causal Heruka. “ Vajra” is the gnosis of emptiness.

original: sems dpa' ni snod bcud thams cad du snang ba'i longs sku ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya bar rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa nas bshad do //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni snod bcud thams cad du snang ba'i longs sku ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya bar rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa nas bshad do //
translated: “ Sattva” is the enjoyment body that appears as the entire environment and its inhabitants, which is explained in the forty-second chapter of the Vajradaka as “Vajrasattva.”

original: bde ba'i mchog ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin pas bde mchog go //
analyzed: bde ba'i mchog ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes ji snyed pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin pas bde mchog go //
translated: “ Supreme bliss” is the gnosis that knows all the pure mundane gnoses, and therefore it is supreme bliss.

original: 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //
translated: This is the self-arisen Transcendent Conqueror.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku ste /🔽'di ni zhes bya ba ni don dam bas na zhes bya'o / rang 'byung ba ni rang rigs pa rgyu nus pa thogs med nyams su myong pa'i 'od gsal ba'i rgyu las skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku ste / 'di ni zhes bya ba ni don dam bas na zhes bya'o / rang 'byung ba ni rang rigs pa rgyu nus pa thogs med nyams su myong pa'i 'od gsal ba'i rgyu las skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the dharmakāya.🔽This is said to be the ultimate. Self-arisen means that it arises from the cause of the clear light of the experience of unimpeded potential of its own kind, not from adventitious causes and conditions.

original: glo bur gyi rgyu rkyen las ma skyes pas na rang byung ngo //
analyzed: glo bur gyi rgyu rkyen las ma skyes pas na rang byung ngo //
translated: It is self-arisen.

original: mnyam sbyor gyi rgyud las /
analyzed: mnyam sbyor gyi rgyud las /
translated: In the Yoga Tantra, it says:

original: rtag tu da ltar 'byung ba bzhin //
analyzed: rtag tu da ltar 'byung ba bzhin //
translated: Always like the present.

original: zhes bya ba rang gi sems kyi chos nyid nyams su myong ba 'dus byas dus gsum du me dmigs pas na rang byung zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rang gi sems kyi chos nyid nyams su myong ba 'dus byas dus gsum du me dmigs pas na rang byung zhes bshad do //
translated: This is explained as self-arisen because the experience of the dharmatā of one’s mind is not observed as conditioned in the three times.

original: bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: It is the Transcendent Conqueror because the four māras are conquered.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag nyal phra mo spangs pas dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bag nyal phra mo spangs pas dpa' ba'o //
translated: It is the hero because it abandons the latent tendencies of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de ltar sku gsum gyi ston pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar sku gsum gyi ston pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the teacher of the three kāyas, now, the explanation of the retinue of the three kāyas:

original: chos phun sum tshogs pa ni mkha' 'gro dra ba'i sngom pa yin //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: chos phun sum tshogs pa ni mkha' 'gro dra ba'i sngom pa yin // zhes pa ste /
translated: The perfection of Dharma is the binding of the net of dakinis.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa lha'i 'khor lo sngom pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa dman pa dbyibs rtsa'i 'khor @123b lo sngom pa dang / gsang bsngags rlung gi dra ba'i sngom pa dang / mthar thug chos sems kyi dra ba'i sngom pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa lha'i 'khor lo sngom pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa dman pa dbyibs rtsa'i 'khor @123b lo sngom pa dang / gsang bsngags rlung gi dra ba'i sngom pa dang / mthar thug chos sems kyi dra ba'i sngom pa gsum mo //
translated: This is the binding of the three nets: the binding of the divine wheel of the creation stage, the binding of the inferior shape of the channel wheel of the completion stage, the binding of the secret mantra of the wind net, and the binding of the ultimate Dharma mind net.

original: de ltar kun rdzob tu phun sum tshogs pa lnga thos bsam gyi shes rab kyi thad kar bshad nas bsgom bzhes rab kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob tu phun sum tshogs pa lnga thos bsam gyi shes rab kyi thad kar bshad nas bsgom bzhes rab kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Having explained the five perfections in terms of the wisdoms of hearing and contemplating in that way, in terms of the wisdom of meditation,

original: autpala lta bu'i gang zag chags lam pa'i ngor las kyi phyag rgya'i bla la dga' ba gsum 'byung bas na gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na'o //
analyzed: autpala lta bu'i gang zag chags lam pa'i ngor las kyi phyag rgya'i bla la dga' ba gsum 'byung bas na gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na'o //
translated: in the perspective of the person who is like a lotus, who is on the path of passion, the three joys arise in the guru’s karmamudra, and therefore, “in the supreme secret place of pleasure.”

original: thams cad bdag nyid ni 'khor lo bzhi'i rtsa'o //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ni 'khor lo bzhi'i rtsa'o //
translated: “All of oneself” is the channels of the four chakras.

original: sku gsum gyi ston pa ni lkog ma dang snying ga dang lte bar phyin pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi ston pa ni lkog ma dang snying ga dang lte bar phyin pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: “The teacher of the three kayas” is the bliss that arrives at the throat, heart, and navel.

original: chos ni 'khor lo bzhi la bde bas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni 'khor lo bzhi la bde bas khyab pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is the pervasion of bliss in the four cakras.

original: padma lta bu'i gang zag grol ba'i lam pa'i dbang du byas nas gsang ba sngags su bshad pa ni /
analyzed: padma lta bu'i gang zag grol ba'i lam pa'i dbang du byas nas gsang ba sngags su bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the secret mantra from the perspective of the person who is like a lotus on the path of liberation:

original: dbugs 'byung rngub gsum kyi gnas yin pas na gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung rngub gsum kyi gnas yin pas na gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na'o //
translated: Since it is the place of the three exhalations and inhalations, it is in the “supremely secret place of joy.”🔽The nature of all is the retinue of the exhalations and inhalations, the eleven thousand six hundred vāyus.

original: thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni dbugs ni khri chig stong drug brgya'i 'khor rdo rje / rtag du bzhugs pa ni rlung ni 'gog pa'i dus te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni dbugs ni khri chig stong drug brgya'i 'khor rdo rje / rtag du bzhugs pa ni rlung ni 'gog pa'i dus te /
translated: The abiding is the time of the cessation of the vāyu.

original: srog aa wa dh'u t'i ra chud pa'o /
analyzed: srog aa wa dh'u t'i ra chud pa'o /
translated: The life vāyu enters the avadhūti.

original: sku gsum gyi ston pa ni lte ba'i rlung dbus su chud nas /
analyzed: sku gsum gyi ston pa ni lte ba'i rlung dbus su chud nas /
translated: The teacher of the three kāyas is the vāyu that enters the center of the navel.

original: mig tshums gcig sdod pa dang / snying gar mig tshums gnyis sdod pa dang / lkog mar mig tshums gsum sdod pa'i rtog pa me pa'i shes pa gsum skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mig tshums gcig sdod pa dang / snying gar mig tshums gnyis sdod pa dang / lkog mar mig tshums gsum sdod pa'i rtog pa me pa'i shes pa gsum skyes pa'o //
translated: The three conceptions arise: the vāyu that abides in the eyes for one moment, the vāyu that abides in the eyes for two moments at the heart, and the vāyu that abides in the eyes for three moments at the throat.

original: bshad pa'i chos ni dbugs nyid khri chig stong drug brgya'i dra ba bkag pa las sngom pa'i bde mchog skyed pa'i rin po che lta bu'i gang zag bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i lam la mthar chos kyi dbang du byas na chos kyi dbyings rnam par thar pa sgo
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos ni dbugs nyid khri chig stong drug brgya'i dra ba bkag pa las sngom pa'i bde mchog skyed pa'i rin po che lta bu'i gang zag bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i lam la mthar chos kyi dbang du byas na chos kyi dbyings rnam par thar pa sgo
translated: The Dharma that is explained is like a jewel that generates the supreme bliss of the vow from blocking the net of 11,116 breaths.

original: gsum gyi rang bzhin phyag rgya chen po ni gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na'o //
analyzed: gsum gyi rang bzhin phyag rgya chen po ni gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na'o //
translated: From the perspective of the ultimate Dharma, the nature of the three doors of liberation, the dhātu of phenomena, is mahāmudrā, in the state of supreme, sublime, secret joy.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The nature of all is the thirty-seven factors conducive to awakening.

original: rtag tu bzhugs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus te /
analyzed: rtag tu bzhugs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus te /
translated: The always-abiding is the inconceivable time,

original: rang gi sems kyi stong nyis la rtag tu bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi stong nyis la rtag tu bzhugs pa'o //
translated: always abiding in the emptiness of one’s mind.

original: mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ni gong bu'i gzugs las 'das pa gzugs bar rang bzhin med pa'i ye shes sprul sku'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ni gong bu'i gzugs las 'das pa gzugs bar rang bzhin med pa'i ye shes sprul sku'o //
translated: The hero who is the nature of all dakinis is the nirmāṇakāya pristine consciousness that is free from the form of a ball, the nature of which is formless.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba mchog ni 'dzin pa rang bzhin med pa longs sku'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bde ba mchog ni 'dzin pa rang bzhin med pa longs sku'o //
translated: The supreme bliss of Vajrasattva is the saṃbhogakāya that is free from grasping.

original: di ni rang 'byung bcom ldan dpa' ni sems kyis bsam mi khyab ces pa'i bde chen chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: di ni rang 'byung bcom ldan dpa' ni sems kyis bsam mi khyab ces pa'i bde chen chos kyi sku'o //
translated: This is the dharmakāya of great bliss, the self-originated, fearless Bhagavān, “the mind that is inconceivable.”

original: bshad pa'i chos ni sems kyi mkha' @124a * //
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos ni sems kyi mkha' @124a * //
translated: The Dharma to be explained is the space of the mind.

original: 'gro ma dra ba'i sngom pa sgyu ma'i 'od gsal zung 'jug rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ma dra ba'i sngom pa sgyu ma'i 'od gsal zung 'jug rtogs pa'o //
translated: The tantra of the net of magical illusion is the realization of union.

original: de ltar gleng gzhi bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar gleng gzhi bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the nidāna,

original: bskyed rim gyi lus mdor bstan ni /
analyzed: bskyed rim gyi lus mdor bstan ni /
translated: the brief explanation of the body of the creation stage is as follows:

original: sgra'i tshul las nges par 'byung ba ni lta bskyed pa'i sgyur ste /
analyzed: sgra'i tshul las nges par 'byung ba ni lta bskyed pa'i sgyur ste /
translated: “The definite emergence from the method of sound” is the creation of the view.

original: sgra ni h'um ngo //
analyzed: sgra ni h'um ngo //
translated: Sound is hūṃ.

original: tshul ni rlung dbu ma'o //
analyzed: tshul ni rlung dbu ma'o //
translated: The method is the central nāḍī.

original: nges 'byung ni 'khor lo lnga dang dur khrod dang bcas pa rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor sprul ba'o //
analyzed: nges 'byung ni 'khor lo lnga dang dur khrod dang bcas pa rten dang brten pa'i dkyil 'khor sprul ba'o //
translated: The definite emergence is the emanation of the maṇḍala of the supported and the supporter, including the five cakras and the charnel grounds.

original: dam tshig spyod pa ni dbang thos pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o /
analyzed: dam tshig spyod pa ni dbang thos pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o /
translated: “The conduct of samaya” is the yoga of hearing the empowerment.

original: sprod yul yin no lha'i 'khor lo bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sprod yul yin no lha'i 'khor lo bsgom pa'o //
translated: The place of union is the meditation on the maṇḍala of the deity.

original: ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how is it meditated,

original: thog mar tshad med pa dang byin gyis brlab pa dang / srung ba'i 'khor lo dang tshogs bsags pa dang stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor ro /
analyzed: thog mar tshad med pa dang byin gyis brlab pa dang / srung ba'i 'khor lo dang tshogs bsags pa dang stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor ro /
translated: The yoga of the four immeasurables, the yoga of the consecration, the yoga of the protection wheel, the yoga of the accumulation of the stores, and the yoga of the voidness.

original: dbugs ni ldang ba dang / 'jug pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / byin gyis rlob pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / mchod pa'i rnal 'byor dang / ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs ni ldang ba dang / 'jug pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / byin gyis rlob pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / mchod pa'i rnal 'byor dang / ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'o //
translated: The yoga of the exhalation, inhalation, and retention of the breath, the yoga of the consecration of the breath, the yoga of the empowerment of the breath, the yoga of the offering of the breath, and the yoga of the meditation of the breath.

original: mtha' nye bar bsdu ba dang / kun du spyod pa ste ldang ba ni rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: mtha' nye bar bsdu ba dang / kun du spyod pa ste ldang ba ni rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The yoga of the final gathering of the elements, and the yoga of the conduct, or arising.

original: rnam par gnas pa ni //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa ni //
translated: The yoga of the abiding.

original: thog ma dbus mtha' dri ma med ni /
analyzed: thog ma dbus mtha' dri ma med ni /
translated: The yoga of the stainless beginning, middle, and end.

original: sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang rjes kyi tshul gyis sprul pa'i sku dri ma med pa zag med kyi snang gas nga pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang rjes kyi tshul gyis sprul pa'i sku dri ma med pa zag med kyi snang gas nga pa'o //
translated: The yoga of the stainless emanation body, which is the stainless appearance of the uncontaminated.

original: de'i phan yon ce zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phan yon ce zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit of that?

original: 'jig rten gsum du rnyed dka' ba se sa 'og sa bla sa steng du zag ba med pa'i spel pa'i sku rnyed par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum du rnyed dka' ba se sa 'og sa bla sa steng du zag ba med pa'i spel pa'i sku rnyed par dka' ba'o //
translated: The uncontaminated emanation body is difficult to obtain in the three worlds, below the earth, above the earth, and on the earth.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i lus mdor gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i lus mdor gzhag pa ni /
translated: The summary of the body of the stage of completion is:

original: shes rab thabs kyi kun spyor las //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi kun spyor las //
translated: From the union of wisdom and means.

original: zhes bya ba shes rab phyag rgya bzhi dang / thabs shes pa bzhi mngon sum gyi lam gyis kun du sbyor bas bde ba rtog pa med pa dang dbang po drug bde ba dga' ba dang / yul drug bde ba mchog dga' dang / rnam par shes pa drug bde ba lhan cig skyes dga' ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba shes rab phyag rgya bzhi dang / thabs shes pa bzhi mngon sum gyi lam gyis kun du sbyor bas bde ba rtog pa med pa dang dbang po drug bde ba dga' ba dang / yul drug bde ba mchog dga' dang / rnam par shes pa drug bde ba lhan cig skyes dga' ni /
translated: The non-conceptual bliss is the union of the four wisdoms and the four means, the bliss of the six sense faculties is the joy, the bliss of the six objects is the supreme joy, and the bliss of the six consciousnesses is the co-emergent joy.🔽As it is said:

original: 'chi med ji lta de lta bur //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'chi med ji lta de lta bur // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Like immortality.

original: me dang chu dang rlung gi bar du mi 'chi bas na 'chi med do //
analyzed: me dang chu dang rlung gi bar du mi 'chi bas na 'chi med do //
translated: Immortality is not dying from fire, water, or wind.

original: de la sgyur ma dang 'od gsal bdag dang zung du 'jug pa rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin 'od gsal dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sgyur ma dang 'od gsal bdag dang zung du 'jug pa rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid ni rang bzhin 'od gsal dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The illusory body, clear light, and union are the emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, which is called “the pure natural luminosity.”

original: de rgyu gang las byung zhes na /
analyzed: de rgyu gang las byung zhes na /
translated: What is the cause of that?

original: gsang ba'i gnas byung zhes bya ba las chos dang dam tshig gsum las byung ba'i bsam gtan gyis lus dang di bde ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas byung zhes bya ba las chos dang dam tshig gsum las byung ba'i bsam gtan gyis lus dang di bde ba'o //
translated: The “arising from the secret place” is the bliss of body and mind from the concentration that arises from the three: Dharma, pledge, and reality.

original: las 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gyi bde ba de las skyes pa'i sgyur ma 'od gsal zung 'jug rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: las 'byung ba ni bsam gtan gyi bde ba de las skyes pa'i sgyur ma 'od gsal zung 'jug rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Arising from action” is the realization of the illusory body, clear light, and union that arises from that bliss of concentration.

original: de la nyes @124b bral ni sgyu ma'i brgyad dang mtshungs ba'i bdag byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyes @124b bral ni sgyu ma'i brgyad dang mtshungs ba'i bdag byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: “Free from faults” is the self-consecration that is similar to the eight liberations of the illusory body.

original: rtag ba ni 'od gsal rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rtag ba ni 'od gsal rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: “Permanent” is the concentration of the three doors of liberation, the clear light.

original: zhi ba ni zung 'jug ste 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas cig car rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni zung 'jug ste 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas cig car rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Peace” is the union, the simultaneous realization of the compounded and uncompounded.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it says:

original: bla gros chen po mthong rnams kyis //
analyzed: bla gros chen po mthong rnams kyis //
translated: The great intellects see

original: rnam pa thams cad cig car nges //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad cig car nges // zhes gsungs so //
translated: all aspects simultaneously.

original: shes pa de gsung gi yul gang yin zhe na /🔽nam mkha' dang mnyam pa skyed pa po ste /
analyzed: shes pa de gsung gi yul gang yin zhe na / nam mkha' dang mnyam pa skyed pa po ste /
translated: What is the object of that knowledge?🔽It is the space-like cause,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: arising from the cause of the ultimate dimension of phenomena.

original: rgyu de yang rang bzhin dag pa las byung ste sems kyi chos nyid 'dus ma byas ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu de yang rang bzhin dag pa las byung ste sems kyi chos nyid 'dus ma byas ba'o //
translated: That cause arises from natural purity, the unconditioned nature of mind.

original: dbang po bdag po'i rkyen bsam gtan de gang las skye zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po bdag po'i rkyen bsam gtan de gang las skye zhe na /
translated: What is the dominant condition of the sense organ?

original: rnal 'byor ma yis bde ba ster //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma yis bde ba ster //
translated: It is the bliss that yoginis bestow.

original: zhes bya ba las kyi phyag rgyas dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgyas dang gsum gyis bde ba ster ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba las kyi phyag rgyas dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgyas dang gsum gyis bde ba ster ro //
translated: The bliss that is bestowed is from three: the karmamudra, the samayamudra, and the jnanamudra.

original: de'i mtshungs ba de ma thag pa'i rkyen yid nang du chud pa ste rdo rje'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshungs ba de ma thag pa'i rkyen yid nang du chud pa ste rdo rje'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: The equivalent immediately preceding condition is the mind turned inward, which is vajra repetition.

original: dbang po bdag po'i rkyen ni bsam gtan de dga' ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: dbang po bdag po'i rkyen ni bsam gtan de dga' ba bzhi'o //
translated: The dominant condition of the sense organ is the concentration of the four joys.

original: sogs ni yul phyag rgyas bzhi dang / rgyu'i rkyen bsam gtan dang zag med kyi sa bon gyi bag chags so //
analyzed: sogs ni yul phyag rgyas bzhi dang / rgyu'i rkyen bsam gtan dang zag med kyi sa bon gyi bag chags so //
translated: The causal condition is the habitual tendencies of the seeds of the concentrations and the uncontaminated states.

original: de'i 'bras bu sbyor ba nyid chog gi ye shes ni rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i sbyor ba ni cho ga ste de'i rnam shes dga' ba gsum dang / ye shes sgyu ma 'od gsal zung 'jug shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu sbyor ba nyid chog gi ye shes ni rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'i sbyor ba ni cho ga ste de'i rnam shes dga' ba gsum dang / ye shes sgyu ma 'od gsal zung 'jug shes pa'o //
translated: The result of that is the wisdom of the rite of union. The union of the assembled causes and conditions is the rite. The consciousness of that is the three joys and the wisdom of the illusory body, luminosity, and union.

original: de skad du yang mnyam sbyor las /
analyzed: de skad du yang mnyam sbyor las /
translated: Thus it is said in the Sarvarahasya

original: ngo bo nyid dang mthu dag gis /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang mthu dag gis /
translated: By nature and by power

original: rang bzhin gyis ni de 'grub po //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni de 'grub po // zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is accomplished by nature.🔽The one hundred thousand Tantra of the Completion of the Expanse

original: bkyed rdzogs kyi de nyid rgyud 'bum pa las gsungs pa dag /
analyzed: bkyed rdzogs kyi de nyid rgyud 'bum pa las gsungs pa dag /
translated: says:

original: ba'i bdag po sdud pa po //
analyzed: ba'i bdag po sdud pa po //
translated: Lord of the clan, the compiler,

original: lag na rdo rje rab tu nyon //🔽zhes bya'o // dbugs 'byin par ma mchog dag dang // zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi'i le'u stong phrag gsum las stong phrag gcig tshogs kyi 'khor lo bsam gtan bskyed pa'i stong phrag btung ba sgyur ma lta btung ba sgyur ma lta bu'i yi shes bskyed pa stong phrag gcig pho nya'i gtsang sbra song pa yid kyi ye
analyzed: lag na rdo rje rab tu nyon // zhes bya'o // dbugs 'byin par ma mchog dag dang // zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi'i le'u stong phrag gsum las stong phrag gcig tshogs kyi 'khor lo bsam gtan bskyed pa'i stong phrag btung ba sgyur ma lta btung ba sgyur ma lta bu'i yi shes bskyed pa stong phrag gcig pho nya'i gtsang sbra song pa yid kyi ye
translated: Vajrapani, listen well!🔽The three thousand chapters of the nidana

original: shes bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: shes bskyed pa'o //
translated: are the three thousand chapters of the wheel of the feast, the three thousand chapters of the generation of concentration, the three thousand chapters of the generation of the knowledge of the drink like an illusion, and the three thousand chapters of the generation of the knowledge of the mind of the pure messenger.

original: de las dang por bsam gtan bskyed pa'i zas ni dbugs 'byin byang chub kyi sems dang bar ma rang byung gi khrag dang / mchog shad chen shad chen po dang / dri bshad pa'i dang sam dang / chu lci ba'i dang sam dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: de las dang por bsam gtan bskyed pa'i zas ni dbugs 'byin byang chub kyi sems dang bar ma rang byung gi khrag dang / mchog shad chen shad chen po dang / dri bshad pa'i dang sam dang / chu lci ba'i dang sam dang bcas pa ni /
translated: First, the food that generates meditative concentration is the exhalation, the bodhicitta, the intermediate self-originated blood, the supreme, the great, the great, the explanation of the smell, the explanation of the water, and the explanation of the earth.

original: rta dang glang po dang khyi dang ba la dang mi'i shad de lnga la /
analyzed: rta dang glang po dang khyi dang ba la dang mi'i shad de lnga la /
translated: The five are the flesh of the horse, the elephant, the dog, the cow, and the human.

original: aom aa: h'um gsum gyis bdud rtsir byas nas mkhas pa tshogs kyi @125a * //
analyzed: aom aa: h'um gsum gyis bdud rtsir byas nas mkhas pa tshogs kyi @125a * //
translated: Having made them into nectar with the three, Oṃ, Aḥ, and Hūṃ, the wise one should offer the five nectars to the assembly of the retinue.

original: 'khor lo byed pas bdud rtsi lnga'i ri lu byas ba'i khams kyi za de su la sbyin zhes na /
analyzed: 'khor lo byed pas bdud rtsi lnga'i ri lu byas ba'i khams kyi za de su la sbyin zhes na /
translated: To whom is the food of the five nectars given?

original: padma'i dkyil 'khor dag la mchod //
analyzed: padma'i dkyil 'khor dag la mchod //
translated: “Offer to the maṇḍala of lotuses.”

original: ce bya ste ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i padma dang / thugs dang / gsung dang / sku dang dam tshig dang / dur khrod brgyad kyi bar gyi dkyil 'khor drug la ro'i bdud rtsi mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: ce bya ste ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i padma dang / thugs dang / gsung dang / sku dang dam tshig dang / dur khrod brgyad kyi bar gyi dkyil 'khor drug la ro'i bdud rtsi mchod par bya'o //
translated: The six maṇḍalas are the lotus of the maṇḍala of the gnosis wheel, the mind, the speech, the body, the commitment, and the eight charnel grounds.

original: dus nam gyi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: dus nam gyi tshe zhe na /
translated: At what time?

original: 'byung po'i dus kyi khyad par la ste /🔽yar ngo'i tshes bcu'am /
analyzed: 'byung po'i dus kyi khyad par la ste / yar ngo'i tshes bcu'am /
translated: The special time of the bhūta is🔽the tenth day of the waxing moon or

original: mar ngo'i tshes bcu'am /
analyzed: mar ngo'i tshes bcu'am /
translated: the tenth day of the waning moon.

original: zla ba gcig la gzhag sum cu thun bzhi'i dus kyi khyad par la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba gcig la gzhag sum cu thun bzhi'i dus kyi khyad par la mchod par bya'o //
translated: Or, it is said that the offering is made in the special time of the four periods of a month.

original: ro gcig pu yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ro gcig pu yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it only one taste?

original: pho nya rnams kyis de la mchod //
analyzed: pho nya rnams kyis de la mchod //
translated: The messengers make offerings to that.

original: ces pas pho nya rnams ni rigs lnga'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma se /
analyzed: ces pas pho nya rnams ni rigs lnga'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma se /
translated: The messengers are the yogas and yoginīs of the five families.

original: de'i gzugs yid du 'ong ba dang / rdo rje'i glu snyan pa dang / ga bur dang tsandan dang / gla rtsi'i dri dang / bdud rtsi lnga'i ro dang lag bcangs dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa'i reg bya lngas 'khor lo lnga'i lha la mchod do / mchod pa ni bsam gtan gyi ting 'dzin yin te /
analyzed: de'i gzugs yid du 'ong ba dang / rdo rje'i glu snyan pa dang / ga bur dang tsandan dang / gla rtsi'i dri dang / bdud rtsi lnga'i ro dang lag bcangs dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa'i reg bya lngas 'khor lo lnga'i lha la mchod do / mchod pa ni bsam gtan gyi ting 'dzin yin te /
translated: The five offerings are the five objects of desire: the form that is pleasing to the mind, the sound of the pleasant vajra song, the smell of camphor, sandalwood, and musk, the taste of the five elixirs, and the touch of hand and embrace.

original: de'i yul dmigs pa'i rkyen ni /
analyzed: de'i yul dmigs pa'i rkyen ni /
translated: The object condition of the visualization is

original: mchog ye shes las skyes pa skyes rabs kyi byang chub sems ma'o //
analyzed: mchog ye shes las skyes pa skyes rabs kyi byang chub sems ma'o //
translated: the supreme, the bodhicitta of the Jātakamātṛkā born from the gnosis.

original: 'bring ni bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med bzhi 'thob pa'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med bzhi 'thob pa'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: The medium is the yoginī who obtains the four meditative concentrations and the four formless [absorptions].

original: tha ma ni slob dpon gyis ye shes pha nas srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chu pa'i sngags skyes ma'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni slob dpon gyis ye shes pha nas srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chu pa'i sngags skyes ma'o //
translated: The inferior is the mantra-born [yoginī] of the life-force in the avadhūti, generated by the master's gnosis.

original: yul dmigs pa'i rkyen ni /
analyzed: yul dmigs pa'i rkyen ni /
translated: The objective condition is

original: mthar thug dngos grub thams cad 'byung ste /
analyzed: mthar thug dngos grub thams cad 'byung ste /
translated: the arising of all accomplishments in the end.

original: zhig gnas dang lhag mthong mngon par shes par lnga dang / zag pa zag pa'i ye shes thams cad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhig gnas dang lhag mthong mngon par shes par lnga dang / zag pa zag pa'i ye shes thams cad 'byung ngo //
translated: The five are the superknowledges of the states of discernment and insight, and the gnosis of the cessation of defilements.🔽The equivalent immediately preceding condition is

original: de'i mtshungs ba de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni yid ni nang du bsdus pa yis //
analyzed: de'i mtshungs ba de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni yid ni nang du bsdus pa yis //
translated: the mind gathered inward.

original: zhes bya ba srog aa wa dh'u t'ir pas dbugs nyi khro cho stong drug brgyad dang / rnam rtog gi rang bzhin brgyad cu 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba srog aa wa dh'u t'ir pas dbugs nyi khro cho stong drug brgyad dang / rnam rtog gi rang bzhin brgyad cu 'gags pa'o //
translated: By the life-force entering the avadhūti, the sixteen thousand and six hundred breaths and the eighty conceptions cease.

original: de ci 'grub ce na /
analyzed: de ci 'grub ce na /
translated: What is accomplished by that?

original: yid nad du chud na 'dod pa'i dngos grub gsum bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: yid nad du chud na 'dod pa'i dngos grub gsum bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: When the mind is gathered inward, the three desired accomplishments are achieved.

original: sam gtan bdag po'i rkyen ni rang rdzas thig le spyi gtsug gi kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems gtum mo drod kyis phab pa ste /
analyzed: sam gtan bdag po'i rkyen ni rang rdzas thig le spyi gtsug gi kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems gtum mo drod kyis phab pa ste /
translated: The dominant condition is one's own substance, the bindu, the relative awakening mind at the crown, which is brought down by the heat of fierce fire.

original: dbang po bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: dbang po bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: This is the dominant condition of the sense organ.

original: gal te dga' bral du song nas sangs rgyas te phung po lnga dang / sems dpa' dbang po drug dang / 'byung ba yum lnga la mchog par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dga' bral du song nas sangs rgyas te phung po lnga dang / sems dpa' dbang po drug dang / 'byung ba yum lnga la mchog par bya'o //
translated: If one awakens to buddhahood after being separated from bliss, one should make offerings to the five aggregates, the six sense organs, and the five elements, the mothers.

original: bdag nyid rang gi lha'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang / @125b gzhan rnal 'byor ma lha'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i lus kyi dkyil 'khor la yang mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid rang gi lha'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang / @125b gzhan rnal 'byor ma lha'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i lus kyi dkyil 'khor la yang mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should also make offerings to the body mandala of oneself endowed with the yoga of one's deity and others endowed with the yoga of the yoginis.

original: las kyi phyag rgya spangs pa'i grol ba'i lam la yid nang du chud pa yul gang las bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya spangs pa'i grol ba'i lam la yid nang du chud pa yul gang las bsgom zhe na /
translated: If one is on the path of liberation that is free from the karmamudra, what object should one meditate on with the mind turned inward?

original: mthong pa gzugs dang / reg pa lag bcangs dang / thos pa sgra dang / dran pa chos kyi rdo rje ma la ma rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed kyi chos kyi phyag rgya 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin bsgoms na 'dod ai khams kyi sdig pa kun las grol zhing dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba
analyzed: mthong pa gzugs dang / reg pa lag bcangs dang / thos pa sgra dang / dran pa chos kyi rdo rje ma la ma rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed kyi chos kyi phyag rgya 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin bsgoms na 'dod ai khams kyi sdig pa kun las grol zhing dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba
translated: If one meditates on the concentration of meditative stabilization on the five objects of desire—form seen, touch felt, sound heard, and recollection of the dharma mudra—without confusion, the yoga of this path of liberation will arise without doubt, just as it is known.

original: dang / bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin ji ltar shes pa de ltar grol ba'i lam gyi rnal 'byor pa 'di la skye bar the tshom med do //
analyzed: dang / bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin ji ltar shes pa de ltar grol ba'i lam gyi rnal 'byor pa 'di la skye bar the tshom med do //
translated: The bliss of meditative stabilization arisen from isolation and the joy🔽are liberated.

original: de ltar chags lam dang grol lam gyi tshogs kyi 'khor lo las skyes pa'i bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar chags lam dang grol lam gyi tshogs kyi 'khor lo las skyes pa'i bsam gtan gyi ting nge 'dzin bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the concentration of meditative stabilization arisen from the gaṇacakra of the path of passion and the path of liberation,

original: de'i phan yon shlo ka gcig gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phan yon shlo ka gcig gsungs pa ni /
translated: one verse is stated on the benefits of that.

original: bsam gtan thob pa'i rnal 'bor pa nyid bsod rnam kyi tshogs mi g-yo ba'i las yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan thob pa'i rnal 'bor pa nyid bsod rnam kyi tshogs mi g-yo ba'i las yin no //
translated: The yoga of attaining concentration is the accumulation of immutable karma.

original: 'dod pa las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa /
translated: It is free from desire, free from negative actions and nonvirtuous qualities.

original: bden pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang bo'i ting nge 'dzin yin no zhes shes rab 'bum pa las gsungs pa'i dag byed ni kun 'byung nyon mongs pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang bo'i ting nge 'dzin yin no zhes shes rab 'bum pa las gsungs pa'i dag byed ni kun 'byung nyon mongs pa dag pa'o //
translated: The first meditative concentration is the meditative stabilization of the first meditative concentration, which is born of the truth, which is endowed with thought and discernment, and which is free from the desire realm, free from nonvirtuous phenomena.🔽The purifier is the purification of the afflictions, the origin.

original: sdig pa 'jig par byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa 'jig par byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dag pa'o //
translated: The destroyer of sin is the purification of the truth of suffering.

original: sngags bzlas ni srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pas dben pas las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sngags bzlas ni srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pas dben pas las skyes pa'o //
translated: The recitation of the mantra is the purification born of karma, because the life force enters the avadhūtī.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba can ni bsam gan gyi dga' ba lus dang yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba can ni bsam gan gyi dga' ba lus dang yid bde ba'o //
translated: Endowed with joy and bliss is the joy of meditation, the mental and physical bliss.

original: myur du tshe 'di las dngos grub skyes bas na mngon sum gyi lam lhan cig skyes pa las 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: myur du tshe 'di las dngos grub skyes bas na mngon sum gyi lam lhan cig skyes pa las 'grub pa'o //
translated: Because it is quickly born of accomplishment in this life, it is accomplished from the innate on the path of direct realization.

original: rgyud kyi sdud pa pos 'grel pa mdzad pa ni de nyid las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi sdud pa pos 'grel pa mdzad pa ni de nyid las shes par bya'o //
translated: The commentary by the compiler of the tantra should be understood from that very text.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyu bsdus pa rtsa rgyud phyi ma slob ma la snying po nges brjod kyi rgyud kyi dam tshig la 'jug pa'i le'u dang bo'i 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyu bsdus pa rtsa rgyud phyi ma slob ma la snying po nges brjod kyi rgyud kyi dam tshig la 'jug pa'i le'u dang bo'i 'grel ba'o /
translated: The root Tantra is summarized in the Later Tantra, and the first chapter of the Essence Tantra, the Tantra of the Commitments, is an explanation for the disciples.

original: // / phyi ma'i phyi ma snying po'i le'u dan por sbas te lhag ma tshogs pa la bshad pa tsam bsdus par zad do //
analyzed: // / phyi ma'i phyi ma snying po'i le'u dan por sbas te lhag ma tshogs pa la bshad pa tsam bsdus par zad do //
translated: The Later Tantra is summarized in the first chapter of the Essence Tantra, which is hidden, and the rest is just explained to the assembly.

original: de'i phyir slob ma dang tshogs pa dag la so sor bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob ma dang tshogs pa dag la so sor bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be explained separately to the disciples and the assembly.

original: rgyud phyi ma yang phyi ma'o //
analyzed: rgyud phyi ma yang phyi ma'o //
translated: The Later Tantra is later.

original: stong phrag nyis kyi don gi ni rtsa ba'i rgyud dang mthun par le'u bzhin bcu rtsa brgyud pa las phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong phrag nyis kyi don gi ni rtsa ba'i rgyud dang mthun par le'u bzhin bcu rtsa brgyud pa las phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the two thousand [lines] is explained later in the root Tantra, in accordance with the chapters.

original: de ltar gleng gzhi'i le'u dang pa shad nas /🔽gleng bslang ba'i le'u @126a * //
analyzed: de ltar gleng gzhi'i le'u dang pa shad nas / gleng bslang ba'i le'u @126a * //
translated: Having explained the chapter on the introduction,🔽the second chapter is the chapter on the introduction.

original: gnyis pa ni de'i rjes thogs la de nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de'i rjes thogs la de nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: After that, it is said, Then.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ni 'bras bu'i he ru ka'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ni 'bras bu'i he ru ka'o //
translated: Bhagavat Vajrasattva is the resultant Heruka.

original: rdo rje dbyings la rnams par rol pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bya ba ni rdo rje dbyings ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings la rnams par rol pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bya ba ni rdo rje dbyings ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The phrase playing in the vajra realm means that the vajra activity is the dharmakāya vajra realm.

original: rnam par rol ba ni longs sku'i 'khor ro //
analyzed: rnam par rol ba ni longs sku'i 'khor ro //
translated: The playing is the retinue of the saṃbhogakāya.

original: 'khor de yang khro bo chen po'i gzugs su snang ba'i yul la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam par zhugs nas /🔽dngos grub thams cad 'grub pa'i lha rnams kyi ming gi gsang ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor de yang khro bo chen po'i gzugs su snang ba'i yul la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam par zhugs nas / dngos grub thams cad 'grub pa'i lha rnams kyi ming gi gsang ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: That retinue, having entered into the meditative concentration that observes the object that appears in the form of a great wrathful deity, having entered into the equipoise of śamatha and vipaśyanā equally,🔽the Bhagavān Vajradhara, the cause of the saṃbhogakāya, Vairocana, having entered into the meditative concentration of the previous, spoke the secret names of the deities who accomplish all powers.
