original: su'i 'khor yin zhe na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i 'khor bcom ldan 'das rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang ba rnam par snang mdzad kyis snga ma'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
analyzed: su'i 'khor yin zhe na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i 'khor bcom ldan 'das rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang ba rnam par snang mdzad kyis snga ma'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
translated: Whose retinue? The retinue of the saṃbhogakāya. The Bhagavān Vajradhara, the cause of the saṃbhogakāya, Vairocana, having entered into the meditative concentration of the previous, spoke the secret names of the deities who accomplish all powers.

original: brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sbrul nas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la phul pa ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul dang mnyam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sbrul nas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la phul pa ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: Having emanated bodhisattva mahāsattvas equal to the particles in the buddha realms of the inexpressible multiplied by countless, they offered them to the saṃbhogakāya.

original: dpa' bo chen po ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The great hero is the one who has abandoned the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: gzugs kyi dbang phyug rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad lta bu 'khor lo dang dril bu thogs pa dkar bo /
analyzed: gzugs kyi dbang phyug rdo rje ni rnam par snang mdzad lta bu 'khor lo dang dril bu thogs pa dkar bo /
translated: The lord of form Vajra is like Vairocana, holding a wheel and a bell, and is white.

original: tshor ba rdo rje ni rin po che dang dril bu thogs pa ser po /
analyzed: tshor ba rdo rje ni rin po che dang dril bu thogs pa ser po /
translated: The feeling vajra is holding a jewel and a bell, and is yellow.

original: 'du shes rdo rje ni padma dang dril bu thogs pa dmar bo //
analyzed: 'du shes rdo rje ni padma dang dril bu thogs pa dmar bo //
translated: The discrimination vajra is holding a lotus and a bell, and is red.

original: 'du byed rdo rje ni sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa ljang gu /
analyzed: 'du byed rdo rje ni sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa ljang gu /
translated: The compositional factors vajra is holding a vajra cross and a bell, and is green.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rdo rje ni rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa mthing ga'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rdo rje ni rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa mthing ga'o //
translated: The consciousness vajra is holding a vajra and a bell, and is blue.

original: dum skyes ma ni so sor 'brang ma'o //
analyzed: dum skyes ma ni so sor 'brang ma'o //
translated: The “one born in a charnel ground” is Pramohā.

original: kos rings ma ni rma bya chen mo'o //
analyzed: kos rings ma ni rma bya chen mo'o //
translated: The “one with a goiter” is Mahāmāyūrī.

original: 'khor lo'i go cha ma ni ri khrod lo ma can mo //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i go cha ma ni ri khrod lo ma can mo //
translated: The “one with a wheel armor” is Śikhī.

original: rab tu dpa' mo ni rdo rje lu gu rgyud do //
analyzed: rab tu dpa' mo ni rdo rje lu gu rgyud do //
translated: The “one with great courage” is Vajrāryā.

original: stobs chen ma ni phyir bzlog chen mo'o //
analyzed: stobs chen ma ni phyir bzlog chen mo'o //
translated: The “one with great strength” is Mahāpratyangirā.

original: 'khor los sgyur ma ni gtsug tor dkar mo'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ma ni gtsug tor dkar mo'o //
translated: The “one with a wheel” is Sitātapatrā.

original: brtson 'grus chen mo ni rdo rje 'jigs ma'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen mo ni rdo rje 'jigs ma'o //
translated: The “one with great effort” is Vajra-bhīma.

original: sngon grub pa yi lha mo ste /
analyzed: sngon grub pa yi lha mo ste /
translated: The goddesses who were accomplished in the past

original: 'dod pa'i dngos grub thams cad gsol //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub thams cad gsol //
translated: bestow all the desired accomplishments.

original: zhes le'u drug cu bdun pa las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes le'u drug cu bdun pa las gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in the sixty-seventh chapter.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'dra ba'i sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo'i lha mos gdul bya sna tshogs 'dul ba'i gzugs kyis stong gsum gyi nam mkha'i khams mthar thug par ru yab kyi zhal nas h'um dang yum gyi zhal nas phat
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'dra ba'i sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo'i lha mos gdul bya sna tshogs 'dul ba'i gzugs kyis stong gsum gyi nam mkha'i khams mthar thug par ru yab kyi zhal nas h'um dang yum gyi zhal nas phat
translated: “Such as these” refers to the goddesses of the body, speech, and mind wheels who are similar to them. They have the forms of various trainees to be tamed. They fill the entire space element of the billion-world universe. They emerge from the mouths of the fathers, saying hūṃ, and from the mouths of the mothers, saying phaṭ.

original: sgrogs shing cang te'u dkrol nas k'i li k'i li'i sgra sgrogs pa @128a * //
analyzed: sgrogs shing cang te'u dkrol nas k'i li k'i li'i sgra sgrogs pa @128a * //
translated: Having proclaimed this, they rang their hand-bells and proclaimed the sound of “kāli kāli.”

original: rkang pas rang gi thabs kyi dam tshig la 'khyud dang zhal gyis zhal la reg ba'i tsum ba na dang / snying rje'i nyams kyis phyag rgya drug yongs su rdzogs pa'i dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / rnal 'byor ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis nam mkha'i khams gang bar gzigs pa rin chen 'byung ldan gyis phul lo //
analyzed: rkang pas rang gi thabs kyi dam tshig la 'khyud dang zhal gyis zhal la reg ba'i tsum ba na dang / snying rje'i nyams kyis phyag rgya drug yongs su rdzogs pa'i dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / rnal 'byor ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis nam mkha'i khams gang bar gzigs pa rin chen 'byung ldan gyis phul lo //
translated: With their feet embracing their method consorts, and with their mouths kissing, they saw the twenty-four heroes and twenty-four yoginīs who are complete with the six mudras and who fill the realm of space with the experience of compassion.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa ni //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid bshad pa ni //
translated: The characteristics of those are explained.

original: dpa' bo byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dam tshig gi mchog rang gi thabs la dgongs shing gzigs nas dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i dam tshig gis gdul bya la stong ba nyid ston pas gdul bya lhag mthong dang zhi gnas kyi nam mkhar
analyzed: dpa' bo byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dam tshig gi mchog rang gi thabs la dgongs shing gzigs nas dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i dam tshig gis gdul bya la stong ba nyid ston pas gdul bya lhag mthong dang zhi gnas kyi nam mkhar
translated: The twenty-four heroes are the supreme commitment of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment. Having seen the transcendent state of their own methods, through the commitment of the glorious Vajraḍāka, emptiness is shown to disciples.

original: kyi nam mkhar 'gro ma 'bras bu'i lha mo rnams kyis thun mong gi ming ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'khor lo gsum la bzhugs so //
analyzed: kyi nam mkhar 'gro ma 'bras bu'i lha mo rnams kyis thun mong gi ming ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'khor lo gsum la bzhugs so //
translated: The goddesses of the result, who move in the sky, have a common name, the perfection of wisdom, which is called “arising,” and they reside in the three wheels.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi sprul pa'i lha mo rnams ni //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi sprul pa'i lha mo rnams ni //
translated: The goddesses who are emanations of Amitābha🔽are the twelve goddesses of the retinue.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'bras bu'i he ru kas ma mo'i tshogs thams cad kyi gsang ba ni lha mo bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'bras bu'i he ru kas ma mo'i tshogs thams cad kyi gsang ba ni lha mo bcu gnyis so //
translated: Then, Bhagavat, the heruka of the result, the secret of all the hosts of mātṛkā is the twelve goddesses.

original: thabs sbas nas shes rab 'ba' zhig gi sku gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thabs sbas nas shes rab 'ba' zhig gi sku gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The method is hidden, and only the wisdom is spoken of as the body.

original: mi'am ci 'dul bas rdo rje ma mo zhes btags so //
analyzed: mi'am ci 'dul bas rdo rje ma mo zhes btags so //
translated: Since she tames the kinnaras, she is called the vajra mātṛkā.

original: khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i dam tshig gi lha mo brgyad ni /
analyzed: khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i dam tshig gi lha mo brgyad ni /
translated: The eight goddesses of the sacred commitments, such as the owl-faced one,

original: thams cad kyang gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyang gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa /
translated: all hold flaying knives and skull cups.

original: shang sngo ba byang ljang ba nub dmar ba lho ser ba mtshams phyed gzugs ma'i kha dog can /
analyzed: shang sngo ba byang ljang ba nub dmar ba lho ser ba mtshams phyed gzugs ma'i kha dog can /
translated: The colors of the faces are as follows: the east is white, the south is yellow, the west is red, the north is green, and the intermediate directions are the colors of the sky.

original: khva gdong ma la sogs pa bzhi ni mi'am ci 'dul bas mkha' lding gi gdong du bstan pa la lus bud med kyi gzugs ni /
analyzed: khva gdong ma la sogs pa bzhi ni mi'am ci 'dul bas mkha' lding gi gdong du bstan pa la lus bud med kyi gzugs ni /
translated: Their bodies are in the form of women.

original: goo r'i dang / tsoo r'i dang / pukkas'i dang / bet'a la'i bzhi'i //
analyzed: goo r'i dang / tsoo r'i dang / pukkas'i dang / bet'a la'i bzhi'i //
translated: The four of Gaurī, Caurī, Pukkasī, and Vetālī

original: zhal bzhi ni khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba dang / bdud rtsi 'khyil pa dang / rta mchog dang / gshin rje'i gshed dang bzhi thabs sbas ba'o //
analyzed: zhal bzhi ni khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba dang / bdud rtsi 'khyil pa dang / rta mchog dang / gshin rje'i gshed dang bzhi thabs sbas ba'o //
translated: have four faces, which are the four of Trilokavijaya, Amṛtakuṇḍali, Hayagrīva, and Yamāntaka.

original: gshin rje brtan ma ni gha sma ra'i'o //🔽gshin rje pho nya mo ni sha ba ra'i'o //
analyzed: gshin rje brtan ma ni gha sma ra'i'o // gshin rje pho nya mo ni sha ba ra'i'o //
translated: Yamadāntī is Ghasmarī.🔽Yamadūti is Śāvarī.

original: gshin rje mche ba ni tsanda li'o //
analyzed: gshin rje mche ba ni tsanda li'o //
translated: Yamadamṣṭrī is Caṇḍālī.

original: gshin rje 'joms ma ni to bi ni'a'o //
analyzed: gshin rje 'joms ma ni to bi ni'a'o //
translated: Yamamathanī is Ṭākinī.

original: g-yas ba'i phyed ni thabs dbyig sngon can dang / 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang / mi g-yo ba dang / stobs po che dang / khro bo chen po sngon grub pa khro mo dang bcas pas gdug pa gnon zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: g-yas ba'i phyed ni thabs dbyig sngon can dang / 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang / mi g-yo ba dang / stobs po che dang / khro bo chen po sngon grub pa khro mo dang bcas pas gdug pa gnon zhes gsungs so //
translated: The right half is the method, with Nīladaṇḍa, Kāmeśvara, Acalā, Mahābala, and Mahācanda, who have already been accomplished, subduing the wicked together with the wrathful women.

original: de lta bu la sog pa ni khams gsum du sprul ba'i lha @128b mo'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sog pa ni khams gsum du sprul ba'i lha @128b mo'o //
translated: Such are the emanated goddesses of the three realms.🔽The entire host of mātṛkā means all the emanations and the emanators.

original: ma mo'i tshogs thams cad kyis zhes pa ni sbrul ba dang nyid sbrul thams cad kyis nam mkha'i khams dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi dbyings thams cad yongs su bkang nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma mo'i tshogs thams cad kyis zhes pa ni sbrul ba dang nyid sbrul thams cad kyis nam mkha'i khams dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi dbyings thams cad yongs su bkang nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having filled the entire realm of phenomena equal with space,

original: chos kyi dbyings las byung las byung ba'i stong gsum gyi gzhal yas khang nas so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings las byung las byung ba'i stong gsum gyi gzhal yas khang nas so //
translated: from the celestial mansion of the billion worlds arisen from the realm of phenomena,

original: rigs ma lus pa lnga'i bdag pos 'bras bu'i he ru ka'o //
analyzed: rigs ma lus pa lnga'i bdag pos 'bras bu'i he ru ka'o //
translated: the lord of all the five families is the heruka of the result.

original: de'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yum rdo rje mo thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i shes rab las byung ba na mngal skyes dang rdzus skyes dang / drod gsher skyes so //
analyzed: de'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yum rdo rje mo thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i shes rab las byung ba na mngal skyes dang rdzus skyes dang / drod gsher skyes so //
translated: His mother, the nature of the pure realm of phenomena, arises from the wisdom of the nondual method and wisdom.

original: dpal he ru ka'i dam tshig ni stong ba nyid do //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka'i dam tshig ni stong ba nyid do //
translated: The pledge of glorious Heruka is emptiness.

original: de gnyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de gnyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Those two are the nature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rdo rje ni stong ba nyid de'i rigs ni ye shes /
analyzed: rdo rje ni stong ba nyid de'i rigs ni ye shes /
translated: The vajra is emptiness, and the family is the intuition of that.

original: de'i dam tshig ni kun rdzob kyi lha mo'i /
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni kun rdzob kyi lha mo'i /
translated: The commitment is the conventional deity-goddesses.

original: de gsungs pa ni tshes rnams thams cad dngos po med pa ni stong ba nyid de zhi lnga'i dngos po dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni tshes rnams thams cad dngos po med pa ni stong ba nyid de zhi lnga'i dngos po dang bral ba'o //
translated: The statement of that is that all the lunar days are empty, devoid of substantial reality, free from the five substantial realities.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par spangs pa ni mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba'i mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par spangs pa ni mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba'i mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of the characteristics of phenomena is the signlessness free from the three characteristics.

original: bdag med chos las yang dag 'byung ni gang zag dang chos kyi bdag med pas ma 'ongs pa la smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med chos las yang dag 'byung ni gang zag dang chos kyi bdag med pas ma 'ongs pa la smon pa med pa'o //
translated: The perfect emergence from selfless phenomena is the wishlessness, the aspirationlessness due to the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: rnam thar sgo gsum 'di ni don dam pa'i dam tshig mchog yin la /
analyzed: rnam thar sgo gsum 'di ni don dam pa'i dam tshig mchog yin la /
translated: These three doors of liberation are the supreme commitment of the ultimate.

original: de las byung ba'i lha mo bcu gnyis ni snang ba mtha' yas kyis sbrul nas phul ba'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i lha mo bcu gnyis ni snang ba mtha' yas kyis sbrul nas phul ba'o //
translated: The twelve goddesses who emerge from that are emanated by Amitabha and offered.

original: da ni don yod grub pas snga ma'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas go cha drug gi dpa' bo dang dpa' mo bcu gnyis phyung nas phul ba ni de rnams kyi ming 'bras bu'i he ru ka gsungs pa yin pas na /
analyzed: da ni don yod grub pas snga ma'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas go cha drug gi dpa' bo dang dpa' mo bcu gnyis phyung nas phul ba ni de rnams kyi ming 'bras bu'i he ru ka gsungs pa yin pas na /
translated: Now, Amoghasiddhi, having entered into the earlier meditative stabilization, having brought forth the twelve heroes and heroines of the six armors, and having offered them, their names are stated as the resultant Heruka.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'o //
translated: Then means immediately.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyis su med pa'i rdo rje'i dam tshig ni dpa' bo dang dpa' mo drug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyis su med pa'i rdo rje'i dam tshig ni dpa' bo dang dpa' mo drug go //
translated: The Bhagavat's pledge of nonduality is the six heroes and heroines.

original: de gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Stating that is as follows.

original: rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen po zhes bya ba ni stong ba nyid shes pa'i lhag mthong dang / bde ba dang yid bde bzhi gnas dang lhan cig sbyor ba'i 'bras bu rigs drug gi dbang phyug bskyed pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa dkar po /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug chen po zhes bya ba ni stong ba nyid shes pa'i lhag mthong dang / bde ba dang yid bde bzhi gnas dang lhan cig sbyor ba'i 'bras bu rigs drug gi dbang phyug bskyed pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa dkar po /
translated: The great lord of yogins is the one who generates the lord of the six clans, the fruit of the union with the four blisses and mental bliss together with the insight that knows emptiness, holding a vajra and bell, white Vajrasattva,

original: rnam par snang mdzad 'khor lo dang dril bu thogs pa ser po /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad 'khor lo dang dril bu thogs pa ser po /
translated: holding a wheel and bell, yellow Vairochana,🔽holding a jewel and bell, red Ratnasambhava,🔽holding a lotus and bell, green Amoghasiddhi,🔽holding a sword and bell, white Akshobhya,🔽and holding a wheel and bell, yellow Vairochana.

original: padma gar gyi dbang phyug padma dang dril bu thogs pa dmar bo /
analyzed: padma gar gyi dbang phyug padma dang dril bu thogs pa dmar bo /
translated: Padma Heruka holds a lotus and a bell, and is red.

original: rdo rje he ru ka rdo rje dril bu thogs pa sngon po //
analyzed: rdo rje he ru ka rdo rje dril bu thogs pa sngon po //
translated: Vajra Heruka holds a vajra and a bell, and is blue.

original: rdo rje nyi ma rin po che dang dril bu thogs pa ser po /
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma rin po che dang dril bu thogs pa ser po /
translated: Vajra Sun holds a jewel and a bell, and is yellow.

original: rta mchog sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa @129a * //
analyzed: rta mchog sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa @129a * //
translated: Supreme Horse holds a vajra cross and a bell, and is green.

original: ljang ga'o // rigs drug po de dag phyi rol du 'khor lo rtsibs drug la dgod pa dang / lus la snying ga dang mgo bo dang spyi gtsug dang phrag pa dang mig dang yan lag lnga la dgod pa'i zag med kyi dam tshigs srung ba'o //
analyzed: ljang ga'o // rigs drug po de dag phyi rol du 'khor lo rtsibs drug la dgod pa dang / lus la snying ga dang mgo bo dang spyi gtsug dang phrag pa dang mig dang yan lag lnga la dgod pa'i zag med kyi dam tshigs srung ba'o //
translated: These six families are the external placement on the six spokes of the wheel, and the internal placement on the heart, head, crown, shoulders, eyes, and five limbs, which are the protection of the untainted commitments.

original: de dang gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid las skyes pa'i shes rab dang lhan cig gnyis su med par dkyil 'khor la dgod pa'am /
analyzed: de dang gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid las skyes pa'i shes rab dang lhan cig gnyis su med par dkyil 'khor la dgod pa'am /
translated: Or else, one should place the mandala with the wisdom born from the Tathāgata himself, who is nondual with that, and is nondual with the wisdom born from the Tathāgata himself.

original: yang na lus la srung ba'i rnal 'byor chen mo'i mchog mu stegs can la gsang ba nyan thos la sbas pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: yang na lus la srung ba'i rnal 'byor chen mo'i mchog mu stegs can la gsang ba nyan thos la sbas pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: Or else, the supreme great yoga of protection on the body, which is secret from the tīrthikas and hidden from the śrāvakas, is taught.

original: rdo rje phag mo ni gri gug dang thod pa thogs pa dmar mo //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo ni gri gug dang thod pa thogs pa dmar mo //
translated: Vajravarahi holds a flaying knife and a skull-cup, and is red.

original: gshin rje ma ni gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa ser mo //
analyzed: gshin rje ma ni gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa ser mo //
translated: Yamai holds a flaying knife and a skull-cup, and is yellow.

original: rmongs byed ma ni gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa dkar mo //🔽g-yo byed ma ni gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa sngon mo //
analyzed: rmongs byed ma ni gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa dkar mo // g-yo byed ma ni gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa sngon mo //
translated: Mohari holds a flaying knife and a skull-cup, and is white.🔽Chamari holds a flaying knife and a skull-cup, and is blue.

original: skrag byed ma ni gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa'i du ba'i mdog can /
analyzed: skrag byed ma ni gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa'i du ba'i mdog can /
translated: Tarjani holds a flaying knife and a skull-cup, and is smoky-colored.

original: tsandi ka ni gri gug dang thod pa thogs pa dmar mo'o /
analyzed: tsandi ka ni gri gug dang thod pa thogs pa dmar mo'o /
translated: Chandali holds a flaying knife and a skull-cup, and is red.

original: de lta bu nam mkha'i khams dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi dbyings las byung ba'i gnas su dpa' bo dang gnyis su med pa'i dam tshig gi lha mo drug yum gyi lte ba dang / snying ga dang / dpral ba dang / spyi gtsug dang / yan lag thams cad la bsrung ba'i phyir gsang ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi lha mo'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nam mkha'i khams dang mnyam pa'i chos kyi dbyings las byung ba'i gnas su dpa' bo dang gnyis su med pa'i dam tshig gi lha mo drug yum gyi lte ba dang / snying ga dang / dpral ba dang / spyi gtsug dang / yan lag thams cad la bsrung ba'i phyir gsang ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi lha mo'o //
translated: Thus, the six pledge goddesses, who are inseparable from the heroes, arise from the realm of phenomena equal to space, and are the secret goddesses of the realm of phenomena, in order to protect the navel, heart, forehead, crown of the head, and all the limbs of the mother.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor mang po du ma sna tshogs pas 'thung ba'i rakta la sogs pa bdud rtsi lnga'i mchog rang gi 'od zer gyis thod pa'i nag du phyung nas /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor mang po du ma sna tshogs pas 'thung ba'i rakta la sogs pa bdud rtsi lnga'i mchog rang gi 'od zer gyis thod pa'i nag du phyung nas /
translated: Having extracted the supreme blood of the heroes and so forth, the five nectars, with their own light rays into the skull cup,

original: bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la rnam snang dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub pas sprul pa'i lha mos mchod pa byas so //🔽de nas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku gdul bya sna tshogs la gzigs pas 'dul byed kyi 'khor lo dgongs pa sna tshogs p'a kha dog dang dbyibs tha dad pa'i kun rdzob kyi dam tshig chen po rnam par rol cing sbrul ba'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i yul de
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la rnam snang dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub pas sprul pa'i lha mos mchod pa byas so // de nas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku gdul bya sna tshogs la gzigs pas 'dul byed kyi 'khor lo dgongs pa sna tshogs p'a kha dog dang dbyibs tha dad pa'i kun rdzob kyi dam tshig chen po rnam par rol cing sbrul ba'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i yul de
translated: the emanated goddesses, Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi, made offerings to the Bhagavān’s saṃbhogakāya.

original: la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: Then, the saṃbhogakāya, seeing the various objects to be tamed, entered into equipoise on the samādhi called “the emanated vajra,” the great conventional pledge, the various intentions of the wheel of the tamer, the various colors and shapes.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten ma lus shing bcud kyi sems can lus pa med pa'i sems can byang chub kyi snying po can gyis chos kyi dbyings kyi snang ba kun du gang bar gzigs nas /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten ma lus shing bcud kyi sems can lus pa med pa'i sems can byang chub kyi snying po can gyis chos kyi dbyings kyi snang ba kun du gang bar gzigs nas /
translated: Having seen that the entire world of the environment and the world of beings without exception are filled with the light of the dharmadhatu,

original: gdul bya de'i don du longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang gi ba spu'i bu gnas gling @129b bzhi bye ba phrag brgyar dkyil 'khor gyi lo sna tshogs pa spros te /
analyzed: gdul bya de'i don du longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang gi ba spu'i bu gnas gling @129b bzhi bye ba phrag brgyar dkyil 'khor gyi lo sna tshogs pa spros te /
translated: for the sake of those to be tamed, the sambhogakaya emanates various maṇḍalas from its own pores, such as the four continents and the billion worlds,

original: gdul bya sna tshogs pa 'dul ba'i thabs kyis nas mkha'i khams yongs su gang bar gdul bya snod dang ldan pa rnams la lha'i mig dang rna ba la snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: gdul bya sna tshogs pa 'dul ba'i thabs kyis nas mkha'i khams yongs su gang bar gdul bya snod dang ldan pa rnams la lha'i mig dang rna ba la snang bar gyur to //
translated: and having filled the realm of space with the methods of taming the various to be tamed, the eyes and ears of those who are suitable vessels to be tamed are illuminated.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling yon tan rgyal mtshan 'dir bcom ldan 'das bde mchog rigs lnga thams cad kyi bdag po zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pas sna tshogs pa'i sku 'dzin pa drag po 'jigs byed kyi gdul bya'i sems can lha bzhi dang / dri za bzhi dang /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling yon tan rgyal mtshan 'dir bcom ldan 'das bde mchog rigs lnga thams cad kyi bdag po zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pas sna tshogs pa'i sku 'dzin pa drag po 'jigs byed kyi gdul bya'i sems can lha bzhi dang / dri za bzhi dang /
translated: In this world of Jambudvipa, the four-faced, twelve-armed Bhagavat Cakrasaṃvara, lord of all five families, who holds various forms, with the intention of benefiting the four gods, four gandharvas,

original: gnod sbyin bzhi dang / srin po bzhi dang / klu bzhi dang / lha ma yin bzhi dang / mi'am ci bzhi dang / dur khrod brgyad kyi sems can la phan par rjes su dgongs nas rgyu thugs rje chen po las byung ba'i 'bras bu'i khro bo'i nyams dgu dang ldan pa'i yab yum gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas ye shes dang /
analyzed: gnod sbyin bzhi dang / srin po bzhi dang / klu bzhi dang / lha ma yin bzhi dang / mi'am ci bzhi dang / dur khrod brgyad kyi sems can la phan par rjes su dgongs nas rgyu thugs rje chen po las byung ba'i 'bras bu'i khro bo'i nyams dgu dang ldan pa'i yab yum gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas ye shes dang /
translated: four yakṣas, four rākṣasas, four nāgas, four asuras, four kinnaras, and the beings of the eight charnel grounds, arose from the cause of great compassion as the result, possessing the nine expressions of wrath, in union with the mother, with the gnosis of nondual union.

original: thugs dang / gsung dang / sku dang / dam tshig gi 'khor lo do mtshar ba sna tshogs shing 'dzam bu'i gling mtha' yas pa'i gnas sum cu rtsa gnyis su dbang byas pa dang / longs spyod pa dang / thim pa'i cho 'phrul chen po rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i sa 'og dang /
analyzed: thugs dang / gsung dang / sku dang / dam tshig gi 'khor lo do mtshar ba sna tshogs shing 'dzam bu'i gling mtha' yas pa'i gnas sum cu rtsa gnyis su dbang byas pa dang / longs spyod pa dang / thim pa'i cho 'phrul chen po rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i sa 'og dang /
translated: The amazing wheel of mind, speech, body, and samaya, which is the great magical display of the empowerment, enjoyment, and dissolution in the thirty-two places of infinite Jambudvīpas, is the wheel of the lord of the earth, equal to the particles of the entire three realms of the environment and its inhabitants.

original: sa bla dang sa steng gi bdag po'i 'khor lo bde mchog gi dkyil 'khor du yang dag par bstan nas /
analyzed: sa bla dang sa steng gi bdag po'i 'khor lo bde mchog gi dkyil 'khor du yang dag par bstan nas /
translated: Having perfectly revealed the maṇḍala of Cakrasaṃvara,

original: sbrul pa'i sku gzugs kyi sgo nas gdul bya btul ba chos bshad nas //
analyzed: sbrul pa'i sku gzugs kyi sgo nas gdul bya btul ba chos bshad nas //
translated: the nirmāṇakāya tames disciples through the door of the form of the nirmāṇakāya.🔽Now, the maṇḍala of the air vāyu arises from yaṃ, the maṇḍala of fire arises from raṃ, the maṇḍala of water arises from vaṃ, and the maṇḍala of Mahādeva arises from laṃ.

original: da na yam la sa rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / ram las me'i dkyil 'khor dang / bam las chu'i dkyil 'khor dang / lam las dbang chen gyi skyil 'khor gyi steng du ri'i rgyal po ri rab shar shel //🔽lho beed'u r+ya /
analyzed: da na yam la sa rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / ram las me'i dkyil 'khor dang / bam las chu'i dkyil 'khor dang / lam las dbang chen gyi skyil 'khor gyi steng du ri'i rgyal po ri rab shar shel // lho beed'u r+ya /
translated: On top of that, Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, arises from kaṃ.🔽The east is crystal,🔽the south is beryl,

original: nub padma r'a ga //
analyzed: nub padma r'a ga //
translated: the west is ruby,🔽and the north is gold.

original: byang gser gyi rang bzhin gyi gzi brjid gser gyi ri bdun dang / gling bzhi gling phran brgyad lcags ri nag pos bskor ba de'i steng du /
analyzed: byang gser gyi rang bzhin gyi gzi brjid gser gyi ri bdun dang / gling bzhi gling phran brgyad lcags ri nag pos bskor ba de'i steng du /
translated: In the north, the golden mountain with seven golden mountains, the four continents, the eight subcontinents, and the black iron perimeter mountain.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin ae gru gsum chos kyi dbyings kyi nang du /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin ae gru gsum chos kyi dbyings kyi nang du /
translated: Upon that, the nature of glorious Vajrasattva is the triangular e, the inner space of the dharmadhatu.

original: aom las 'khor lo //🔽de las rnam par snang mdzad 'og nas 'byung ba lta bu'i khro bo chen po yongs su gyur ba las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje chen po dang padma bcas pa'i gzhal yas khang dkyil 'khor chen po lnga bcu rtsa drug 'khor ba'i gnyen por gyur ba na
analyzed: aom las 'khor lo // de las rnam par snang mdzad 'og nas 'byung ba lta bu'i khro bo chen po yongs su gyur ba las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje chen po dang padma bcas pa'i gzhal yas khang dkyil 'khor chen po lnga bcu rtsa drug 'khor ba'i gnyen por gyur ba na
translated: From om, there is a wheel.🔽From that, there is a great wrathful one, similar to Vairocana below. The great vajra cross and lotus arise from the transformation of that. The celestial mansion with the great mandala of thirty-six deities becomes the antidote for the cycle of existence.

original: rgyal po'o // kun du bzang bo gyur ba las byung ba'i ae gru gsum gyi bus su rdo rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor sbrul ba'i nang du phyi'i 'khor lo rnams @130a * //
analyzed: rgyal po'o // kun du bzang bo gyur ba las byung ba'i ae gru gsum gyi bus su rdo rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor sbrul ba'i nang du phyi'i 'khor lo rnams @130a * //
translated: In the center of the great vajra mandala that arises from the transformation of Samantabhadra, the outer wheels are drawn.

original: la mngal skyes dang / sgong skyes dang / drod gsher las skyes dang / rdzus skyes kyis 'du zhing 'khor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: la mngal skyes dang / sgong skyes dang / drod gsher las skyes dang / rdzus skyes kyis 'du zhing 'khor bar 'gyur te /
translated: They will gather and circle in the womb-born, egg-born, moisture-born, and spontaneously-born realms.

original: rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs pas mdzes pa'i sa gzhi gzhal yas khang bslang ba'i rtsig pa la rin po che'i rgyan //
analyzed: rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs pas mdzes pa'i sa gzhi gzhal yas khang bslang ba'i rtsig pa la rin po che'i rgyan //
translated: The ground is beautified with various jewels. The celestial mansion is raised on the walls of the jeweled ornaments.

original: shar du rdo rje dang / lhor rin po che dang / nub tu padma dang / byang du sna tshogs rdo rjes spras pas /
analyzed: shar du rdo rje dang / lhor rin po che dang / nub tu padma dang / byang du sna tshogs rdo rjes spras pas /
translated: In the east is a vajra, in the south a jewel, in the west a lotus, and in the north a crossed vajra.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma ltar mdog sdug pa'i nyi zla dang / dril bu dang / dril bu dang / phyogs bzhir rnga yab dang / rgyal mtshan dang / g-yer ka'i dra bas mig mangs ris su bris ba /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma ltar mdog sdug pa'i nyi zla dang / dril bu dang / dril bu dang / phyogs bzhir rnga yab dang / rgyal mtshan dang / g-yer ka'i dra bas mig mangs ris su bris ba /
translated: The sun and moon are beautiful like the moon and sun, with a bell and a small drum. In the four directions are yak-tail fans, victory banners, and nets of small bells.

original: rta babs bzhi dang rdo rje theg pa'i mdo sde'i chos kyi 'khor lo la 'jug lo la 'jug pa'i rdo rje 'obs dang me 'od kyis bskor ba /
analyzed: rta babs bzhi dang rdo rje theg pa'i mdo sde'i chos kyi 'khor lo la 'jug lo la 'jug pa'i rdo rje 'obs dang me 'od kyis bskor ba /
translated: There are four arched gates and the vajra fence and the blazing fire that surround the Dharma wheel of the vajra vehicle.

original: dril bu g-yer kas chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra sgrogs pa de'i nang du dur khrod brgyad ni shar gyi shing la sna tshogs pa'i lha dang / nub kyi shing la klu dang / byang gi shing la gnod sbyin dang / lho nub kyi shing la srin po dang /
analyzed: dril bu g-yer kas chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra sgrogs pa de'i nang du dur khrod brgyad ni shar gyi shing la sna tshogs pa'i lha dang / nub kyi shing la klu dang / byang gi shing la gnod sbyin dang / lho nub kyi shing la srin po dang /
translated: Inside that, on the eastern tree are various gods, on the western tree are nāgas, on the northern tree are yakṣas, on the southwestern tree are rākṣasas,

original: byang shar gyi shing la 'byung po dbang ldan dang / lho phyogs kyi shing la gshin rje yi dags kyis bskor ba dang / shar lho'i shing la me lha sha za'i gzugs can dang / nub byang gi shing la rlung lha smyo byed brjed byed kyi 'khor can dang /
analyzed: byang shar gyi shing la 'byung po dbang ldan dang / lho phyogs kyi shing la gshin rje yi dags kyis bskor ba dang / shar lho'i shing la me lha sha za'i gzugs can dang / nub byang gi shing la rlung lha smyo byed brjed byed kyi 'khor can dang /
translated: on the northeastern tree are powerful bhūtas, on the southern tree is Yama surrounded by pretas, on the southeastern tree is Agni in the form of a piśāca, and on the northwestern tree is Vāyu surrounded by unmada and apasmāra.

original: de rnams kyi gzugs can ni glang po che la sog pa'i gdong ba can nam /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gzugs can ni glang po che la sog pa'i gdong ba can nam /
translated: Their forms are those of an elephant-faced gaṇapati,

original: yang na phyogs skyong rang gi gzugs kyis bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na phyogs skyong rang gi gzugs kyis bri bar bya'o //
translated: or they can be drawn in the forms of the directional guardians themselves.

original: de'i 'khor ni shar du lha'i gdon dang / lhor ma mo ma rangs pa dang / nub tu klu shin du gdug pa dang / byang du gnod sbyin la ro langs mang po'i 'khor dang / byang shar du ro ma tshig pa dang / shar lhor ro bsregs pa dang /
analyzed: de'i 'khor ni shar du lha'i gdon dang / lhor ma mo ma rangs pa dang / nub tu klu shin du gdug pa dang / byang du gnod sbyin la ro langs mang po'i 'khor dang / byang shar du ro ma tshig pa dang / shar lhor ro bsregs pa dang /
translated: In the east, the retinue of the lord of death is the god-demon, in the south is the displeased mamo, in the west is the very poisonous nāga, in the north is the yakṣa, and in the northeast is the many corpse-like retinue.🔽In the southeast is the unburned corpse, in the southwest is the burned corpse,

original: lho nub tu gtum pos za ba dang / nub byang du ce sbyang dang / ce sbyang mo yis zos nas dum bur byed cing sgra sgrogs pa dang / dur khrod brgyad du dpa' bo brgyad dang / mkha' 'gro ma brgyad phat kyi sgra dang /🔽aa la la'i sgra sgrogs pa rnal 'byor ma dril bu //
analyzed: lho nub tu gtum pos za ba dang / nub byang du ce sbyang dang / ce sbyang mo yis zos nas dum bur byed cing sgra sgrogs pa dang / dur khrod brgyad du dpa' bo brgyad dang / mkha' 'gro ma brgyad phat kyi sgra dang / aa la la'i sgra sgrogs pa rnal 'byor ma dril bu //
translated: in the northwest is the corpse eaten by the jackal and jackaless, which is divided into pieces and howls, and in the eight charnel grounds are the eight heroes and eight ḍākinīs, the sound of “phaṭ,”🔽and the sound of “a la la.”🔽The sound of the hero’s hand drum and the sound of the yoginī’s bell are resounding.

original: dpa' bo cang te'u brdung ba'i sgra sgrogs shing ngo mtshar ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dpa' bo cang te'u brdung ba'i sgra sgrogs shing ngo mtshar ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is amazing,

original: mgo med pa brgyad gar bye dpas nye bar brgyan pa /
analyzed: mgo med pa brgyad gar bye dpas nye bar brgyan pa /
translated: the eight headless ones are dancing.

original: bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa gzhal yas khang gdan dang bcas pa bcom ldan 'das la phul lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa gzhal yas khang gdan dang bcas pa bcom ldan 'das la phul lo //
translated: The Bhagavān Akṣobhya, together with the celestial mansion and seat, is offered to the Bhagavān.

original: gnas de ru gleng bslang ba'i phyir phyag na rdo rjes bsnyen bkur gyi phyag dang mchod pa byas nas gdul bya sems can thams cad dge ba la gzung pa'i phyir snying rje'i nyams kyis stang stabs drug cu rtsa @130b bzhis rkang ba'i rol pa dang /
analyzed: gnas de ru gleng bslang ba'i phyir phyag na rdo rjes bsnyen bkur gyi phyag dang mchod pa byas nas gdul bya sems can thams cad dge ba la gzung pa'i phyir snying rje'i nyams kyis stang stabs drug cu rtsa @130b bzhis rkang ba'i rol pa dang /
translated: In order to bring up the topic, Vajrapāṇi made a gesture of respect and offering and, in order to lead all sentient beings to be trained to virtue, he danced with the sixty-four dance movements of compassion.

original: lag pa'i phyag rgyas rnam par rol ba'i padmo'i sngon bu bskor ba ltar lha drug cu rtsa bzhi gar byed cing thal mo sbyar nas mchod do //
analyzed: lag pa'i phyag rgyas rnam par rol ba'i padmo'i sngon bu bskor ba ltar lha drug cu rtsa bzhi gar byed cing thal mo sbyar nas mchod do //
translated: In order to bring up the topic, Vajrapāṇi made a gesture of respect and worship, and in order to lead all sentient beings to be trained to virtue, with the mood of compassion, he danced with the sixty-four postures, and with the mudrā of the hands, he circled like a lotus in full bloom, dancing with the sixty-four deities, and with palms joined, he made offerings.

original: de nas g-yas brkyang ba'i gnas pas thal mo sbyar te /
analyzed: de nas g-yas brkyang ba'i gnas pas thal mo sbyar te /
translated: Then, with the posture of right leg extended, he joined his palms🔽and made a request to Buddha Skull, who is adorned with bone ornaments.

original: rus pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i sangs rgyas thod pa la gsol ba btab po zhes bya ba gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: rus pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i sangs rgyas thod pa la gsol ba btab po zhes bya ba gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: This is the request.

original: ston pa'i mtshan nyid ni mchog tu zab mo'i chos kyi sku'i tshul dang / khro bo'i rgyal po chen po longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sbrul ba'i sku ru yum dang 'khyud pa rnam par sgeg pa'i sku chen po 'dzin pas /
analyzed: ston pa'i mtshan nyid ni mchog tu zab mo'i chos kyi sku'i tshul dang / khro bo'i rgyal po chen po longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sbrul ba'i sku ru yum dang 'khyud pa rnam par sgeg pa'i sku chen po 'dzin pas /
translated: the great body of the dance.🔽Although the Dharma is explained in the form of the Jambudvīpa, on🔽the summit of Sumeru, in the maṇḍala of the retinue, the root tantra of the🔽profound speech that explains emptiness and gnosis, the Tantra of the🔽Binding of the Web of ḍākinīs of the Fifty-Six Maṇḍalas of the King of

original: 'jam bu'i gling du du gzugs kyi sgo nas chos bshad kyang ri rab kyi steng du 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du stong ba nyid dang / ye shes ston pa'i zab pa'i gsung gi rtsa ba'i rgyud nges par brjod pa'i ba ma zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug gi mkha' 'gro pa'i dra ba'i tshogs kyi sngom pa 'dul byed kyi 'khor lo'i rgyal pos gdul bya sems can sna tshogs pa'i bsam
analyzed: 'jam bu'i gling du du gzugs kyi sgo nas chos bshad kyang ri rab kyi steng du 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du stong ba nyid dang / ye shes ston pa'i zab pa'i gsung gi rtsa ba'i rgyud nges par brjod pa'i ba ma zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug gi mkha' 'gro pa'i dra ba'i tshogs kyi sngom pa 'dul byed kyi 'khor lo'i rgyal pos gdul bya sems can sna tshogs pa'i bsam
translated: the Wheel of Vinaya, is taught.

original: pa dang mthun pa mi phyed kyi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa'i 'khor lo ma 'ongs par dngos grub gsum gyis phan zhing tshe 'dir dngos grub gsum gyi bde bas bskyed rdzogs sna tshogs pa'i chos bstan ba rtsa ba'i rgyud mdzad du gsol zhes rgyud kyi gleng bslang
analyzed: pa dang mthun pa mi phyed kyi dbang phyug ma la sogs pa'i 'khor lo ma 'ongs par dngos grub gsum gyis phan zhing tshe 'dir dngos grub gsum gyi bde bas bskyed rdzogs sna tshogs pa'i chos bstan ba rtsa ba'i rgyud mdzad du gsol zhes rgyud kyi gleng bslang
translated: The retinue of the dakini Queen of Action and so forth, who are in harmony with the three spiritual powers of the future, and who are the benefactors of the three spiritual powers in this life, request the root tantra to be taught, saying, “Please teach the various dharmas of the creation and completion stages with the bliss of the three spiritual powers.”

original: ba dang skabs phye ba ni gdul bya'i don du sems dpa' chen po legs so //
analyzed: ba dang skabs phye ba ni gdul bya'i don du sems dpa' chen po legs so //
translated: The request to expound the tantra is for the benefit of those to be tamed.

original: 'dul byed kyi 'khor lag na rdo rje khyod legs par nyon cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dul byed kyi 'khor lag na rdo rje khyod legs par nyon cig ces bya'o //
translated: The retinue of the tamer, Vajrapani, is told, “Listen well!”

original: le'u gnyis pa'i 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa'i 'grel ba'o /
translated: This is the commentary to the second chapter.

original: // / de ltar gleng gzhi dang gleng bslang bshad nas rgyud 'byung ba'i rgyu lus mdor gzhag bshad par bzhes pas de nas bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: // / de ltar gleng gzhi dang gleng bslang bshad nas rgyud 'byung ba'i rgyu lus mdor gzhag bshad par bzhes pas de nas bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: Having explained the introduction and the request to expound the tantra, the root tantra is explained in order to set forth the cause from which the tantra arises. Therefore, “then” is stated.

original: ston pa bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la don dang po bskyed rim thams cad kyi rgyud rdo rje gsang ba gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ston pa bcom ldan 'das kyis nyan pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la don dang po bskyed rim thams cad kyi rgyud rdo rje gsang ba gsungs pa ni /
translated: The Teacher, the Bhagavat, taught the tantra of the vajra secret, the cause of all the generation stages, to the entire retinue of listeners.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi snying gar dbyang yig las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi snying gar dbyang yig las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: In the heart of all future yogins and yoginis, the moon mandala arises from the vowels,

original: gsal byed las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor //
analyzed: gsal byed las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor //
translated: and the sun mandala arises from the consonants.

original: de'i dbus su h'um bsgoms pa las rdo rje phra mo'i dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug sbrul ba ni /
analyzed: de'i dbus su h'um bsgoms pa las rdo rje phra mo'i dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug sbrul ba ni /
translated: In the center of those, one should meditate on a hum, from which arises the mandala of the fifty-six subtle vajras.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rnal 'byor pas thun bzhir bsgoms te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rnal 'byor pas thun bzhir bsgoms te /
translated: Future yogins and yoginis should meditate on this in four sessions.

original: dkyil 'khor lnga bcu drug po de dag de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mkha' 'gro ma dra ba'i sngom pa zhes lnga bcu rtsa drug kun la ming gis gdags so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor lnga bcu drug po de dag de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mkha' 'gro ma dra ba'i sngom pa zhes lnga bcu rtsa drug kun la ming gis gdags so //
translated: Those fifty-six mandalas are called the binding of the dakinis of all tathagatas, and all fifty-six are designated by that name.

original: @131a * // don gnyis pa dkyil 'khor grub zin pa de rnams la /
analyzed: @131a * // don gnyis pa dkyil 'khor grub zin pa de rnams la /
translated: The second topic is the accomplishment of those already existing mandalas.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i sngags 'di ni byin gyis brlab pa bstan par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i sngags 'di ni byin gyis brlab pa bstan par byed pa yin te /
translated: The mantra that will be taught below is the one that blesses.

original: de yang byin gyis rlob pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i sngom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang byin gyis rlob pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba'i sngom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is called the binding of the net of the dakinis who bless.🔽When asked, “What is the mantra of blessing like?”

original: byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags de ji ltar bu lags zhes zhus pa dang / gsang ba'i snying po mchog nyon cig /🔽ces bka' stsal te /🔽de la ye shes kyi tshogs snod bcud thams cad aom a'a:h'um gsum du bsdus pa'i tshe sngags dang pos rang bzhin dag pas chos thams cad dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags de ji ltar bu lags zhes zhus pa dang / gsang ba'i snying po mchog nyon cig / ces bka' stsal te / de la ye shes kyi tshogs snod bcud thams cad aom a'a:h'um gsum du bsdus pa'i tshe sngags dang pos rang bzhin dag pas chos thams cad dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: Listen to the supreme secret essence!🔽In that regard, when the accumulation of wisdom gathers all the world and beings into the three syllables oṃ āḥ hūṃ, at the time of the first mantra, it is said, “Since the nature is pure, all phenomena are pure.”

original: aom a'a:h'um gsum thig ler gyur pa'i tshe sngags gnyis pa stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin bdag nyi dang yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um gsum thig ler gyur pa'i tshe sngags gnyis pa stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin bdag nyi dang yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: When the three syllables oṃ āḥ hūṃ become the bindu, at the time of the second mantra, it is said, “Since the nature of the vajra of the wisdom of emptiness is the nature of the self-appearance of the bindu, it is pure.”

original: rdzus skyes la nyi zla'i dbus su thig le 'jug pa'i sngags gsum pa rdo rje dag pas chos thams cad dag go zhes gsung so //
analyzed: rdzus skyes la nyi zla'i dbus su thig le 'jug pa'i sngags gsum pa rdo rje dag pas chos thams cad dag go zhes gsung so //
translated: For the spontaneously born, when the three seed syllables enter the drop in the center of the sun and moon, the fourth mantra, the pure vajra, proclaims, “All phenomena are pure.”

original: nyi zla kha sbyar gyi dbus na h'um gi spro bsdu las 'byung ba'i dam tshigs sems dpa' la ye shes sems dpa' 'jug pa'i tshe sngags bzhi pa rnal 'byor ma dag pas chos thams cad kyi rnal 'byor ma dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyi zla kha sbyar gyi dbus na h'um gi spro bsdu las 'byung ba'i dam tshigs sems dpa' la ye shes sems dpa' 'jug pa'i tshe sngags bzhi pa rnal 'byor ma dag pas chos thams cad kyi rnal 'byor ma dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: When the gnosis being enters the commitment being, which arises from the emanation and re-absorption of hūṃ in the center of the joined sun and moon, the fifth mantra, the pure gnosis, proclaims, “All phenomena are the pure gnosis.”

original: la la sgong skyes la mos pa'i tshe sngags lnga pa ye shes dag pas chos thams cad kyi ye shes dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: la la sgong skyes la mos pa'i tshe sngags lnga pa ye shes dag pas chos thams cad kyi ye shes dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: When one is devoted to the egg-born, the fifth mantra, the pure gnosis, proclaims, “All phenomena are the pure gnosis.”

original: drod gsher skyes la mos pa yig 'bru dang phyag mtshan las skyes pa'i tshe sngags drug pa dam tshig dag pas chos thams cad kyi dam tshig dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: drod gsher skyes la mos pa yig 'bru dang phyag mtshan las skyes pa'i tshe sngags drug pa dam tshig dag pas chos thams cad kyi dam tshig dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: When one is devoted to the moisture-born, when one is born from seed syllables and hand implements, the sixth mantra, the pure commitment, proclaims, “All phenomena are the pure commitment.”

original: mngal skyes la mos pa'i tshe rdo rje dang padma byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags bdun pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rjes su chags pa'i rdo rje'i rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngal skyes la mos pa'i tshe rdo rje dang padma byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags bdun pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rjes su chags pa'i rdo rje'i rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: When one is interested in womb birth, one recites the seven-syllable mantra of vajra and lotus consecration, and one says, “I am the nature of the vajra of the exalted wisdom of emptiness of all tathāgatas, which is the passion of the vajra.”

original: phung po lnga sangs rgyas dbang po drug sems dpa' 'byung ba lnga lha mo gnas nyid shu rtsa bzhi lus kyi dkyil 'khor la bkod pa'i tshe sngags brgyad pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje'i rang🔽bzhin bdag yin no zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: phung po lnga sangs rgyas dbang po drug sems dpa' 'byung ba lnga lha mo gnas nyid shu rtsa bzhi lus kyi dkyil 'khor la bkod pa'i tshe sngags brgyad pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes gsungs so /
translated: When one arranges the five aggregates as the five buddhas, the six sense powers as the six bodhisattvas, the five elements as the five goddesses, and the twenty-four places as the body mandala, one recites the eight-syllable mantra, and one says, “I am the nature of the vajra of the exalted wisdom of the reality realm, which is the complete purity of all tathāgatas.”

original: lus kyi gnas nyid shu rtsa bzhir bu dz'a aom aa go r'a de m'a la sogs pa bkod pa'i tshe sngags dgu pa sngags thams cad pas chos thams dag go gsungs so //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas nyid shu rtsa bzhir bu dz'a aom aa go r'a de m'a la sogs pa bkod pa'i tshe sngags dgu pa sngags thams cad pas chos thams dag go gsungs so //
translated: When one arranges the twenty-four places of the body with the nine-syllable mantra, “oṃ āḥ go ra ā de ma,” and so on, one recites the nine-syllable mantra, and one says, “I am the nature of the vajra of the exalted wisdom of the reality realm, which is the complete purity of all mantras.”

original: lha thams cad skyes pa las gar gyi nyams dgur grub pa'i tshe /
analyzed: lha thams cad skyes pa las gar gyi nyams dgur grub pa'i tshe /
translated: When all the deities are born and achieve the nine moods of dance,

original: sngags bcu pa khro bo @131b thams cad kyi chos kyi sngags kyis dag go zhes gsungs so //🔽sgom brgyad bskyed pa'i tshe sngags bcu gcig pa khro bo dag pas chos thams cad kyi khro bo dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngags bcu pa khro bo @131b thams cad kyi chos kyi sngags kyis dag go zhes gsungs so // sgom brgyad bskyed pa'i tshe sngags bcu gcig pa khro bo dag pas chos thams cad kyi khro bo dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that the mantra of the eleventh stage purifies all the wrathful ones.🔽When the eight goddesses are generated, it is said that the mantra of the twelfth stage purifies all phenomena.

original: thugs kyi 'khor lo bskyed pa'i tshe sngags bcu gnyis pa sems dag pas chos thams cad sems kyi dag go zhes gsungs so //🔽gsung gi 'khor lo bskyed pa'i tshe sngags bcu gsum pa dag pas chos thams cad dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thugs kyi 'khor lo bskyed pa'i tshe sngags bcu gnyis pa sems dag pas chos thams cad sems kyi dag go zhes gsungs so // gsung gi 'khor lo bskyed pa'i tshe sngags bcu gsum pa dag pas chos thams cad dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: When the mind wheel is generated, it is said that the mantra of the thirteenth stage purifies all phenomena.🔽When the speech wheel is generated, it is said that the mantra of the fourteenth stage purifies all phenomena.

original: sku'i 'khor lo bskyed pa'i tshe sngags bcu bzhi pa lus dag pas chos thams cad lus kyis dag go //🔽ye shes sems dpa' bcug pa'i tshe sngags bco lnga pa ye shes bdud rtsi dag pas chos thams cad ye shes bdud rtsis dag go //
analyzed: sku'i 'khor lo bskyed pa'i tshe sngags bcu bzhi pa lus dag pas chos thams cad lus kyis dag go //🔽ye shes sems dpa' bcug pa'i tshe sngags bco lnga pa ye shes bdud rtsi dag pas chos thams cad ye shes bdud rtsis dag go //
translated: When the body wheel is generated, it is said that the mantra of the fifteenth stage purifies all phenomena.🔽When the gnosis being is invoked, it is said that the mantra of the sixteenth stage purifies all phenomena.

original: dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i go cha bkon pa'i tshe sngags bcu drug pa dam tshig sna tshogs kyi chos kun yang dag pas chos thams cad dam tshig sna tshogs kyis dag go //
analyzed: dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i go cha bkon pa'i tshe sngags bcu drug pa dam tshig sna tshogs kyi chos kun yang dag pas chos thams cad dam tshig sna tshogs kyis dag go //
translated: When donning the armor of the heroes and heroines, the sixteenth mantra, “All phenomena are pure by means of the variety of pledges,” purifies all phenomena by means of the variety of pledges.

original: bzlas pa byed pa'i tshe sngags bcu bdun pa spyod pa dag pas chos thams cad spyod pas dag go //
analyzed: bzlas pa byed pa'i tshe sngags bcu bdun pa spyod pa dag pas chos thams cad spyod pas dag go //
translated: When doing the recitation, the seventeenth mantra, “Pure by means of the conduct,” purifies all phenomena by means of the conduct.

original: dam tshig sems dpa'i thugs kar ye shes sems dpa' de'i thugs kar phyag mtshan dang yig 'bru ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bsgom pa'i tshe sngags bco brgyad pa rnal 'byor gsum dag pas chos thams cad rnal 'byor gsum gyis dag go //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa'i thugs kar ye shes sems dpa' de'i thugs kar phyag mtshan dang yig 'bru ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bsgom pa'i tshe sngags bco brgyad pa rnal 'byor gsum dag pas chos thams cad rnal 'byor gsum gyis dag go //
translated: When meditating on the awareness being in the heart of the pledge being, the insignia and seed syllable in the heart of the awareness being, and the concentration being, the eighteenth mantra, “Pure by means of the three yogas,” purifies all phenomena by means of the three yogas.

original: dbang bskur ba'i tshe sngags bcud gu pa dbang bskur dag pas chos thams cad dbang bskur gyis dag go //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i tshe sngags bcud gu pa dbang bskur dag pas chos thams cad dbang bskur gyis dag go //
translated: When conferring empowerment, the nineteenth mantra, “Pure by means of the conferral of empowerment,” purifies all phenomena by means of the conferral of empowerment.

original: rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags kyis lha mo brgyad sprul pa'i tshe sngags nyid shu pa mchod pa dag pas chos thams cad mchod pas dag go //
analyzed: rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags kyis lha mo brgyad sprul pa'i tshe sngags nyid shu pa mchod pa dag pas chos thams cad mchod pas dag go //
translated: When the eight goddesses are emanated by the mantra of eight lines, the mantra itself is the twenty-first, and all phenomena are purified by the offering of the pure offering.

original: yab yum gnyis dga' ba bzhi bsgom pa'i tshe sngags nyer gcig pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gnyis su med pa'i mchod pa'i rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yab yum gnyis dga' ba bzhi bsgom pa'i tshe sngags nyer gcig pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gnyis su med pa'i mchod pa'i rang bzhin bdag yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the father and mother meditate on the four joys, the twenty-first mantra is the nature of the nondual offering of all tathāgatas, which is oneself.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'i tshe sngags nyer gnyis pa dkyil 'khor dag pas chos thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor dag go //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'i tshe sngags nyer gnyis pa dkyil 'khor dag pas chos thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor dag go //
translated: When meditating on the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the twenty-second mantra is the purity of the maṇḍala, and all phenomena are the purity of the maṇḍala.

original: gtso bo yab yum 'ba' zhig bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gtso bo yab yum 'ba' zhig bsgom pa'i tshe /
translated: When meditating on the principal father and mother alone,

analyzed: sngags nyer gsum pa bdag po dag pas chos thams cad bdag pos dag go //
translated: the twenty-third mantra is the purity of the lord, and all phenomena are the purity of the lord.

analyzed: khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi dpa' bor bsgom pa'i tshe sngags nyer bzhi pa dpa' bo dag pas chos thams cad dpa' bos dag go //
translated: When meditating on the twenty-four elements as heroes, the twenty-fourth mantra is the purity of the heroes, and all phenomena are the purity of the heroes.

analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi dpa' mor bsgom @132a * //

analyzed: pa'i tshe / sngags nyer lnga pa rnal 'byor ma dag pas chos thams cad rnal 'byor mas dag go //
translated: the twenty-fifth mantra, “All phenomena are pure by the purity of the yoginīs,”🔽is recited. When meditating on the deity of the union of illusion and emptiness,

analyzed: sgyu ma dang stong pa zung 'jug gi lha bsgom pa'i tshe sngags nyer drug pa de nyid dag pas chos thams cad de kho na nyid dag go //
translated: the twenty-sixth mantra, “All phenomena are pure by the purity of reality,”

analyzed: he ru ka'i mtshan nyid bsgom pa'i tshe sngags nyer bdun pa ste /
translated: is recited. When meditating on the characteristics of Heruka, the twenty-seventh mantra is recited.🔽“

analyzed: nyi zhes bya ba rgyu dang bral bas chos thams cad rgyu dang bral ba'o //
translated: Ni” is free from causes, so all phenomena are free from causes.🔽“

analyzed: du zhes bya ba bkod pa dang bral bas chos thams cad bkod pa dang bral ba'o //

analyzed: ka zhes bya ba gang du yang mi gnas pas chos thams gang du yang mi gnas so //
translated: Ka” does not abide anywhere, so all phenomena do not abide anywhere.

analyzed: thun bzhir lhan cig tu cig car bsgom pa'i tshe sngags nyer brgyad pa skad cig gis dag pas chos thams cad skad cig gis dag go //
translated: When meditating on the four sessions simultaneously and all at once, the twenty-eighth mantra, “All phenomena are pure by the purity of an instant,”🔽is recited.

analyzed: stong gsum gyi snod bcud lta'i 'khor lor bsgom pa'i cho sngags nyer dgu pa srid pa dag pas chos thams cad srid pas dag go //
translated: The twenty-ninth mantra, “Purification of existence,” is meditated upon as the wheel of the world and its inhabitants. It purifies all phenomena by purifying existence.

original: 'gro ba rigs drug lhar bskyed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'gro ba rigs drug lhar bskyed pa'i tshe /
translated: When the six classes of beings are generated as deities,

analyzed: sngags sum cu pa skye ba dag pas chos thams cad skye ba'i srid pas dag go //
translated: the thirtieth mantra, “Purification of birth,” purifies all phenomena by purifying the birth of existence.🔽When one enjoys the five sense objects,

analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la longs spyod pa'i tshe sngags so gcig pa longs spyod dag pas chos thams cad longs spyod kyis dag go //
translated: the thirty-first mantra, “Purification of enjoyment,” purifies all phenomena by purifying enjoyment.

analyzed: kha zas kyi rnal 'byor bdud rtsi ldar byin gyis brlabs nas za ba'i tshe /

analyzed: sngags so gnyis pa bza' ba dag pas chos thams cad bza' bas dag go //
translated: the thirty-second mantra, “Purification of food,” purifies all phenomena by purifying food.

analyzed: thun mtshams kyi he ru ka spyod lam rnam bzhi'i te sngags so gsum pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dag pas chos thams cad mnyam par ma bzhag pas dag go //
translated: The thirty-third mantra, “Purification of non-equipoise,” is the Heruka of the session breaks and the four types of daily activities. It purifies all phenomena by purifying non-equipoise.

original: zab pa'i rdzogs rim bsgom pa'i tshe sngags so bzhi pa rang rig pa dag pas chos thams cad rang rig pas dag go //
analyzed: zab pa'i rdzogs rim bsgom pa'i tshe sngags so bzhi pa rang rig pa dag pas chos thams cad rang rig pas dag go //
translated: When meditating on the profound completion stage, since the mantra “so” purifies one’s awareness, all phenomena are purified by one’s awareness.

original: zhe sdang bsgom pa'i tshe sngags so lnga pa zhe sdang dag pas chos thams cad zhe sdang gis dag go //
analyzed: zhe sdang bsgom pa'i tshe sngags so lnga pa zhe sdang dag pas chos thams cad zhe sdang gis dag go //
translated: When meditating on anger, since the mantra “so” purifies anger, all phenomena are purified by anger.

original: rnam snang bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam snang bsgom pa'i tshe /
translated: When meditating on Vairocana,

translated: since the mantra “so” purifies ignorance, all phenomena are purified by ignorance.🔽When meditating on Amitābha, since the mantra “so” purifies desire, all phenomena are purified by desire.🔽When meditating on Ratnasaṃbhava, since the mantra “so” purifies pride, all phenomena are purified by pride.

translated: When meditating on Amoghasiddhi, since the mantra “so” purifies jealousy, all phenomena are purified by jealousy.

translated: When meditating on the vajra, the forty mantras purify space, and all phenomena are purified as the vajra of space.

original: lus kyi nang du 'khor lo gsung bsgom pa'i tshe sngags zhe gcig pa 'khor lo gsum dag pas chos thams cad 'khor lo gsum gyis dag go //
analyzed: lus kyi nang du 'khor lo gsung bsgom pa'i tshe sngags zhe gcig pa 'khor lo gsum dag pas chos thams cad 'khor lo gsum gyis dag go //
translated: When meditating on the wheel of speech within the body, the forty-one mantras purify the three wheels, and all phenomena are purified as the three wheels.

original: mkha' 'gro ma bcu gnyis bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma bcu gnyis bsgom pa'i tshe /

analyzed: sngags zhe gnyis pa mkha' 'gro ma dag pas chos thams cad mkha' 'gro bcu gnyis kyis dag go //
translated: the forty-two mantras purify the dakinis, and all phenomena are purified as the twelve dakinis.

analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad la ltar rigs brgya'i dbye bas bsgom pa'i tshe /
translated: When meditating on all migrating beings as the one hundred families,

analyzed: sngags zhe gsum pa rigs brgyas pas chos thams cad rigs brgyas dag go //
translated: the forty-three mantras purify the one hundred families, and all phenomena are purified as the one hundred families.

original: dur khrod brgyad kyi ma mo brgyad bsgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dur khrod brgyad kyi ma mo brgyad bsgom pa'i tshe /
translated: When meditating on the eight mamos of the eight charnel grounds,

analyzed: sngags zhe bzhi pa ma mo dag pas chos thams cad ma mos dag go //
translated: the forty-four mantras purify the mamos, and all phenomena are purified as the mamos.

analyzed: gnas nyid shu rtsa bzhi bsgom pa'i tshe sngags zhe lnga pa pi ta shuddha sarba dharm'a:pi ta shuddho& ham /

analyzed: au pashma sh'a na shuddha sarba dharm'a: au pashma sh'a na shuddo& ham /
