original: zhes bya ba'i don ni de bzhin du ji srid du nye ba'i dur khrod kyi bar thams cad rnam par dag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don ni de bzhin du ji srid du nye ba'i dur khrod kyi bar thams cad rnam par dag par shes par bya'o //
translated: ” The meaning of this is that one should understand that everything is pure, up to the neighboring charnel grounds.

original: thams cad la aom yod pa ni ye shes lda'o //
analyzed: thams cad la aom yod pa ni ye shes lda'o //
translated: The presence of oṃ in everything is the presence of wisdom.

original: thams cad cad la aa ham yod pa ni rang rig pa'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: thams cad cad la aa ham yod pa ni rang rig pa'i rgyal po'o //
translated: The presence of aham in everything is the king of self-awareness.

original: don gnyis pa sngags de rnams ni lha'i sku'i don bsgom par mi nus pa sngags brjod cing nga rgyal bsgom pa'i tha ma'i don yin no //
analyzed: don gnyis pa sngags de rnams ni lha'i sku'i don bsgom par mi nus pa sngags brjod cing nga rgyal bsgom pa'i tha ma'i don yin no //
translated: The second meaning is that these mantras are for the purpose of cultivating the meaning of the deity’s form for those who are unable to do so, and for cultivating pride by reciting the mantras.

original: rnal 'byor pa rab thos bsam bsgom gsum la mkhas pa don gsum pa bsgom pa ni mtshan nyid brgyad shes pa yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rab thos bsam bsgom gsum la mkhas pa don gsum pa bsgom pa ni mtshan nyid brgyad shes pa yin te /
translated: The yoga of the three topics of meditation for the best practitioners is knowing the eight characteristics.

original: gnas kyi mtshan nyid ni pu pulli ra ma la ya nas /
analyzed: gnas kyi mtshan nyid ni pu pulli ra ma la ya nas /
translated: The characteristic of the location is the twenty-four syllables from🔽Pūrṇagiri to Kukkuṭapāda.

original: ku ku lu ta'i bar du yi ge nyi shu rtsa bzhes sngon 'byung yul nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / rjes 'jug 'khor lo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / lus la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor nyi shu rtsa bzhi bsdu na /
analyzed: ku ku lu ta'i bar du yi ge nyi shu rtsa bzhes sngon 'byung yul nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / rjes 'jug 'khor lo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / lus la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor nyi shu rtsa bzhi bsdu na /
translated: The twenty-four countries of the past, the twenty-four wheels of the followers, and the twenty-four maṇḍalas of the sun in the body are included in the ten stages and the ten perfections.

original: sa bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i don yin te phung po khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i shes pa bcu dag pa dag /
analyzed: sa bcu dang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i don yin te phung po khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i shes pa bcu dag pa dag /
translated: The ten pure knowledges of the aggregates, constituents, sense bases, and so on are purified.

original: dbang bcu rnam par dag pa bsgom pas 'khor lo gsum gyi gnas yongs su dag nas gnas nyid shu rtsa gzhi zag med kyis dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang bcu rnam par dag pa bsgom pas 'khor lo gsum gyi gnas yongs su dag nas gnas nyid shu rtsa gzhi zag med kyis dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the ten powers are meditated on as pure, the three wheels are completely purified, and the twenty-four locations are purified by the stainless basis.

original: zag med kyi dge ba yin pa'i rgyu des dus gsum pas grol /
analyzed: zag med kyi dge ba yin pa'i rgyu des dus gsum pas grol /
translated: Since that is the cause of stainless virtue, one is liberated from the three times.

original: gnas skabs thub brgyad grol /
analyzed: gnas skabs thub brgyad grol /
translated: The eight conditions are liberated.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rnal 'byor yid dga' ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi don te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor yid dga' ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi don te /
translated: It is the meaning of the factors of enlightenment that delight the mind of the yogi.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun las @133a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun las @133a * //
translated: From among the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment,

original: 'bras bu lus dang sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor 'byung bas nges brjod bla ma zhes mtshan btags te /
analyzed: 'bras bu lus dang sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor 'byung bas nges brjod bla ma zhes mtshan btags te /
translated: the result is the body and the emanation wheel Heruka mandala.🔽The great secret Dharma, the supreme enjoyment, and the holy emanation bodies are arranged counterclockwise in the directions and clockwise in the sub-directions.

original: gsang chen chos dang / mchog longs spyod dang dam pa sprul pa'i skul phyogs g-yon skor dang / mtshams g-yas skor gyis mchod pa dang lha dgod pa dang / sgom pa dang bzlas pa'i tshe bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsang chen chos dang / mchog longs spyod dang dam pa sprul pa'i skul phyogs g-yon skor dang / mtshams g-yas skor gyis mchod pa dang lha dgod pa dang / sgom pa dang bzlas pa'i tshe bskor bar bya'o //
translated: The offering, the arrangement of the deities, the meditation, and the recitation are to be performed in this way.

original: mtshan nyid dang po'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang po'o //
translated: This is the first chapter.

original: gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang gis sgyu ma dang stong pa nyid shes pas dag byed dang / dbang dang / dpa' bo dang / bkas gnang ba dang / ngan spyod kyi rnal 'byor gyi brda lnga bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang gis sgyu ma dang stong pa nyid shes pas dag byed dang / dbang dang / dpa' bo dang / bkas gnang ba dang / ngan spyod kyi rnal 'byor gyi brda lnga bya'o //
translated: The definition of the second-stage yogin is that any yogin who has attained the sign, by knowing illusion and emptiness, should perform the five gestures of the yogin of purification, empowerment, hero, permission, and bad conduct.

original: gang la mi bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gang la mi bstan zhe na /
translated: To whom should it not be taught?

original: dbang ma bskur ba la'o //
analyzed: dbang ma bskur ba la'o //
translated: To one who has not been initiated.

original: rgyud 'dir bla mas dbang bskur ba las gzhan du 'bras bu med pa dang / glegs bam tsham thos nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo byed na phyi ma dmyal bar ltung ba dang / tshe 'di la phol mig la sogs pa nas tshogs bdag gis gsod cing phyi ma dmyal bar ltung ngo //
analyzed: rgyud 'dir bla mas dbang bskur ba las gzhan du 'bras bu med pa dang / glegs bam tsham thos nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo byed na phyi ma dmyal bar ltung ba dang / tshe 'di la phol mig la sogs pa nas tshogs bdag gis gsod cing phyi ma dmyal bar ltung ngo //
translated: In this Tantra, other than the initiation by the guru, there is no result; and if one performs the ganacakra after merely hearing the book, in the next life one will fall into hell; and in this life one will be killed by Gaṇeśa, and in the next life one will fall into hell.🔽Therefore,

original: de bas zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: is the conclusion.

original: bla ma'i brgyud las dbang thob nas sngags myur du grub pa dang / gnyis med ye shes kyi sbyor ba lha bsgoms na mchog sangs rgyas nges bar thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla ma'i brgyud las dbang thob nas sngags myur du grub pa dang / gnyis med ye shes kyi sbyor ba lha bsgoms na mchog sangs rgyas nges bar thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one meditates on the deity with the yoga of nondual pristine awareness, one will definitely attain the supreme, buddhahood.🔽The characteristics of the karma consort

original: gsum ba las kyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: gsum ba las kyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristics of the karmamudra.🔽🔽

original: mi'i bu mo 'og nas 'byung ba mtshan nyid 'chad pa 'di 'dra ba spang ngo //
analyzed: mi'i bu mo 'og nas 'byung ba mtshan nyid 'chad pa 'di 'dra ba spang ngo //
translated: One should avoid a human girl who has the characteristics explained below.

original: de gang zhe na dam tshig me shes zhes bya ba nas phyag rgya spang bar bya zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de gang zhe na dam tshig me shes zhes bya ba nas phyag rgya spang bar bya zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: What are those characteristics?

original: bla bar bya ba'i rnal 'byor ma ni gzugs bzang ba dang / lo nyi shu la sogs pas brgyan pa lhan cig la sems zin pa /
analyzed: bla bar bya ba'i rnal 'byor ma ni gzugs bzang ba dang / lo nyi shu la sogs pas brgyan pa lhan cig la sems zin pa /
translated: A yoginī who is to be respected is one who has a good figure, is adorned with youth, is twenty years old, and so forth, and is focused on the practice.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i brtul zhugs shes pa /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i brtul zhugs shes pa /
translated: She knows the conduct of the gaṇacakra.

original: dam tshig thams cad shes pa /
analyzed: dam tshig thams cad shes pa /
translated: She knows all the pledges.

original: dur khrod kyis mi 'jigs pas dpa' ba /
analyzed: dur khrod kyis mi 'jigs pas dpa' ba /
translated: She is fearless in the charnel ground.

original: sgyu mar shes pas chags pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: sgyu mar shes pas chags pa dang bral ba /
translated: She is free of attachment because she knows illusion.

original: stong nyid shes pas 'dzem pa med pa /
analyzed: stong nyid shes pas 'dzem pa med pa /
translated: She is shameless because she knows emptiness.

original: zag med shes pas nga rgyal med pa /
analyzed: zag med shes pas nga rgyal med pa /
translated: By knowing the uncontaminated, there is no pride.

original: lhag mthong shes pas ser sna med pa /
analyzed: lhag mthong shes pas ser sna med pa /
translated: By knowing insight, there is no stinginess.

original: dmangs rigs kyi bu mo mchog blang nas de dang lhan cig rig pa'i brtul zhugs bde ba stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
analyzed: dmangs rigs kyi bu mo mchog blang nas de dang lhan cig rig pa'i brtul zhugs bde ba stong pa nyid bsgom mo //
translated: Having taken a supreme śūdra girl, one should meditate on the bliss of emptiness, the spiritual deportment of knowledge, together with her.

original: gsum pa spyod pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par shes pa skyes nas rdzu 'phrul thob pas 'jig rten gyis smod pas mi 'jigs pa //
analyzed: gsum pa spyod pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par shes pa skyes nas rdzu 'phrul thob pas 'jig rten gyis smod pas mi 'jigs pa //
translated: The third, the characteristics of conduct, is that having generated the superknowledges, one attains magical powers and is fearless of the world’s contempt.

original: spros bcas kyi spyod pa dang / spros med kyi spyod pa srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pas sngags rig pa ni smig rgyu dang du ba dang srin bu me khyer dang / gron me dang nam mkha' stong @133b pa lta bu'i rtags rig nas bdag nyid brtul zhugs spyod do //
analyzed: spros bcas kyi spyod pa dang / spros med kyi spyod pa srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pas sngags rig pa ni smig rgyu dang du ba dang srin bu me khyer dang / gron me dang nam mkha' stong @133b pa lta bu'i rtags rig nas bdag nyid brtul zhugs spyod do //
translated: The conduct with elaboration and the conduct without elaboration are the knowledge of mantra, the signs of the mirage, smoke, fireflies, a butter lamp, and the empty sky.

original: ru pa'i phyag rgya lnga rtag rag tu bcang ngo //
analyzed: ru pa'i phyag rgya lnga rtag rag tu bcang ngo //
translated: One should always wear the five symbolic bone ornaments.

original: rus ba'i cod pan mgo la rgyan bya'o //
analyzed: rus ba'i cod pan mgo la rgyan bya'o //
translated: One should adorn one’s head with a bone crest.

original: thod pa dang kha tv'am ga bzung nas thal ba'i rdul gyis byung //
analyzed: thod pa dang kha tv'am ga bzung nas thal ba'i rdul gyis byung //
translated: Having taken up the skull cup and khaṭvāṅga, one should be covered with the dust of ashes.

original: sha che na bza' chang btung /
analyzed: sha che na bza' chang btung /
translated: If one is hungry, one should eat meat; if thirsty, one should drink alcohol.

original: ro'i ras bgo / lhag ma zos kyang ting nge 'dzin mi nyams /
analyzed: ro'i ras bgo / lhag ma zos kyang ting nge 'dzin mi nyams /
translated: One should wear the cloth of the corpse, and even if one eats the leftovers, one’s meditative concentration will not deteriorate.

original: spros med rtogs na khrag gi btung bas tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: spros med rtogs na khrag gi btung bas tshim par bya'o //
translated: If one realizes the unelaborate [stage], one should be satisfied by drinking blood.

original: skyed mos tshal la sogs pa'i gnas su stong pa nyid bsgoms pas gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal la sogs pa'i gnas su stong pa nyid bsgoms pas gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should remain in a place such as a pleasure garden by meditating on emptiness.

original: nyan thos dang rang rgyal dang / 'jig rten gyi mu stegs skal pa med pa rdo rje theg pa la smod pa'i gtsug lag khang du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang rgyal dang / 'jig rten gyi mu stegs skal pa med pa rdo rje theg pa la smod pa'i gtsug lag khang du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not remain in a monastery where the unfortunate śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and tīrthikas of the world disparage the Vajrayāna.

original: der gnas na nyes pa ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: der gnas na nyes pa ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the problem with remaining there?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan don 'grub pa'i dbul por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzhan don 'grub pa'i dbul por 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva will become poor, unable to accomplish the welfare of others.

original: gnas gang du gnas she na /
analyzed: gnas gang du gnas she na /
translated: Where should one remain?

original: dur khrod du gnas rdo rje gar gyi phyag rgya dang stang stabs bya /
analyzed: dur khrod du gnas rdo rje gar gyi phyag rgya dang stang stabs bya /
translated: One should remain in a charnel ground, performing the dance and gait of the vajra.

original: yid 'ong lha mo dang bcas /
analyzed: yid 'ong lha mo dang bcas /
translated: Together with a beautiful goddess,

original: tshig pa dang ma tshig pa'i sha chen bza'/
analyzed: tshig pa dang ma tshig pa'i sha chen bza'/
translated: one should eat the burnt and unburnt great flesh,

original: chang ba tung /
analyzed: chang ba tung /
translated: drink alcohol,

original: ro yod pa'i dur khrod kyi gnas su bsgom mo //
analyzed: ro yod pa'i dur khrod kyi gnas su bsgom mo //
translated: and meditate in a charnel ground where there are corpses.

original: lnga pa phyag rgya chen po'i mtshan nyid ni shin tu spros pa med pa'i rnal 'byor pas las kyi phyag rgya med na /
analyzed: lnga pa phyag rgya chen po'i mtshan nyid ni shin tu spros pa med pa'i rnal 'byor pas las kyi phyag rgya med na /
translated: The characteristic of mahāmudrā is that a yogin of the extremely unelaborate mode, if he does not have a karmamudra,

original: phyag rgya chen po stong ba nyid khams gsum gyi dri ma spangs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes las byung ba yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i lha mo gzung 'dzin med cing brjod byed med pa 'dus ma byas dang gnyis su med par sems
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po stong ba nyid khams gsum gyi dri ma spangs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes las byung ba yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i lha mo gzung 'dzin med cing brjod byed med pa 'dus ma byas dang gnyis su med par sems
translated: should visualize the mahāmudrā, emptiness free of the taints of the three realms, the wisdom of the dharmadhātu, the goddess of the perfection of wisdom, the mother, free of subject and object, inexpressible, and noncomposite.

original: rtse gcig par bya nas spros med bsgom pa'i spyod pa lus bde ba dang sems dga' ba'i dngos grub tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtse gcig par bya nas spros med bsgom pa'i spyod pa lus bde ba dang sems dga' ba'i dngos grub tu 'gyur te /
translated: He should visualize her as inseparable from his own mind, and he should meditate on the unelaborate mode. The result of this practice is the attainment of physical bliss and mental joy.

original: shes rab thabs kyi cho ga'i rim pa ni phyag rgya chen po stong pa nyid dang nyid nges par rol pa'i sgom pa mngon sum du 'grub pas rnams par mi rtog pa'i ye shes sa dang po skyes pa khams gsum gyi nyes pa thams cad las grol bas
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi cho ga'i rim pa ni phyag rgya chen po stong pa nyid dang nyid nges par rol pa'i sgom pa mngon sum du 'grub pas rnams par mi rtog pa'i ye shes sa dang po skyes pa khams gsum gyi nyes pa thams cad las grol bas
translated: The process of the rite of wisdom and means is that the meditation on the manifestation of emptiness, the mahāmudrā, is accomplished in actuality. The nonconceptual wisdom of the first bhūmi is attained, and one is freed from all the faults of the three realms.

original: tshe 'di la dngos grub thob po //
analyzed: tshe 'di la dngos grub thob po //
translated: One attains spiritual powers in this life.

original: drug pa phan yon gyi mtshan nyid ni sngon gyi bde mchog dang 'dra bar g-yon pa bde ba stong pa nyid ni yum shes rab po //
analyzed: drug pa phan yon gyi mtshan nyid ni sngon gyi bde mchog dang 'dra bar g-yon pa bde ba stong pa nyid ni yum shes rab po //
translated: The definition of benefit is as follows: The bliss of the left is emptiness, which is the mother, wisdom.

original: g-yas pa bde ba med pa 'dod khams kyi sems dang stong nyid med pa kun rdzob kyi shes rab ni thabs yin no //
analyzed: g-yas pa bde ba med pa 'dod khams kyi sems dang stong nyid med pa kun rdzob kyi shes rab ni thabs yin no //
translated: The bliss of the right is the mind of the desire realm, and the emptiness of that is the relative wisdom, which is method.

original: 'dus byas dang dus ma byas dang / kun rdzob dang don dam cig car shes pa'i sgom pa'i mthu stobs dang ldan na zung 'jug gi ye shes yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang dus ma byas dang / kun rdzob dang don dam cig car shes pa'i sgom pa'i mthu stobs dang ldan na zung 'jug gi ye shes yin te /
translated: If one has the power of meditation that simultaneously knows the conditioned and the unconditioned, the relative and the ultimate, that is the gnosis of union.🔽As it is explained:

original: slar zhir gang la yang mi bslab //
analyzed: slar zhir gang la yang mi bslab //
translated: Do not train in anything at all.🔽And it is explained:

original: ces bshad pa dang / blo gros chen po mthong rnams kyis /
analyzed: ces bshad pa dang / blo gros chen po mthong rnams kyis /
translated: The visionaries with great intelligence

original: rnam pa thams cad cig car nges //🔽@134a * // zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad cig car nges // @134a * // zhes bshad do //
translated: simultaneously ascertain all aspects.🔽Thus,

original: de ltar / zung 'jug thob na mnyam sbyor las //
analyzed: de ltar / zung 'jug thob na mnyam sbyor las //
translated: if one attains union, as it is explained in the Union with Buddha:🔽The power of the strength of the manifest

original: tshang pa ngo 'thon stobs kyis mnan //
analyzed: tshang pa ngo 'thon stobs kyis mnan //
translated: suppresses the power of the strength of Indra.

original: dga' bde mi spong 'phrog nas ni //
analyzed: dga' bde mi spong 'phrog nas ni //
translated: Not abandoning bliss and joy,

original: brgya byin ngo 'thob stobs kyis mnan //
analyzed: brgya byin ngo 'thob stobs kyis mnan //
translated: the power of the strength of the manifest seizes it.

original: bde sogs ma yang 'phrog nas ni //
analyzed: bde sogs ma yang 'phrog nas ni //
translated: Having robbed the mother of bliss and so forth,

original: zhes gsungs pas sum cu'i dbang phyug la dbang byed ni lha dbang du byed pa longs spyod pa thim pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas sum cu'i dbang phyug la dbang byed ni lha dbang du byed pa longs spyod pa thim pa'o //
translated: The lord of the thirty is the lord of the gods, who is the dissolution of the enjoyer.

original: thog ma'i dngos grub pa ni dang po thugs kyi dngos grub ster ba'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: thog ma'i dngos grub pa ni dang po thugs kyi dngos grub ster ba'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: The first siddhi is the yoginī who grants the first mental siddhi.

original: gnod spyin ni zhing dang nye ba'i zhing gi rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: gnod spyin ni zhing dang nye ba'i zhing gi rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: The yakṣiṇī is the yoginī of the field and the nearby field.

original: srin po ni tshando ha dang nye ba'i tshan do ha'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: srin po ni tshando ha dang nye ba'i tshan do ha'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: The rākṣasī is the yoginī of the caṇḍola and the nearby caṇḍola.

original: klu mo ni 'dus pa dang nye ba'i 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: klu mo ni 'dus pa dang nye ba'i 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: The nāginī is the yoginī of the assembly and the nearby assembly.

original: lha ma yin ni dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin ni dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: The asurī is the yoginī of the charnel ground and the nearby charnel ground.

original: dri za mo ni nye ba'i gnas bzhi'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: dri za mo ni nye ba'i gnas bzhi'i rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: The gandharvī is the yoginī of the nearby four places.

original: gzhan yang sna tshogs pa ni grong mtha' dang nye ba'i grong mtha' brgyad kyi mi'am ci'i lha mo brgyad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang sna tshogs pa ni grong mtha' dang nye ba'i grong mtha' brgyad kyi mi'am ci'i lha mo brgyad do //
translated: Moreover, the various ones are the eight kinnara goddesses of the eight peripheries and nearby peripheries.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod ces pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod ces pa ni /
translated: The enjoyment of desire is

original: gdong drug ngo 'thon stobs kyis mnan //
analyzed: gdong drug ngo 'thon stobs kyis mnan //
translated: The six-faced one is suppressed by the power of the face-to-face.

original: gzhon nu ma yang 'phrog nas su //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma yang 'phrog nas su //
translated: Having also stolen the young woman,

original: zhes bshad pas lha mo dang dri za mo dang / gnod sbyin dang srin mo dang klu mo dang lha ma yin mo dang / mi'am ci mo rnams la dga' bzhi'i longs spyod nas /
analyzed: zhes bshad pas lha mo dang dri za mo dang / gnod sbyin dang srin mo dang klu mo dang lha ma yin mo dang / mi'am ci mo rnams la dga' bzhi'i longs spyod nas /
translated: thus it is explained. Having enjoyed the four joys with the goddess, gandharva, yakṣa, rākṣasa, nāga, asura, and kinnara women,

original: a'a li k'a li thabs dang shes rab mnyam par bsgom pas don dam gyi bden pa de nyid sgyu ma dang / 'od gsal ba dang / zung 'jug thob pa'i thabs pa'i thabs gsang ba shes rab ye shes dang / dbang bzhi pa gong nas gong du bskor nas rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyi gang zhag thams cad kyis rgyud sde bzhi thams cad le de bzhin du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li thabs dang shes rab mnyam par bsgom pas don dam gyi bden pa de nyid sgyu ma dang / 'od gsal ba dang / zung 'jug thob pa'i thabs pa'i thabs gsang ba shes rab ye shes dang / dbang bzhi pa gong nas gong du bskor nas rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyi gang zhag thams cad kyis rgyud sde bzhi thams cad le de bzhin du brtag par bya'o //
translated: through the meditation on the equality of method and wisdom, ālikāli, the method of attaining the suchness of ultimate truth, the wisdom of the secret wisdom initiation, and the fourth initiation, one should investigate all the tantras of the four classes in the same way as all the yogas of one’s deity are turned from above downward.

original: bdun pa brda'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes babs pa'am /
analyzed: bdun pa brda'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes babs pa'am /
translated: The definition of the sign of the gnosis descent is as follows.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo byed pa'i tshe dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor mas brda rnams bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo byed pa'i tshe dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor mas brda rnams bstan pa ni /
translated: When performing the gaṇacakra, the heroes and yoginīs display the symbolic gestures.

original: dpa' bo rnams kyis lag pa g-yon pas brda bya /
analyzed: dpa' bo rnams kyis lag pa g-yon pas brda bya /
translated: The heroes make the symbolic gestures with the left hand.

original: rnal 'byor mas lag pa g-yas pas brda bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor mas lag pa g-yas pas brda bya'o //
translated: The yoginīs make the symbolic gestures with the right hand.

original: rgyun ba sems dang me rgyu ba snod kyi 'jig rten gsum snod bcud kyi 'gro ba thams cad stong pa nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i g-yon pa las 'byung ba yin pas rdo rje sems dpa' mtheb mo la bzhugs so //
analyzed: rgyun ba sems dang me rgyu ba snod kyi 'jig rten gsum snod bcud kyi 'gro ba thams cad stong pa nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i g-yon pa las 'byung ba yin pas rdo rje sems dpa' mtheb mo la bzhugs so //
translated: Since the movement of the mind and the movement of fire arise from the left, which is emptiness and illusion, Vajrasattva resides in the left thumb.

original: rnam par snang mdzad mdzub mo la bzhugs so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad mdzub mo la bzhugs so //
translated: Vairocana resides in the left index finger.

original: gung mo la padma gar gyi dbang phyug / srin lag la dpal he ru ka / the'u chung la nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: gung mo la padma gar gyi dbang phyug / srin lag la dpal he ru ka / the'u chung la nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: Padmanarteśvara resides in the left middle finger, Śrī Heruka resides in the left ring finger, and Ākāśagarbha resides in the left little finger.

original: sen mo lnga la rta mgrin /
analyzed: sen mo lnga la rta mgrin /
translated: Hayagrīva resides in the five nails.

original: dpa' bo rnams kyi gzhi ni sor mo @134b yin no //
analyzed: dpa' bo rnams kyi gzhi ni sor mo @134b yin no //
translated: The heroes’ basis is the fingers.

original: lag pa'i mthil du pho nya drug dbus dang 'dab ma lnga 'dus pa la bsgoms la /
analyzed: lag pa'i mthil du pho nya drug dbus dang 'dab ma lnga 'dus pa la bsgoms la /
translated: The six messengers are meditated on the palm of the hand, in the center and on the five petals.

original: go cha bgo na ye shes sems dpa' bcug la /
analyzed: go cha bgo na ye shes sems dpa' bcug la /
translated: If you are going to don the armor, then having inserted the gnosis being,

original: lag pa'i rgyab gzhal yas khang du bsams nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i brda bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa'i rgyab gzhal yas khang du bsams nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i brda bya'o //
translated: imagine the back of the hand as a celestial mansion and make the gesture of the gaṇacakra.

original: lag ba'i 'byung ba lnga ni lha mo lngar go sla'o //
analyzed: lag ba'i 'byung ba lnga ni lha mo lngar go sla'o //
translated: The five elements of the hand are easily understood as the five goddesses.

original: ldang ba'i tshe lag pa'i rgyab tu thim nas gshegs par bsam /
analyzed: ldang ba'i tshe lag pa'i rgyab tu thim nas gshegs par bsam /
translated: When rising, imagine that they dissolve into the back of the hand and depart.

original: dbang ma bskur ba la dam tshig tu mi bstan /
analyzed: dbang ma bskur ba la dam tshig tu mi bstan /
translated: Do not teach this to those who have not been initiated.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo lhan cig za ba'i tshe bya /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo lhan cig za ba'i tshe bya /
translated: Do this when eating together at the gaṇacakra.

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo dpa' bo thams cad tshogs pa'i lag pa'i mkha' 'gro dra ba'i sngom pa yin no //
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo dpa' bo thams cad tshogs pa'i lag pa'i mkha' 'gro dra ba'i sngom pa yin no //
translated: This is the network of the ḍākinīs of the hand of all heroes gathered in the gaṇacakra.

original: brgyad pa thabs la mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid ni rgyud le'u bdun cu'i don thams cad shes pas tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i slob dpon bya'o zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brgyad pa thabs la mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid ni rgyud le'u bdun cu'i don thams cad shes pas tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i slob dpon bya'o zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The eighth is the characteristic of skill in means. In order to understand that one should be a gaṇacakra master by knowing all the topics of the seventy chapters of the tantra,

original: phan tshun rjes 'gro thams cad dang // zhes bya ba ni le'u bzhi pa sku'i 'khor lo nas brtsams nas le'u sum cu rtsa bdun pa go cha'i 'khor lo'i bar du dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa bzhir dpa' bo blta ba dang / tshur lha mo blta bas rjes 'gro thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun rjes 'gro thams cad dang // zhes bya ba ni le'u bzhi pa sku'i 'khor lo nas brtsams nas le'u sum cu rtsa bdun pa go cha'i 'khor lo'i bar du dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa bzhir dpa' bo blta ba dang / tshur lha mo blta bas rjes 'gro thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: All the followers means that from the fourth chapter, the wheel of the body, up to the thirty-seventh chapter, the wheel of armor, in the thirty-four mandalas, the hero is seen, and the goddess is seen in return. Therefore, it is called all the followers.

original: de ltar le'u sum cu rtsa bdun gyi sa gcod tshig rkang pa gcig bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar le'u sum cu rtsa bdun gyi sa gcod tshig rkang pa gcig bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the one verse of the chapter divisions of the thirty-seven chapters,

original: le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pa nas bzhi bcu rtsa bdun gyi par du dngos grub kyi yan lag le'u bcu pa'i sa gcod ni tshig rkang lda yin te /
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pa nas bzhi bcu rtsa bdun gyi par du dngos grub kyi yan lag le'u bcu pa'i sa gcod ni tshig rkang lda yin te /
translated: the chapter divisions of the tenth chapter on the branches of attainment from the thirty-eighth up to the forty-seventh are forty-one verses.

original: sna tshogs brda ni dag byed la sogs pa'i brda' bzhi'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs brda ni dag byed la sogs pa'i brda' bzhi'o //
translated: The various signs are the four signs of purification, and so on.

original: tshig ni pro tanggi pra ti por tanggi la sogs pa dang gis brda'o //
analyzed: tshig ni pro tanggi pra ti por tanggi la sogs pa dang gis brda'o //
translated: The words are the signs of protgiti, pratiportigiti, and so on.

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes las skyes pa'i lha mo //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes las skyes pa'i lha mo //
translated: The characteristics of the dakinis are the goddesses born from wisdom.

original: pho nya rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni zhing skyes dang sngags skyes so //
analyzed: pho nya rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni zhing skyes dang sngags skyes so //
translated: The characteristics of the messengers are the field-born and the mantra-born.

original: sgrub pa po la phan pa'i phyir ni sbyor ba gtsang spra gsum gyi mchod pa dang / dngos gzhi gtsang sbra gsum gyi brtul zhugs dang / rjes gtsang sbra gsum gyi spyod pa de dag thams cad dang / dbang bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu ma lus par 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa po la phan pa'i phyir ni sbyor ba gtsang spra gsum gyi mchod pa dang / dngos gzhi gtsang sbra gsum gyi brtul zhugs dang / rjes gtsang sbra gsum gyi spyod pa de dag thams cad dang / dbang bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu ma lus par 'chad pa yin no //
translated: For the benefit of the practitioner, all of these—the worship of the three purities of the preparation, the observances of the three purities of the main practice, and the conduct of the three purities of the conclusion—and the result characterized by the fourth consecration are explained without omission.

original: le'u bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa'i sngar song ba'i sum cu rtsa bzhi dang / phyis 'ong ba thams cad kyi rab gnas kyi le'u ras ris ba lang gi pags pa la sogs pa sna tshogs par bri ba dang / rdo rje dang rin po che dang ba so dang shing la sogs pa la 'bur du brkos pa'i sku gzugs dang /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa'i sngar song ba'i sum cu rtsa bzhi dang / phyis 'ong ba thams cad kyi rab gnas kyi le'u ras ris ba lang gi pags pa la sogs pa sna tshogs par bri ba dang / rdo rje dang rin po che dang ba so dang shing la sogs pa la 'bur du brkos pa'i sku gzugs dang /
translated: The chapter on consecration of the forty-eighth chapter, which is the foundation of all that has gone before and all that follows, explains the painting on various skins of cows and so on, and the images carved in relief on vajras, jewels, ivory, wood, and so on.

original: de bzhin bri ba ni tshon rtsi bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin bri ba ni tshon rtsi bshad do //
translated: The painting is explained as the colors.

original: dri chen chu dang zhag dang khrag / mig sman chen po de bzhin te //
analyzed: dri chen chu dang zhag dang khrag / mig sman chen po de bzhin te //
translated: and eye ointment,

original: mi rus bdar ba'i @135a * //
analyzed: mi rus bdar ba'i @135a * //
translated: and the white powder of burned human bone,🔽and the seed of the naturally arisen flower,

original: dkar po dang // rang byung me tog sa bon dang / rigs ngan bran ze gdol pa mo //
analyzed: dkar po dang // rang byung me tog sa bon dang / rigs ngan bran ze gdol pa mo //
translated: and the outcaste woman,🔽and the blood of the naturally arisen outcaste woman,🔽and the difference between semen and blood,

original: g-yung mo las byung rang byung khrag / shu kra rakta'i khyad par dang // mi skra rus pa'i pir gyis bri //
analyzed: g-yung mo las byung rang byung khrag / shu kra rakta'i khyad par dang // mi skra rus pa'i pir gyis bri //
translated: and the brush of human hair and bone,🔽and the painting of the mandala.

original: zhes phyis 'chang par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes phyis 'chang par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the future practice.

original: dam tshig dang le'u bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa mdor bstan pas yan lag gis gcod de /
analyzed: dam tshig dang le'u bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa mdor bstan pas yan lag gis gcod de /
translated: The vow and the forty-ninth chapter are summarized and divided into sections.

original: dbang bskur ba'i tshe dkyil 'khor gyi dam tshig bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i tshe dkyil 'khor gyi dam tshig bshad pa'o //
translated: At the time of empowerment, the mandala vow is explained.

original: 'dir dbang bskur nas lha thams cad phyis bsgom mo zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dir dbang bskur nas lha thams cad phyis bsgom mo zhes dgongs so //
translated: Here, it is intended that after empowerment, all deities are later meditated on.

original: sku mdog gi ni khyad par gyis //
analyzed: sku mdog gi ni khyad par gyis //
translated: By the difference in color,

original: gang gi sgrub pa pos 'grub pa //
analyzed: gang gi sgrub pa pos 'grub pa //
translated: what is accomplished by the practitioner?

original: zhes pa ni le'u bco brgyad pa'i mdor bstan dang yan lag gis gcod de /
analyzed: zhes pa ni le'u bco brgyad pa'i mdor bstan dang yan lag gis gcod de /
translated: This is the summary and division of the eighteenth chapter.

original: dkyil 'khor gang la bskyed pa'i rims pa'i dus su ye shes babs nas dbyangs skyong gi glu len pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dus su dga' bral du mi gtong pa ni dbyangs skyong ba ste dbyangs ni byang chub sems bde ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gang la bskyed pa'i rims pa'i dus su ye shes babs nas dbyangs skyong gi glu len pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dus su dga' bral du mi gtong pa ni dbyangs skyong ba ste dbyangs ni byang chub sems bde ba'o //
translated: The sustaining of melody is the descent of pristine awareness at the time of the generation stage of any mandala, the singing of the melody-protector song, and at the time of the completion stage, not letting go of the separation from joy. The melody is the bodhicitta bliss.🔽The sustaining is the meditation on the special feature of the deity's body being white in color, and the mantra of various joys.

original: de skyongs ba'i lha sku mdog dkar po 'ba' zhig gi khyad par bsgom pa dang / sna tshogs dga' ba'i gsang sngags dang // zhes pa ni le'u gcig pa dang gnyis pa'i bsdus don gyis gcod de nye snying dang snying po'i sngags kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de skyongs ba'i lha sku mdog dkar po 'ba' zhig gi khyad par bsgom pa dang / sna tshogs dga' ba'i gsang sngags dang // zhes pa ni le'u gcig pa dang gnyis pa'i bsdus don gyis gcod de nye snying dang snying po'i sngags kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The various scriptural systems are the wheels of the quintessence and essence mantras, which are the topics of the first and second chapters.

original: gzhung lugs sna tshogs dkyil 'khor ni nga gsum pa rnam dag gi le'u mdor bstan pa rgyas pa'i sa gcod do //
analyzed: gzhung lugs sna tshogs dkyil 'khor ni nga gsum pa rnam dag gi le'u mdor bstan pa rgyas pa'i sa gcod do //
translated: The various mandalas are the topics of the third chapter, the brief explanation of the pure chapter.

original: dkyil 'khor lus dang / dkyil 'khor bha ga dang / dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings te gzhung lugs sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor lus dang / dkyil 'khor bha ga dang / dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings te gzhung lugs sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The various scriptural systems are the mandala of the body, the mandala of the bhaga, and the mandala of the dharmadhātu.

original: yid 'ong dam tshig mchog rnams dang // zhes pa ni thabs kyi tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i bu  nga bzhi pa'i rtsa ba'am sa gcod do //
analyzed: yid 'ong dam tshig mchog rnams dang // zhes pa ni thabs kyi tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i bu  nga bzhi pa'i rtsa ba'am sa gcod do //
translated: are the root or outline of the fourth chapter of the assembly of the method wheel.🔽The supreme variety of yoginīs

original: sna tshogs rnal 'byor ma mchog dang // zhes pa ni le'i nga lnga pa'i rtsa ba'am sa gcod de /
analyzed: sna tshogs rnal 'byor ma mchog dang // zhes pa ni le'i nga lnga pa'i rtsa ba'am sa gcod de /
translated: is the root or outline of the forty-fifth chapter.

original: shes rab kyi 'khor lo grub gsum pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'khor lo grub gsum pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: The third is the meditation on the perfection of the wisdom wheel.🔽The pleasing heroes of the variety🔽and the yoginīs and the speech

original: yid 'ong dpa' bo sna tshogs dang / rnal 'byor ma yin ngag dang / zhes pa ni le'u bcu rtsa drug pa'i rtsa ba'am sa gcod de rgyud dang / thabs kyi rgyud dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud dang gsum ston pa'o //
analyzed: yid 'ong dpa' bo sna tshogs dang / rnal 'byor ma yin ngag dang / zhes pa ni le'u bcu rtsa drug pa'i rtsa ba'am sa gcod de rgyud dang / thabs kyi rgyud dang / 'bras bu'i rgyud dang gsum ston pa'o //
translated: are the root or outline of the forty-sixth chapter, which teaches the tantra, the method tantra, and the result tantra.🔽The intimate instructions of the dakinis

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi man ngag dang // zhes pa ni le'u nga bdun pa rtsa ba'i sngags btu ba dang / nga brgyad pa go cha gnyis dang snying dang snying po'i sngags btu ba dang / nga dgu pa rdo rje phag mo'i snying po'i sngags kyi 'khrul 'khor dang /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi man ngag dang // zhes pa ni le'u nga bdun pa rtsa ba'i sngags btu ba dang / nga brgyad pa go cha gnyis dang snying dang snying po'i sngags btu ba dang / nga dgu pa rdo rje phag mo'i snying po'i sngags kyi 'khrul 'khor dang /
translated: are the extraction of the root mantra in the forty-seventh chapter, the extraction of the two armors, the essence, and the essence mantra in the forty-eighth chapter, and the maṇḍala of Vajravārāhī’s essence mantra in the forty-ninth chapter.

original: drug cu pa rdza rda bcing ba'i gnod mdzes 'khor lo'i rtsa ba dang sa gcod bstan @135b to //
analyzed: drug cu pa rdza rda bcing ba'i gnod mdzes 'khor lo'i rtsa ba dang sa gcod bstan @135b to //
translated: The sixty-first chapter teaches the root and the summary of the wheel of Sumbha bound to the clay drum.🔽The supreme, sublime family of the various

original: sna tshogs rigs mchog dam pa dang // zhes pa ni grong khyer dkrugs pa drug cu rtsa gcig dang / dngos grub len pa'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo bong bu'i rnam par mdzad pa re gnyis pa dang / rigs lnga'i dbang bskur ba re gsum pa dang /
analyzed: sna tshogs rigs mchog dam pa dang // zhes pa ni grong khyer dkrugs pa drug cu rtsa gcig dang / dngos grub len pa'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo bong bu'i rnam par mdzad pa re gnyis pa dang / rigs lnga'i dbang bskur ba re gsum pa dang /
translated: is the sixty-first chapter on the disturbance of the city, the second on the gaṇacakra of receiving spiritual powers in the form of a donkey, and the third on the empowerment of the five families.

original: lha mo bzhis zhus pa re bzhi pa dang / gshin rje'i 'khor lo re lnga pa'i rtsa ba dang sa gcod bstan to //
analyzed: lha mo bzhis zhus pa re bzhi pa dang / gshin rje'i 'khor lo re lnga pa'i rtsa ba dang sa gcod bstan to //
translated: The question of the four goddesses is the sixty-fourth chapter, and the root and summary of the fifty-first chapter is the wheel of Yama.

original: bla ma brgyad pa'i man ngag ni //
analyzed: bla ma brgyad pa'i man ngag ni //
translated: The instruction of the eight gurus

original: slob ma rnams la phan phyir ro //
analyzed: slob ma rnams la phan phyir ro //
translated: is for the benefit of the disciples.

original: zhes pa ni le'u re drug pa skye ba bdun pa'i shas bskyar ba'i sa gcod do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni le'u re drug pa skye ba bdun pa'i shas bskyar ba'i sa gcod do //
translated: The sixty-sixth chapter is the summary of the flesh of the seven-born.

original: bdag po'i las la shin tu mkhas //
analyzed: bdag po'i las la shin tu mkhas //
translated: Very skilled in the activity of the lord,

original: sngags dang rgyud la legs par bslabs //
analyzed: sngags dang rgyud la legs par bslabs //
translated: well trained in mantra and tantra,

original: zhes pa ni le'u re bdun pa'i sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i sngags dang rgyud kyi dkyil 'khor dang / re brgyad pa so sor 'brang ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi sngags dang rgyud la legs par bslab pa'o //🔽bya ba'i rgyud dang / spyod pa'i rgyud dang / gnyi ga'i rgyud dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud gzhan gyi cho ga'i rim pa rigs gsum ma ma rigs lnga'i lha'i khyad par rnams nges brjod rgyud kyi las nyid kyis te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni le'u re bdun pa'i sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i sngags dang rgyud kyi dkyil 'khor dang / re brgyad pa so sor 'brang ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi sngags dang rgyud la legs par bslab pa'o // bya ba'i rgyud dang / spyod pa'i rgyud dang / gnyi ga'i rgyud dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud gzhan gyi cho ga'i rim pa rigs gsum ma ma rigs lnga'i lha'i khyad par rnams nges brjod rgyud kyi las nyid kyis te /
translated: This is the proper training in the mantra and the mandala of the tantra of the Net of Illusion in the seventeenth chapter, and in the mantra and the mandala of the Uṣṇīṣavijayā in the eighteenth chapter.🔽The procedure of the other tantras, namely, the Kriyātantras, Caryātantras, Ubhayatantras, and Yogatantras, is to be known by the mantrin from the very action of the Nīti Tantra,

original: phrin las rnam bzhin bshad pa las rgyud rdo rje mkha' 'gro bshad par bya ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyud 'di'i sngags pas rgyud gzhan gyi cho ga rnams lta ba mngon sum gyi lam dang spyod pa man ta tanta gsum gyis gzhan rmongs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phrin las rnam bzhin bshad pa las rgyud rdo rje mkha' 'gro bshad par bya ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyud 'di'i sngags pas rgyud gzhan gyi cho ga rnams lta ba mngon sum gyi lam dang spyod pa man ta tanta gsum gyis gzhan rmongs par shes par bya'o //
translated: which is the Vajraḍāka Tantra, by means of the four actions, namely, the path of direct vision, the three of conduct, and the three of delusion.

original: le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma de rnams lha'i 'khor lor ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: le'u sum cu rtsa brgyad pa la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma de rnams lha'i 'khor lor ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: One may say: But how do those yoginis of the 38th chapter and so on become the circle of deities?

original: skyes rabs kyi byang chub sems dpa' dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: skyes rabs kyi byang chub sems dpa' dang 'dra bar /
translated: They are like the Bodhisattvas of the Jataka Tales.🔽As it is said: The conduct of the yoginis,🔽 refers to the field-born ones, and:

original: rnal 'byor ma yis spyod pa dang // zhes pa zhing skyes dang / mkha' 'gro ma yang de bzhin te //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma yis spyod pa dang // zhes pa zhing skyes dang / mkha' 'gro ma yang de bzhin te //

original: sangs rgyas spyan gyi rgyud mnyam sgyor dang / m'a ma k'i'i rgyud dgyes rdor dang / gos dkar mo'i rgyud bde mchog dang / sgrol ma'i rgyud sgrol ma 'byung ba'i rgyud dang bzhi shes pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud de nyid bsdus pa dang /

original: bla na med pa'i spyod pa skabs brgyad ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas 'bring gsum dang / phyi rol gyi bstan bcos ni slob dpon kha cig tshangs pa dang brgya byin dang khyab 'jug dang ma h'a de bas bshad pa'i bstan bcos dor byar shes pa'o zhes 'chad kyang /

original: sga dang tshad ma shes pa spyod pa'i mchog 'jig rten pa ji ltar mos pa rig pa'i gnas lnga sna tshogs pa bslabs nas kyang zhes bya ba thabs mkhas pa'i mtshan dang po'o //

translated: Having understood in that way through hearing and contemplation, when the yogi meditates, he should train in all the generation and completion stages of the ultimate Cakrasaṃvara yoga.

original: gsum pa rgyus du bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: gsum pa rgyus du bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pa ni /

translated: One should always recite the mantra of the three siddhis, which accomplishes all aims, and having extracted the mantra, one should recite the mantra of the father, mother, essence, quintessence, and protector Sumbha.

original: gnas gang du btu snyam na /
analyzed: gnas gang du btu snyam na /
translated: If one wonders where to extract the mantra,

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i dbus kyi lte ba la dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi sngags bcu pos 'byung ba'i yi ge'i phyi mo dbyangs dang gsal byed bzhi bcu rtsa dgu bkod nas gsang sngags thams cad gsang ba'i gsang ba gru gsum gyi nang nas
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i dbus kyi lte ba la dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi sngags bcu pos 'byung ba'i yi ge'i phyi mo dbyangs dang gsal byed bzhi bcu rtsa dgu bkod nas gsang sngags thams cad gsang ba'i gsang ba gru gsum gyi nang nas
translated: Or, in the center of an eight-petaled lotus, in the center of the hub, having arranged the forty-nine vowels and consonants of the alphabet with the ten syllables of all heroes and yoginīs, one should extract all secret mantras from the secret of secrets, the triangle.

original: btu'o // yi ge phyi mo ni sngags kun gyi gnas yin zhing lha'i 'gro ba thams cad kyang bskyed pas sngags kyi yi ge'i dam tshig tu gzhan la mi bstan /
analyzed: btu'o // yi ge phyi mo ni sngags kun gyi gnas yin zhing lha'i 'gro ba thams cad kyang bskyed pas sngags kyi yi ge'i dam tshig tu gzhan la mi bstan /
translated: The alphabet is the abode of all mantras and also generates all the movements of the deities. Therefore, the mantra syllables should not be shown to others.

original: bstan na dngos grub nyams par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bstan na dngos grub nyams par 'gyur ba yin no //

original: bzhi pa rnam dag gi thabs la mkhas pa ni phyis 'ong ba'i bsgom pa 'di ni mchog yin te /
analyzed: bzhi pa rnam dag gi thabs la mkhas pa ni phyis 'ong ba'i bsgom pa 'di ni mchog yin te /
translated: The fourth, skill in the means of purification, is the meditation that will come later, which is supreme.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdud bzhi bcom pas 'dod pa'i dngos grub bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pas 'dod pa'i dngos grub bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it conquers the four māras and is the unsurpassed spiritual power of desire.

original: dngos grub nam gyi tshe na thob ce na /
analyzed: dngos grub nam gyi tshe na thob ce na /
translated: When is one to attain power?

original: tshe 'di la rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phangs 'thob po //
analyzed: tshe 'di la rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phangs 'thob po //
translated: In this life one attains the state of Vajrasattva.

original: phung po'i bdud las rgyal ba'i phyir //🔽snying gar hr'i ;
analyzed: phung po'i bdud las rgyal ba'i phyir // snying gar hr'i ;
translated: In order to conquer the demon of the aggregates,

original: las padma 'dab ma brgyad /
analyzed: las padma 'dab ma brgyad /
translated: at the heart is a lotus with eight petals from HRIH.

original: aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor h'um las tshad med pa'i 'od zer bzhi spros nas 'gro ba'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched lhar byas pa dang / rang gi phung po dang khams dang skye mched bsdus pas lhar byas pa ni byams pa'i go cha bgos pa ste /
analyzed: aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor h'um las tshad med pa'i 'od zer bzhi spros nas 'gro ba'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched lhar byas pa dang / rang gi phung po dang khams dang skye mched bsdus pas lhar byas pa ni byams pa'i go cha bgos pa ste /
translated: From A is a moon mandala. From HUM emanate four immeasurable light rays. The aggregates, elements, and sense bases of transmigrators are made into deities, and one's own aggregates, elements, and sense bases are made into deities. This is the donning of the armor of love.

original: snying rje yi ni ya lad bgos //
analyzed: snying rje yi ni ya lad bgos //
translated: One dons the armor of compassion.

original: zhes bya'o // shes rab kyi mtshon chas lha'i 'khor lo sgyu ma dang stong par bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i bdud las rgyal lo //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // shes rab kyi mtshon chas lha'i 'khor lo sgyu ma dang stong par bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa'i bdud las rgyal lo //
translated: Through the weapon of wisdom, one conquers the demon of afflictions by meditating on the divine wheel as an illusion and as empty.

original: le'u nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'i phyir bzlog chen mo'i srung bas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang thugs kyi 'khor lo'i rgyab tu rdo rje kha bzhi pas mtshan @137a * //
analyzed: le'u nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'i phyir bzlog chen mo'i srung bas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang thugs kyi 'khor lo'i rgyab tu rdo rje kha bzhi pas mtshan @137a * //
translated: The great reversal protection of chapter 21 is the protection wheel of timeless awareness and the protection wheel of enlightened mind.🔽

original: pa dang / sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo gsum las rdo rje padma 'khor lo'i phreng bas mtshan pas srung ba thams cad kyi mchog dngos grub thams cad rab tu stsol bas 'chi bdag gi bdud las rgyal bar rgyud 'di nyid las 'chad do //
analyzed: pa dang / sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo gsum las rdo rje padma 'khor lo'i phreng bas mtshan pas srung ba thams cad kyi mchog dngos grub thams cad rab tu stsol bas 'chi bdag gi bdud las rgyal bar rgyud 'di nyid las 'chad do //
translated: The supreme protection of all, which bestows all powers, is explained in this very tantra as the victory over the demon of death.

original: lha'i bu'i bdud las rgyal ba ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud las rgyal ba ni /
translated: The victory over the demon of the sons of the gods is as follows:

original: su mbha ni'i bka'i 'khor lo srung ba chen po'i phur bgegs med pa dang / logs su rdo rje'i rab dang / 'og tu rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang / steng du mda'i dra ba dang / steng gi bla re me 'od kyi phreng ba rab tu dgyes pas gdug pa'i bdud thams cad skrag par bya zhes pa ni 'di ltar bsgom ste /
analyzed: su mbha ni'i bka'i 'khor lo srung ba chen po'i phur bgegs med pa dang / logs su rdo rje'i rab dang / 'og tu rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang / steng du mda'i dra ba dang / steng gi bla re me 'od kyi phreng ba rab tu dgyes pas gdug pa'i bdud thams cad skrag par bya zhes pa ni 'di ltar bsgom ste /
translated: The great protection of the wheel of the command of Sumbha Ni is the stake without obstacles, the side is the vajra, the ground below is the vajra, above is the net of arrows, and the canopy above is the garland of blazing fire.🔽The meditation is as follows:

original: 'og tu sa gzhi dang rdo rje'i sa gzhi gnyis las /🔽logs su rdo rje rab dang dra ba gnyis /
analyzed: 'og tu sa gzhi dang rdo rje'i sa gzhi gnyis las / logs su rdo rje rab dang dra ba gnyis /
translated: Below, there are two, the ground and the vajra ground.🔽Apart from those, there are two, the vajra floor and the net.

original: steng du mda'i bla re dang rdo rje'i bla re gnyis /
analyzed: steng du mda'i bla re dang rdo rje'i bla re gnyis /
translated: Above, there are two, the arrow canopy and the vajra canopy.

original: thams cad gdug pa skrag pa'i me /
analyzed: thams cad gdug pa skrag pa'i me /
translated: All around, there is the fire that terrifies the wicked.

original: phyis phur bu bcu gnyis pa bgegs med par byed pa'i cho ga'i go rims yin no //
analyzed: phyis phur bu bcu gnyis pa bgegs med par byed pa'i cho ga'i go rims yin no //
translated: Later, the twelve kīlas are the sequence of the rite for the absence of obstructors.

original: las dang po bdud bzhi las rgyal ba'i rnam dang bshad nas /
analyzed: las dang po bdud bzhi las rgyal ba'i rnam dang bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the beginner’s victory over the four māras,

original: zab pa'i rdzogs rim bsgom pa shin tu spros med kyi spyod pa byed pa ni /
analyzed: zab pa'i rdzogs rim bsgom pa shin tu spros med kyi spyod pa byed pa ni /
translated: the conduct of the very unelaborate mode is the practice of the profound completion phase.

original: rang rig pas sems kyi chos 'dus byas rtogs na phyi rol gyi bdud bzhi mi 'joms pas phyi rol gyi bdud dang bdud ma yin pa rang gi sems 'dus ma byas la bcings pas kun rdzob kyi bdud 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: rang rig pas sems kyi chos 'dus byas rtogs na phyi rol gyi bdud bzhi mi 'joms pas phyi rol gyi bdud dang bdud ma yin pa rang gi sems 'dus ma byas la bcings pas kun rdzob kyi bdud 'jug pa med do //
translated: If one realizes the conditioned phenomena of the mind with one’s awareness, the four external māras are not conquered. Since the external māras and non-māras are bound in the unconditioned mind, the relative māras do not enter.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi sems ni dri yang de yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi sems ni dri yang de yin /
translated: The unconditioned mind is the scent.

original: byug pa yang de yin /
analyzed: byug pa yang de yin /
translated: It is also the unguent.

original: g-yas ngos su ste'u 'jog pa dang / g-yon ngos su tsandan gyi sa skud pa la 'dus ma byas rtogs pas sems mnyam pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: g-yas ngos su ste'u 'jog pa dang / g-yon ngos su tsandan gyi sa skud pa la 'dus ma byas rtogs pas sems mnyam pa nyid yin te /
translated: The pestle is on the right side, and the sandalwood paste is on the left side.

original: mkhas pa'i phyir na mi dga' med //🔽bsod rnams bsags pas sdug bsngal med //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i phyir na mi dga' med // bsod rnams bsags pas sdug bsngal med //
translated: Since one is skilled, there is no unhappiness.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Since one has accumulated merit, there is no suffering.

original: ste'us 'jog pa la bzod pa bsgom pa ni med tog yin la /
analyzed: ste'us 'jog pa la bzod pa bsgom pa ni med tog yin la /
translated: The cultivation of patience in the pestle is the flower.

original: sems kyis stong nyid la 'bad pa'i brtson 'grus ni gtor ma yang de yin /
analyzed: sems kyis stong nyid la 'bad pa'i brtson 'grus ni gtor ma yang de yin /
translated: The effort that is the mind's exertion in emptiness is the incense.

original: sems dag ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba mar me yang de yin /
analyzed: sems dag ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba mar me yang de yin /
translated: The pure mind that is naturally luminous is the lamp.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas mnyam nyid bsgom pa bdug pa yang de yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas mnyam nyid bsgom pa bdug pa yang de yin te /
translated: The cultivation of the equality of the compounded and the uncompounded is the perfume.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ji ltar chu la chu bzhag dang // ji ltar mar la mar bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar chu la chu bzhag dang // ji ltar mar la mar bzhin du //
translated: Just as water is placed in water, and just as butter is placed in butter,

original: rang gis rang gi chos nyid mthong //
analyzed: rang gis rang gi chos nyid mthong //
translated: one sees one's own dharmatā.

original: mchog dang phyag 'tshal kun yin no //🔽zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog dang phyag 'tshal kun yin no //🔽zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the supreme and the homage to all.

original: gang gsungs na ci de dang gi bskyed chog gi lugs dang zhen /
analyzed: gang gsungs na ci de dang gi bskyed chog gi lugs dang zhen /
translated: What is taught? The system of the creation rite of that?🔽How?

original: ji ltar / sngon 'gro lda dang dngos gzhi gsum //
analyzed: ji ltar / sngon 'gro lda dang dngos gzhi gsum //
translated: The preliminaries are three, the main part is three,

original: @137b rjes brgyad thun mtshams bcu gnyis te //
analyzed: @137b rjes brgyad thun mtshams bcu gnyis te //
translated: The conclusion is eight, the session breaks are twelve,

original: rgyas pa'i yan lag bzhi bcu brgyad //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i yan lag bzhi bcu brgyad //
translated: The extended branches are forty-eight,🔽The first preparation is nine dharmas,

original: sbyor ba dang po'i chos dgu dang // dkyil 'khor rgyal po'i mchog gi drug / las rgyal mchog brgyad bsdus pa'i dgu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang po'i chos dgu dang // dkyil 'khor rgyal po'i mchog gi drug / las rgyal mchog brgyad bsdus pa'i dgu'o //
translated: The supreme king mandala is six, the supreme victor activity is nine.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi le'u gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi le'u gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the third chapter of the Root Tantra.

original: // / de ltar gleng gzhi dang / gleng bslang ba dang / rgyud 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / rgyud kyi lus mdor gzhag pa bshad nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar gleng gzhi dang / gleng bslang ba dang / rgyud 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / rgyud kyi lus mdor gzhag pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the nidāna, the introduction, the cause of the origin of the tantra, and the summary of the body of the tantra,

original: rgyud kyi don dang po dngos grub bsgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor bcu bdun las thog na sku'i 'khor lo ston par bzhed pas de nas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyud kyi don dang po dngos grub bsgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor bcu bdun las thog na sku'i 'khor lo ston par bzhed pas de nas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: since the first topic of the tantra is the seventeen mandalas for achieving powers, and among them, the body wheel is to be explained, therefore is stated.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje mkha' rdo rje mkha' 'gro ni 'bras bu'i he ru ka'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje mkha' rdo rje mkha' 'gro ni 'bras bu'i he ru ka'o //
translated: The Bhagavān Vajradāka is the resultant Heruka.

original: de kho na nyid kyi gsang ba ni sku gsum bsgrub pa'i thabs bcu bdun gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi gsang ba ni sku gsum bsgrub pa'i thabs bcu bdun gsungs pa'o //
translated: The secret of reality is the teaching of the seventeen means of accomplishing the three bodies.

original: de nos zhes bya ba ni 'khor rnams kyis bdud rtsi lngas phyag 'tshal nas zhus pa'i rjes la de nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nos zhes bya ba ni 'khor rnams kyis bdud rtsi lngas phyag 'tshal nas zhus pa'i rjes la de nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: Then they, the retinue, having bowed down with the five nectars, after the request, then is said.

original: gzhan yang bshad bya ba ni sku'i 'khor lo nges brjod rgyud kyi bla ma 'di rjod byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang bshad bya ba ni sku'i 'khor lo nges brjod rgyud kyi bla ma 'di rjod byed do //
translated: Moreover, what is to be explained is this: The teacher of the body wheel, the Tantra of Expression, is the speaker.

original: de'i brjod bya sgrub pa po la phan btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i brjod bya sgrub pa po la phan btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its subject matter is for the sake of benefiting the practitioner.

original: sgrub thabs kyi rim pa ji ltar shes snyam na /
analyzed: sgrub thabs kyi rim pa ji ltar shes snyam na /
translated: If one wonders, How is the sequence of the means of accomplishment known?

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: It is said: The past buddhas have taught,

original: ma 'ongs rnams kyang gsung 'gyur la //
analyzed: ma 'ongs rnams kyang gsung 'gyur la //
translated: and the future ones will teach,

original: da ltar byung ba rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: and the perfect buddhas of the present

original: zhes sangs rgyas kyi bla ma dus gsum du brgyud pas bshad pa'i rgyud rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dag gis kyang bshad par bya ba tsa ba'i rgyud bsdus pa 'dis gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes sangs rgyas kyi bla ma dus gsum du brgyud pas bshad pa'i rgyud rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dag gis kyang bshad par bya ba tsa ba'i rgyud bsdus pa 'dis gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this summary of the tantra, which is to be explained by the vajra dakinis, the tantra that is explained by the teacher of the buddhas, the lineage of the three times, it will be clearly understood.

original: sgrub thabs la don gsum ste /
analyzed: sgrub thabs la don gsum ste /
translated: The means of accomplishment has three topics:

original: sgrub pa'i rten gang zag dang / sgrub pa'i gnas dang / sgrub pa'i thabs so /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rten gang zag dang / sgrub pa'i gnas dang / sgrub pa'i thabs so /
translated: the person who is the support of the means of accomplishment, the place of the means of accomplishment, and the means of accomplishment.

original: sgrub pa po rten gyi gang zag ni mtshan nyid bcu drug dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa po rten gyi gang zag ni mtshan nyid bcu drug dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The person who is the support of the means of accomplishment is endowed with sixteen characteristics:

original: phyi rol 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas /
analyzed: phyi rol 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the five external conceptual objects of desire,

original: dam tshig tshig bsrung ba dang yid gnyis med pa gtan la phab pa dang / bgegs la sogs pas mi 'jigs pa dang mtshan ma thob pas tshes grangs mi brtsi ba dang / skar ma mi lta ba dang / smyung ba mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: dam tshig tshig bsrung ba dang yid gnyis med pa gtan la phab pa dang / bgegs la sogs pas mi 'jigs pa dang mtshan ma thob pas tshes grangs mi brtsi ba dang / skar ma mi lta ba dang / smyung ba mi byed pa dang /
translated: one is free from doubt in guarding the words of samaya, one is not afraid of obstructors, and so on, one does not count the lunar day because one has obtained the signs, one does not look at the stars, one does not fast,

original: gtsang sbra khrus mi byed pa dang / kha zas la mi gtsang ba med pa dang / sgo dgu'i dbang po dri ma dang par mi byed pa dang / dus drug mi lta ba dang / chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis mi lta bas grol ba dang /
analyzed: gtsang sbra khrus mi byed pa dang / kha zas la mi gtsang ba med pa dang / sgo dgu'i dbang po dri ma dang par mi byed pa dang / dus drug mi lta ba dang / chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis mi lta bas grol ba dang /
translated: one does not perform purification ablutions, one does not have impure food, one does not wash the impurities of the nine orifices, one does not look at the six times, and one is liberated by not looking at the thirty-two watches.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gnyis kyis dag pa spangs pa dang / rang gi rgyud bde @138a * //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan gnyis kyis dag pa spangs pa dang / rang gi rgyud bde @138a * //
translated: The purification of the two kinds of obscurations by the two kinds of excellences of abandonment and realization, and the benefit of sentient beings by compassion.

original: mchog gi bzlas pa'i sngags dang / bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor shes pa dang / snying rjes sems can gyi don byed pa mtshan nyid bcu drug dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mchog gi bzlas pa'i sngags dang / bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor shes pa dang / snying rjes sems can gyi don byed pa mtshan nyid bcu drug dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The sixteen characteristics are: the mantra of the supreme recitation, the knowledge of the yoga of meditation, and the benefit of sentient beings by compassion.

original: sgrub pa'i gnas ni bcu bzhi ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i gnas ni bcu bzhi ste /
translated: The fourteen places of practice are:

original: ris la nas bzi mdo'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ris la nas bzi mdo'i bar du'o //
translated: from the continent of Videha up to the continent of Godaniya.

original: gnas kyi 'bras bu ni dngos grub 'dod pa thams cad stsol ba'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi 'bras bu ni dngos grub 'dod pa thams cad stsol ba'o //
translated: The result of the place is the bestowal of all desired accomplishments.

original: las dang po pas gnas pa brtag pa byas pa dang / mtshan ma thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas yid gang du dga' ba der bsgrubs na dngos grub tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: las dang po pas gnas pa brtag pa byas pa dang / mtshan ma thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas yid gang du dga' ba der bsgrubs na dngos grub tu 'gyur te /
translated: For the beginner, the place should be examined, and for the yogin who has attained signs, accomplishment will occur wherever the mind delights.

original: sgrub pa'i thabs du bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs du bsgom zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how many methods of practice are there,

original: dbye ba du mas bsgom pa ni dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: dbye ba du mas bsgom pa ni dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug go //
translated: the practice with many divisions is the fifty-six mandalas.

original: de'i rgyu ci zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ci zhe na /
translated: If it is asked what is the cause of that,

original: gdul bya'i mos pa bsam pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: gdul bya'i mos pa bsam pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: it is the power of the intention of the various inclinations of those to be tamed.

original: de la sgrub pa'i thabs kyi yan lag ni /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i thabs kyi yan lag ni /
translated: In that, the branches of the method of practice are

original: ye shes lnga'i bdud rtsis sa gzhi byugs pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod dang me tog 'thor ba'i 'bad pa brtson 'grus dang / sna tshogs pa'i phyag rgya grol lam la chos kyi phyag rgya yid du 'ong ba bcu gnyis dang //🔽bcu drug lang tshos brgyan pa'i gdan la dga' ba bzhi'i bsam gtan bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i bdud rtsis sa gzhi byugs pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod dang me tog 'thor ba'i 'bad pa brtson 'grus dang / sna tshogs pa'i phyag rgya grol lam la chos kyi phyag rgya yid du 'ong ba bcu gnyis dang // bcu drug lang tshos brgyan pa'i gdan la dga' ba bzhi'i bsam gtan bsgom pa'o //
translated: The ground is anointed with the nectar of the five awarenesses, which is generosity; the scattering of flowers, which is patience; and the effort of striving, which is discipline.🔽The seat is adorned with the sixteen and twelve-year-old maidens, which are the twelve pleasing seals of the dharma of the path of liberation.

original: bying rmugs dang rgod 'gyod bsal nas rtse gcig pa'i sems shes rab /
analyzed: bying rmugs dang rgod 'gyod bsal nas rtse gcig pa'i sems shes rab /
translated: The meditation of the four joys is wisdom.

original: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa'i yan lag dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa'i yan lag dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs ni gsum ste /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub pa'i yan lag dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa'i yan lag dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs ni gsum ste /
translated: The method of practice endowed with the branches of accomplishing the six perfections is as follows:

original: sngon 'gro dang / dngos gzhi dang / rjes so //
analyzed: sngon 'gro dang / dngos gzhi dang / rjes so //
translated: The preliminaries, the main subject, and the conclusion.

original: de la sngon 'gro ni lnga ste /
analyzed: de la sngon 'gro ni lnga ste /
translated: The preliminaries are five.

original: dang po sems can gyi don ni snying gar hr'i ;
analyzed: dang po sems can gyi don ni snying gar hr'i ;
translated: First, for the benefit of sentient beings, there is hriḥ at the heart.

original: las padma 'dab ma brgyad /
analyzed: las padma 'dab ma brgyad /
translated: From that, there is an eight-petaled lotus.

original: aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: From aḥ, there is a moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du yi ge h'um las 'od zer dkar po //
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge h'um las 'od zer dkar po //
translated: On top of that, white light rays emerge from the syllable hūṃ.

original: ser po / dmar po /
analyzed: ser po / dmar po /
translated: Yellow, red, and green light rays emerge.

original: ljang gu bzhi 'phros pas sems can la tshangs pa'i gnas bzhis byams pas phung po lnga dang khams dan skye mched lhar bskyed pa'i bde ba dang phrad par byas /
analyzed: ljang gu bzhi 'phros pas sems can la tshangs pa'i gnas bzhis byams pas phung po lnga dang khams dan skye mched lhar bskyed pa'i bde ba dang phrad par byas /
translated: Since sentient beings are endowed with the four immeasurables, they are made to meet with the bliss of generating the five aggregates, elements, and sense bases as the deity.

original: snying rjes khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal dang bral /
analyzed: snying rjes khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal dang bral /
translated: Through compassion, they are separated from the suffering of the three realms.

original: dga' bas lha'i chos nyid rtogs /
analyzed: dga' bas lha'i chos nyid rtogs /
translated: Through joy, they realize the dharmatā of the deity.

original: btang snyoms kyis sems can la dbri bkol med pas btang snyoms par byas pa'am //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyis sems can la dbri bkol med pas btang snyoms par byas pa'am //
translated: Through equanimity, since sentient beings are neither diminished nor enhanced, they are made to be equanimous.

original: yang na sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun par byas nas sam /
analyzed: yang na sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun par byas nas sam /
translated: Alternatively, after practicing generosity, pleasant speech, purposeful behavior, and working for the benefit of others,

original: yang na 'od zer spros pas dge ba bcu la bkod pa'i sems can gyi don bya ba rnal 'byor bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'od zer spros pas dge ba bcu la bkod pa'i sems can gyi don bya ba rnal 'byor bsrung ba'o //
translated: or after establishing sentient beings in the ten virtues through emanating light rays, the purpose of sentient beings is accomplished.

original: de'i 'od zer tshur 'dus pas phyi gzugs kyi phung po dang / nang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa sgyu ma lta bu'i lha bsgom @138b pa dang / phyi'i dbang po lnga dang nang yid kyi dbang po dang drug sgyu ma lta bu'i sems dpa' drug tu bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer tshur 'dus pas phyi gzugs kyi phung po dang / nang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa sgyu ma lta bu'i lha bsgom @138b pa dang / phyi'i dbang po lnga dang nang yid kyi dbang po dang drug sgyu ma lta bu'i sems dpa' drug tu bsgom pa dang /
translated: The light rays that gather back in from that visualize the outer aggregate of form and the inner aggregates of feeling, discernment, formation, and consciousness as illusion-like deities, and the outer five sense powers and the inner mental sense power as the six illusion-like bodhisattvas.

original: phyi'i byung ba bzhi nam mkha' dang bcas pa lha mo ldar bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: phyi'i byung ba bzhi nam mkha' dang bcas pa lha mo ldar bsgom pa ni /
translated: The outer four elements and space are visualized as the six goddesses.

original: thams cad stong pa nyid du bltas nas zhes bya ba ni phung po khams dang skye mchod rnam par dag pa'i lha bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad stong pa nyid du bltas nas zhes bya ba ni phung po khams dang skye mchod rnam par dag pa'i lha bsgom pa ste /
translated: “ View everything as emptiness” means to meditate on the pure deity of the aggregates, constituents, and sense bases.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub kyi tshogs zag pa med pa'i lha mchog dam pa rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam la gnas par bya ba yin te bdag phung po'i bdud las bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub kyi tshogs zag pa med pa'i lha mchog dam pa rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam la gnas par bya ba yin te bdag phung po'i bdud las bsrung ba'o //
translated: The definition of that is to abide in the supreme, sublime, uncontaminated deity of the accumulation of enlightenment, which is merely the appearance of one’s mind, and to protect oneself from the māra of the aggregates.

original: de nas tshogs bsags pa'i rnal 'byor ni /
analyzed: de nas tshogs bsags pa'i rnal 'byor ni /
translated: The yoga of accumulating the assembly

original: rang gi snying gar hr'i ;
analyzed: rang gi snying gar hr'i ;
translated: is the hūṃ in one’s heart.

original: las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa /
analyzed: las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa /
translated: The action is an eight-petaled lotus.

original: de'i dbus su ma las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de'i dbus su ma las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: In its center, from maṃ, is a sun maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du h'um de kho na nyid mchog tu gyur pa las /
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um de kho na nyid mchog tu gyur pa las /
translated: Upon that, from hūṃ, is the supreme suchness.

original: kha dog sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer gsal ba 'phros pas /
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer gsal ba 'phros pas /
translated: From that, light rays of various colors shine and

original: phyogs bcu kun du khyab pa dang / ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin nyon mongs pa zhi ba'i sku sngon grub pa'i sangs rgyas bskul nas sdig pa bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i byin byin gyis rlob par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun du khyab pa dang / ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin nyon mongs pa zhi ba'i sku sngon grub pa'i sangs rgyas bskul nas sdig pa bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i byin byin gyis rlob par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: pervade everywhere in the ten directions, invoking the previously accomplished buddhas, the peaceful kāyas that are the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses, who bless the confession of misdeeds, rejoicing, going for refuge, and so on.

original: de nas nam mkha'i khams lnga nyams dga' bar dkyil 'khor mchog lnga mthong ba ni /
analyzed: de nas nam mkha'i khams lnga nyams dga' bar dkyil 'khor mchog lnga mthong ba ni /
translated: Then, the five elements of space are delightful, and the supreme maṇḍala of five is seen.

original: 'khor lo bde mchog gi lha drug cu rtsag nyis khro bo'i gzugs kyis khyab par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo bde mchog gi lha drug cu rtsag nyis khro bo'i gzugs kyis khyab par mthong ste /
translated: The sixty-two deities of Cakrasaṃvara are seen pervading the wrathful forms.

original: gtso bo sangs rgyas lnga dang / 'khor byang chub sems dpa' drug cu rtsa gnyis phrag lnga dang / byang chub kyi sems 'khor lo bde mchog gi gzugs can bla ma gtso bo'i cha byad can dang / lha mo bcu gnyis sna tshogs pa mthong nas rnal 'byor pha bdag gis le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa nas 'byung ba bzhin du lha mo brgyad dam bcu drug gam nyi shus mchod la /
analyzed: gtso bo sangs rgyas lnga dang / 'khor byang chub sems dpa' drug cu rtsa gnyis phrag lnga dang / byang chub kyi sems 'khor lo bde mchog gi gzugs can bla ma gtso bo'i cha byad can dang / lha mo bcu gnyis sna tshogs pa mthong nas rnal 'byor pha bdag gis le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa nas 'byung ba bzhin du lha mo brgyad dam bcu drug gam nyi shus mchod la /
translated: Having seen the principal figures, the five buddhas, the retinue, the fifty-two sets of sixty bodhisattvas, the wheel of bodhicitta Cakrasaṃvara in the form of the principal guru, and the twelve goddesses, the father yogin should make offerings with the eight, sixteen, or twenty goddesses, as in chapter 26.

original: bla ma dang dkyil 'khor la phyag bya /
analyzed: bla ma dang dkyil 'khor la phyag bya /
translated: One should prostrate to the guru and the maṇḍala.

original: rjed par bya'o //
analyzed: rjed par bya'o //
translated: One should praise.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i tshogs dang / khro bo'i rgyal po rnams kyi ye shes lnga'i 'od zer spros pas rnal 'byor pa dang / 'gro ba rigs drug gi sems can rnams kyi gzugs bskyed nas 'god pa ni sdig pa bshags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i tshogs dang / khro bo'i rgyal po rnams kyi ye shes lnga'i 'od zer spros pas rnal 'byor pa dang / 'gro ba rigs drug gi sems can rnams kyi gzugs bskyed nas 'god pa ni sdig pa bshags so //
translated: The assembly of emanations of the buddhas and the light rays of the five gnoses of the kings of wrath emanate and generate the forms of the yogins and the sentient beings of the six realms and establish them.

original: de la dga' ba ni rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: Joy in that is rejoicing.

original: de nas 'do zer gyen la pas nam mkha'i dkyil kun khyab par sangs rgyas lnga'i dkyil 'khor mchog rnams bzhugs par mthong bas thugs kar bsdus nas byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni thugs kar zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas 'do zer gyen la pas nam mkha'i dkyil kun khyab par sangs rgyas lnga'i dkyil 'khor mchog rnams bzhugs par mthong bas thugs kar bsdus nas byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni thugs kar zhugs pa'o //
translated: Then, the light rays rise up and fill the whole sky with the supreme maṇḍalas of the five buddhas. Having seen that, they dissolve into the heart and go for refuge to the Three Jewels until the essence of enlightenment is reached.

original: @139a * // sangs rgyas ni gtso bo /
analyzed: @139a * // sangs rgyas ni gtso bo /
translated: The Buddha is the principal one.

original: 'khor ni dge 'dun no //
analyzed: 'khor ni dge 'dun no //
translated: The retinue is the saṅgha.

original: thugs ka'i yi ga 'bru ni chos so //
analyzed: thugs ka'i yi ga 'bru ni chos so //
translated: The syllable at the heart is the dharma.

original: bdag dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad buddha lnga'i thugs kar zhugs pa ni go 'phang de la bzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad buddha lnga'i thugs kar zhugs pa ni go 'phang de la bzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having entered the heart of all sentient beings, who are like oneself, it is called “placing them in that state.”

original: der sgrub pa pos gsol ba gdab ces bas na /
analyzed: der sgrub pa pos gsol ba gdab ces bas na /
translated: Since it is said that the practitioner should make supplications there,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang / mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang / mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: it is the urging to turn the wheel of dharma and the supplicating not to pass into nirvāṇa.

original: lus phul nas dge rtsa bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: lus phul nas dge rtsa bsngo ba ni /
