translated: The dedication of the roots of merit after offering the body is

original: rtag tu skyabs su 'gro bar bya //
analyzed: rtag tu skyabs su 'gro bar bya //
translated: always going for refuge.

original: zhes pa'o // de ltar tshogs bsags pa'i rnal 'byor bshad nas /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de ltar tshogs bsags pa'i rnal 'byor bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the yoga of gathering the accumulations,

original: gal te phung po khams dang skye mched lhar bsgoms pas bdag dang bdag gir blta pa rmongs pa'i phung po 'dis kham dang skye mched la gnyen po lha'i nga rgyal bsgom pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i bsam bzang po bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te phung po khams dang skye mched lhar bsgoms pas bdag dang bdag gir blta pa rmongs pa'i phung po 'dis kham dang skye mched la gnyen po lha'i nga rgyal bsgom pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i bsam bzang po bskyed par bya ste /
translated: if one meditates on the aggregates, elements, and sense bases as deities, the pride of the deity should be cultivated as the antidote to the aggregates, which are the view of “I” and “mine” due to delusion.🔽The antidote to the aggregate of form is Vairocana, who arises from bhrūṃ at the head, white in color, holding a wheel and a bell.

original: mgo bor gzugs kyi phung po'i gnyen por bh'um las rnam par snang mdzad 'khor lo dang dril bu bsnams pa dkar po / tshor ba'i gnyen po lte bar aom las rdo rje nyi ma yin po che dang dril bu bsnams pa ser po //🔽'du shes kyi khams kyi gnyen po lkog mar hr'i ;
analyzed: mgo bor gzugs kyi phung po'i gnyen por bh'um las rnam par snang mdzad 'khor lo dang dril bu bsnams pa dkar po / tshor ba'i gnyen po lte bar aom las rdo rje nyi ma yin po che dang dril bu bsnams pa ser po // 'du shes kyi khams kyi gnyen po lkog mar hr'i ;
translated: The antidote to the aggregate of feeling is Vajrasūrya, who arises from oṃ at the navel, yellow in color, holding a jewel and a bell.

original: las padma gar gyi dbang phug padma gar dang dril bu bsnams pa dmar po /
analyzed: las padma gar gyi dbang phug padma gar dang dril bu bsnams pa dmar po /
translated: The antidote to the element of discrimination is Padmanarteśvara, who arises from hriḥ at the throat, red in color, holding a lotus and a bell.

original: rkang pa'i long bu gnyis su 'du byed kyi gnyen por ho ;
analyzed: rkang pa'i long bu gnyis su 'du byed kyi gnyen por ho ;
translated: The antidote to the aggregate of formation is Amoghasiddhi, who arises from jaḥ at the two heels, green in color, holding a sword and a bell.

original: las rdo rje rgyal po sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa ljang gu /
analyzed: las rdo rje rgyal po sna tshogs rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa ljang gu /
translated: The karma vajra is the king, holding a vajra and a bell, and is green.

original: snying gar rnams shes kyi gnyen po h'um las rdo rje sems dpa' rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa mthing ga'o //
analyzed: snying gar rnams shes kyi gnyen po h'um las rdo rje sems dpa' rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa mthing ga'o //
translated: At the heart, the antidote to the enemy of pride is a vajra arisen from hūṃ, with Vajrasattva holding a vajra and a bell, and is blue.

original: nub ma'i bar du he las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid he ru ka rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa sngon po bdag nyid bsam mo //
analyzed: nub ma'i bar du he las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid he ru ka rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa sngon po bdag nyid bsam mo //
translated: In the west, oneself is imagined as Heruka, the nature of all tathāgatas, arisen from he he, holding a vajra and a bell, and is blue.

original: mig tu aom las gti mug rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra'o //🔽rna bar h'um las zhe sdang rdo rje rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra /
analyzed: mig tu aom las gti mug rdo rje rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra'o // rna bar h'um las zhe sdang rdo rje rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra /
translated: In the eyes, from oṃ, is Mohavajrā, similar to Vairocana.🔽In the ears, from hūṃ, is Dveṣavajrā, similar to Vajrasattva.

original: sna la hr'i:las phrag dog rdo rje rdo rje nyi ma dang 'dra /🔽lce la aom las 'dod chags rdo rje padma gar gyi dbang phug dang 'dra /
analyzed: sna la hr'i:las phrag dog rdo rje rdo rje nyi ma dang 'dra / lce la aom las 'dod chags rdo rje padma gar gyi dbang phug dang 'dra /
translated: In the nose, from hrīḥ, is Īrṣyāvajrā, similar to Vajrasūrya.🔽In the tongue, from oṃ, is Rāgavajrā, similar to Padmanarteśvara.

original: spyi bor kham ser sna rdo rje rdo rje rgyal po dang 'dra /
analyzed: spyi bor kham ser sna rdo rje rdo rje rgyal po dang 'dra /
translated: In the head, from khaṃ, is Mātsaryavajrā, similar to Vajrarāja.

original: snying gar skye mched thams cad la 'jug pa'i yid ham las dbang phyug rdo rje rdo rje dril bu bsnams pa sngon po'o //
analyzed: snying gar skye mched thams cad la 'jug pa'i yid ham las dbang phyug rdo rje rdo rje dril bu bsnams pa sngon po'o //
translated: At the heart, from ham, which is the mind that engages all the sense bases, is blue Ishvara-vajra holding a vajra and a bell.

original: snying gar sa'i dkyil 'khor lam las ltung byed ma gri gug dang ka pa la thogs pa ser mo /
analyzed: snying gar sa'i dkyil 'khor lam las ltung byed ma gri gug dang ka pa la thogs pa ser mo /
translated: At the heart, from lam, is yellow Praluridarva holding a flaying knife and a skull.

original: lte bar chu'i dkyil 'khor lam las gsod byed ma gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa dkar mo /
analyzed: lte bar chu'i dkyil 'khor lam las gsod byed ma gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa dkar mo /
translated: At the navel, from lam, is white Maralqini holding a flaying knife and a skull.

original: lte bar me'i dkyil 'khor la pam las 'gugs byed ma gri gug dang ka @139b p'a la thogs pa dmar mo /
analyzed: lte bar me'i dkyil 'khor la pam las 'gugs byed ma gri gug dang ka @139b p'a la thogs pa dmar mo /
translated: At the navel, from pam, is red Alidha holding a flaying knife and a skull.🔽At the feet, from tam, is green Natyadhipa holding a flaying knife and a skull.

original: rkang pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor gsang ba'i gnas su tam las gar gyi dbang phug ma gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa ljang gu / mgo nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor bam las padma'i dkyil 'khor bam las padma'i dra ba can gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs🔽pa nam mkha'i mdog can sngo skya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor gsang ba'i gnas su tam las gar gyi dbang phug ma gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs pa ljang gu / mgo nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor bam las padma'i dkyil 'khor bam las padma'i dra ba can gri gug dang ka p'a la thogs🔽pa nam mkha'i mdog can sngo skya'o //
translated: At the head, from bam, is blue-green Padmajala holding a flaying knife and a skull.

original: de ltar lha la dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i phung po khams dang skye mched sbyangs nas /🔽aom pra kri ti pa ri shu dha sarba dharm'a /🔽par kri ti pa ri shudho& ham ;
analyzed: de ltar lha la dga' ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i phung po khams dang skye mched sbyangs nas / aom pra kri ti pa ri shu dha sarba dharm'a / par kri ti pa ri shudho& ham ;
translated: Thus, having purified the aggregates, elements, and sense bases of the yogin who delights in the deity,🔽one should meditate on the purification into outer emptiness with the mantra, “Oṃ prakṛti pariśuddhaḥ sarvadharmāḥ /🔽prakṛti pariśuddho ’haṃ.

original: zhes bya bas phyi stong pa nyid du rnam par dag par bsgoms la /
analyzed: zhes bya bas phyi stong pa nyid du rnam par dag par bsgoms la /
translated: Meditate on the purity of outer emptiness.🔽

original: de'i rjes la de nas dkon mchog gsum la bdun rnam dag dang skyabs 'gro bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la de nas dkon mchog gsum la bdun rnam dag dang skyabs 'gro bya'o //
translated: Then, after that, one should perform the sevenfold service and go for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: de nas srung ba'i rnal 'byor dang / de nas bdag bsrung ba dang / de nas bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa skyabs 'gro / de nas ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa bya'o zhes go rims gsung pa yin no //🔽de nas dpral bar aom /
analyzed: de nas srung ba'i rnal 'byor dang / de nas bdag bsrung ba dang / de nas bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa skyabs 'gro / de nas ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa bya'o zhes go rims gsung pa yin no // de nas dpral bar aom /
translated: Then, the sequence is: the yoga of protection, then self-protection, then going for refuge, which accumulates the merit accumulation, then one should perform the wisdom accumulation.

original: lkog mar a'a ;
analyzed: lkog mar a'a ;
translated: Then, on the forehead, one should meditate on oṃ,🔽at the throat āḥ,

original: snying gar h'um /
analyzed: snying gar h'um /
translated: and at the heart hūṃ.

original: yi ge gsum gyis sngags kyi skur gyur bar bsgoms nas /
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyis sngags kyi skur gyur bar bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on the mantra body with the three syllables,

original: de nas 'od zer spros pas phyogs bcu'i sems can kun gyi don du he ru ka'i gzugs su bskyed nas bdag nyid he ru ka dang 'dra rdo rje dang dril bus 'khyud pa /
analyzed: de nas 'od zer spros pas phyogs bcu'i sems can kun gyi don du he ru ka'i gzugs su bskyed nas bdag nyid he ru ka dang 'dra rdo rje dang dril bus 'khyud pa /
translated: Then, having emanated light rays, for the sake of all sentient beings in the ten directions, one should generate the form of Heruka and visualize oneself as similar to Heruka, embraced by the vajra and bell.

original: gnyis pa'i g-yas g-yon nyung ba bzhi'i rngul phra rab tshun chad lta'i skur dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i g-yas g-yon nyung ba bzhi'i rngul phra rab tshun chad lta'i skur dgod par bya'o //
translated: On the right and left of the second [stage], one should visualize the bodies of the subtle particles of sweat, down to the smallest, of all sentient beings.

original: de nas aom sva bh'a wa bi shu dha sarba dharm'a sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham /
analyzed: de nas aom sva bh'a wa bi shu dha sarba dharm'a sva bh'a wa shuddho& ham /
translated: Then, one should recite three times, Oṃ svabhāva viśuddha sarvadharma svabhāva viśuddho 'haṃ.

original: zhes bya ba lan gsum bzlas pas ye shes kyi tshogs bsag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lan gsum bzlas pas ye shes kyi tshogs bsag go //
translated: By this, one accumulates the collection of wisdom.

original: de nas srung ba'i rnal 'byor ni rang nyid rgyu'i h'um mdzad du bskyed la /
analyzed: de nas srung ba'i rnal 'byor ni rang nyid rgyu'i h'um mdzad du bskyed la /
translated: Then, the yoga of protection is as follows: One generates oneself as the causal Heruka.

original: de'i thugs ka nas khro bo brgyad sprul nas rgyu'i h'um mdzad de gyur pa las 'bras bu'i h'um mdzad bskyed do //
analyzed: de'i thugs ka nas khro bo brgyad sprul nas rgyu'i h'um mdzad de gyur pa las 'bras bu'i h'um mdzad bskyed do //
translated: From one's heart, one emanates the eight wrathful ones, and that causal Heruka transforms into the resultant Heruka.

original: de'i thugs ka nas steng 'og gi khro bo gnyis bskyed de /
analyzed: de'i thugs ka nas steng 'og gi khro bo gnyis bskyed de /
translated: From his heart, one generates the two wrathful ones above and below.

original: khro bo bcu la bka' bsgos nas bgegs gdan du bting ba'i rjes la bgegs mi 'jug pa'i srung ba 'di rnams bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo bcu la bka' bsgos nas bgegs gdan du bting ba'i rjes la bgegs mi 'jug pa'i srung ba 'di rnams bya'o //
translated: After the ten wrathful ones are commanded and the obstructors are placed on the seats, the following protection is done to prevent the obstructors from entering.🔽The result-continuum Heruka emanates vajra light rays from his heart to the ends of the ten directions and the peak of existence.

original: 'bras bu'i he ru thugs ka nas phyogs bcu srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rdo rje phra mo'i 'od zer 'phros pas 'od de gyur pa las de'i 'og tu rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang / 'og gis gzhi gnyis byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i he ru thugs ka nas phyogs bcu srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rdo rje phra mo'i 'od zer 'phros pas 'od de gyur pa las de'i 'og tu rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang / 'og gis gzhi gnyis byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: After the light rays transform into the vajra ground and the vajra fence, the directions and intermediate directions are blessed with the vajra tent above and the vajra canopy below.

original: phyogs dang mtshams kyi logs su rab dang dra ba nyis rim /
analyzed: phyogs dang mtshams kyi logs su rab dang dra ba nyis rim /
translated: The upper and lower nets are in two layers.

original: steng du rdo rje bla re /
analyzed: steng du rdo rje bla re /
translated: The vajra canopy is above.

original: mda'i bla re nyis rim /
analyzed: mda'i bla re nyis rim /
translated: The arrow canopy is in two layers.

original: de thams cad kyi phyi rol nas rdo rje me 'od 'bar ba rnal 'byor ba'i bsam pa dang mthun par 'dzam bu'i gling tsam phyi rol nas bskor ram /🔽@140a * // gling bzhi tsam stong spyi phung tsam /
analyzed: de thams cad kyi phyi rol nas rdo rje me 'od 'bar ba rnal 'byor ba'i bsam pa dang mthun par 'dzam bu'i gling tsam phyi rol nas bskor ram / @140a * // gling bzhi tsam stong spyi phung tsam /
translated: All of those are surrounded by blazing vajra fire light, either the size of Jambudvīpa or the size of the outer perimeter of the yogas,

original: stong gnyis pa'am /
analyzed: stong gnyis pa'am /
translated: the size of the four continents, the size of the trichiliocosm, or the size of the billion-world universe.

original: stong gsum tsam du phyi rol nas srung ba'i 'khor lo dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: stong gsum tsam du phyi rol nas srung ba'i 'khor lo dgod par bya'o //
translated: The protection wheel is set up on the outside.

original: 'og gi sa gzhi dang rdo rje'i sa gzhi gnyis /
analyzed: 'og gi sa gzhi dang rdo rje'i sa gzhi gnyis /
translated: The lower ground and the vajra ground.

original: aom me di ni badzri bha ba badzra bandha h'um /
analyzed: aom me di ni badzri bha ba badzra bandha h'um /
translated: Oṃ medini vajribhava vajra bhandha hūṃ.

original: logs kyir ba'i sngags ni /
analyzed: logs kyir ba'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra for the sides is:

original: aom badzra phra'a k'a ra badzra h'um bam h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra phra'a k'a ra badzra h'um bam h'um /
translated: Oṃ vajra prakara vajra hūṃ vaṃ hūṃ.

original: nang gi rdo rje dra ba'i sngags ni /
analyzed: nang gi rdo rje dra ba'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra for the inner vajra net is:

original: aom badzra pa nytsa ra h'um bam h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra pa nytsa ra h'um bam h'um /
translated: Oṃ vajra pāṇi vajra hūṃ vaṃ hūṃ.

original: steng du bye dus mtshan zhabs kyis mnan pa /
analyzed: steng du bye dus mtshan zhabs kyis mnan pa /
translated: Above, the ground is stamped with the soles of the feet.

original: sangs rgyas bzhi dan spyi gtsug nang du mda'i dra ba'i sngags ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhi dan spyi gtsug nang du mda'i dra ba'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra for the net of arrows inside the crown of the four buddhas is:

original: aom badzra sha ra dz'a la tram sham tram /
analyzed: aom badzra sha ra dz'a la tram sham tram /
translated: Oṃ vajra śarāṭ jāla traṃ śaṃ traṃ.

original: phyi rol nas bskor ba'i rdo rje me 'od kyi sngags ni /
analyzed: phyi rol nas bskor ba'i rdo rje me 'od kyi sngags ni /
translated: The mantra for the vajra firelight that circles outside is:

original: aom bam dzra dzrva la aa na l'a rka h'um /
analyzed: aom bam dzra dzrva la aa na l'a rka h'um /
translated: Oṃ vajra jvalānalā arka hūṃ.

original: de ltar srung ba'i 'khor lo byas pa'i sngon du gang bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar srung ba'i 'khor lo byas pa'i sngon du gang bsgom zhe na /
translated: What is meditated upon prior to creating the protection wheel in that way?

original: bcom ldan 'das khrag 'thung gis su mbha nis bka' bsgos pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad 'bar ba'i steng du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das khrag 'thung gis su mbha nis bka' bsgos pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad 'bar ba'i steng du /
translated: On top of the blazing eight-spoked wheel commanded by Bhagavat Heruka with his sum-bā-ni,

original: ma las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsams la /
analyzed: ma las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsams la /
translated: contemplate a sun maṇḍala from ma.

original: de'i dbus su h'um las rdo rje sems dpa' zhal gsum phyag drug zhi ba shel ltar dkar ba /
analyzed: de'i dbus su h'um las rdo rje sems dpa' zhal gsum phyag drug zhi ba shel ltar dkar ba /
translated: In its center, from hūṃ, is Vajrasattva, with three faces—white like crystal—and six arms.

original: rang snang ba'i yum phyag rgya chen mo lha mo dang snyoms par 'jug pa yab yum gnyis kyil krung gis bzhugs pa rus pa las byas pa'i sangs rgyas lnga'i rgyan can /
analyzed: rang snang ba'i yum phyag rgya chen mo lha mo dang snyoms par 'jug pa yab yum gnyis kyil krung gis bzhugs pa rus pa las byas pa'i sangs rgyas lnga'i rgyan can /
translated: He is in union with his natural appearance, the great seal goddess, and both of them sit in vajra posture, adorned with the bone ornaments of the five buddhas.

original: mi bskyod pa ni gtsug gi lte ba la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa ni gtsug gi lte ba la bzhugs pa /
translated: Akṣobhya is in the center of the crown.

original: rna rgyan dang / dpung rgyan dang / lag gdub dang do shal dang sen mo do dang / ska rags dang rkang gdub ste rgyan thams cad rdzogs pa /
analyzed: rna rgyan dang / dpung rgyan dang / lag gdub dang do shal dang sen mo do dang / ska rags dang rkang gdub ste rgyan thams cad rdzogs pa /
translated: He is complete with all the ornaments—earrings, armlets, bracelets, necklace, anklets, belt, and anklets.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with the signs and features.

original: dang po'i rdo rje dang dril bus 'khyud pa /
analyzed: dang po'i rdo rje dang dril bus 'khyud pa /
translated: He embraces the original vajra and bell.

original: gnyis pa'i g-yas g-yon na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i g-yas g-yon na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga 'dzin pa /
translated: In the second pair of hands he holds a skull cup and khaṭvāṅga.

original: gsum pa'i g-yas g-yon na lcags kyu dang zhags pa bsnams pa /🔽zhal g-yas ser ba /
analyzed: gsum pa'i g-yas g-yon na lcags kyu dang zhags pa bsnams pa / zhal g-yas ser ba /
translated: In the third pair of hands he holds a hook and a lasso.🔽His right face is yellow.

original: g-yon ljang ba /
analyzed: g-yon ljang ba /
translated: His left face is green.

original: dbus dkar ba /
analyzed: dbus dkar ba /
translated: His central face is white.

original: de'i yab yum gyi thugs ka nas khro bo brgyad spros te /🔽shar du rdor je drag po /
analyzed: de'i yab yum gyi thugs ka nas khro bo brgyad spros te / shar du rdor je drag po /
translated: The eight wrathful ones emanate from the hearts of the father and mother.🔽In the east is Vajravega.

original: byang du rdo rje nyi ma /🔽nub tu rdo rje gtsug tor /
analyzed: byang du rdo rje nyi ma / nub tu rdo rje gtsug tor /
translated: In the north is Vajrasūrya.🔽In the west is Vajroṣṇīṣa.

original: lhor rdo rje thab sbyor /🔽shar lhor rdo rje gnod sbyin /
analyzed: lhor rdo rje thab sbyor / shar lhor rdo rje gnod sbyin /
translated: In the south is Vajrakaṭhin.🔽In the southeast is Vajranāga.

original: lho nub tu rdo rje nag po //🔽nub byang du rdo rje stobs po che /
analyzed: lho nub tu rdo rje nag po // nub byang du rdo rje stobs po che /
translated: In the southwest is Vajrakṛṣṇa.🔽In the northwest is Vajrabhairava.

original: byang shar du rdo rje 'jigs byed /🔽byang ser ba /
analyzed: byang shar du rdo rje 'jigs byed / byang ser ba /
translated: In the northeast is Vajrabhairava.🔽The north is yellow.

original: nub dmar ba /
analyzed: nub dmar ba /
translated: The west is red.

original: lhor ljang gu /
analyzed: lhor ljang gu /
translated: The south is green.

original: shar lho du ba'i mdog can /🔽lhon nub dkar ba /
analyzed: shar lho du ba'i mdog can / lhon nub dkar ba /
translated: The southeast is the color of smoke.🔽The southwest is white.

original: nub byang gang pa /
analyzed: nub byang gang pa /
translated: The northwest is full.

original: byang shar sngo dmar /🔽thod pa las byas pa'i sangs rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan can thams cad zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
analyzed: byang shar sngo dmar / thod pa las byas pa'i sangs rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan can thams cad zhal gsum phyag drug pa /
translated: The northeast is blue-red.

original: rus pa'i rgyun gyis snga ma bzhin du thams cad brgyan pa /🔽sna tshogs pa'i padma'i 'dab @140b mar nyi ma'i steng du /
analyzed: rus pa'i rgyun gyis snga ma bzhin du thams cad brgyan pa / sna tshogs pa'i padma'i 'dab @140b mar nyi ma'i steng du /
translated: All have three faces and six arms, and are adorned with the five buddha crowns made of skulls, just as before.

original: g-yas brkyang pas phyogs skyong brgyad zhabs kyis mnan par bsam mo //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang pas phyogs skyong brgyad zhabs kyis mnan par bsam mo //
translated: They stand on the eight directional guardians, with their right legs extended, on variegated lotus petals and suns.

original: g-yas g-yon gyi dang po gnyis na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga / gnyis pa gnyis na lcags kyu dang zhags pa /
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi dang po gnyis na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga / gnyis pa gnyis na lcags kyu dang zhags pa /
translated: The first two of the right and left hands hold a skull cup and khaṭvāṅga. The second two hold a hook and lasso.

original: cang te'u dang dril bus rang snang ba'i shes rab la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: cang te'u dang dril bus rang snang ba'i shes rab la 'khyud pa /
translated: He embraces the wisdom consort who is the appearance of his own mind with a ḍamaru and a bell.

original: dbu skra dmar skra dmar ser mche ba bzhi gtsigs pa /
analyzed: dbu skra dmar skra dmar ser mche ba bzhi gtsigs pa /
translated: His reddish-yellow hair is bound up, and he bares his four fangs.

original: stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs la rdo rje dang sprul gyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i gnas thams cad sbrul gyis kyang brgyan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs la rdo rje dang sprul gyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i gnas thams cad sbrul gyis kyang brgyan par shes par bya'o //
translated: He wears a tiger-skin skirt and is adorned with bone ornaments and snakes.

original: khro bo brgyad bskyed nas rgyu'i h'um mdzad de gyur pa las bdag nyid 'bras bu'i h'um mdzad 'od zer 'bar ba mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: khro bo brgyad bskyed nas rgyu'i h'um mdzad de gyur pa las bdag nyid 'bras bu'i h'um mdzad 'od zer 'bar ba mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: Having generated the eight wrathful ones, the causal hūṃ dissolves into the resultant hūṃ. From that arises one’s own appearance as the result, blazing with light, with bared fangs,

original: zhal gsum phyag drug pa g-yas brkyang ba'i gnas pas bzhugs /
analyzed: zhal gsum phyag drug pa g-yas brkyang ba'i gnas pas bzhugs /
translated: with three faces and six arms, standing with the right leg straight.

original: dang po rdo rje dang dril bus 'khyud pa gnyi pa na lcags kyu dang zhags pa /
analyzed: dang po rdo rje dang dril bus 'khyud pa gnyi pa na lcags kyu dang zhags pa /
translated: The first two hands embrace the vajra and bell, the second two hold a hook and lasso,

original: gsum pa na kha tv'am ga dang thod pa 'dzin pa mi mgo lnga bcu'i do shal can /
analyzed: gsum pa na kha tv'am ga dang thod pa 'dzin pa mi mgo lnga bcu'i do shal can /
translated: and the third two hold a khaṭvāṅga and a skull cup. He has a garland of fifty human heads.

original: rus pa'i rdo rje rgya gram gyi phreng ba'i skye rags can /
analyzed: rus pa'i rdo rje rgya gram gyi phreng ba'i skye rags can /
translated: He has a garland of human heads and a garland of crossed vajras.

original: gdug pa can thams cad kyi bdag po 'jigs byed dus mtshan zhabs kyis mnan pa /
analyzed: gdug pa can thams cad kyi bdag po 'jigs byed dus mtshan zhabs kyis mnan pa /
translated: He tramples on the lord of all evildoers, Bhairava, and Kālarātri.

original: sangs rgyas bzhi dang spyi gtsug na rdo rje sems dpa'i cod pan can bsgom mo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhi dang spyi gtsug na rdo rje sems dpa'i cod pan can bsgom mo //
translated: He has the four buddhas and a crown of Vajrasattva on his crown.

original: de'i thugs ka nas steng 'og gi khro bo gnyis bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i thugs ka nas steng 'og gi khro bo gnyis bskyed par bya'o //
translated: You should visualize that two wrathful ones are generated above and below his heart.

original: steng gtsug tor dkar po 'og rdo rjes 'og mig sman lta bu sngon po //
analyzed: steng gtsug tor dkar po 'og rdo rjes 'og mig sman lta bu sngon po //
translated: The upper one is white Uṣṇīṣa, and the lower one is blue Vajra.

original: zhal gsum pa phyag brgyad pa /
analyzed: zhal gsum pa phyag brgyad pa /
translated: He has three faces and eight arms.

original: dang po gnyis na rdor dril /
analyzed: dang po gnyis na rdor dril /
translated: In the first pair of hands he holds a vajra and a bell.

original: gnyis pa gnyis na lcags kyu dang zhags pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa gnyis na lcags kyu dang zhags pa /
translated: In the second pair he holds a hook and a noose.

original: gsum pa gnyis na mdung rtse gsum pa dang 'khor lo //
analyzed: gsum pa gnyis na mdung rtse gsum pa dang 'khor lo //
translated: In the third pair he holds a trident and a chakram.

original: bzhi pa gnyis na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga 'chang ba /
analyzed: bzhi pa gnyis na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga 'chang ba /
translated: In the fourth pair he holds a skull cup and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: g-yas brkyang bas bzhugs pa bsgom //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang bas bzhugs pa bsgom //
translated: He stands with his right leg straight.

original: de ltar khro bo bcu bskyed nas yang 'bras bu'i h'um mdzad kyi thugs ka las /
analyzed: de ltar khro bo bcu bskyed nas yang 'bras bu'i h'um mdzad kyi thugs ka las /
translated: Having generated the ten wrathful ones in that way, again from the heart of Resultant Hūṃkara,

original: de nas stod khro bo smad phur bu'i rnam pa phyogs bcur spros nas bgegs la phur bus gdab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas stod khro bo smad phur bu'i rnam pa phyogs bcur spros nas bgegs la phur bus gdab pa'o //
translated: Then, having emanated the ten wrathful ones in the ten directions, the upper part in the form of a wrathful one and the lower part in the form of a kila, he strikes the obstructors with the kila.

original: de nas 'bras bu'i h'um mdzad du bsgoms pa'i sngags pas khro bo bcu la gegs med par gyis shig ces bka' bsgo ste /
analyzed: de nas 'bras bu'i h'um mdzad du bsgoms pa'i sngags pas khro bo bcu la gegs med par gyis shig ces bka' bsgo ste /
translated: Then, the mantrin who has meditated on the resultant Humkara commands the ten wrathful ones to be free of obstructors.

original: sngags pas su mbha ni'i sngags dran zhing phyogs bzhir sdigs mdzub kyi se gol gyi phyag rgyas /
analyzed: sngags pas su mbha ni'i sngags dran zhing phyogs bzhir sdigs mdzub kyi se gol gyi phyag rgyas /
translated: The mantrin recalls the mantra of Sumbha Ni and with the gesture of snapping the fingers of the threatening forefinger in the four directions,

original: shar du aom su mbha ni su mbha h'um h'um phat kyis brgya byin non cig ces bka' bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: shar du aom su mbha ni su mbha h'um h'um phat kyis brgya byin non cig ces bka' bsgo ba'o //
translated: in the east he commands, “Om Sumbha nisumbha hum hum phat, trample on Indra.”

original: byang du aom grihna grihna h'um h'um phat kyis gnod sbyin gyi bgegs med par gyis shig pa'o //🔽nub tu aom gri hn'a pa ya h'um phat kyis chu lha'i bgegs med par gyis shig pa'o //🔽lhor aom @141a * //
analyzed: byang du aom grihna grihna h'um h'um phat kyis gnod sbyin gyi bgegs med par gyis shig pa'o // nub tu aom gri hn'a pa ya h'um phat kyis chu lha'i bgegs med par gyis shig pa'o // lhor aom @141a * //
translated: In the north he commands, “Om grihni grihni hum hum phat, be free of the obstructors of the yakshas.”

original: a'a na ya ho bha ga b'an badzra r'a dza h'um h'um phat kyis gshin rje'i bgegs med par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: a'a na ya ho bha ga b'an badzra r'a dza h'um h'um phat kyis gshin rje'i bgegs med par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: In the west he commands, “Om grihnapaya hum phat, be free of the obstructors of Varuna.”🔽In the south he commands, “Om anaya ho bhagavan vajra raja hum hum phat, be free of the obstructors of Yama.”

original: de bzhin du yang su mbha ni'i sngags brjod pas shar lho me'i bgegs dang / lho nub tu gri gnas srin po'i bgegs dang / nub byang du grihn'a pa yas rlung gi bgegs dang / byang shar du a'a na ya hos dbang ldan gyi bgegs med par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang su mbha ni'i sngags brjod pas shar lho me'i bgegs dang / lho nub tu gri gnas srin po'i bgegs dang / nub byang du grihn'a pa yas rlung gi bgegs dang / byang shar du a'a na ya hos dbang ldan gyi bgegs med par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Likewise, by reciting the mantra of Yamāntaka, the obstacle of fire in the southeast, the obstacle of Rākṣasa in the southwest, the obstacle of wind in the northwest, and the obstacle of Indra in the northeast are removed.

original: lan gsum brjod pas steng gi lha'i bgegs dang / sa 'og gi lha ma yin gyi bgegs med par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: lan gsum brjod pas steng gi lha'i bgegs dang / sa 'og gi lha ma yin gyi bgegs med par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: By reciting it three times, the obstacle of the gods above and the obstacle of the asuras below are removed.

original: khro bo bcu la bka' bsgos pa'i rjes la 'og tu sa gzhi dang / rdo rje'i sa gzhi gnyis /
analyzed: khro bo bcu la bka' bsgos pa'i rjes la 'og tu sa gzhi dang / rdo rje'i sa gzhi gnyis /
translated: After giving the command to the ten wrathful ones, there are two sections below: the ground and the vajra ground.

original: logs su ra ba dang dra ba gnyis dang / steng du rdo rje'i bla re dang mda'i bla re gnyis /
analyzed: logs su ra ba dang dra ba gnyis dang / steng du rdo rje'i bla re dang mda'i bla re gnyis /
translated: There are two sections on the side: the fence and the net. There are two sections above: the vajra canopy and the arrow canopy.

original: phyogs thams cad du me 'od bsams la sngar bskyed pa'i phur bus 'og nas 'byung ba'i gsang sngags kyi rgyal po 'dis phyogs skyong bcu bgegs kun gyi glang pa la lugs 'byung ba phyogs dang / lugs bzlog mtshams kyi phur bus gdab po //
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du me 'od bsams la sngar bskyed pa'i phur bus 'og nas 'byung ba'i gsang sngags kyi rgyal po 'dis phyogs skyong bcu bgegs kun gyi glang pa la lugs 'byung ba phyogs dang / lugs bzlog mtshams kyi phur bus gdab po //
translated: Having visualized the firelight in all directions, one should drive in the stakes generated earlier with this king of secret mantras that will arise below, with the stakes of the directions in forward order and the stakes of the intermediate directions in reverse order, into the heads of the ten direction protectors and all the obstructors.

original: de'i sngags gha gha gsod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sngags gha gha gsod pa'o //
translated: The mantra of that is gha gha, which is killing.

original: gh'a ta ya ni gsod par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gh'a ta ya ni gsod par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Ghataya means “kill!”

original: su bsad ce na /
analyzed: su bsad ce na /
translated: Whom does one kill?

original: sarba dusht'am bi bhn'am ni gdug pa'i bgegs thams cad do //
analyzed: sarba dusht'am bi bhn'am ni gdug pa'i bgegs thams cad do //
translated: Sarva dushtān means “all evil obstructors.”

original: k'i li k'i la ya ni phur bus so //
analyzed: k'i li k'i la ya ni phur bus so //
translated: Kil kilāya means “with the stakes.”

original: su la zhe na /
analyzed: su la zhe na /
translated: Whom does one kill?

original: sarba p'a pam ste sdig pa'i las byas pa thams cad la'o //
analyzed: sarba p'a pam ste sdig pa'i las byas pa thams cad la'o //
translated: Sarva pāpam means “all those who have committed evil actions.”

original: h'um gsum dang badzra k'i la ya ni rdo rje phur bu sum cu bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: h'um gsum dang badzra k'i la ya ni rdo rje phur bu sum cu bskyed pa'o //
translated: The three hūṃs and vajra kil kilāya generate thirty vajra stakes.

original: su'i bkas gdab ce na /
analyzed: su'i bkas gdab ce na /
translated: Whose order does one give?

original: badzra dha ro a'adzny'a ya ti /
analyzed: badzra dha ro a'adzny'a ya ti /
translated: Vajra dhāra ā jñā yati.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bkas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bkas so //
translated: It is the order of the vajra holder.

original: gang la gdab ce na /🔽k'a ya dpral ba /
analyzed: gang la gdab ce na / k'a ya dpral ba /
translated: Where does one drive them in?🔽Kāya is the forehead.

original: bka' ma mgrin pa /
analyzed: bka' ma mgrin pa /
translated: Vāk is the throat.

original: tsitta snying gar ro //
analyzed: tsitta snying gar ro //
translated: The heart is the heart.

original: sus gdab ce na badzra k'i la ya h'um phat de rdo rje phur bus so //
analyzed: sus gdab ce na badzra k'i la ya h'um phat de rdo rje phur bus so //
translated: By whom is it to be driven in? By Vajrakilaya, with the mantra Vajrakilaya HUM Phat.

original: phur bu 'debs pa'i tshe khro bo'i sdang mig gis bltas nas sngags bzlas shing gdab po //
analyzed: phur bu 'debs pa'i tshe khro bo'i sdang mig gis bltas nas sngags bzlas shing gdab po //
translated: When driving in the stakes, one should look with the wrathful sidelong glance, and drive them in while reciting the mantra.

original: de nas khro bo thams cad kyi phyag g-yas pa'i rdo rjes bgegs bsad pa'i mngon spyod kyi blos brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas khro bo thams cad kyi phyag g-yas pa'i rdo rjes bgegs bsad pa'i mngon spyod kyi blos brdung bar bya'o //
translated: Then, with the vajra in the right hand of all the wrathful ones, one should beat with the thought of killing the obstructors with the rite of destroying.🔽OM Vajramudgara

original: aom badzra mu dha ra ni rdo rje tho ba'o //🔽aom badzra k'i la ya ni rdo rje phur bu'o //
analyzed: aom badzra mu dha ra ni rdo rje tho ba'o // aom badzra k'i la ya ni rdo rje phur bu'o //
translated: OM Vajrakilaya

original: a'a ko ta ya ni rdungs shig pa'o //
analyzed: a'a ko ta ya ni rdungs shig pa'o //
translated: AKODA YA

original: de nas bgegs med par 'dod na khro bo bcu gcig gi bzlas pa la bdud rtsi lnga'i ri lu'i nang gi sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bgegs med par 'dod na khro bo bcu gcig gi bzlas pa la bdud rtsi lnga'i ri lu'i nang gi sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, if one wishes to be free from obstructors, one should perform a burnt offering in the mouth of the eleven wrathful ones, using a pill of the five nectars.

original: sngags bcu gcig ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sngags bcu gcig ni go sla'o //
translated: The eleven mantras are easy to understand.

original: de lan nga gi sbyin sreg gi rdzas ni /
analyzed: de lan nga gi sbyin sreg gi rdzas ni /
translated: The substances for the burnt offering are:🔽Flesh, bone, marrow,

original: mam sa sha dang rkang dang zhag / shu kra dang khrag dang lhan cig sbyar nas /
analyzed: mam sa sha dang rkang dang zhag / shu kra dang khrag dang lhan cig sbyar nas /
translated: semen, and blood, mixed together.

original: aom a'a:h'um / gsum gyis ri lu byas shing zos na @141b bgegs med pa'i dngos grub tu nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um / gsum gyis ri lu byas shing zos na @141b bgegs med pa'i dngos grub tu nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of the three [seed syllables], one should make a pill and eat it. One will certainly attain the power of being free from obstacles.

original: bzlas pa dang nang gi sbyin sreg byed pa'i tshe khro bo zhal gsum phyag drug pa bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: bzlas pa dang nang gi sbyin sreg byed pa'i tshe khro bo zhal gsum phyag drug pa bsgom pa ni /
translated: When one is doing repetition and inner fire sacrifice, one should meditate on the wrathful one with three faces and six arms.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad dbus sngo ba g-yas ser pa g-yon ljang ba'o //🔽byang gi khro bo dbus ser ba g-yas gang pa g-yon ljang ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad dbus sngo ba g-yas ser pa g-yon ljang ba'o // byang gi khro bo dbus ser ba g-yas gang pa g-yon ljang ba'o //
translated: Vajra Humkara is blue in the middle, yellow on the right, and green on the left.🔽 The wrathful one in the north is yellow in the middle, green on the right, and blue on the left.

original: lho dang shar lho'i khro bo ni dbus sngo ba'i mdog dang g-yas ser ba g-yon ljang ba'o //
analyzed: lho dang shar lho'i khro bo ni dbus sngo ba'i mdog dang g-yas ser ba g-yon ljang ba'o //
translated: The wrathful ones in the south and southeast are blue in the middle, yellow on the right, and green on the left.

original: lho nub dang steng gi khro bo ni dbus dkar ba g-yas ser ba g-yon ljang ba'o //
analyzed: lho nub dang steng gi khro bo ni dbus dkar ba g-yas ser ba g-yon ljang ba'o //
translated: The wrathful ones in the southwest and above are white in the middle, yellow on the right, and green on the left.

original: nub kyi khro bo ni dbus dmar ba g-yar ljang ba'o //
analyzed: nub kyi khro bo ni dbus dmar ba g-yar ljang ba'o //
translated: The wrathful one in the west is red in the middle and green on the right.

original: shar dang nub byang shar dang 'og gi khro bo bzhi ni bdag po bzhin du dbus sngo ba /🔽g-yas ser ba /
analyzed: shar dang nub byang shar dang 'og gi khro bo bzhi ni bdag po bzhin du dbus sngo ba / g-yas ser ba /
translated: The four wrathful ones in the east, northwest, northeast, and below are blue in the middle like the lord,🔽yellow on the right,

original: g-yon ljang ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon ljang ba'o //
translated: and green on the left.

original: thams cad kyi spyi bor mi bskyod pa'i cod pan bsam pa nas nang gi sbyin sreg byas na rdo rje can kun mnyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi spyi bor mi bskyod pa'i cod pan bsam pa nas nang gi sbyin sreg byas na rdo rje can kun mnyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one performs the inner fire sacrifice, imagining the diadem of Akṣobhya on the head of all, all the vajra-holders will be pleased.

original: de lta bu'i srung ba'i 'khor lo ni rlung ni rgyun las ldog pa yang srid /
analyzed: de lta bu'i srung ba'i 'khor lo ni rlung ni rgyun las ldog pa yang srid /
translated: Such a protection wheel is possible even if the wind reverses its course.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba dogs sa la lhung ba yang srid /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba dogs sa la lhung ba yang srid /
translated: It is possible that the sun and moon fall to the earth.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i bka'i dam tshig 'da' bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i bka'i dam tshig 'da' bar dka' ba'o //
translated: The commitment of the Sugata's word is difficult to transgress.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug brda la sogs pa du ma rnams la gtso bo'i bka' bsgom pas bgegs med par mthong nas sngags pas lnga bcu rtsa drug gi dkyil 'khor gang 'dod pa lnga bcu rtsa drug bsgom pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug brda la sogs pa du ma rnams la gtso bo'i bka' bsgom pas bgegs med par mthong nas sngags pas lnga bcu rtsa drug gi dkyil 'khor gang 'dod pa lnga bcu rtsa drug bsgom pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the many signs such as the fifty-six maṇḍalas, by meditating on the principal's command, seeing that there are no obstacles, the mantrin should abide in meditating on whichever of the fifty-six maṇḍalas is desired.

original: las dang po pa dang mtshan ma thob pa gnyis kas bsgom mam zhe na /
analyzed: las dang po pa dang mtshan ma thob pa gnyis kas bsgom mam zhe na /
translated: Should both the beginner and the one who has attained the signs meditate?

original: gcer bu'am yang na mi gcer ba //
analyzed: gcer bu'am yang na mi gcer ba //
translated: Either naked or not naked,

original: skra grol thal bas byugs kyang rung //
analyzed: skra grol thal bas byugs kyang rung //
translated: with loose hair or smeared with ashes,

original: zhes gsungs pas gos med pa'i spyod pa dang / gos can gnyi gas kyang bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas gos med pa'i spyod pa dang / gos can gnyi gas kyang bya bar gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said that both the naked and the clothed should perform this.

original: de ltar re zhig 'khor lo bzlas //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'khor lo bzlas //
translated: Thus, one should recite the wheel for a while.

original: zhes pa ni phyis 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug gi sngags bzlas nas skyo bar gyur na stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje la mnyam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyis 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor lnga bcu rtsa drug gi sngags bzlas nas skyo bar gyur na stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje la mnyam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having recited the mantras of the fifty-six maṇḍalas that will arise later, when one becomes weary, one should rest in the vajra of the gnosis of emptiness.

original: dpral ba dang lkog ma dang snying gar aom a'a:h'um gsum bkod la 'od zer spro bsdu yi ge gsum du bsdus nas stong par bsgoms te /🔽aom thim pa'i tshe aom thim pa'i tshe aom sh'u n+ya t'a'i sngags brjod //🔽a'a: thim pa'i tshe aom aa mi ta dznya na zhes bya ba mtshan ma med pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: dpral ba dang lkog ma dang snying gar aom a'a:h'um gsum bkod la 'od zer spro bsdu yi ge gsum du bsdus nas stong par bsgoms te / aom thim pa'i tshe aom thim pa'i tshe aom sh'u n+ya t'a'i sngags brjod // a'a: thim pa'i tshe aom aa mi ta dznya na zhes bya ba mtshan ma med pa'i sngags so //
translated: Having arranged the three syllables oṃ āḥ hūṃ on the forehead, throat, and heart, one should meditate on emptiness by gathering the light rays into the three syllables and dissolving them.🔽When oṃ dissolves, one should recite the mantra of emptiness, oṃ śūnyatā-jñāna-vajra-svabhāvātmako ’haṃ.🔽When āḥ dissolves, one should recite the mantra of signlessness, oṃ amṛta-jñāna.

original: h'um thig ler zhu ba'i tshe aa pra ti ha ta dzny'a na zhes bya bas smon pa med pa'i sngags bzla'o //
analyzed: h'um thig ler zhu ba'i tshe aa pra ti ha ta dzny'a na zhes bya bas smon pa med pa'i sngags bzla'o //
translated: When hūṃ dissolves into the bindu, one should recite the mantra of wishlessness, oṃ apratihata-jñāna.

original: de ltar na rta mchog pa ni shr'i lta bu tshad med pa'i rnal 'byor dang / byin gyis brlab pa'i rnal 'byor dang / bsod @142a * //
analyzed: de ltar na rta mchog pa ni shr'i lta bu tshad med pa'i rnal 'byor dang / byin gyis brlab pa'i rnal 'byor dang / bsod @142a * //
translated: Thus, the supreme horse is the yoga of immeasurable compassion like Śhrī Heruka, the yoga of consecration, the yoga of accumulating the collection of merit, the yoga of emptiness that is the collection of wisdom, and the yoga of the protection wheel.

original: nams kyi tshogs bsogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang / ye shes kyi tshogs stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor dang / srung ba'i 'khor los byas la nang gi sbyin sreg byas pa'i rjes la lha'i 'khor lo lnga bcu rtsa drug gang 'dod pa bsgoms nas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnam thar sgo gsum gyi stong pa nyid bsgom /
analyzed: nams kyi tshogs bsogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang / ye shes kyi tshogs stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor dang / srung ba'i 'khor los byas la nang gi sbyin sreg byas pa'i rjes la lha'i 'khor lo lnga bcu rtsa drug gang 'dod pa bsgoms nas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnam thar sgo gsum gyi stong pa nyid bsgom /
translated: After performing the inner fire sacrifice, one should meditate on the emptiness of the three doors of liberation of the creation stage of the fifty-six deities of the maṇḍala of the deity of one’s choice.

original: mo// aindra bh'u ti lta bu bskyed pa'i rim pa'i zhabs su de kho na nyid kyi man ngag rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: mo// aindra bh'u ti lta bu bskyed pa'i rim pa'i zhabs su de kho na nyid kyi man ngag rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom mo //
translated: Indrabhūti and so on meditate on the completion stage, the instruction on reality, after the stage of creation.

original: padma rdo rje lta bu bskyed pa'i rim pa la mos pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs dang / dam tshig ye shes dang / sgong skyes la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rim pa mngal skyes dang / sgong skyes dang / drod gsher skyes dang / rdzus skyes kyi 'khor lo rnal 'byor gsum dang bsnyen gru bzhi dang ldan pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: padma rdo rje lta bu bskyed pa'i rim pa la mos pa ni sku dang gsung dang thugs dang / dam tshig ye shes dang / sgong skyes la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rim pa mngal skyes dang / sgong skyes dang / drod gsher skyes dang / rdzus skyes kyi 'khor lo rnal 'byor gsum dang bsnyen gru bzhi dang ldan pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One who is devoted to the creation stage of the lotus and vajra should meditate on the three yogas of the creation stage of the womb-born, the egg-born, the heat-and-moisture born, and the spontaneously born, endowed with the three liberations and the four powers of approach.

original: gzhung lugs gsum yin no //
analyzed: gzhung lugs gsum yin no //
translated: There are three textual traditions.

original: de la dang po bshad zin nas bar ma aindra bh'u ti lta bu bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: de la dang po bshad zin nas bar ma aindra bh'u ti lta bu bsgom pa ni /
translated: The first has already been explained. The meditation of the middle one, like that of Indrabhūti, is as follows.

original: snang brnyan tsam gyi rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: snang brnyan tsam gyi rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The consciousness that is merely an image

original: rnam thar sgo gsum bsgom pa'i thig le'o //
analyzed: rnam thar sgo gsum bsgom pa'i thig le'o //
translated: is the bindu of meditation on the three doors of liberation.

original: sems tsam du ni rnam par brtag / ces pa ni /
analyzed: sems tsam du ni rnam par brtag / ces pa ni /
translated: The mind is imagined to be mere consciousness.

original: thig le me long la rlangs pa zhu ba ltar mi snang bar song nas /
analyzed: thig le me long la rlangs pa zhu ba ltar mi snang bar song nas /
translated: The bindu disappears like steam on a mirror.

original: gzung ba rang bzhin med pa rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas btab ste /
analyzed: gzung ba rang bzhin med pa rnam par snang mdzad kyis rgyas btab ste /
translated: The absence of intrinsic existence of the object is sealed by Vairocana.

original: sems rig pa tsam du bsgom mo //
analyzed: sems rig pa tsam du bsgom mo //
translated: The mind is meditated on as mere consciousness.

original: chos rnams nam mkha' lta bu de ni rnam par shes pa drug gis kyang mi dmigs pas 'dzin pa rang bzhin med pa mi bskyod pas rgyas gdab po //
analyzed: chos rnams nam mkha' lta bu de ni rnam par shes pa drug gis kyang mi dmigs pas 'dzin pa rang bzhin med pa mi bskyod pas rgyas gdab po //
translated: Since that space-like phenomena are not observed by the six consciousnesses, seal with Akṣobhya, the absence of a nature of apprehender.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni chos sems kyang ma yin chos nyid sems kyi stong pa yang ma yin na nam mkha' lta bur gzung 'dzin gos pa med cing gzhi lnga po dngos po med pas mtshan nyid gsum du gnas pa med pa rdo rje sems dpa'i rgyas btab pa
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni chos sems kyang ma yin chos nyid sems kyi stong pa yang ma yin na nam mkha' lta bur gzung 'dzin gos pa med cing gzhi lnga po dngos po med pas mtshan nyid gsum du gnas pa med pa rdo rje sems dpa'i rgyas btab pa
translated: If the characteristic of that is not the mind of phenomena and is not the emptiness of the mind of dharmatā, then, like space, it is uncontaminated by subject and object. Since the five bases do not exist, the three characteristics do not exist.

original: bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the seal of Vajrasattva.

original: ci'i phyir bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsgom zhe na /
translated: Why meditate?

original: gang du snying gi padma kha sbyor zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gang du snying gi padma kha sbyor zhes pa ni /
translated: “The lotus of the heart is closed” means

original: snying ga'i chos kyi 'khor lo rtsa brgyad dang / lte ba drug cu rtsa bzhi kha sbyar pa'i dbus na gsal zhes bya ba gtum mo drod de /
analyzed: snying ga'i chos kyi 'khor lo rtsa brgyad dang / lte ba drug cu rtsa bzhi kha sbyar pa'i dbus na gsal zhes bya ba gtum mo drod de /
translated: that in the center of the eight spokes of the dharmacakra in the heart and the closed sixty-four petals of the navel, “clear” means the heat of caṇḍālī.

original: phra bar blta ba ni rtsa dbu ma chu shin gyi snying po ltar drang ba /
analyzed: phra bar blta ba ni rtsa dbu ma chu shin gyi snying po ltar drang ba /
translated: “The subtle” is the central nāḍī, which is straight like the core of a plantain tree.

original: til gyi mar me ltar gsal ba /
analyzed: til gyi mar me ltar gsal ba /
translated: “Clear” is like the flame of a sesame oil lamp.

original: rgya skyegs kyi me tog ltar dmar ba /
analyzed: rgya skyegs kyi me tog ltar dmar ba /
translated: It is red like a lac flower.

original: padma'i skud pa ltar phra ba la blta ba'o //
analyzed: padma'i skud pa ltar phra ba la blta ba'o //
translated: It is as fine as a lotus fiber.

original: rang 'byung ba ni spyi gtsug nas byang chub kyi sems babs pas dbang po drug bde par myong ba'i dga' ba'i sems 'jug pa dang / yul drug bde bar myong ba mchog @142b dga'i sems 'jug pa dang / rnam par shes pa drug bde bar myong ba lhan cig skyes dga'i sems 'jug pa khams gsum ma lus pa 'dus ma byas pa dang /
analyzed: rang 'byung ba ni spyi gtsug nas byang chub kyi sems babs pas dbang po drug bde par myong ba'i dga' ba'i sems 'jug pa dang / yul drug bde bar myong ba mchog @142b dga'i sems 'jug pa dang / rnam par shes pa drug bde bar myong ba lhan cig skyes dga'i sems 'jug pa khams gsum ma lus pa 'dus ma byas pa dang /
translated: The self-originated is the mind of joy that experiences the bliss of the six sense organs through the descent of bodhicitta from the crown, the mind of supreme joy that experiences the bliss of the six objects, and the mind of connate joy that experiences the bliss of the six consciousnesses.

original: gnyis su med pa'i nye bar 'gro zhing rtogs pas rang rig pa mngon sum du gsal pa'i chos kyi dbyings sems kyi stong nyid de la bdag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i nye bar 'gro zhing rtogs pas rang rig pa mngon sum du gsal pa'i chos kyi dbyings sems kyi stong nyid de la bdag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the dharmadhātu, the emptiness of the mind, which is the noncomposite of the entire three realms, which is the nondual, direct realization and entry, and which is the clarity of one’s vidyā.

original: klu grub kyi zhal snga nas kyang //
analyzed: klu grub kyi zhal snga nas kyang //
translated: Also, Nāgārjuna says:🔽Just as water in water

original: ji ltar chu la chu bzhag dang / ji ltar mar la mar bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar chu la chu bzhag dang / ji ltar mar la mar bzhin du //
translated: and just as butter in butter,

original: de ltar rang gi ye shes ni //
analyzed: de ltar rang gi ye shes ni //
translated: In that way, one’s wisdom

original: legs mthong gang yin 'dir phyag yin //
analyzed: legs mthong gang yin 'dir phyag yin //
translated: is the correct seeing that is homage here.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: so so skye bo yid kyi rnam shes kyi nges pa ma drangs par rang rig pa stong nyid la tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: so so skye bo yid kyi rnam shes kyi nges pa ma drangs par rang rig pa stong nyid la tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the mind of an ordinary person is not drawn into certainty, how can it be a valid cognition in regard to the emptiness of self-awareness?🔽The answer is:

original: lan du / dbang po g-yo ba'i /
analyzed: lan du / dbang po g-yo ba'i /
translated: The horse of the moving sense powers

original: rta kun nang du nges sbyar ba'i //
analyzed: rta kun nang du nges sbyar ba'i //
translated: is tied up inside with certainty.

original: zhes pa ni dbang po yul drug la g-yo ba'i rta dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbang po yul drug la g-yo ba'i rta dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya yin la /
translated: The horse of the sense powers moving to the six objects is the twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths.

original: de kun srog aa ba dh'u t'i'i nang du bcug nas nges pa'i rnal 'byor du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kun srog aa ba dh'u t'i'i nang du bcug nas nges pa'i rnal 'byor du 'gyur te /
translated: All of them are brought into the life-force, the avadhūtī, and become the yoga of certainty.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud 'di las kyang bsdus pas phyi ma'i rgyud las /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud 'di las kyang bsdus pas phyi ma'i rgyud las /
translated: In this root tantra, it is also summarized in the Later Tantra:

original: yid ni nang du chud pa yis //
analyzed: yid ni nang du chud pa yis //
translated: By bringing the mind inside,

original: 'dod pa'i dngos grub bsgom par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub bsgom par bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: one should meditate on the siddhi of desire.

original: ye shes rgyal ba ma lus 'dus pa'i snod gyur pa ni /
analyzed: ye shes rgyal ba ma lus 'dus pa'i snod gyur pa ni /
translated: The vessel that is the accumulation of all the jinas of timeless awareness🔽is the body of the vajra master.

original: dus gsum gyi rgyal ba ma lus pa'i sa bcu gcig gi ye shes dbugs bkag nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems rang bzhin brgyad cu bkag pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / gtum mo drod dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / spyi gtsug gi byang chub kyi sems dbang po bdag po'i rkyen las rnam par shes pa bsam gtan gyi dga' bde skyes la /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi rgyal ba ma lus pa'i sa bcu gcig gi ye shes dbugs bkag nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems rang bzhin brgyad cu bkag pa'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / gtum mo drod dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / spyi gtsug gi byang chub kyi sems dbang po bdag po'i rkyen las rnam par shes pa bsam gtan gyi dga' bde skyes la /
translated: From that, the consciousness arises as the bliss of the joy of concentration.🔽From that, the unconditioned, which is beyond the three realms, is realized in a direct perception of nonduality.

original: de las khams gsum ma lus pa las 'das pa 'dus ma byas dang / gnyis su med pa mngon gsum gyis nye bar rtogs nas 'dus ma byas mthong pa'i ye shes nam mkha' dang 'dra ba khams gsum gyi gzung 'dzin dri ma dang bral bas dpal rdo rje 'chang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las khams gsum ma lus pa las 'das pa 'dus ma byas dang / gnyis su med pa mngon gsum gyis nye bar rtogs nas 'dus ma byas mthong pa'i ye shes nam mkha' dang 'dra ba khams gsum gyi gzung 'dzin dri ma dang bral bas dpal rdo rje 'chang du 'gyur ro //
translated: The pristine consciousness of seeing the unconditioned, which is like space, is free from the taints of the apprehended and the apprehender of the three realms.

original: snying ga'i kha sbyor gyi ming ci zhe na /
analyzed: snying ga'i kha sbyor gyi ming ci zhe na /
translated: What is the name of the union at the heart?🔽The union of the two benefits

original: sangs rgyas rjes dran sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes dran sbyor ba yis //
translated: is the union of the two benefits.

original: zhes bya ste snying ga'i rtsa brgyad sangs rgyas yab yum brgyad /
analyzed: zhes bya ste snying ga'i rtsa brgyad sangs rgyas yab yum brgyad /
translated: The eight channel petals at the heart are the eight male and female buddhas.🔽The central channel is glorious Heruka.

original: dbu ma dpal he ru ka yin te de yang sangs rgyas spyan dang / chu'i rtsa m'a ma k'i dang / me'i rtsa gos dkar mo //
analyzed: dbu ma dpal he ru ka yin te de yang sangs rgyas spyan dang / chu'i rtsa m'a ma k'i dang / me'i rtsa gos dkar mo //
translated: The water channel is Mamaki, the fire channel is Pandara,

original: rlung gi rtsa sgrol ma /
analyzed: rlung gi rtsa sgrol ma /
translated: and the wind channel is Tara.

original: bshang ba'i dangs ma rgyu ba'i rtsa rnam snang /🔽lci ba'i dangs ma 'byung ba'i rtsa rin 'byung /🔽khrag gi dangs ma rgyu ba'i rtsa snang @143a * //
analyzed: bshang ba'i dangs ma rgyu ba'i rtsa rnam snang / lci ba'i dangs ma 'byung ba'i rtsa rin 'byung / khrag gi dangs ma rgyu ba'i rtsa snang @143a * //
translated: The channel that carries the refined essence of feces is Vairochana.🔽The channel that carries the refined essence of urine is Ratnasambhava.

original: ba mtha' yas /
analyzed: ba mtha' yas /
translated: The channel that carries the refined essence of blood is Amitabha.

original: sha'i dangs ma rgyu ba'i rtsa don yod grub pa /
analyzed: sha'i dangs ma rgyu ba'i rtsa don yod grub pa /
translated: The channel that carries the refined essence of flesh is Amoghasiddhi.

original: dbus ma byang chub sems dang mkha' rgyu ba'i rtsa he ru ka'o //
analyzed: dbus ma byang chub sems dang mkha' rgyu ba'i rtsa he ru ka'o //
translated: The central channel and the channel that carries the refined essence of bodhichitta are Heruka.

original: de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sbyor ba rgyud kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sbyor ba rgyud kyi rim pa'o //
translated: That is the stage of the tantra of the yoga of recalling the buddhas.

original: chos rjes su dran pa'i sgom pa ni gtum mo drod de /
analyzed: chos rjes su dran pa'i sgom pa ni gtum mo drod de /
translated: The cultivation of recalling the dharma is the heat of chandali.

original: g-yas g-yon gyi rtsa srub thag / dbu ma aa wa dh'u t'i'i srub shing /
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi rtsa srub thag / dbu ma aa wa dh'u t'i'i srub shing /
translated: The right and left channels are the plow, the central channel is the plow pole,

original: khrag gi thig le gtsub stan /
analyzed: khrag gi thig le gtsub stan /
translated: and the drop of blood is the base of the plow.

original: dbugs 'byung rngub bkag nas gtsubs pa las gtum mo drod yin no //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung rngub bkag nas gtsubs pa las gtum mo drod yin no //
translated: The heat of chandali is from the friction of blocking the exhalation and inhalation of breath.🔽The burning of the four cakras from the fire at the navel is the yoga of mindfulness of dharma.

original: lte ba nas 'bar ba las 'khor lo bzhi bsregs pa ni chos rjes su dran pa'i sbyor ba lus kyi khams nyid shu bzhi'i bar du bsregs pa ni /
analyzed: lte ba nas 'bar ba las 'khor lo bzhi bsregs pa ni chos rjes su dran pa'i sbyor ba lus kyi khams nyid shu bzhi'i bar du bsregs pa ni /
translated: The burning of the elements of the body up to the four śa is

original: chos kyi skur ni bdag 'gyur te //
analyzed: chos kyi skur ni bdag 'gyur te //
translated: “I will become the dharmakāya.”

original: zhes bya ste su chu la thim pas smig rgyu lta bu'i rtags dang / chu me la thim pas du ba lta bu'i rtags dang me rlung la thim pas srin bu me khyer lta bu'i rtags dang / rlung rnam par shes pa la thim pas nam mkha' stong pa lta bu'i rtags 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ste su chu la thim pas smig rgyu lta bu'i rtags dang / chu me la thim pas du ba lta bu'i rtags dang me rlung la thim pas srin bu me khyer lta bu'i rtags dang / rlung rnam par shes pa la thim pas nam mkha' stong pa lta bu'i rtags 'byung ba ni /
translated: The signs of the mirage-like sign of water dissolving into fire, the smoke-like sign of fire dissolving into air, the firefly-like sign of air dissolving into consciousness, and the sign of space-like consciousness dissolving into clear light arise.

original: chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin no //
translated: This is becoming the nature of the dharmakāya.

original: des spyi gtsug nas byang chub kyi sems phab nas snying ga'i dbus na 'byung ba lnga dang bdud rtsi lnga gcig tu gyur pa'i thig le ni /
analyzed: des spyi gtsug nas byang chub kyi sems phab nas snying ga'i dbus na 'byung ba lnga dang bdud rtsi lnga gcig tu gyur pa'i thig le ni /
translated: The bodhicitta descends from the crown to the center of the heart, where the five elements and the five amṛtas become one.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog de las mngon sum gyis shes pa'i gsal byed dga' ba mchog dga' lhan cig skyes dga'i rnam par lhan cig shes pa la ye shes kyi mchog bde ba stong pa nyid sa bcu gcig gi de kho na nyid kyi man ngag shes pa rnams🔽kyis bla ma dam pa'i man ngal la brten nas shin tu bsgoms pa goms pa las /
analyzed: dge 'dun dkon mchog de las mngon sum gyis shes pa'i gsal byed dga' ba mchog dga' lhan cig skyes dga'i rnam par lhan cig shes pa la ye shes kyi mchog bde ba stong pa nyid sa bcu gcig gi de kho na nyid kyi man ngag shes pa rnams kyis bla ma dam pa'i man ngal la brten nas shin tu bsgoms pa goms pa las /
translated: Those who know that should meditate on the bindu of bodhicitta, which is the supreme bliss of the buddhas, the supreme bliss of the bodhisattvas, and the supreme bliss of the yogins, in the center of the heart of all sentient beings.🔽The signs of attaining the stage, such as the blazing, and so on, will arise without a doubt.

original: sa thob pa'i rtags dgu 'bar ba la sogs pa 'og nas le'u lnga bcu rtsa drug pa las bshad pa'i yon tan skye bar the tshom med do //
analyzed: sa thob pa'i rtags dgu 'bar ba la sogs pa 'og nas le'u lnga bcu rtsa drug pa las bshad pa'i yon tan skye bar the tshom med do //
translated: The qualities explained in the fifty-sixth chapter will arise.🔽The yogi/nī should meditate on the bindu that always exists in the heart of the bodhisattvas, which is inexpressible with words, and is the bindu that is the essence of all buddhas.

original: rnal 'byor pas dus yun du byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du bzhin du snying la gnas pa'i thig le rlung bkag pas yi ges rjod du med pa rnal 'byor pa'i skyes bus de bsgoms na sa bcu gcig gi ye shes skye ba la the tshom med do
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas dus yun du byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu du bzhin du snying la gnas pa'i thig le rlung bkag pas yi ges rjod du med pa rnal 'byor pa'i skyes bus de bsgoms na sa bcu gcig gi ye shes skye ba la the tshom med do
translated: If the yogi/nī meditates on that, there is no doubt that the pristine consciousness of the eleventh stage will arise.

original: // sems can rjes rjes dran sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: // sems can rjes rjes dran sbyor ba yis //
translated: The yogi/nī should meditate on the bindu that always exists in the heart of all sentient beings.

original: sems can rjes dran bsgom par bya //
analyzed: sems can rjes dran bsgom par bya //
translated: One should cultivate the recollection of sentient beings.

original: zhes pa ni klu sgrub lugs kyis sems can rjes dran ni sems sgyu ma lta bu bdag byin gyis rlob pa dran pa dang / sems 'od gsal ba stong pa nyid dran pa dang / sems zung 'jug pa bde ba chen po rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni klu sgrub lugs kyis sems can rjes dran ni sems sgyu ma lta bu bdag byin gyis rlob pa dran pa dang / sems 'od gsal ba stong pa nyid dran pa dang / sems zung 'jug pa bde ba chen po rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: According to Nagarjuna's system, the recollection of sentient beings is the cultivation of the recollection of the mind as an illusion, the recollection of the mind as radiant light, and the recollection of the mind as the union of bliss.

original: rjes su dran zhes pa ni mngon sum @143b gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dran zhes pa ni mngon sum @143b gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: Recollection means direct valid cognition.

original: blo gros chen pos mthong rnams kyi //
analyzed: blo gros chen pos mthong rnams kyi //
translated: The cognitions of the great intellect

original: rnam pa thams cad cig car nges //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad cig car nges //
translated: are ascertained all at once in every way.

original: zhes pas dran pa'i nges pa drangs pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes pas dran pa'i nges pa drangs pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: This is the valid cognition that induces the ascertainment of recollection.

original: sems can rjes dran chos kyis ni //
analyzed: sems can rjes dran chos kyis ni //
translated: By the recollection of sentient beings,

original: chos kyi sems dpa' bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sems dpa' bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should cultivate the bodhisattva of the Dharma.

original: zhes pa ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes sems can gyi don byed pa'i chos kyi sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bzhin du 'gro ba mi gtong ba'i thugs rje chen po bsgom par bya zhes ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes sems can gyi don byed pa'i chos kyi sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bzhin du 'gro ba mi gtong ba'i thugs rje chen po bsgom par bya zhes ba'o //
translated: This means that one should cultivate great compassion, which does not abandon transmigrators, like the Bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara, the Dharma-lord who performs the welfare of sentient beings with pure mundane gnosis.

original: tshigs bcad 'di rnams kyi 'brel ba ni de kho na nyid kyi man ngag ces bya ba'i sgrub pa'i thabs byas pa de yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs bcad 'di rnams kyi 'brel ba ni de kho na nyid kyi man ngag ces bya ba'i sgrub pa'i thabs byas pa de yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The connection of these verses is that one should also look at the Sādhana composed called the Instructions on Reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni bskyed rim lnga bcu rtsa drug gis skyon sems ngal gso ba'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rim pa bde ba stong pa nyid bsgoms par nges pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni bskyed rim lnga bcu rtsa drug gis skyon sems ngal gso ba'i thabs rdzogs pa'i rim pa bde ba stong pa nyid bsgoms par nges pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat’s intention is that the method of resting the mind, which is the fault of the fifty-six generation stages, is definitely the meditation on the emptiness of bliss, the perfection stage.

original: de ltar sngon du 'gro ba'i rnal 'byor lnga rdzogs nas /
analyzed: de ltar sngon du 'gro ba'i rnal 'byor lnga rdzogs nas /
translated: Thus, having completed the five preliminary yogas,

original: rten dang brten pa'i dang po sbyor ba 'byung ba bzhi'i ri rab gzhal yas khang dang bcas pa bskyed pa ni don dam pa'i stong pa nyid yin yang snying rje'i bdag nyid kyis sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir byang chub tu sems sems bskyed pa'i rim ba
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dang po sbyor ba 'byung ba bzhi'i ri rab gzhal yas khang dang bcas pa bskyed pa ni don dam pa'i stong pa nyid yin yang snying rje'i bdag nyid kyis sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir byang chub tu sems sems bskyed pa'i rim ba
translated: However, because of the nature of compassion, in order to benefit sentient beings, the stages of generating bodhicitta and the stages of the path are generated.

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu lta bu kha dog sngon po zur bzhi pa ba dan gyis mtshan pa /
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu lta bu kha dog sngon po zur bzhi pa ba dan gyis mtshan pa /
translated: The wind maṇḍala arises from yaṃ, a blue bow-shaped wind maṇḍala marked with pennants in the four directions.

original: ram las byung ba'i me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum dmar po 'bar ba'i phreng bas dkrigs pa gru gsum du rdo rjes mtshan pa /
analyzed: ram las byung ba'i me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum dmar po 'bar ba'i phreng bas dkrigs pa gru gsum du rdo rjes mtshan pa /
translated: The fire maṇḍala arising from raṃ is a red, triangular fire maṇḍala marked with a vajra in the three corners, covered with garlands of flames.

original: de'i steng du bam las chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po dkar po bum pas mtshan pa /
analyzed: de'i steng du bam las chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po dkar po bum pas mtshan pa /
translated: Above that, the water maṇḍala arising from vaṃ is a white, round water maṇḍala marked with a vase.

original: de'i steng du lam las byung ba'i sa'i dkyil grub zhi ser po sna tshogs rdo rje mtshan pa /
analyzed: de'i steng du lam las byung ba'i sa'i dkyil grub zhi ser po sna tshogs rdo rje mtshan pa /
translated: Above that, the earth maṇḍala arising from laṃ is a square, yellow earth maṇḍala marked with a crossed vajra.

original: de'i steng du sum las byang ba'i ri rab zur bzhi pa /
analyzed: de'i steng du sum las byang ba'i ri rab zur bzhi pa /
translated: Above that, Mount Sumeru arises from suṃ.

original: shar shel / lho bee d'u rya /
analyzed: shar shel / lho bee d'u rya /
translated: The east is crystal, the south is beryl,

original: nub padma r'a ga //
analyzed: nub padma r'a ga //
translated: the west is ruby,🔽and the north is the color of gold.

original: byang gser gyi kha dog / phyogs bzhi mtshams brgyad kyi rtse mo mtho ba /
analyzed: byang gser gyi kha dog / phyogs bzhi mtshams brgyad kyi rtse mo mtho ba /
translated: The eight corners are high.🔽Above that, from bhruṃ, is Vairocana holding a wheel and a bell.

original: de'i steng du bhr'um las rnam par snang mdzad 'khor lo dang dril bu bsnams pa yongs su gyur pa la las sku'i 'khor lo gzhal yas khang steng du brtsegs pa tshad med pa bzhi zur bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang rta babs bzhis brgyan pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spongs pa'i dra ba dra phyed kyis mdzes pa ye shes bzhi'i snang pa'i ba dan bzhi dang /
analyzed: de'i steng du bhr'um las rnam par snang mdzad 'khor lo dang dril bu bsnams pa yongs su gyur pa la las sku'i 'khor lo gzhal yas khang steng du brtsegs pa tshad med pa bzhi zur bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang rta babs bzhis brgyan pa nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spongs pa'i dra ba dra phyed kyis mdzes pa ye shes bzhi'i snang pa'i ba dan bzhi dang /
translated: From that transformation, the celestial mansion of the wheel of awakened body is stacked above, with four corners for the four immeasurables, four gates for the four doors of liberation, four pediments for the four meditative concentrations, and is beautified by nets and half-nets that abandon the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: byang chub kyi yan la ga me tog phreng bas brgyan pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan la ga me tog phreng bas brgyan pa /
translated: It is adorned with four banners of the light of the four pristine consciousnesses and garlands of flowers of the seven riches.

original: zur dang sgo khyud kyi mtshams su rdo rje rin po ches brgyan pa /
analyzed: zur dang sgo khyud kyi mtshams su rdo rje rin po ches brgyan pa /
translated: The corners and the gates are adorned with vajra jewels.

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor thig gdab po //🔽zhes bya @144a * //
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor thig gdab po //🔽zhes bya @144a * //
translated: The outer maṇḍala is measured.

original: ba ni sngon byung sprul pa dang / rjes 'jug bri ba gnyis ka zin par dgongs so //
analyzed: ba ni sngon byung sprul pa dang / rjes 'jug bri ba gnyis ka zin par dgongs so //
translated: The former is the emanation, and the latter is the drawing of the disciples.

original: de'i nang du 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa dkar po 'khor lo'i phreng bas bskor ba /
analyzed: de'i nang du 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa dkar po 'khor lo'i phreng bas bskor ba /
translated: In the middle of that, there is a white eight-spoked wheel surrounded by a garland of wheels.

original: de'i dbus su sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad pa /
analyzed: de'i dbus su sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad pa /
translated: In the middle of that, there is an eight-petaled multicolored lotus.

original: shar sngo ba lho ser ba nub dmar ba byang ljang ba /
analyzed: shar sngo ba lho ser ba nub dmar ba byang ljang ba /
translated: The east is blue, the south is yellow, the west is red, and the north is green.

original: mtshams phyed gzugs kyi padma gri gug gi phreng bas bskor bar bsam mo //
analyzed: mtshams phyed gzugs kyi padma gri gug gi phreng bas bskor bar bsam mo //
translated: The intermediate directions are half-forms. The lotus is surrounded by a garland of flaying knives.

original: rten gyi dang po sbyor ba bstan nas nas brten pa lha'i dang po sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: rten gyi dang po sbyor ba bstan nas nas brten pa lha'i dang po sbyor ba ni /
translated: Having explained the first yoga of the support, now, for the first yoga of the supported deity,

original: zla ba me long ye shes k'a li /
analyzed: zla ba me long ye shes k'a li /
translated: the moon is the ka of the mirrorlike gnosis.

original: nyi ma mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes a'a li /
analyzed: nyi ma mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes a'a li /
translated: The sun is the ā of the gnosis of uniformity.

original: h'um bam gnyis dang po rdo rje dang gri gug so sor rtog pa /
analyzed: h'um bam gnyis dang po rdo rje dang gri gug so sor rtog pa /
translated: The two huṃ and vaṃ are the individual discernment of the vajra and flaying knife.🔽The emanation and reabsorbing of the light rays is the gnosis of activities.🔽The causal heruka, Vajrasattva, is the gnosis of the dharmadhātu.🔽The front face is white,

original: 'ong zer spro bsdu bya ba nan tan la sogs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rgyu'i he ru ka rdo rje sems dpa' rim ma dad bcas pa mdun dkar ba /
analyzed: 'ong zer spro bsdu bya ba nan tan la sogs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rgyu'i he ru ka rdo rje sems dpa' rim ma dad bcas pa mdun dkar ba /
translated: the right face is yellow,

original: g-yas ser ba /
analyzed: g-yas ser ba /
translated: the left face is red,🔽and the rear face is green.

original: rgyab dmar ba /
analyzed: rgyab dmar ba /
translated: The back is red.

original: g-yon ljang ba /
analyzed: g-yon ljang ba /
translated: The left is green.

original: mdun ma zhi ba'i nyams kyi zhal /
analyzed: mdun ma zhi ba'i nyams kyi zhal /
translated: The front face has the experience of peace.

original: g-yas dgod pa'i nyams kyi zhal /🔽rgyab khro ba'i nyams /
analyzed: g-yas dgod pa'i nyams kyi zhal / rgyab khro ba'i nyams /
translated: The right face has the experience of laughter.🔽The back face has the experience of wrath.

original: g-yon 'jigs su rung ba'i nyams /
analyzed: g-yon 'jigs su rung ba'i nyams /
translated: The left face has the experience of terror.

original: phyag dang po rdo rje dang dril bus 'khyud pa /
analyzed: phyag dang po rdo rje dang dril bus 'khyud pa /
translated: The first pair of hands embrace with a vajra and a bell.

original: g-yas g-yon gyi gnyis pas tshangs pa'i pags pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi gnyis pas tshangs pa'i pags pa bsnams pa /
translated: The second pair of hands on the right and left hold the skin of Brahmā.

original: g-yas g-yon gyi gsum pa ni gri gug dang thod pa /
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi gsum pa ni gri gug dang thod pa /
translated: The third pair of hands on the right and left hold a flaying knife and skull cup.🔽The fourth pair of hands on the right and left hold a ḍamaru and khaṭvāṅga.

original: g-yas g-yon gyi bzhi pa na cang te'u dang kha tv'am ga / g-yas g-yon gyi lnga pa na dgra sta dang zhags /
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi bzhi pa na cang te'u dang kha tv'am ga / g-yas g-yon gyi lnga pa na dgra sta dang zhags /
translated: The fifth pair of hands on the right and left hold an axe and a club.

original: g-yas g-yon gyi drug pa na mdud dang tshangs pa'i mgo bo ste /
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi drug pa na mdud dang tshangs pa'i mgo bo ste /
translated: The sixth pair of hands on the right and left hold a trident and the head of Brahmā.

original: phyag bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: phyag bcu gnyis pa /
translated: He has twelve arms.

original: sems dpa'i skyil krung can /
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil krung can /
translated: He sits in the sattvaparyaṅka posture.

original: dbu rgyan rus pa las byas pa'i sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan can /
analyzed: dbu rgyan rus pa las byas pa'i sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan can /
translated: He has a head ornament of the five bone crests.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis spras pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad can no //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis spras pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad can no //
translated: He is adorned with all the ornaments and has the major and minor marks.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i rgyud las rdo rje bsgom pa'i shes rab /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i rgyud las rdo rje bsgom pa'i shes rab /
translated: The vajra is the wisdom of meditation,

original: dril bu thos bsam gyi shes rab /
analyzed: dril bu thos bsam gyi shes rab /
translated: the bell is the wisdom of hearing and reflection,

original: tshangs pa'i pags pa bzod pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i pags pa bzod pa /
translated: the skin of Brahma is patience,

original: gri gug ye shes /
analyzed: gri gug ye shes /
translated: the curved knife is wisdom,

original: thod pa thabs mkhas pa /🔽cang te'u smon lam /
analyzed: thod pa thabs mkhas pa / cang te'u smon lam /
translated: the skull is skillful means,🔽the hand drum is aspiration,

original: kha tv'am ga bsam gtan /
analyzed: kha tv'am ga bsam gtan /
translated: the khaṭvāṅga is meditative concentration,

original: dgra sta tshul khrims /🔽zhag pa brtson 'grus /
analyzed: dgra sta tshul khrims / zhag pa brtson 'grus /
translated: the battle-ax is ethical discipline,🔽the shield is diligence,

original: mdung spyin pa /
analyzed: mdung spyin pa /
translated: the spear is generosity,🔽and the head of Brahma is power.

original: tshangs pa'i mgo bo stobs te pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis las byung ba yin no zhes gsungs pas dkyil 'khor ba thams cad kyi phyag bcu gnyis ni don dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mgo bo stobs te pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis las byung ba yin no zhes gsungs pas dkyil 'khor ba thams cad kyi phyag bcu gnyis ni don dang sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, the twelve perfections are the source of the twelve arms of all the deities of the maṇḍala.

original: de'i thugs kar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su ye shes sems dpa' zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa de'i thugs kar zla ba'i rdo rje'i dam tshig can ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' ste sems dpa' sum brtsegs so //
analyzed: de'i thugs kar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su ye shes sems dpa' zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa de'i thugs kar zla ba'i rdo rje'i dam tshig can ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' ste sems dpa' sum brtsegs so //
translated: In the heart of the principal deity is a sun maṇḍala, in the center of which is the gnosis being with four faces and twelve arms. In the heart of that deity is a moon maṇḍala, in the center of which is the commitment being, the concentration being, the vajra of the moon. Thus, there are three beings.

original: @144b ye shes sems dpa'i cod pan gyi dbus su rdo rje 'dzin ba ji ltar thabs la phyag rgya drug yod pa bzhin du shes rab de la phyag rgya lngas byin gyis brlabs pas zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa gri gug dang ka p'a la bsnams pa'o// phyogs bcu'i
analyzed: @144b ye shes sems dpa'i cod pan gyi dbus su rdo rje 'dzin ba ji ltar thabs la phyag rgya drug yod pa bzhin du shes rab de la phyag rgya lngas byin gyis brlabs pas zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa gri gug dang ka p'a la bsnams pa'o// phyogs bcu'i
translated: In the center of the crown of the awareness being, Vajradhara is blessed by the five mudras, just as the method has the six mudras. He has one face and two hands, holding a flaying knife and skull cup.

original: sangs rgyas yab yum gyi zhal nas zhugs pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas yab yum gyi zhal nas zhugs pas /
translated: The buddhas of the ten directions enter through the mouths of the male and female bodhisattvas.

original: lkog ma dang snying ga lte bar srid pa bar dor 'od zer dkar dmar yab yum gyi mkha' gsang gi gnas su rigs kyi dbye bas phye ba'i ye shes kyi lha mo bzhi /
analyzed: lkog ma dang snying ga lte bar srid pa bar dor 'od zer dkar dmar yab yum gyi mkha' gsang gi gnas su rigs kyi dbye bas phye ba'i ye shes kyi lha mo bzhi /
