translated: At the throat, heart, and navel, in the intermediate state of existence, the four awareness goddesses, who are the divisions of the families of the white and red light rays, are in the space of the male and female consorts.🔽The twenty-eight deities of the mandala are placed in the locations of the creation stage: the sixteen male and female bodhisattvas of the body wheel and the eight pledge goddesses.

original: sku'i 'khor lo yab yum bcu drug dam tshig gi lha mo brgyad de nyi shu rtsa brgyad mang la skyes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi gnas la bkod pa ni yab yum gyi rdo rje dbyings kyi rgyu las lha nyi shu rtsa brgyad sras kyi tshul du bskyed pa ni
analyzed: sku'i 'khor lo yab yum bcu drug dam tshig gi lha mo brgyad de nyi shu rtsa brgyad mang la skyes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi gnas la bkod pa ni yab yum gyi rdo rje dbyings kyi rgyu las lha nyi shu rtsa brgyad sras kyi tshul du bskyed pa ni
translated: The twenty-eight deities are generated from the father and mother Vajradhatu Ishvara as the children.

original: dbang phyug mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug mchog ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “the supreme lord.”

original: de lta bu'i rgyu'i he ru ka longs skus mngal skyes kyi 'khor gyi lha mo sprul nas bde ba chen po chos kyi skur yab yum gyi mkha' gsang gi thad kar sku gnyis nyi zla'i thig ler zhu ba las lha mo rnams kyi glus bskul ba ni sku'i
analyzed: de lta bu'i rgyu'i he ru ka longs skus mngal skyes kyi 'khor gyi lha mo sprul nas bde ba chen po chos kyi skur yab yum gyi mkha' gsang gi thad kar sku gnyis nyi zla'i thig ler zhu ba las lha mo rnams kyi glus bskul ba ni sku'i
translated: The causal Heruka, the sambhogakaya, emanates the retinue of goddesses born from the womb. The great bliss of the dharmakaya melts into the bindu of the sun and moon of the two bodies of the father and mother in the space of the secret place. The goddesses sing songs of encouragement.🔽The retinue of the body is the eight lords who dwell below the earth and the twenty-four yoginis.

original: 'khor lo sa 'og nas gnas pa'i dbang po brgyad dang / rnal 'byor ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis chags pa'i mig gis blta ba dang / lag pa bskyod pa'i gar dang ngag gi sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor lo sa 'og nas gnas pa'i dbang po brgyad dang / rnal 'byor ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis chags pa'i mig gis blta ba dang / lag pa bskyod pa'i gar dang ngag gi sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa ni /
translated: The praise to the bhagavat with the eyes of passion, the dance of moving the hands, and with the voice is as follows.

original: yum bzhis bde bar gshegs pa bde ba chen po /
analyzed: yum bzhis bde bar gshegs pa bde ba chen po /
translated: The four mothers say, “Sugata, great bliss,

original: rab dga' bde chen mchog thob mdzod /
analyzed: rab dga' bde chen mchog thob mdzod /
translated: attain supreme great bliss.”

original: aa la la la ho zhes brjod pa dang / yang sku'i 'khor lo'i lha mo brgyad kyis kyang tshig de rang gi glu blangs pa dang / yang dam tshig gi lha mo rnams kyis de nyid glu blangs pa'i tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa la la la ho zhes brjod pa dang / yang sku'i 'khor lo'i lha mo brgyad kyis kyang tshig de rang gi glu blangs pa dang / yang dam tshig gi lha mo rnams kyis de nyid glu blangs pa'i tshigs bcad phyed dang gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: and again the pledge goddesses sing that very song in two and a half verses.

original: glu 'di blangs pa cam gyis khams gsum gyi srid pa las grol ba'i chos ni sku'i bde bar gshegs pa sgrib pa rnam gnyis spangs pa'i dag pa chen po yang dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'i tshul du yang brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: glu 'di blangs pa cam gyis khams gsum gyi srid pa las grol ba'i chos ni sku'i bde bar gshegs pa sgrib pa rnam gnyis spangs pa'i dag pa chen po yang dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo'i tshul du yang brtag par bya'o //
translated: The moment this song is sung, the Dharma of liberation from existence in the three realms is the Sugata of the body, the great purity that is the abandonment of the two obscurations, and it should be imagined in the manner of the principal of the mandala.

original: rnal 'byor pa kha cig ga mos pa'i dbang gis mngal skyes la dga' bas 'khor sngon du skyes pa chos kyi sku la sprul sku'i dkyil 'khor mngal skyes yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa kha cig ga mos pa'i dbang gis mngal skyes la dga' bas 'khor sngon du skyes pa chos kyi sku la sprul sku'i dkyil 'khor mngal skyes yin no //
translated: Some yogis, due to their preference for womb birth, imagine the mandala of the emanation body in the dharmakaya of the previously born retinue as womb birth.

original: de nas de ma thag pa'i zhes pa'i sku'i mkha' 'gro ma sprul pa'i sku la sngar grub pa'i dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi 'khor dang bcas pa g-yas brkyang pas bzhugs pa /
analyzed: de nas de ma thag pa'i zhes pa'i sku'i mkha' 'gro ma sprul pa'i sku la sngar grub pa'i dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi 'khor dang bcas pa g-yas brkyang pas bzhugs pa /
translated: Then, the dakinis of the body of the immediately subsequent stage, the emanation body, are generated, together with the retinue of heroes and yoginis who were previously generated, standing on the right leg.

original: mdun dkar pa /🔽g-yon sngo ba /
analyzed: mdun dkar pa / g-yon sngo ba /
translated: The front face is white,🔽the left face is blue,

original: g-yas ser ba /
analyzed: g-yas ser ba /
translated: the right face is yellow,

original: rgyab dmar ba /
analyzed: rgyab dmar ba /
translated: and the rear face is red.

original: 'khor lo dang dril bus 'khyud pa /🔽sngar @145a * //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang dril bus 'khyud pa / sngar @145a * //
translated: They embrace the consort with a wheel and a bell.

original: gyi rdo rje sems dpa'i rim gyis phyag dang phyag mtshan 'dzin pa zhes bya ba nas dgyes pa rol pas khyab par bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: gyi rdo rje sems dpa'i rim gyis phyag dang phyag mtshan 'dzin pa zhes bya ba nas dgyes pa rol pas khyab par bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The rest is easy to understand, from the stage of Vajrasattva, holding hands and hand implements, up to pervaded by the play of passion.

original: de ltar gtso bo bskyed pa ni bsnyen pa /
analyzed: de ltar gtso bo bskyed pa ni bsnyen pa /
translated: Thus, the generation of the principal deity is the approach,

original: lus kyi dkyil 'khor sgrub pa /
analyzed: lus kyi dkyil 'khor sgrub pa /
translated: the body mandala is the accomplishment,

original: ye shes sems dpa' 'jug pa dang / go bskon pa la sogs pa sgrub pa chen po yin no zhes le'u bcu bzhi pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' 'jug pa dang / go bskon pa la sogs pa sgrub pa chen po yin no zhes le'u bcu bzhi pa las gsungs so //
translated: and the entry of the gnosis being and the consecration and so on are the great accomplishment.

original: rgyu'i he ru ka bskyed pa dang po sbyor ba /
analyzed: rgyu'i he ru ka bskyed pa dang po sbyor ba /
translated: The generation of the causal Heruka is the first yoga.

original: lha mo bskyed pa dang zhu ba dang glus bskul pa dang 'bras bu'i he ru ka bskyed pa dang / lus kyi 'khor lo dang sprul pa'i 'khor lo rnams ni dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog yin no //
analyzed: lha mo bskyed pa dang zhu ba dang glus bskul pa dang 'bras bu'i he ru ka bskyed pa dang / lus kyi 'khor lo dang sprul pa'i 'khor lo rnams ni dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog yin no //
translated: The generation of the goddess, the melting, the urging with the song, and the generation of the result Heruka, and the body wheel and emanation wheel are the king of the maṇḍalas.

original: ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang po go cha bskon pa la sogs pa ni las kyi rgyal mchog yin pas mngal skyes thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gsum de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang po go cha bskon pa la sogs pa ni las kyi rgyal mchog yin pas mngal skyes thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gsum de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: The entry of the gnosis being, the first donning of the armor, and so on, are the king of the activities.

original: lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi khams dang phung po dang skye mched rnams byin gyis brlab pa'i ming dang sku mdog dang sa bon ni bshad mi dgos so //
analyzed: lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi khams dang phung po dang skye mched rnams byin gyis brlab pa'i ming dang sku mdog dang sa bon ni bshad mi dgos so //
translated: The names, colors, and seed syllables of the consecration of the elements, aggregates, and sense bases of the body maṇḍala do not need to be explained.

original: thams cad kyang gi gug dang ka p'a la bsnams par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gi gug dang ka p'a la bsnams par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that all of them hold a skull cup and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i sa bon dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan dang gnas rnams ni rgyud las gsal la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i sa bon dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan dang gnas rnams ni rgyud las gsal la /
translated: The seed syllables, colors, implements, and locations of the aggregate of form and so on are clear in the tantra.

original: phyag mtshan nyid sngar bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag mtshan nyid sngar bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The hand implements should be understood as explained above.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug ni sa bon dang / sku mdog dang ming rgyud las gsal la phyag mtshan dang gnas ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug ni sa bon dang / sku mdog dang ming rgyud las gsal la phyag mtshan dang gnas ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The six sense powers of eyes and so forth are clear in the tantra in terms of seed, color, and name, but the hand implements and locations are as explained above.

original: sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa ni /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa ni /
translated: The consecration of awakened body, speech, and mind

original: dbus kyi gtso bo yab yum yin par rgyud las gsal lo //
analyzed: dbus kyi gtso bo yab yum yin par rgyud las gsal lo //
translated: is clear in the tantra as the principal father and mother in the center.

original: ye shes kyi lha mo bzhi dang mtshams kyi bum pa bzhi ni rgyud las gsal /
analyzed: ye shes kyi lha mo bzhi dang mtshams kyi bum pa bzhi ni rgyud las gsal /
translated: The four awareness goddesses and the four vases in the intermediate directions are clear in the tantra.

original: gri gug gi phreng bas bskor bar bya'o zhes kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: gri gug gi phreng bas bskor bar bya'o zhes kha bskang ngo //
translated: The addition is that they are surrounded by a garland of flaying knives.

original: phyi rol gyi rtsibs bas brgyad kyi 'khor lo'i ming dang / dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i ming dang / sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni rgyud las gsal /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rtsibs bas brgyad kyi 'khor lo'i ming dang / dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i ming dang / sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni rgyud las gsal /
translated: The names of the wheels in the eight outer spokes, the names of the heroes and heroines, and the colors and implements are clear in the tantra.

original: 'khor lo'i phreng bas bskor ba kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i phreng bas bskor ba kha bskang ngo //
translated: The addition is that they are surrounded by a garland of wheels.

original: dam tshig gi lha mo rnams kyi shar dang byang dang nub dang / lho sgo'i ming dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni rgyud las gsal /
analyzed: dam tshig gi lha mo rnams kyi shar dang byang dang nub dang / lho sgo'i ming dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni rgyud las gsal /
translated: The names, colors, and implements of the goddesses of the commitment beings at the eastern, northern, western, and southern gates are clear in the tantra.

original: mtshams kyi lha mo rnams kyang rgyud las gsal te /
analyzed: mtshams kyi lha mo rnams kyang rgyud las gsal te /
translated: The goddesses of the intermediate directions are also clear in the tantra.

original: rang rang gi gzugs can gyi ro'i gdan la bzhugs par kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: rang rang gi gzugs can gyi ro'i gdan la bzhugs par kha bskang ngo //
translated: They all sit on corpse seats that are the forms of their individual consorts.

original: dpa' bo dang dpa' mo 'di dag thams cad kyi dpral bar me long lta bu'i ye shes @145b byung ba'i rtag su 'khor lo'i phreng ba can no //
analyzed: dpa' bo dang dpa' mo 'di dag thams cad kyi dpral bar me long lta bu'i ye shes @145b byung ba'i rtag su 'khor lo'i phreng ba can no //
translated: All of these heroes and heroines have a garland of wheels as the sign of the arising of the mirrorlike gnosis in their foreheads.

original: dur khrod brgyad dang rdo rje ra ba dang / me 'od ni le'u bcu pa las kha bskong ngo //
analyzed: dur khrod brgyad dang rdo rje ra ba dang / me 'od ni le'u bcu pa las kha bskong ngo //
translated: The eight charnel grounds, vajra fence, and blazing fire light are supplemented from chapter 10.

original: sku'i 'khor lo'i glus bskul ba ni 'dir bshad kyang skye ba dang bsgom pa'i go rims kyi sngar bstan to //
analyzed: sku'i 'khor lo'i glus bskul ba ni 'dir bshad kyang skye ba dang bsgom pa'i go rims kyi sngar bstan to //
translated: Although the invocation with the song of the body wheel is explained here, it was taught earlier in the sequence of birth and meditation.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the supreme king of maṇḍalas,

original: las kyi rgyal mchog ni snying gar hr'i:las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa /
analyzed: las kyi rgyal mchog ni snying gar hr'i:las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa /
translated: the supreme king of activities is as follows: From hṛiḥ in one’s heart arises an eight-petaled lotus.

original: aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor h'um las 'od zer gyis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor phem phem gyi sngags dang phyag rgya dang bcas pas spyan drangs nas /
analyzed: aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor h'um las 'od zer gyis ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor phem phem gyi sngags dang phyag rgya dang bcas pas spyan drangs nas /
translated: From A appears a moon mandala, and from HŪM light rays, which invoke the gnosis mandala with the mantra and mudra of pheṃ pheṃ.

original: nam mkha' la blta ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' la blta ste /
translated: Look at the sky.

original: rkang pa brgyad kyis sprul pa'i lha mo brgyad kyis mchod la /
analyzed: rkang pa brgyad kyis sprul pa'i lha mo brgyad kyis mchod la /
translated: Make offering with the eight-line praise by the eight emanated goddesses.

original: dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i sngags kyis bstod pa byas nas /
analyzed: dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i sngags kyis bstod pa byas nas /
translated: Do the praise with the mantra of the heroes and heroines.

original: ye shes sems dpa' de nyid kyis dbang ba skur nas /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' de nyid kyis dbang ba skur nas /
translated: The empowerment of the awareness beings is conferred by those awareness beings themselves.🔽Place the heart mudra and say Oṃ yoga śuddhaḥ sarva dharmā yoga śuddho ’haṃ.

original: snying ga'i phyag rgya dang aom yo ga shuddha: sarba dharm'a yo ga shuddho& ham gis bcug la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: snying ga'i phyag rgya dang aom yo ga shuddha: sarba dharm'a yo ga shuddho& ham gis bcug la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Meditate on that.

original: phyir bshad pa'i rgyud 'di la bsgom pa bcu tham pa snang ste /
analyzed: phyir bshad pa'i rgyud 'di la bsgom pa bcu tham pa snang ste /
translated: In this explanatory tantra, there are ten meditations.🔽Here, meditate on the yoga of emanating and gathering into the billion worlds from the heart of the principal.

original: de las 'dir gtso bo'i thugs ka nas stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su spro ba dang bsdu pa'i sbyor ba bsgoms te de yang thun dang por spros nas /
analyzed: de las 'dir gtso bo'i thugs ka nas stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su spro ba dang bsdu pa'i sbyor ba bsgoms te de yang thun dang por spros nas /
translated: In the first session, emanate from the heart of the principal.

original: thun mtshams su ldang ba'i cho ga snying gar bsdus pas dngos po med par bsgom mo //
analyzed: thun mtshams su ldang ba'i cho ga snying gar bsdus pas dngos po med par bsgom mo //
translated: In the session breaks, the yogī should meditate on the dissolution of the emanation into the heart, and the absence of substantial reality.

original: spros nas lha'i 'khor lo gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: spros nas lha'i 'khor lo gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: When emanating, while abiding in the maṇḍala of deities,

original: rnal 'byor pas ma nor bar bzlas pa 'khor lo khri dang gtso bo la 'bum nyin zhag re rer bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ma nor bar bzlas pa 'khor lo khri dang gtso bo la 'bum nyin zhag re rer bzla bar bya'o //
translated: the yogī should recite the mantra without error, ten thousand times for the retinue and one hundred thousand times for the principal deity, each day.

original: bsgoms pa dang bzlas pa'i 'bras bu skye ba 'di nyid la mngon bar shes pa drug 'thob pas rdzu 'phrul gyi lus 'grub ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa dang bzlas pa'i 'bras bu skye ba 'di nyid la mngon bar shes pa drug 'thob pas rdzu 'phrul gyi lus 'grub ste /
translated: The result of meditation and recitation is the attainment of the six higher perceptions in this very life, and the accomplishment of the body of magical power.

original: mkha' spyod sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams su gnas par the tshom med do //
analyzed: mkha' spyod sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams su gnas par the tshom med do //
translated: There is no doubt that one will abide in the celestial realm of the buddhafield.

original: de la rgyud 'di las spro sdu bsgom pa dang gtso bo yab yum 'ba' zhig bsgom pa dang / 'khor dang bcas par bsgom pa dang / sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i lha bsgom pa dang sems kyi 'khor lo rnam dag bsgom pa dang / lus kyi 'khor lo rtsa dang khams kyi rang bzhin bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: de la rgyud 'di las spro sdu bsgom pa dang gtso bo yab yum 'ba' zhig bsgom pa dang / 'khor dang bcas par bsgom pa dang / sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i lha bsgom pa dang sems kyi 'khor lo rnam dag bsgom pa dang / lus kyi 'khor lo rtsa dang khams kyi rang bzhin bsgom pa dang /
translated: In this tantra, there is the meditation of emanation and dissolution, the meditation of the principal male and female alone, the meditation of the retinue, the meditation of the emanated maṇḍala deities, the meditation of the pure mind maṇḍala, the meditation of the nature of the body maṇḍala’s nāḍīs and elements,

original: yab yum gyi mkha' gsang gi gnas su yung sa kar gyi 'bru tsam gyi lha phra mo'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa dang / lha thams cad zhu ba'i thig le bsgom pa dang / phrin las rnam bzhi'i kha dog tu bsgyur nas bsgom pa dang / sems dpa' sum brtsegs kyi ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bsgoms la bskyed pa'i rim pa ni bsgom pa bcu'i yin la /🔽rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni rgyud 'di nas rtsa bsgom pa dang / rlung bsgom @146a * //
analyzed: yab yum gyi mkha' gsang gi gnas su yung sa kar gyi 'bru tsam gyi lha phra mo'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa dang / lha thams cad zhu ba'i thig le bsgom pa dang / phrin las rnam bzhi'i kha dog tu bsgyur nas bsgom pa dang / sems dpa' sum brtsegs kyi ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bsgoms la bskyed pa'i rim pa ni bsgom pa bcu'i yin la / rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni rgyud 'di nas rtsa bsgom pa dang / rlung bsgom @146a * //
translated: The ten meditations are the meditation on the subtle deity mandala the size of a mustard seed in the secret space of the father and mother, the meditation on the bindu that is the melting of all the deities, the meditation on the transformation into the color of the four activities, and the meditation on the concentration of the three nested sattvas.

original: pa dang / thig le bsgom pa dang / drod bsgom pa dang / byang chub sems bsgom pa dang / mtshan bcas bsgom pa dang lnga yin la /
analyzed: pa dang / thig le bsgom pa dang / drod bsgom pa dang / byang chub sems bsgom pa dang / mtshan bcas bsgom pa dang lnga yin la /
translated: The five meditations of the completion stage are the meditation on the channels, the meditation on the winds, the meditation on the bindus, the meditation on the warmth, the meditation on the bodhicitta, and the meditation on the signs.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs don dam pa'i bden pa sgyu ma lta bu dang / 'od gsal stong pa nyid bsgom pa dang / zung 'jug bsgom pa dang gsum ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs don dam pa'i bden pa sgyu ma lta bu dang / 'od gsal stong pa nyid bsgom pa dang / zung 'jug bsgom pa dang gsum ste /
translated: The three meditations of the accumulation of wisdom are the meditation on the illusionlike ultimate truth, the meditation on the luminosity of emptiness, and the meditation on the union.

original: srog aa wa dh'u t'ir 'jug pa'i thabs bsam gtan bsgom pa ni lnga yin la /
analyzed: srog aa wa dh'u t'ir 'jug pa'i thabs bsam gtan bsgom pa ni lnga yin la /
translated: The method of entering the life-force into the avadhūti is the meditation on the concentration, which is the fifth.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs don dam pa'i bden pa bsgom pa ni gsum yin la /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs don dam pa'i bden pa bsgom pa ni gsum yin la /
translated: The meditation on the ultimate truth, the accumulation of wisdom, is the third.

original: de ltar bskyed pa'i rim pa ni bcu yin la /
analyzed: de ltar bskyed pa'i rim pa ni bcu yin la /
translated: Thus, there are ten in the creation stage.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni brgyad yin pas spyir bsgom pa'i bye brag bco brgyad yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni brgyad yin pas spyir bsgom pa'i bye brag bco brgyad yin no //
translated: Since there are eight in the completion stage, in general, there are eighteen different meditations.

original: bzlas pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa la bzhi ste /
analyzed: bzlas pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa la bzhi ste /
translated: There are four in the creation stage for the recitation.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni gcig yin te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni gcig yin te /
translated: There is one in the completion stage.

original: spro bsdu bsgom pas bzla ba dang / yab kyi zhal nas yum gyi zhal du zhugs nas lto ba nas mgal me'i 'khor lo ltar bzla ba dang / snying gar yi ge'i 'khor lo yi ge bdun pa'am /
analyzed: spro bsdu bsgom pas bzla ba dang / yab kyi zhal nas yum gyi zhal du zhugs nas lto ba nas mgal me'i 'khor lo ltar bzla ba dang / snying gar yi ge'i 'khor lo yi ge bdun pa'am /
translated: The recitation is the meditation of emanation and gathering, the recitation through entering the mouth of the mother from the mouth of the father and exiting from the navel like the wheel of a firebrand, the recitation of the wheel of syllables at the heart, the wheel of the seven syllables,

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'am /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'am /
translated: the twenty-one syllables,

original: bcu gsum pa'am /
analyzed: bcu gsum pa'am /
translated: the thirteen syllables,

original: go cha'i sngags kyi 'khor lo rtsibs lnga pa'am /
analyzed: go cha'i sngags kyi 'khor lo rtsibs lnga pa'am /
translated: the wheel of the armor mantra, the five spokes,

original: rkang pa brgyad pa'am /
analyzed: rkang pa brgyad pa'am /
translated: the eight lines,

original: rdo rje rol pa rta'i 'gros sam /
analyzed: rdo rje rol pa rta'i 'gros sam /
translated: the horse gait of the vajra dance,

original: yi dgas srin po'i gdong ngam /
analyzed: yi dgas srin po'i gdong ngam /
translated: the face of the pretas and rakshasas,🔽and the recitation of the three seed syllables.

original: gshin rje dbyug pa 'chang ba'am /
analyzed: gshin rje dbyug pa 'chang ba'am /
translated: One should recite the mantra in the manner of Yama, the holder of a staff,

original: ma mo rigs ldan ma'i 'khor lo ltar bzla ba dang / yang na lce padma'i 'dab ma la zla ba rdo rje'i zlo ba dang bzhi yin no //
analyzed: ma mo rigs ldan ma'i 'khor lo ltar bzla ba dang / yang na lce padma'i 'dab ma la zla ba rdo rje'i zlo ba dang bzhi yin no //
translated: or in the manner of the wheel of the mother of the lineage, or else on the moon on the tongue with the recitation of the vajra.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa gcig pu yin no //🔽aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa la dbye na lte bar mig btsums gcig sdod pa'i a'a:dang snying gar mig btsums gnyis sdod pa h'um /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni srog aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa gcig pu yin no // aa wa dh'u t'ir chud pa la dbye na lte bar mig btsums gcig sdod pa'i a'a:dang snying gar mig btsums gnyis sdod pa h'um /
translated: The completion stage is the single entry of the life-force into the central channel.

original: lkog mar mig btsums gsum sdod pa aom dang / spyi bor aa na ha mi shigs pa'i rlung dang bzhi zlo ba yin no //
analyzed: lkog mar mig btsums gsum sdod pa aom dang / spyi bor aa na ha mi shigs pa'i rlung dang bzhi zlo ba yin no //
translated: The entry of the life-force into the central channel is divided into four: the entry of the life-force into the navel, where it abides as the syllable aḥ for one eye-blink; the entry of the life-force into the heart, where it abides as the syllable hūṃ for two eye-blinks; the entry of the life-force into the throat, where it abides as the syllable oṃ for three eye-blinks; and the entry of the life-force into the crown, where it abides as the indestructible wind and syllable a.

original: sh'anti pa'i zhal nas bgrang ba dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang / 'jog pa dang / rtog pa dang / bsgyur ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang drug gis bzla'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sh'anti pa'i zhal nas bgrang ba dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang / 'jog pa dang / rtog pa dang / bsgyur ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang drug gis bzla'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Santipa states that one should recite the mantra with six: counting, following, settling, investigating, transforming, and purifying.

original: mngon pa mdzod las dbyig gnyen gyis bshad kyang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud 'di la ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: mngon pa mdzod las dbyig gnyen gyis bshad kyang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud 'di la ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: Although Vasubandhu explains it in the Treasury of Abhidharma, I do not see it in this Yoginī tantra.

original: 'dir ni bzlas pa gsum du 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni bzlas pa gsum du 'gro ste /
translated: Here there are three types of recitation:

original: spro bsdu bsgom pa la ye shes kyi bzlas pa zhes ming 'dogs /
analyzed: spro bsdu bsgom pa la ye shes kyi bzlas pa zhes ming 'dogs /
translated: The meditation on emanation and reabsorption is called “the recitation of wisdom.”

original: dbugs 'byung rngub dang 'grogs na zlo ba la yid kyi bzlas pa zhes ming 'dogs /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung rngub dang 'grogs na zlo ba la yid kyi bzlas pa zhes ming 'dogs /
translated: When it is accompanied by the exhalation and inhalation of breath, it is called “the mental recitation.”

original: phreng ba bgrangs nas ngag gis zlo ba la ngag gi bzlas pa zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig bla dgas su gdags so //🔽ngag gi bzlas pa @146b de yang mnyam sbyor gyi rgyud las 'khun pa dbugs kyi rlung 'byin srin po'i ngar skad /
analyzed: phreng ba bgrangs nas ngag gis zlo ba la ngag gi bzlas pa zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig bla dgas su gdags so // ngag gi bzlas pa @146b de yang mnyam sbyor gyi rgyud las 'khun pa dbugs kyi rlung 'byin srin po'i ngar skad /
translated: When one recites with the voice while counting on a rosary, it is called “the vocal recitation.” The Bhagavān has designated these terms.🔽The vocal recitation is of three types: the recitation of the “howling breath” as taught in the Yoginī’s Activity Tantra,

original: de nyid bsdus pa las khro bo'i 'brug sgra dang / he ru ka 'byung ba las rigs bzhi'i glus zlos pa ni gsum yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bsdus pa las khro bo'i 'brug sgra dang / he ru ka 'byung ba las rigs bzhi'i glus zlos pa ni gsum yin no //
translated: the recitation of the “wrathful thunder” as taught in the Compendium of Reality Tantra, and the recitation of the “song of the four families” as taught in the Arising of Heruka Tantra.

original: 'dir bzlas pa'i snying po ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir bzlas pa'i snying po ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: Here I will not explain the essence of the recitation because it is easy to understand.

original: yum bzhi'i sngags phyis bshad kyang gtso bo yab yum bzlas pa'i rjes la yum bzhi bzlas //
analyzed: yum bzhi'i sngags phyis bshad kyang gtso bo yab yum bzlas pa'i rjes la yum bzhi bzlas //
translated: The mantra of the four mothers is explained later, but after the recitation of the principal father and mother, one recites the four mothers.

original: de nas sku'i 'khor lo yum bzhi bzlas //
analyzed: de nas sku'i 'khor lo yum bzhi bzlas //
translated: Then one recites the four mothers of the body wheel.🔽Then one recites the eight pledge door-guarding goddesses.

original: de nas dam tshig gi sgo mtshams ma brgyad bzla'o zhes bla ma'i man ngag gis gsungs so //🔽de nyid rgyud 'di las /
analyzed: de nas dam tshig gi sgo mtshams ma brgyad bzla'o zhes bla ma'i man ngag gis gsungs so // de nyid rgyud 'di las /
translated: This is stated in the guru's instructions.

original: 'di ni mkha' 'gro ma sogs te //
analyzed: 'di ni mkha' 'gro ma sogs te //
translated: This is the dakini and so on.

original: dang por padmar sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: dang por padmar sbyar bar bya //
translated: First one should apply to the lotus.

original: lnga pa'i bdag nyid rtag bzlas na //
analyzed: lnga pa'i bdag nyid rtag bzlas na //
translated: If one always recites the essence of the five,

original: dngos grub 'gyur gyi gzhan du min //
analyzed: dngos grub 'gyur gyi gzhan du min //
translated: there will be spiritual powers, not otherwise.

original: lnga'i bdag nyid las gtso bo yab yum gyi dngos grub gsum du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: lnga'i bdag nyid las gtso bo yab yum gyi dngos grub gsum du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: From the essence of the five, the spiritual powers of the principal father and mother become three, not otherwise.

original: mkha' 'gro mas zhi ba /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro mas zhi ba /
translated: The dakini is for pacification.

original: l'a mas dbang /
analyzed: l'a mas dbang /
translated: The la is for power.

original: khanda ro his rmongs pa /
analyzed: khanda ro his rmongs pa /
translated: The khandarohi is for stupefaction.

original: gzugs can mas gnon pa dag 'grub pa dang / sku'i mkha' 'gros dngos grub dam pa me long lta bu'i ye shes 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / bzlas pa'i go rims nges pa dang 'bras bu bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs can mas gnon pa dag 'grub pa dang / sku'i mkha' 'gros dngos grub dam pa me long lta bu'i ye shes 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / bzlas pa'i go rims nges pa dang 'bras bu bshad do //
translated: The order of recitation and the explanation of the result.

original: de ltar bsgom pa dang bzlas pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa dang bzlas pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the meditation and recitation,

original: bdud rtsi myang bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdud rtsi myang bar bya ste /
translated: one should partake of the elixir.

original: bum pa bzhi la thod pa bteg par bsams la /
analyzed: bum pa bzhi la thod pa bteg par bsams la /
translated: Imagine that the skull cups are lifted up in the four vases.

original: yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor bzhi /
analyzed: yam las rlung gi dkyil 'khor bzhi /
translated: From yaṃ, there are four wind mandalas.

original: ram las me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum pa bzhi /
analyzed: ram las me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum pa bzhi /
translated: From raṃ, there are four tetrahedral fire mandalas.

original: ka bzhi las thod pa rgya che ba bzhi /
analyzed: ka bzhi las thod pa rgya che ba bzhi /
translated: From ka, there are four vast skull cups.

original: de'i nang du dbus su mu las beed'u rya lta bu'i bdud rtsi'i gong bu la don yod grub pa'i sa bon h'um /
analyzed: de'i nang du dbus su mu las beed'u rya lta bu'i bdud rtsi'i gong bu la don yod grub pa'i sa bon h'um /
translated: In the center of that, from mu, there is a bindu of elixir like beryl, with the syllable hūṃ of Amoghasiddhi.

original: shar du bi las bdud rtsi shel dang ba lta bu la rnam snang gi sa bon bhr'um /
analyzed: shar du bi las bdud rtsi shel dang ba lta bu la rnam snang gi sa bon bhr'um /
translated: In the east, from vi, there is clear crystal-like elixir, with the syllable bhrūṃ of Vairocana.

original: lhor ra las gser btso ma lta bu la rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sa bon aom /
analyzed: lhor ra las gser btso ma lta bu la rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sa bon aom /
translated: In the south, from ra, there is elixir like refined gold, with the syllable oṃ of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: nub tu shu las padma r'a ga lta bu'i gong bu la snang ba mtha' yas kyi dzr'im /
analyzed: nub tu shu las padma r'a ga lta bu'i gong bu la snang ba mtha' yas kyi dzr'im /
translated: In the west, from śū arises a mass like a ruby, on which is the jriṃ of Amitābha.

original: byang du ma las margat lta bu'i gong bu la don yod grub pa'i sa bon kham bsam mo //
analyzed: byang du ma las margat lta bu'i gong bu la don yod grub pa'i sa bon kham bsam mo //
translated: In the north, from ma arises a mass like an emerald, on which is the seed syllable kham of Amoghasiddhi.🔽Above that, think of a white oṃ, above that a red āḥ,

original: de'i steng du aom/ dkar po/ de'i steng du a'a:dmar po /🔽de'i steng du h'um mthing ga bsams nas /
analyzed: de'i steng du aom/ dkar po/ de'i steng du a'a:dmar po / de'i steng du h'um mthing ga bsams nas /
translated: and above that a blue hūṃ.

original: sna bug gi rlung gis ba dan g-yo bas na me sbar te /
analyzed: sna bug gi rlung gis ba dan g-yo bas na me sbar te /
translated: The wind from the nostrils moves the banners, which causes the fire to blaze.

original: bdud rtsi'i rlangs ba aom la phog ste /🔽aom thim pa las 'dod pa'i khams kyi kha dog dang dri dang ro dag dang / a'a: lhung ba las bsam gtan dang po'i mes mi 'tshig pa'i bdud rtsi dang / gnyis pa chus mi shigs pa dang gsum pa rlung gis mi shigs @147a * //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i rlangs ba aom la phog ste / aom thim pa las 'dod pa'i khams kyi kha dog dang dri dang ro dag dang / a'a: lhung ba las bsam gtan dang po'i mes mi 'tshig pa'i bdud rtsi dang / gnyis pa chus mi shigs pa dang gsum pa rlung gis mi shigs @147a * //
translated: The steam from the elixir strikes the oṃ,🔽and the oṃ dissolves into the elixir, which becomes the colors, smells, and tastes of the desire realm.🔽The āḥ falls from the fire of the first meditative concentration, and becomes the elixir that is not burned by fire.

original: pa'i bdud rtsir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i bdud rtsir 'gyur ro //
translated: The elixir becomes the elixir that is not destroyed by water in the second meditative concentration and the elixir that is not destroyed by wind in the third meditative concentration.

original: h'um rdo rjer gyur nas ye shes kyi ro bdud rtsi'i chos nyid bkug nas thim pas zag pa med pa'i kha zas su gyur pa ni h'um gi rdo rje zhu ba las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: h'um rdo rjer gyur nas ye shes kyi ro bdud rtsi'i chos nyid bkug nas thim pas zag pa med pa'i kha zas su gyur pa ni h'um gi rdo rje zhu ba las blta bar bya'o //
translated: Having become the vajra HŪṀ, one should draw in the nectar of the wisdom-knowledge of the dead person and dissolve it, whereby it becomes the food of the uncontaminated.

original: de nas aom a'a:h'um gsum lan lnga'i bar du bzlas nas /
analyzed: de nas aom a'a:h'um gsum lan lnga'i bar du bzlas nas /
translated: Then, one should recite the three syllables OṀ, AḤ, and HŪṀ five times.

original: aom ma h'a aa mri ta hri tha zhes bya bas lha rnams kyi ljags las 'od zer gyi sbu gu byung bas 'thung bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: aom ma h'a aa mri ta hri tha zhes bya bas lha rnams kyi ljags las 'od zer gyi sbu gu byung bas 'thung bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: With the words OṀ MAHA-AMRTA HRĪṬHA, one should imagine that the nectar is drunk through a tube of light that has come from the tongues of the deities.

original: gtso bo phyogs na gnyis so //🔽yum dang mtshams rnams re re'o //
analyzed: gtso bo phyogs na gnyis so // yum dang mtshams rnams re re'o //
translated: The principal deity has two,🔽and the mother and the intermediate directions have one each.

original: bdud rtsi myangs pas tshim pa las //
analyzed: bdud rtsi myangs pas tshim pa las //
translated: By tasting the nectar, one is satisfied,

original: zag med ro yis tshim par 'gyur //
analyzed: zag med ro yis tshim par 'gyur //
translated: and one is satisfied by the uncontaminated taste.

original: thod pa bzhi bum pa las phab nas sgo bzhir gzhag ste /
analyzed: thod pa bzhi bum pa las phab nas sgo bzhir gzhag ste /
translated: Having poured the four skull-cups from the vase, one should place them at the four doors,🔽and with the words OṀ ARAL-LI HO JAH HŪṀ VAṀ HOḤ,

original: aom aa ralli ho dza: h'um bam ho:/ badzra d'a ki n'i sa ma ya stvam dri shya ho zhes bya bas sgo phye nas /
analyzed: aom aa ralli ho dza: h'um bam ho:/ badzra d'a ki n'i sa ma ya stvam dri shya ho zhes bya bas sgo phye nas /
translated: and BAJRA-ḌĀKINĪ SAMAYA STVAM DRIŚYA HO, one should open the doors.

original: dur khrod brgyad kyi phyogs skyong bkug la /
analyzed: dur khrod brgyad kyi phyogs skyong bkug la /
translated: Having summoned the guardians of the directions of the eight charnel grounds,

original: le'u dgu pa nas 'byung ba'i gtor ma'i sngags kyis bsngos pas 'byung bar bsam mo //
analyzed: le'u dgu pa nas 'byung ba'i gtor ma'i sngags kyis bsngos pas 'byung bar bsam mo //
translated: Imagine that they are offered by the torma mantra that appears in chapter 9.🔽

original: de nas rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags brjod nas lha re re la lha mo brgyad brgyad sprul nas mchod pa dang / dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i sngags kyis stong gsum gyi stong chen por spros pa nas lha dbyangs kyi yan lag rgya mtsho'i zhal nas brjod nas 'khor la bstod pa dang /
analyzed: de nas rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags brjod nas lha re re la lha mo brgyad brgyad sprul nas mchod pa dang / dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i sngags kyis stong gsum gyi stong chen por spros pa nas lha dbyangs kyi yan lag rgya mtsho'i zhal nas brjod nas 'khor la bstod pa dang /
translated: Then, having recited the eight-line prayer, one should imagine that each deity emanates eight goddesses who make offerings, and that the heroes and heroines recite the praises from the ocean of melodies of the gods.

original: 'khor gyis gtso bo la bstod par bsam mo //
analyzed: 'khor gyis gtso bo la bstod par bsam mo //
translated: Then one should imagine that the retinue praises the principal deity.

original: dkyil 'khor byed pa'i tshe ni mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod do //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor byed pa'i tshe ni mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas bstod do //
translated: When one is performing the mandala rite, one should praise with the one hundred and eight names.

original: langs pa'i dus su bsrung ba gsum bya ste /
analyzed: langs pa'i dus su bsrung ba gsum bya ste /
translated: At the time of rising, one should perform the three protections.

original: go cha drug gis bsrung ba dang / le'u nyi shu pa nas 'byung pa'i tsham ngam gyi sngags kyis bsrung ba dang / phyir bzlog pa chen mo'i zhag ces le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa nas bshad pa bzhin du srung ba gsum las 'dir dpa' bo'i go cha drug dang /
analyzed: go cha drug gis bsrung ba dang / le'u nyi shu pa nas 'byung pa'i tsham ngam gyi sngags kyis bsrung ba dang / phyir bzlog pa chen mo'i zhag ces le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa nas bshad pa bzhin du srung ba gsum las 'dir dpa' bo'i go cha drug dang /
translated: The protection by the six armors, the protection by the mantra of the threatening gesture that occurs in chapter 20, and the protection by the “great reversal” that is explained in chapter 26 are the three protections.

original: dpa' mo'i cho cha drug gis srung ba ni rgyud nas go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: dpa' mo'i cho cha drug gis srung ba ni rgyud nas go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: Here, the protection by the six armors of the heroes and the six armors of the heroines is not explained in the tantra because it is easy to understand.

original: dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma sku'i mkha' 'gro la gnas so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma sku'i mkha' 'gro la gnas so zhes pa ni /
translated: “ The heroes and yoginīs are located in the space of the body of the ḍākinīs” means

original: go cha bgos nas sprul pa'i dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad lus kyi dkyil 'khor la bsdu'o //
analyzed: go cha bgos nas sprul pa'i dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad lus kyi dkyil 'khor la bsdu'o //
translated: that after donning the armor, all the emanated heroes and yoginīs are gathered into the body maṇḍala.

original: rang gi lha yi sbyor ba yis /
analyzed: rang gi lha yi sbyor ba yis /
translated: “ By the yoga of one’s deity,

original: thams cad 'di yis rnam par brtag / ces pa ni bsdus pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: thams cad 'di yis rnam par brtag / ces pa ni bsdus pa'i rjes la /
translated: all are imagined by this” means that after the gathering,

original: stong gsum gzhal yas khang du bsams nas 'gro ba rigs drug dang 'dra ba'i lha'i skur brtag go //
analyzed: stong gsum gzhal yas khang du bsams nas 'gro ba rigs drug dang 'dra ba'i lha'i skur brtag go //
translated: the billion worlds are imagined as the immeasurable palace, and the six types of migrating beings are imagined as the bodies of the deities.

original: 'chi med ye shes lnga bza' zhing //
analyzed: 'chi med ye shes lnga bza' zhing //
translated: One should eat the five immortal intuitions.

original: zhes pa ni lha la bdud rtsi dbul ba dang mthun par thun mtshams su kha zas rnams ye shes lnga'i @147b bdud rtsir bskyed la bza' zhing thun mtshams su spyod lam rnam bzhi ji ltar bde bar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha la bdud rtsi dbul ba dang mthun par thun mtshams su kha zas rnams ye shes lnga'i @147b bdud rtsir bskyed la bza' zhing thun mtshams su spyod lam rnam bzhi ji ltar bde bar gnas par bya'o //
translated: This is in accord with the offering of nectar to the deities; in the intervals between sessions, one should generate the foods as the five nectars of the intuitions, and eat them. In the intervals between sessions, one should maintain the four kinds of daily activities in whatever way is comfortable.

original: dam tshig rdo rje'i mchod pa dag / ces pa ni thun mtshams bzhi ru ldang ba'i tshe 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs par byin gyis brlabs nas rang gzhan la 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas mchod pa dus bzhir bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig rdo rje'i mchod pa dag / ces pa ni thun mtshams bzhi ru ldang ba'i tshe 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs par byin gyis brlabs nas rang gzhan la 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas mchod pa dus bzhir bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The pledge-vajra offerings are the five sense objects, which one should offer to oneself and others in the four intervals, by consecrating them as the five goddesses such as Rūpavajrā.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud bla ma 'dir thun mtshams kyi cho ga ni bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud bla ma 'dir thun mtshams kyi cho ga ni bcu gnyis te /
translated: In this Root Tantra of the Supreme Original Buddha, there are twelve rites for the intervals between sessions.

original: ye shes sems dpa' gshegs pa'i tshe smon lam gdab pa dang / dkyil 'khor bsdus nas 'gro ba'i tshe khams gsum lha'i 'khor lor bsgom pa dang / bdag dang gzhan la 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas mchod pa dang / 'dug pa'i tshe kha zas bdud rtsir byin gyis brlabs nas nang gi sbyin sreg bya ba dang /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' gshegs pa'i tshe smon lam gdab pa dang / dkyil 'khor bsdus nas 'gro ba'i tshe khams gsum lha'i 'khor lor bsgom pa dang / bdag dang gzhan la 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas mchod pa dang / 'dug pa'i tshe kha zas bdud rtsir byin gyis brlabs nas nang gi sbyin sreg bya ba dang /
translated: When the gnosis being departs, one should make aspirations; when one leaves the mandala, one should meditate on the wheel of the deities of the three realms; one should make offerings to oneself and others with the five sense desirables; when one sits, one should perform the inner burnt offering by blessing the food as amṛta;

original: rnam par rtog pa shas che na rdo rje rnam 'joms la sogs pa'i khrus chog bya ba dang / dam tshig nyams na sngags bzlas pas kha bskang ba dang / dbang bskur ba le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa bzhin du bya ba dang / phrin las rnam bzhi'i 'khor los sems can gyi don bya ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa shas che na rdo rje rnam 'joms la sogs pa'i khrus chog bya ba dang / dam tshig nyams na sngags bzlas pas kha bskang ba dang / dbang bskur ba le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa bzhin du bya ba dang / phrin las rnam bzhi'i 'khor los sems can gyi don bya ba dang /
translated: when one has many discursive thoughts, one should perform the cleansing rite of Vajra Viṣkambhin; when one’s commitments decline, one should restore them by reciting the mantra; one should confer empowerment as in chapter 26; one should benefit sentient beings with the wheel of the four activities;

original: tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor pho mo bsngags nas mngon bar shes pa bskyed pa dang / bar chad kyi bgegs kyi bdud bzhi las rgyal ba'i phyir srung ba'i 'khor lo bya ba dang / chos spyod bcus sems can gyi don bya ba dang / theg pa gsum gyi gang zag dang mthun pa'i phyir rgyun bshags bdun bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor pho mo bsngags nas mngon bar shes pa bskyed pa dang / bar chad kyi bgegs kyi bdud bzhi las rgyal ba'i phyir srung ba'i 'khor lo bya ba dang / chos spyod bcus sems can gyi don bya ba dang / theg pa gsum gyi gang zag dang mthun pa'i phyir rgyun bshags bdun bya'o //
translated: Having praised the male and female yogis of the gaṇacakra, one should generate clairvoyance, and in order to be victorious over the four māras of obstructing spirits, one should perform the protection wheel, and in order to benefit sentient beings with the ten dharma activities, one should perform the seven daily confessions in accordance with the persons of the three vehicles.

original: le'u bzhi pa 'dir ni phyogs gcig tsam mtshon pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa 'dir ni phyogs gcig tsam mtshon pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: In this chapter, only one part is illustrated.

original: de'i don 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is explained in the following.

original: sgrub pa nyams su len pa bsgom na thog mar mal nas langs la tho rangs ka'i thun mtshams la tshad med pa'i rnal 'byor dang / byin gyis brlab pa'i rnal 'byor dang / srung ba'i rnal 'byor dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rnal 'byor dang /
analyzed: sgrub pa nyams su len pa bsgom na thog mar mal nas langs la tho rangs ka'i thun mtshams la tshad med pa'i rnal 'byor dang / byin gyis brlab pa'i rnal 'byor dang / srung ba'i rnal 'byor dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rnal 'byor dang /
translated: If one practices the meditation of the practitioner, first, having risen from bed, at the end of the session of dawn, there are five yogas: the yoga of the immeasurables, the yoga of the consecration, the yoga of protection, the yoga of accumulating the merit accumulation,

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor dang lnga /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor dang lnga /
translated: and the yoga of emptiness.

original: dngos gzhi rten gyi dang po sbyor ba ni ri rab sna tshogs rdo rje gzhal yas khang dang bdun /
analyzed: dngos gzhi rten gyi dang po sbyor ba ni ri rab sna tshogs rdo rje gzhal yas khang dang bdun /
translated: The main subject matter is the first of the two bases, the preparation, which is the sevenfold service of the celestial mansion of the vajra cross and Mount Meru.🔽The first of the two bases, the deity, is the five manifest awakenings, which are the generation by the causal Heruka, the entry into the mouths of the buddhas and consorts of the ten directions, and the abiding in the space and the secret place.

original: brten pa lha'i dang po sbyor ba mngon par byang chub pa lngas rgyu'i he ru kas bskyed pa phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas yab yum gyi zhal du zhugs nas mkha' gsang du gnas pa ste gnyis dang 'khor mngal nas bskyed pa dang / rgyu'i he ru ka bzhu ba dang /🔽lha mo rnams kyi glus bskul ba dang / 'bras bu'i @148a * //
analyzed: brten pa lha'i dang po sbyor ba mngon par byang chub pa lngas rgyu'i he ru kas bskyed pa phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas yab yum gyi zhal du zhugs nas mkha' gsang du gnas pa ste gnyis dang 'khor mngal nas bskyed pa dang / rgyu'i he ru ka bzhu ba dang / lha mo rnams kyi glus bskul ba dang / 'bras bu'i @148a * //
translated: The second is the generation of the retinue from the womb, the melting of the causal Heruka,

original: he ru ka bskyed pa dang / 'khor gyi mtshan nyid dang / lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang drug go //
analyzed: he ru ka bskyed pa dang / 'khor gyi mtshan nyid dang / lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang drug go //
translated: the urging by the songs of the goddesses, the generation of the resultant Heruka, the characteristics of the retinue, and the body mandala.

original: las rgyal mchog ni ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang / go cha bskon pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / bsgom pa dang / bzlas pa dang / bdud rtsi myang ba dang / mchod pa dang / bstod pa ste brgyad dang / 'jig rten pa la gtor ma byin nas /
analyzed: las rgyal mchog ni ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang / go cha bskon pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / bsgom pa dang / bzlas pa dang / bdud rtsi myang ba dang / mchod pa dang / bstod pa ste brgyad dang / 'jig rten pa la gtor ma byin nas /
translated: The supreme royal action is the eight: the entry of the wisdom-being, the donning of the armor, the conferral of initiation, the meditation, the recitation, the tasting of nectar, the offering, and the praise.

original: yi ge brgya pas lhag pa dang ma tshang ba bskang /
analyzed: yi ge brgya pas lhag pa dang ma tshang ba bskang /
translated: Having given the sacrificial cake to the worldly [deities], one should fill in the excess and deficiencies with the hundred-syllable [mantra].

original: bzod pa gsol nas dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo /
analyzed: bzod pa gsol nas dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo /
translated: Having requested forbearance, one should dedicate the roots of virtue.

original: dkyil 'khor lus la bsdu /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor lus la bsdu /
translated: One should gather the mandala into the body.

original: thun mtshams kyi lha bsgom pa dang / tsham dam gyi sngags kyis bsrung /🔽rkang ba brgyad pas mchod /
analyzed: thun mtshams kyi lha bsgom pa dang / tsham dam gyi sngags kyis bsrung / rkang ba brgyad pas mchod /
translated: One should meditate on the deity of the session break and guard with the mantra of the mudra.

original: smon lam gdab po //
analyzed: smon lam gdab po //
translated: One should make offerings with the eight-line [praise].🔽One should make aspirations.

original: de ltar sngon 'gro lnga dang / dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gsum dang / rjes kyi cho ga brgyad dang / ldang ba'i cho ga bcu gnyis te gang zag gcig lha'i 'khor lo bsgoms la zhib mo rnam par 'thag pa'i dbang du byas nas don bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sngon 'gro lnga dang / dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gsum dang / rjes kyi cho ga brgyad dang / ldang ba'i cho ga bcu gnyis te gang zag gcig lha'i 'khor lo bsgoms la zhib mo rnam par 'thag pa'i dbang du byas nas don bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad yin no //
translated: Thus, there are the five preliminaries, the twenty-three kinds of meditative concentration which are the main part, the eight concluding rites, and the twelve rites of rising, so that, in the case of a single person meditating on the wheel of the deity, there are forty-eight topics according to the Vaipulya.

original: de ltar le'u bzhi pa nas drug cu rtsa brgyad kyi bar du don zhib mos 'di ltar bsgom bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar le'u bzhi pa nas drug cu rtsa brgyad kyi bar du don zhib mos 'di ltar bsgom bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should meditate in this way with detailed topics from the fourth chapter up to the sixty-eighth.

original: le'u bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the fourth chapter.

original: // / sku la mos pa de bsgom pa'i thabs bshad nas gsung la mos pa'i don du de nas zhes bya ba de ma thag pa ston te /
analyzed: // / sku la mos pa de bsgom pa'i thabs bshad nas gsung la mos pa'i don du de nas zhes bya ba de ma thag pa ston te /
translated: Having explained the method of meditating on the devotion to the body, in order to explain the devotion to speech, the next is taught, beginning with “then”.

original: gzhan yang bshad bya ba zhes bya ba ni gsung gi 'khor lo brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bshad bya ba zhes bya ba ni gsung gi 'khor lo brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Also to be explained” means that the wheel of speech should be expressed.

original: 'dir yang gsung bsgom pa'i rten gyi gang zag de'i gnas dang / de bsgrub pa'i yan lag tshogs nas tshad med pa dang byin gyis brlab pa dang / tshogs bsags pa stong pa nyid dang / srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / 'byung ba bzhi ri rab sna tshogs rdo rje gzhal yas khang dang bcas pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: 'dir yang gsung bsgom pa'i rten gyi gang zag de'i gnas dang / de bsgrub pa'i yan lag tshogs nas tshad med pa dang byin gyis brlab pa dang / tshogs bsags pa stong pa nyid dang / srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / 'byung ba bzhi ri rab sna tshogs rdo rje gzhal yas khang dang bcas pa bskyed nas /
translated: Here also, the person who is the basis of meditation on speech is in a place, and having gathered the limbs of practice, the immeasurables, consecration, accumulation of the collection, emptiness, protection wheel, the four elements, Mount Meru, and the vajra cross with the celestial mansion,

original: de'i rjes la gsung gi dkyil 'khor rnams bsgom ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la gsung gi dkyil 'khor rnams bsgom ste /
translated: after that, one meditates on the maṇḍala of speech.

original: sngar gyi dkyil 'khor dus dag tu //
analyzed: sngar gyi dkyil 'khor dus dag tu //
translated: As before, in the maṇḍala of the body,

original: zhes pa ni sngar sku'i dkyil 'khor dag bshad pa dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar sku'i dkyil 'khor dag bshad pa dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: the maṇḍala of speech is similar to the previous explanation.

original: gsung gi 'khor lo'i dbus su ye shes 'khor lo sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad gri gug gis bskor ba de'i phyi rol du 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad dmar po'i mdog can la padma'i phreng bas bskor ba de'i nang sna tshogs padma'i lte bar snga ma bzhin du mngon
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor lo'i dbus su ye shes 'khor lo sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad gri gug gis bskor ba de'i phyi rol du 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad dmar po'i mdog can la padma'i phreng bas bskor ba de'i nang sna tshogs padma'i lte bar snga ma bzhin du mngon
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala of speech, there is a multicolored eight-petaled lotus with a flaying knife. Outside of that, there is a red eight-spoked wheel surrounded by a garland of lotuses. In the center of the multicolored lotus, as before, there is a multicolored eight-petaled lotus with a flaying knife.

original: par byang chub pa lnga'i rim pas rgyu'i rdo rje sems dpa' zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa yab yum bskyed la /
analyzed: par byang chub pa lnga'i rim pas rgyu'i rdo rje sems dpa' zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa yab yum bskyed la /
translated: The meaning of “as before” is that one generates the causal Vajrasattva with four faces and twelve arms, together with the consort, by means of the five awakenings.

original: de la phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhal nas @148b zhugs nas mkha' gsang du 'khor nyi shu rtsa brgyad bskyed nas /
analyzed: de la phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhal nas @148b zhugs nas mkha' gsang du 'khor nyi shu rtsa brgyad bskyed nas /
translated: Then, the buddhas of the ten directions enter through the mouth of the causal Vajrasattva couple and are generated in the space and the secret place as the retinue of twenty-eight.

original: phyir byung nas dkyil 'khor gyi gnas su gzhag pa ni snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: phyir byung nas dkyil 'khor gyi gnas su gzhag pa ni snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: Then, they emerge and are placed in the places of the mandala, as before.

original: de nas rgyu'i he ru ka yab yum zhu ba dang / ye shes dang gsung dang dam tshig gi 'khor los glus bskul ba ni /
analyzed: de nas rgyu'i he ru ka yab yum zhu ba dang / ye shes dang gsung dang dam tshig gi 'khor los glus bskul ba ni /
translated: Then, the causal Heruka couple melts, and the gnosis, speech, and pledge wheels urge them with song.

original: lha mos glu 'di blangs pa yis //
analyzed: lha mos glu 'di blangs pa yis //
translated: The goddess sang this song:

original: sems can dge la mngon brtson pa //
analyzed: sems can dge la mngon brtson pa //
translated: Sentient beings who strive for virtue

original: brtson 'grus pha rol phyin brten nas //
analyzed: brtson 'grus pha rol phyin brten nas //
translated: rely on the perfection of diligence

original: chos rnams kun gyis bskul bar bya //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyis bskul bar bya //
translated: and are urged by all Dharmas.

original: zhes bya ba 'og nas gsungs pa'i glus 'dir bskul nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'og nas gsungs pa'i glus 'dir bskul nas /
translated: Urged here by the song that is stated below,

original: thig le mngon bar byang chub pa lnga'i rim pas yongs su gyur pa las gsung gi mkha' 'gro rnam par bsgom pa ni zhal bzhi phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: thig le mngon bar byang chub pa lnga'i rim pas yongs su gyur pa las gsung gi mkha' 'gro rnam par bsgom pa ni zhal bzhi phyag gnyis pa /
translated: The transformation of the five manifest awakenings of the bindu is meditating on the four-faced, two-armed dakini of speech.

original: padma'i mkha' 'gro zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma /
analyzed: padma'i mkha' 'gro zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma /
translated: The lotus dakini has one face and two arms.

original: padmas mtshan pa'i gri gug dang thod pa bsnams pa la yab kyi phyag dang po padma dang dril bu bsnams pas 'khyud pa /
analyzed: padmas mtshan pa'i gri gug dang thod pa bsnams pa la yab kyi phyag dang po padma dang dril bu bsnams pas 'khyud pa /
translated: She holds a flaying knife marked with a lotus and a skull cup, while the first right hand of the father holds a lotus and a bell, embracing the mother.

original: dbang phyug chen po'i bags pa bshus pa phyag gnyis kyis brkyang nas 'dzin pa /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i bags pa bshus pa phyag gnyis kyis brkyang nas 'dzin pa /
translated: The two hands of the father extend to hold the flayed skin of Mahesvara.

original: gsum pa gnyis na cang te'u dang kha tv'am ga bzhi pa gnyis na gri gug dang ka p'a la /
analyzed: gsum pa gnyis na cang te'u dang kha tv'am ga bzhi pa gnyis na gri gug dang ka p'a la /
translated: The third pair hold a chakram and khaṭvāṅga, the fourth pair hold a flaying knife and skull cup,

original: lnga pa gnyis na dgra sta dang zhags pa /
analyzed: lnga pa gnyis na dgra sta dang zhags pa /
translated: the fifth pair hold an axe and lasso,🔽and the sixth pair hold a spear and the head of Mahesvara.

original: drug pa gnyis na mdung dang dbang phyug chen po'i mgo bo bsnams pa ni snga ma'i rim pa bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: drug pa gnyis na mdung dang dbang phyug chen po'i mgo bo bsnams pa ni snga ma'i rim pa bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning is that they are in the same order as before.

original: dbang phyug chen po'i 'khor rnams ni ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang / gsung gi 'khor lo dang dam tshig gi 'khor lo rnams kyis mnan la /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i 'khor rnams ni ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang / gsung gi 'khor lo dang dam tshig gi 'khor lo rnams kyis mnan la /
translated: The retinue of Maheśvara is trodden on by the wheel of pristine consciousness, the wheel of speech, and the wheel of commitment.

original: dbang phyug chen po'i khyo shug ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs kyis mnan par lta'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i khyo shug ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs kyis mnan par lta'o //
translated: The husband and wife of Maheśvara are trodden on by the feet of the Bhagavat.

original: zhal dbus ma dmar ba /🔽g-yas sngo ba /
analyzed: zhal dbus ma dmar ba / g-yas sngo ba /
translated: The central face is red.🔽The right face is blue.

original: rgyab ser ba /
analyzed: rgyab ser ba /
translated: The back face is yellow.

original: g-yon dkar ba spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: g-yon dkar ba spyan gsum pa /
translated: The left face is white, with three eyes.

original: ral ba gyen la brdzes pa la rus pa'i cod pan sangs rgyas lngas brgyan pa /
analyzed: ral ba gyen la brdzes pa la rus pa'i cod pan sangs rgyas lngas brgyan pa /
translated: The hair is bound upward, adorned with a crown of bone and the five buddhas.

original: de la zhal bzhi pa ni ye shes bzhi'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhal bzhi pa ni ye shes bzhi'i snang ba'o //
translated: The four faces are the appearance of the four pristine consciousnesses.

original: spyan gsum ni rnam thar sgo gsum mo //
analyzed: spyan gsum ni rnam thar sgo gsum mo //
translated: The three eyes are the three gates of liberation.

original: thod pa'i phreng ba'i cod pan ni ye shes lnga'o //
analyzed: thod pa'i phreng ba'i cod pan ni ye shes lnga'o //
translated: The crown of a garland of skulls is the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: cod pan la padma'i phreng bas bcings ba ni gsung gi rigs kyi dbang rtags so //
analyzed: cod pan la padma'i phreng bas bcings ba ni gsung gi rigs kyi dbang rtags so //
translated: The crown bound by a garland of lotuses is the sign of empowerment of the family of awakened speech.

original: mche ba gtsigs pa ni bdud bzhi 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs pa ni bdud bzhi 'joms pa'o //
translated: The bared fangs are the four māras conquered.

original: zhal rnam par 'gyur ba ni sems can la thugs rje skyes ba'o //
analyzed: zhal rnam par 'gyur ba ni sems can la thugs rje skyes ba'o //
translated: The contorted face is compassion arising for sentient beings.

original: sgeg pa yab yum 'khyud pa dang / dpa' ba lta chen zhabs kyis mnan pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba ni zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa ni sku la tshor ba bde sdug btang snyoms nus pa'i rtags so //🔽zhal g-yas pa @149a * //
analyzed: sgeg pa yab yum 'khyud pa dang / dpa' ba lta chen zhabs kyis mnan pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba ni zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa ni sku la tshor ba bde sdug btang snyoms nus pa'i rtags so // zhal g-yas pa @149a * //
translated: The embrace of the male and female deities is the grace; the great gaze of the feet is the heroism; and the four faces and twelve arms of the terrifying one are the signs of the ability of the body to experience pleasure, pain, and equanimity.

original: bzhad pa dang / rgyab mi sdug pa mche ba gtsigs pa dang / g-yon pa rngam pas lha chen po'i mgo bo zhal du stobs pa ni /
analyzed: bzhad pa dang / rgyab mi sdug pa mche ba gtsigs pa dang / g-yon pa rngam pas lha chen po'i mgo bo zhal du stobs pa ni /
translated: The right face is smiling, the back face is ugly with bared fangs, and the left face is wrathful, devouring the head of the great god,

original: gsung la chor ba 'de sdug gsum nub pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: gsung la chor ba 'de sdug gsum nub pa'i rtags so //
translated: which are the signs of the ability of speech to experience pleasure, pain, and equanimity.

original: yum la 'khyud pa'i phyag dang po gnyis snying rje'i nyams dang / thal ba'i rdul gyis byugs pas zhi ba dang / klu'i rgyal po seng shas mi mgo lnga brgyus pas ngo mtshar ba'i nyams te /
analyzed: yum la 'khyud pa'i phyag dang po gnyis snying rje'i nyams dang / thal ba'i rdul gyis byugs pas zhi ba dang / klu'i rgyal po seng shas mi mgo lnga brgyus pas ngo mtshar ba'i nyams te /
translated: The first two hands embracing the mother have the experience of compassion, and the application of the dust of ashes is the pacification, and the five hundred human heads of the naga king Takshaka are the experience of wonder.

original: de ltar sgeg pa la sogs pa'i nyams dgu dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas stag gi pags pa mnabs pa dang / mi mgo rlon pa'i phreng ba 'phyang bas 'du byed lnga bcu rtsa gcig dag pa dang / phyag rgya drug pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rgyas btab pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar sgeg pa la sogs pa'i nyams dgu dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas stag gi pags pa mnabs pa dang / mi mgo rlon pa'i phreng ba 'phyang bas 'du byed lnga bcu rtsa gcig dag pa dang / phyag rgya drug pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rgyas btab pa dang /
translated: In this way, the nine expressions of dance such as the flirtatious and so forth, the wearing of a tiger skin because of the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, the purity of the fifty-one mental formations by the hanging garland of fresh human heads, the sealing with the six perfections by the six mudras,🔽the abandonment of the eight worldly concerns by the self-appearing goddess who is naked, the liberation from the karma of the afflictions by the loose hair, the abandonment of the afflictions by dividing them into one and many by the pieces of bone, the destruction of the demon of death by holding a skull cup filled with the blood of Mara in the left hand,

original: rang snang ba'i lha mo gcer bu 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad spangs pa dang nyon mongs pas las grol bas skra grol ba dang / nyon mongs pa gcig dang du mar phye nas spangs pas dum bu'i skye rags can dang / bdud kyi khrag dang ldan pa'i thod pa phyag g-yon pas gzung bas 'chi bdag gi bdud 'joms pa dang /
analyzed: rang snang ba'i lha mo gcer bu 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad spangs pa dang nyon mongs pas las grol bas skra grol ba dang / nyon mongs pa gcig dang du mar phye nas spangs pas dum bu'i skye rags can dang / bdud kyi khrag dang ldan pa'i thod pa phyag g-yon pas gzung bas 'chi bdag gi bdud 'joms pa dang /
translated: and the destruction of the demon of the aggregates by the right hand holding a flaying knife.

original: padmas mtshan pa'i gri gug gis nyon mongs pa'i bdud 'joms pa dang / gzi brjid 'bar bas sprul pa'i 'khor lo 'gyed pa dang / zhal nas khrag lta bu'i 'od zer dmar po 'dzag pas rgyud sde bzhi ston pa dang / byin pa gnyis kyis 'khyud pas stong pa nyid dang ye shes tha mi dad par ston pa dang dngos grub thams cad gsol ba ni gtso bo yab yum bskyed pa ni bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: padmas mtshan pa'i gri gug gis nyon mongs pa'i bdud 'joms pa dang / gzi brjid 'bar bas sprul pa'i 'khor lo 'gyed pa dang / zhal nas khrag lta bu'i 'od zer dmar po 'dzag pas rgyud sde bzhi ston pa dang / byin pa gnyis kyis 'khyud pas stong pa nyid dang ye shes tha mi dad par ston pa dang dngos grub thams cad gsol ba ni gtso bo yab yum bskyed pa ni bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The sword marked with a lotus destroys the demon of afflictions, the blazing splendor radiates emanated wheels, the red light rays like blood dripping from the mouth teach the four classes of tantra, and the embrace with the two legs teaches the non-difference of emptiness and pristine consciousness.

original: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i padma'i kha dog la khyad par med kyang shar gyi mkha' 'gro ma dkar /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i padma'i kha dog la khyad par med kyang shar gyi mkha' 'gro ma dkar /
translated: The colors of the lotus of the dakinis and so on are not different, but the dakini of the east is white,

original: nub kyi dum skyes ma nag / lha mo gnyis ni sngar bshad pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs dang mthun /
analyzed: nub kyi dum skyes ma nag / lha mo gnyis ni sngar bshad pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs dang mthun /
translated: the dakini of the west is black, and the two goddesses are similar to the previously explained colors and shapes.

original: g-yon gyi kha tv'am ga ni bsam gtan /
analyzed: g-yon gyi kha tv'am ga ni bsam gtan /
translated: The khaṭvāṅga in the left hand is meditative concentration.

original: thod pa ni snying rje /
analyzed: thod pa ni snying rje /
translated: The skull cup is compassion.

original: g-yas pa'i cang te'u ni lhag mthong /
analyzed: g-yas pa'i cang te'u ni lhag mthong /
translated: The ḍamaru in the right hand is vipaśyanā.

original: gri gug ni ye shes /
analyzed: gri gug ni ye shes /
translated: The flaying knife is pristine consciousness.

original: mtshams bzhi'i bum pa ni rnam snang dang rin 'byung dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang don yod grub pa dang bzhi nang na bzhugs pa'i phyi rol bum par snang ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams bzhi'i bum pa ni rnam snang dang rin 'byung dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang don yod grub pa dang bzhi nang na bzhugs pa'i phyi rol bum par snang ba'o //
translated: The vases in the four directions are Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi, appearing externally as vases with the four inside.

original: bum pa'i steng gi thod pa'i bdud rtsi ni 'chi bdag gi bdud 'joms so //
analyzed: bum pa'i steng gi thod pa'i bdud rtsi ni 'chi bdag gi bdud 'joms so //
translated: The nectar in the skull-cup above the vase conquers the demon of death.

original: padmas mtshan pa'i gri gug gi phreng bas bskor bas kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: padmas mtshan pa'i gri gug gi phreng bas bskor bas kha bskang ngo //
translated: The garland of flaying knives marked with lotuses fills in the gaps.

original: 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa k'a ma ru pa la sog sa'i sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba la zhing gi ming btags @149b myu gu can dang sa srung ma la sogs ma gnod sbyin dang srin po btul bas gdul bya'i ming gis btags /
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa k'a ma ru pa la sog sa'i sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba la zhing gi ming btags @149b myu gu can dang sa srung ma la sogs ma gnod sbyin dang srin po btul bas gdul bya'i ming gis btags /
translated: The eight-spoked wheel is surrounded by a garland of flaying knives marked with lotuses. The names of the fields in the appearances of the earth and the perfections are given the names of the disciples, such as Aṅgulimāla and Bhūmigarbha, because they subdued yakṣas and rākṣasas.

original: thams cad kha dog dmar por mi snang ba ni sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i dbang gis gdul bya'i nye ba la dgongs so //
analyzed: thams cad kha dog dmar por mi snang ba ni sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i dbang gis gdul bya'i nye ba la dgongs so //
translated: The reason that they do not all appear red is that it is intended for the disciples who are close to the Buddha.

original: gsung gi 'khor lo ni 'dul byed snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs so //
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor lo ni 'dul byed snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs so //
translated: The wheel of enlightened speech is the family of Amitābha, the one to be tamed.

original: sa spyod ni gnod sbyin dang srin po 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: sa spyod ni gnod sbyin dang srin po 'dul ba'o //
translated: The earth-walker is the subduer of yakshas and rakshasas.

original: dpa' bo rnams phyag bzhi ni tshad med pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo rnams phyag bzhi ni tshad med pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four arms of the heroes are the four immeasurables.

original: spyan gsum ni rnam thar sgo gsum mo //
analyzed: spyan gsum ni rnam thar sgo gsum mo //
translated: The three eyes are the three gates of liberation.

original: ral ba gyen du brdzes pa ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo 'gyed pa'i //
analyzed: ral ba gyen du brdzes pa ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo 'gyed pa'i //
translated: The hair standing on end is the sending forth of the emanation wheel.

original: cod pan lnga ni ye shes lnga'o //
analyzed: cod pan lnga ni ye shes lnga'o //
translated: The five crests are the five intuitions.

original: dar dbyangs ni snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten du grags pa'o //
analyzed: dar dbyangs ni snyan pa'i ba dan 'jig rten du grags pa'o //
translated: The streamers are the banners of fame in the world.

original: phyag dang po padma dang dril bus 'khyud pa ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: phyag dang po padma dang dril bus 'khyud pa ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The embrace with the lotus and bell in the first pair of hands is the nonduality of means and insight.

original: kha tv'am ga dang cang te'u ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong /
analyzed: kha tv'am ga dang cang te'u ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong /
translated: The khaṭvāṅga and the ḍamaru are meditative concentration and insight.

original: phyag rgya lnga ni pha rol du phyin pa lnga /
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga ni pha rol du phyin pa lnga /
translated: The five symbolic ornaments are the five perfections.

original: g-yas brkyang pa'i gnas pas bzhugs pa ni shes rab kyis srid pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: g-yas brkyang pa'i gnas pas bzhugs pa ni shes rab kyis srid pa la mi gnas /
translated: The standing posture with the right leg extended is not abiding in existence by means of insight,

original: snying rjes zhi ba la mi gnas pa /
analyzed: snying rjes zhi ba la mi gnas pa /
translated: and not abiding in peace by means of compassion.

original: lha mo brgyad kyi thod pas 'khyud pa ni 'chi bdag gi bdud 'joms so //
analyzed: lha mo brgyad kyi thod pas 'khyud pa ni 'chi bdag gi bdud 'joms so //
translated: The embrace by the eight goddesses is the conquest of the demon of death.

original: g-yas pa'i padma dang sdigs mdzub ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud 'joms /
analyzed: g-yas pa'i padma dang sdigs mdzub ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud 'joms /
translated: The right lotus and threatening forefinger conquer the demon of afflictions.

original: mgul rgyan la sogs pa'i rul pa'i rgyan lnga ni phung po'i bdud 'joms /
analyzed: mgul rgyan la sogs pa'i rul pa'i rgyan lnga ni phung po'i bdud 'joms /
translated: The five rotten ornaments such as the necklace conquer the demon of the aggregates.🔽The necklace of a garland of skulls purifies the sixty-two views of the transitory collection.

original: thod pa'i phreng ba'i mgul rgyan ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis dag / dril bu g-yer ka'i ska rags ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mdo sde 'chad pa'i rtags /🔽kha'i gdong can la sogs pa bzhin ni mi'am ci'i khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i gzugs 'dul ba dang / mtshams bzhi'i lha mom phyed gzugs ma ni /
analyzed: thod pa'i phreng ba'i mgul rgyan ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis dag / dril bu g-yer ka'i ska rags ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi mdo sde 'chad pa'i rtags / kha'i gdong can la sogs pa bzhin ni mi'am ci'i khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i gzugs 'dul ba dang / mtshams bzhi'i lha mom phyed gzugs ma ni /
translated: The girdle of small bells is a sign of explaining the sūtras of the twelve branches of excellent speech.🔽The faces of Khaṇḍakapālin and so on are the forms of the kinnara Khaṇḍakapālin and so on, which are the forms for taming.

original: gdul bya'i mi'am ci 'dul ba dang mthun no //
analyzed: gdul bya'i mi'am ci 'dul ba dang mthun no //
translated: The goddesses in the four intermediate directions with half-bodies are in accordance with the kinnaras to be tamed.

original: dpral bar padma'i dbang rtags /
analyzed: dpral bar padma'i dbang rtags /
translated: The sign of the lotus on the forehead is the sign of the lotus family.

original: 'khor bskyed pa nye ba'i bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor bskyed pa nye ba'i bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The generation of the wheel is the near-accomplishment stage.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang khams kun sku'i 'khor lo bzhin du bsgom /🔽thugs ni a'a:dmar po /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang khams kun sku'i 'khor lo bzhin du bsgom / thugs ni a'a:dmar po /
translated: The aggregates, constituents, and sense bases are meditated on as the body maṇḍala.🔽The mind is a red āḥ.

original: gsung ni aom dmar po /
analyzed: gsung ni aom dmar po /
translated: The speech is a red oṃ.

original: gsung ni aom dkar po //
analyzed: gsung ni aom dkar po //
translated: The speech is a white AOM.🔽The body is a blue HUM.

original: sku ni h'um nam mkha'i mdog can 'khor thams cad kyang phung po dang khams dang skye mched byin gyis brlabs pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku ni h'um nam mkha'i mdog can 'khor thams cad kyang phung po dang khams dang skye mched byin gyis brlabs pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: All the retinue should be connected with the consecration of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: lus kyi 'khor lo bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: lus kyi 'khor lo bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: The accomplishment of the body wheel has been explained.🔽As before, light rays radiate from the HUM at the heart, and the wisdom wheel is invited with mantra and mudra.

original: snga ma bzhin du snying ga'i ga'i h'um las 'od zer 'phro ba dang sngags dang phyag rgyas ye shes 'khor lo spyan drangs te de la bltas nas phyag 'tshal ba dang / @150a * //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du snying ga'i ga'i h'um las 'od zer 'phro ba dang sngags dang phyag rgyas ye shes 'khor lo spyan drangs te de la bltas nas phyag 'tshal ba dang / @150a * //
translated: Having seen that, one should prostrate,

original: bstod pa dang mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: bstod pa dang mchod pa byas nas /
translated: praise, and make offerings.🔽Then, one should meditate on the triple-being sentient being, all of whom are of one taste, and then the body wheel emanates from the body wheel at the forehead, the speech wheel emanates from the speech wheel at the throat,

original: de nyid kyis bum pa dang gsang ba dang / shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur te thams cad ro gcig ba'i sems dpa' sum brtsegs bsgoms nas dpral ba'i sku'i 'khor lo las sku'i 'khor lo spro ba dang / lkog ma'i gsung las gsung gi 'khor lo spro ba dang /
analyzed: de nyid kyis bum pa dang gsang ba dang / shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur te thams cad ro gcig ba'i sems dpa' sum brtsegs bsgoms nas dpral ba'i sku'i 'khor lo las sku'i 'khor lo spro ba dang / lkog ma'i gsung las gsung gi 'khor lo spro ba dang /
translated: and the mind wheel emanates from the mind wheel at the heart.

original: thugs ka'i h'um las thugs kyi 'khor lo spro bsdu bya ba ni ye shes kyi bzlas pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thugs ka'i h'um las thugs kyi 'khor lo spro bsdu bya ba ni ye shes kyi bzlas pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The meditation on the gnosis recitation is the emanation and re-absorption of the mind wheel from the hūṃ at the heart.

original: dpa' bo'i snying po ni chos kyi sku'i ye shes ston /
analyzed: dpa' bo'i snying po ni chos kyi sku'i ye shes ston /
translated: The essence mantra of the hero teaches the gnosis of the dharmakāya.

original: nye ba'i snying po ni longs sku'i gzugs ston /
analyzed: nye ba'i snying po ni longs sku'i gzugs ston /
translated: The close essence mantra teaches the form of the saṃbhogakāya.

original: yum gyi snying po ni chos kyi sku'i 'dus ma byas ston /
analyzed: yum gyi snying po ni chos kyi sku'i 'dus ma byas ston /
translated: The essence mantra of the mother teaches the unconditioned dharmakāya.

original: yum gyi nye snying ni longs sku las sprul sku 'gyed pa ston /
analyzed: yum gyi nye snying ni longs sku las sprul sku 'gyed pa ston /
translated: The close essence mantra of the mother teaches the emanation of nirmāṇakāyas from the saṃbhogakāya.

original: yum bzhi'i sngags ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i phrin las bzhi mdzad /
analyzed: yum bzhi'i sngags ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i phrin las bzhi mdzad /
translated: The mantras of the four mothers perform the four activities that will be explained below.

original: gsung gi 'khor lo'i yab yum gyi sngags ni gsung so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dngos grub 'thob /
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor lo'i yab yum gyi sngags ni gsung so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dngos grub 'thob /
