translated: The mantras of the speech wheel father and mother grant the spiritual powers of the individually discerning gnosis of speech.

original: gong ma brgyad kyi sngags kyis ni sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / sems can la phrin las bzhi mdzad /
analyzed: gong ma brgyad kyi sngags kyis ni sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / sems can la phrin las bzhi mdzad /
translated: The mantras of the above eight grant offerings to the buddhas and perform the four activities for sentient beings.

original: de ltar bzlas pa ni spro bsdu bsdu dag gis bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bzlas pa ni spro bsdu bsdu dag gis bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Thus, the recitation is performed by the recitation of emanation and re-absorption.

original: rdo rje dam tshig gis mchod nas //
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig gis mchod nas //
translated: Having made offerings with the vajra pledge,

original: zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin du thod pa bzhi'i bdud rtsi myangs la de nas bzlas pa byas pa'i go rims ston to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin du thod pa bzhi'i bdud rtsi myangs la de nas bzlas pa byas pa'i go rims ston to //
translated: This, as before, shows the order of tasting the nectar of the four skull-bowls and then doing the repetition.

original: yum bzhi'i bzlas pas ni dgug pa dang rgyas pa dang sna tshogs kyi las zhi ba dang mngon spyod 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yum bzhi'i bzlas pas ni dgug pa dang rgyas pa dang sna tshogs kyi las zhi ba dang mngon spyod 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the repetition of the four Mothers, the activities of summoning, prospering, and the various activities of pacifying and destroying are accomplished.

original: gsung gi 'khor lo bzlas pas ni chos chen po'i so sor rtog pa'i ye shes yid 'ong tshang pa'i gsungs dbyangs drug cu ngag gi dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor lo bzlas pas ni chos chen po'i so sor rtog pa'i ye shes yid 'ong tshang pa'i gsungs dbyangs drug cu ngag gi dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the repetition of the Speech Wheel, the power of speech is accomplished, the pleasing speech of the sixty melodious tones of the discriminative awareness of the great Dharma.

original: yang na rdzogs pa'i rim pa la mos na mchog ye shes skyes pa dang / bar ma zhing skyes dang / tha ma sngags skyes kyi bud med mchod bsam gtan dang zag med kyi sngom pa la gnas pa de thams cad 'khor lo la bkod nas /
analyzed: yang na rdzogs pa'i rim pa la mos na mchog ye shes skyes pa dang / bar ma zhing skyes dang / tha ma sngags skyes kyi bud med mchod bsam gtan dang zag med kyi sngom pa la gnas pa de thams cad 'khor lo la bkod nas /
translated: Or, if one is devoted to the stage of completion, one should imagine that all of the women, whether born of supreme gnosis, born of the fields, or born of mantra, are placed on the wheels, and that one worships them, abiding in the vows of contemplation and of the uncontaminated.

original: gnas pa la 'dod pa'i chags pa dga' ba dang mchog dga' ba rjes su chags pa lhan cig skyes dga' 'dod pa'i dga' bas myos pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyis 'od gsal ba stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i sgrub pa po de'i dbang du 'khor gyi lha mo
analyzed: gnas pa la 'dod pa'i chags pa dga' ba dang mchog dga' ba rjes su chags pa lhan cig skyes dga' 'dod pa'i dga' bas myos pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyis 'od gsal ba stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i sgrub pa po de'i dbang du 'khor gyi lha mo
translated: The joy of desire, the supreme joy of attachment to abiding, and the connate joy of intoxication with the joy of desire are the goddesses of the retinue that are under the power of that practitioner who meditates on emptiness, luminosity.🔽

original: rnams gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rnams gnas pa yin te /
translated: The goddesses of the retinue abide under the control of that adept who meditates on emptiness, clear light, by means of all aspects, who is intoxicated by the bliss of desire, who is the coemergent bliss, who is the passion, who is the supreme joy, who is the joy, who is attached to the passion of desire.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sna tshogs padma mdzes gnas nas //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma mdzes gnas nas //
translated: Dwelling in the beautiful lotus of variety,

original: zhes pa 'khor lo bzhi'i padma la gtum mo drod kyis mdzes par gnas nas byang chub sems phab pas rnal 'byor @150b chen po rnam par spyod pa la khams gsum gyi 'dod chags spangs pa chos nyid stong pa nyid 'od gsal ba bsgoms pas bde ba can du
analyzed: zhes pa 'khor lo bzhi'i padma la gtum mo drod kyis mdzes par gnas nas byang chub sems phab pas rnal 'byor @150b chen po rnam par spyod pa la khams gsum gyi 'dod chags spangs pa chos nyid stong pa nyid 'od gsal ba bsgoms pas bde ba can du
translated: the great yogī, having caused the bodhicitta to descend by dwelling in the beautiful lotus of the four cakras by means of the heat of caṇḍālī, is like the one who dwells in Sukhāvatī by abandoning the passion of the three realms through meditating on the emptiness of reality, the reality that is abandoned.

original: rnam par bzhugs pa dang 'dra bar rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: rnam par bzhugs pa dang 'dra bar rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom mo //
translated: One should meditate on the completion stage.

original: langs pa'i dus su dri chen rnam snang dang / dri chu mi bskyod pa bza' zhing bdud rtsi myangs pas zag pa med pa'i chos kyi phung po lnga rdzogs nas stong pa nyid kyi rig pa'i rgyal po sangs rgyas dang / bde ba rig pa gzugs khams kyi 'khor los sgyur ba dang /
analyzed: langs pa'i dus su dri chen rnam snang dang / dri chu mi bskyod pa bza' zhing bdud rtsi myangs pas zag pa med pa'i chos kyi phung po lnga rdzogs nas stong pa nyid kyi rig pa'i rgyal po sangs rgyas dang / bde ba rig pa gzugs khams kyi 'khor los sgyur ba dang /
translated: When one rises, one should eat feces, the form of Vairocana, and urine, the form of Ak˝hobhya, and by tasting the elixir, the five incorruptible aggregates of dharma are perfected.🔽

original: bsod nams rig pa mi'i 'khor los sgyur ba 'grub bo //
analyzed: bsod nams rig pa mi'i 'khor los sgyur ba 'grub bo //
translated: At the time of rising, one should eat feces, which is Vairocana, and urine, which is Akshobhya, and by tasting the nectar, having completed the five aggregates of undefiled Dharma, one becomes the king of the knowledge of emptiness, the Buddha; the bliss-knowledge, the Cakravartin of the form realm; and the merit-knowledge, the Cakravartin of the human realm.

original: ldang ba'i tshe go chas lus la bsrung ba ni rgyud la gsal bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: ldang ba'i tshe go chas lus la bsrung ba ni rgyud la gsal bas ma bshad do //
translated: At the time of rising, the protection of the body with the armor is not explained because it is clear in the tantra.

original: bzlas pa'i dus kyi mthar bkod nas //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i dus kyi mthar bkod nas //
translated: Having arranged at the end of the time of repetition,

original: zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa zin nas go cha bgo ba'i dus bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa zin nas go cha bgo ba'i dus bstan to //
translated: this teaches the time of donning the armor after the repetition is finished.

original: ji ltar bde bas spyad par bya //
analyzed: ji ltar bde bas spyad par bya //
translated: One should practice with whatever is comfortable.

original: zhes pa ni thun mtshams su dpa' bo gcig pus gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thun mtshams su dpa' bo gcig pus gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the practice of the solitary hero between sessions.

original: dkyil 'khor snying gar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor snying gar bsdu ba ni /
translated: The dissolution of the mandala into the heart is as follows:

original: dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma rnams kye //
analyzed: dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma rnams kye //
translated: O heroes and yoginis!

original: zhes pa so so'i sngags brjod cing lus kyi go 'phang gi gnas la bzhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa so so'i sngags brjod cing lus kyi go 'phang gi gnas la bzhugs par bya'o //
translated: Saying the individual mantras, one should cause them to sit on the places of the body.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad snying spyod 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad snying spyod 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will accomplish the activities of all the maṇḍalas.

original: gsung gi 'khor gcig phyag gnyis pa la dmigs te mnyam par gzhag pas tha mal pa'i gsung bar rkang pa brgyad pas bstod cing bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor gcig phyag gnyis pa la dmigs te mnyam par gzhag pas tha mal pa'i gsung bar rkang pa brgyad pas bstod cing bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Having visualized the speech maṇḍala with one face and two arms, one should praise with the eight-line praise, and remain in equipoise.

original: rang gi lha yi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rang gi lha yi sbyor ba yis //
translated: Through the yoga of one’s deity,

original: chos rnams thams cad ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga lha mor bskyed nas rang dang gzhan la mchod pa rab tu brtag go //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga lha mor bskyed nas rang dang gzhan la mchod pa rab tu brtag go //
translated: one should imagine that all phenomena are generated as goddesses of the five sense offerings, and make offerings to oneself and others.

original: de nas kha zas kyi rnal 'byor ni /
analyzed: de nas kha zas kyi rnal 'byor ni /
translated: Then, the yoga of food is as follows:

original: rdo rje chu dang rnam snang dang / sbrang rtsi rang byung gi me tog dkar dmar byang chub sems dang rkang sha chen dang lhan cig sbyar nas lce la /
analyzed: rdo rje chu dang rnam snang dang / sbrang rtsi rang byung gi me tog dkar dmar byang chub sems dang rkang sha chen dang lhan cig sbyar nas lce la /
translated: Having mixed vajra water, Vairocana, honey, the white and red bodhicitta of the naturally arisen flower, and meat, one should place it on one’s tongue.

original: zla ba rdo rje'i 'od zer gyi bu gul dam tshig gi sbyor bas gsol bas snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa' gsung gi 'khor lo snang ba mtha' yas kyi bdag po'i dbu rgyan bsgoms la bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba rdo rje'i 'od zer gyi bu gul dam tshig gi sbyor bas gsol bas snying ga'i ye shes sems dpa' gsung gi 'khor lo snang ba mtha' yas kyi bdag po'i dbu rgyan bsgoms la bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Having supplicated with the vajra song of the moon, one should eat, meditating on the lord Akṣobhya as the head ornament of the gnosis being at the heart, the speech wheel of Amitābha.

original: shugs kyis lkog mar sku'i 'khor lo dang / spyi bor thugs kyi 'khor lo bsgoms la lha'i gzugs su 'gyur bas 'dod pa'i lha drug gi bdag po brgya byin dang tshangs pa'i gzugs can 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shugs kyis lkog mar sku'i 'khor lo dang / spyi bor thugs kyi 'khor lo bsgoms la lha'i gzugs su 'gyur bas 'dod pa'i lha drug gi bdag po brgya byin dang tshangs pa'i gzugs can 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By implication, one should meditate on the body wheel at the throat and the mind wheel at the crown, and one will obtain the form of the lord of the six gods of desire, Śakra and Brahmā.

original: bza' ba bdud rtsi lnga dang 'o ma'i btung ba 'thungs na tshe 'di la na ba dang rgas pa rnam par spang ngo //
analyzed: bza' ba bdud rtsi lnga dang 'o ma'i btung ba 'thungs na tshe 'di la na ba dang rgas pa rnam par spang ngo //
translated: If one drinks the nectar of the five nectars and milk, one will eliminate sickness and aging in this life.

original: langs pa'i rjes la tshogs kyi 'khor lo byed pa'i tshe glu len @151a * //
analyzed: langs pa'i rjes la tshogs kyi 'khor lo byed pa'i tshe glu len @151a * //
translated: After rising, when one performs the gaṇacakra, one should sing the song.

original: pa dang / sngar thig le zhu ba las glus bskul ba'i don gnyis ka cig car gsungs pa ni sems can gyi don la dgongs pas glu blangs te /
analyzed: pa dang / sngar thig le zhu ba las glus bskul ba'i don gnyis ka cig car gsungs pa ni sems can gyi don la dgongs pas glu blangs te /
translated: The simultaneous statement of both the meaning of the song of the melting bindu and the song of the arousing is the song of the arousing, which is intended for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don la brtson 'grus bskyed nas mngon bar byang chub pa lha'i chos rnams kun bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la brtson 'grus bskyed nas mngon bar byang chub pa lha'i chos rnams kun bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to generate the perfection of effort, and in order to generate the qualities of the deity of manifest enlightenment,

original: bskul nas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / lag pa'i gar la brten nas sems can la thugs rjes 'bras bu'i he ru ka blang ba'i thugs kyis gsung gi 'khor gyi ngag gi dngos grub 'grub pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i rnal 'byor ba aindra bh'u ti la sogs pa'i don du gsang ba mchog gi glu bstan du
analyzed: bskul nas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / lag pa'i gar la brten nas sems can la thugs rjes 'bras bu'i he ru ka blang ba'i thugs kyis gsung gi 'khor gyi ngag gi dngos grub 'grub pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i rnal 'byor ba aindra bh'u ti la sogs pa'i don du gsang ba mchog gi glu bstan du
translated: having generated effort for the benefit of sentient beings, the Bhagavān, in order to generate the perfection of effort, and in order to generate the result Heruka of compassion for sentient beings, with the intention of taking [him] with the dance of the hand, in order to accomplish the power of speech of the retinue of the Bhagavān’s speech, for the benefit of future yogins such as Indrabhūti, and so on,🔽requested the teaching of the secret supreme song.

original: gsol/ zhes lag na rdo rjes gsol ba btab nas dgongs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gsol/ zhes lag na rdo rjes gsol ba btab nas dgongs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why did Vajrapāṇi make this request?

original: sems can la 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyis phan pa'i phyir dang / gsang ba'i chos kyi glus grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can la 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub kyis phan pa'i phyir dang / gsang ba'i chos kyi glus grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order to benefit sentient beings with mundane powers and in order to liberate them with the secret Dharma song.

original: rdo rje'i glu ji ltar bstan pa'i grol bar mdzad ces sdud pa po lag na rdo rjes zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje'i glu ji ltar bstan pa'i grol bar mdzad ces sdud pa po lag na rdo rjes zhus pa yin no //
translated: The compiler Vajrapāṇi asks, “How does the vajra song liberate?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor gyi lha mo rnam pa sna tshogs pa mchod pa'i glu dang / dam tshig gi gar ngo mtshar du 'gyur bas chags pa'i lta ba'i mig phyag nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor gyi lha mo rnam pa sna tshogs pa mchod pa'i glu dang / dam tshig gi gar ngo mtshar du 'gyur bas chags pa'i lta ba'i mig phyag nas /
translated: from his hand,

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis bskul ba'i bstod pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis bskul ba'i bstod pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: the yoginīs’ praises that were requested were spoken.

original: dang po yum bzhis /
analyzed: dang po yum bzhis /
translated: First, the four mothers:🔽“Supreme bliss-maker of great delight,

original: aa shin tu dgyes pa'i bde mdzad mchog / gnyis med bde ba'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: aa shin tu dgyes pa'i bde mdzad mchog / gnyis med bde ba'i bdag nyid can //
translated: nondual nature of bliss,🔽the song of the ḍākinīs’ delight.

original: zhes mkha' 'gro ma dga' ba'i glu dang / dgyes pa dbyes pa bde gshegs zhi ba'i bdag po spyod //
analyzed: zhes mkha' 'gro ma dga' ba'i glu dang / dgyes pa dbyes pa bde gshegs zhi ba'i bdag po spyod //
translated: The dance of delight, the lord of the peace of the sugatas,🔽the song of the kāma.

original: ces k'a ma'i glu dang / bde gshegs rnam 'phrul rnam par 'phrul ba padma'i dra rnams kyis //

analyzed: zhes khanda ro h'i'i glu dang / padma'i dra ba bde gsol mdzad pa'i padma'i dra ba yis //

analyzed: chos kyi sku las bzhengs pa'i phyir lha mos glu blangs pa /

analyzed: gzugs can ma'i glu dang / aom a'a:h'um ho /

analyzed: dam tshig gi lha mo brgyad kyi glu ni /

original: khyod ni bde ba chen po ste //
analyzed: khyod ni bde ba chen po ste //

original: bde mchog dri med zla ba nyid //
analyzed: bde mchog dri med zla ba nyid //
translated: You are the stainless moon of supreme bliss.

original: sna tshogs bde mchog dra ba ste //
analyzed: sna tshogs bde mchog dra ba ste //

original: dgyes pa'i bde chen bde ba mchog / aa la la la ho //
analyzed: dgyes pa'i bde chen bde ba mchog / aa la la la ho //
translated: A la la la ho.

analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi'i glu'o //

analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag mtha' //

analyzed: stong pa nyid dang chos kyi dbyings //

original: me long mnyam nyid so sor rtog / bya ba nan tan grub rang bzhin //🔽shin tu mnyam gzhag bsgom bya ba //
analyzed: me long mnyam nyid so sor rtog / bya ba nan tan grub rang bzhin // shin tu mnyam gzhag bsgom bya ba //

analyzed: rnal 'byor 'di ni mchog gi mchog / ces bya ba de bzhin nyid dang / me long lta bu las zla ba dang po'o //
translated: This is the first moon from the suchness and mirror-like [empowerments].

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' dag mnyam pa nyid la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' dag mnyam pa nyid la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa /
translated: The second sun is from the limit of reality and equality.

original: stong pa nyid dang so sor rtog pa las yig 'bru dang phyag mtshan /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang so sor rtog pa las yig 'bru dang phyag mtshan /
translated: The syllables and hand implements are from emptiness and discernment.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang bya ba grub pa las 'od zer spro bsdu /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang bya ba grub pa las 'od zer spro bsdu /
translated: The emanation and re-absorption of light rays are from the dharma-dhātu and accomplishing action.

original: shin tu rnam par dag par bsgom pa las rnal 'byor 'di ni rgyu'i he ru ka'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag par bsgom pa las rnal 'byor 'di ni rgyu'i he ru ka'o //
translated: The meditation on the utterly pure is this yoga, the causal Heruka.

original: yang mchog ni 'bras bu'i he ru ka'o //
analyzed: yang mchog ni 'bras bu'i he ru ka'o //
translated: Again, the supreme is the resultant Heruka.

original: chos rnams ro gcig byas nas ni nyi zla gnyis dang / yig 'bru gnyis dang / 'od zer spro bsdu gnyis dang brgyad 'gyur ba las rang rig gi 'khor lo rnam par blta zhes te /
analyzed: chos rnams ro gcig byas nas ni nyi zla gnyis dang / yig 'bru gnyis dang / 'od zer spro bsdu gnyis dang brgyad 'gyur ba las rang rig gi 'khor lo rnam par blta zhes te /
translated: Having made the dharmas of one taste, the two suns and moons, the two syllables, and the emanation and re-absorption of light rays are multiplied by eight, and one should view the wheel of one's awareness.

original: lha mo rnams kyang mngal du yab yum gyi sa bon nyi zla gnyis dang / yig 'bru dang / phyag mtshan dang / 'od zer spro bsdu dang bcas pa'i mngon par byang chub pa lnga las @153a * //
analyzed: lha mo rnams kyang mngal du yab yum gyi sa bon nyi zla gnyis dang / yig 'bru dang / phyag mtshan dang / 'od zer spro bsdu dang bcas pa'i mngon par byang chub pa lnga las @153a * //
translated: The goddesses also have the five manifest enlightenments: the sun and moon as the seed syllables of the father and mother in the womb, the seed syllable, the hand implement, and the emanation and re-absorption of light rays.🔽

original: nges par skyes par gdon mi la ba'o //
analyzed: nges par skyes par gdon mi la ba'o //
translated: The goddesses are also definitely born from the five manifest enlightenments in the womb, with the two seeds of the father and mother, the sun and moon, the seed syllable, the hand implement, and the emanation and reabsorption of light rays.🔽The Approach

original: bsnyen pa'o // shar gyi 'dab ma la mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba nas/ yongs gang thod pa gzhag par bya// zhes pa'i bar du padma dang sku mdog phyag mtshan ni go sla'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'o // shar gyi 'dab ma la mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya ba nas/ yongs gang thod pa gzhag par bya// zhes pa'i bar du padma dang sku mdog phyag mtshan ni go sla'o //
translated: On the eastern petal, “dakini” up to “filled with skulls.” The lotus, body color, and hand implement are easy to understand.

original: bum pa dang thod pa yang rgyud na gsal /
analyzed: bum pa dang thod pa yang rgyud na gsal /
translated: The vase and skull cup are clear in the tantra.

original: rdo rjes mtshan pa'i gri gug gi phreng bas bskor ba kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rjes mtshan pa'i gri gug gi phreng bas bskor ba kha bskang ngo //
translated: The garland of flaying knives marked with vajras should be added.

original: thugs kyi 'khor lo'i shar phyogs kyi rtsibs brgyad la /
analyzed: thugs kyi 'khor lo'i shar phyogs kyi rtsibs brgyad la /
translated: On the eight spokes of the mind wheel,

original: pulli ra ma la ya la sogs par 'dogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: pulli ra ma la ya la sogs par 'dogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: the designations of Pullīramalaya and so on are the appearances of the buddhafields, the levels, and the perfections.

original: thod pa'i dum bu dang rab gtum ma la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni mkha' spyod lha dang dri za btul bas gdul bya'i ming gis 'dul byed la btags so //
analyzed: thod pa'i dum bu dang rab gtum ma la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni mkha' spyod lha dang dri za btul bas gdul bya'i ming gis 'dul byed la btags so //
translated: The names of Kapālaśikhin, Pracaṇḍā, and so forth are given to the subjugators by the names of the objects to be subjugated, because they subjugate the gods of the sky and the gandharvas.

original: zhal dang phyag mtshan dang / g-yer kha'i sgra sgrogs pa'i ska rags can no zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyud na gsal bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: zhal dang phyag mtshan dang / g-yer kha'i sgra sgrogs pa'i ska rags can no zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyud na gsal bas ma bshad do //
translated: The faces, hand implements, and the girdle that makes the sound of a ringing bell are not explained here because they are clear in the tantra.

original: rdo rje'i phreng bas bskor ba kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje'i phreng bas bskor ba kha bskang ngo //
translated: The gaps in the vajra garland should be filled in.

original: sgo dang grva yi lha mo rnams //
analyzed: sgo dang grva yi lha mo rnams //
translated: The goddesses of the gates and corners

original: khva gdong gshin rje brtan ma sogs //
analyzed: khva gdong gshin rje brtan ma sogs //
translated: are Kākāsyā, Yamāntakī, and so forth.🔽The goddesses are taught to have the same colors as the dakinis and so forth.

original: mkha' 'gro ma sogs mdog 'dra bstan// zhes bya ba mkha' 'gro ma dang mthun pa'i khva gdong ma dkar mo /🔽'ug gdong ma ljang gu / khyi gdong ma dmar mo /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma sogs mdog 'dra bstan// zhes bya ba mkha' 'gro ma dang mthun pa'i khva gdong ma dkar mo / 'ug gdong ma ljang gu / khyi gdong ma dmar mo /
translated: Kākāsyā is white, like the dakini.🔽Ulūkāsyā is green, like Lāmā.🔽Śvānāsyā is red, like Khaṇḍarohā.

original: phag gdong ma ser mo /
analyzed: phag gdong ma ser mo /
translated: Sūkarāsyā is yellow, like Rūpiṇī.

original: g-yon na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga / g-yas na gri gug dang cang te'u bsnams pa /🔽mtshams kyi lha mo de bzhin te //
analyzed: g-yon na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga / g-yas na gri gug dang cang te'u bsnams pa / mtshams kyi lha mo de bzhin te //
translated: In the left hands they hold skulls and khaṭvāṅgas, and in the right hands they hold flaying knives and skull‑cup hand drums.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The goddesses of the intermediate directions are similar.

original: shar lhor gshin rje brtan ma sngo ser /
analyzed: shar lhor gshin rje brtan ma sngo ser /
translated: In the southeast is yellow-green Sthira-Yamī.

original: lho nub gshin rje pho nya mo dkar ser /🔽nub byang gi gshin rje mche ba ma dmar ljang /
analyzed: lho nub gshin rje pho nya mo dkar ser / nub byang gi gshin rje mche ba ma dmar ljang /
translated: In the southwest is yellow-white Dūtī-Yamī.🔽In the northwest is red-green Dāntī-Yamī.

original: byang shar gyi gshin rje 'joms ma ljang sngo /
analyzed: byang shar gyi gshin rje 'joms ma ljang sngo /
translated: In the northeast is blue-green Jayā-Yamī.

original: phyag mtshan bzhi ni sgo ma dang mthun /
analyzed: phyag mtshan bzhi ni sgo ma dang mthun /
translated: The four hand implements are the same as the gate keepers.

original: rang dang 'dra ba ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa yang dag par spong ba bzhi'i dngos grub gsol ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba ro'i gdan la bzhugs pa yang dag par spong ba bzhi'i dngos grub gsol ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: They sit on corpse seats like themselves. Meditate on them as supplicating the spiritual powers of the four perfect abandonments.

original: nye bsnyen no //
analyzed: nye bsnyen no //
translated: This is the approach.

original: 'dir lus kyi dkyil 'khor phung po dang khams dang skye mched lhar bskyed pa bsgom pa kha bskang ste grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lus kyi dkyil 'khor phung po dang khams dang skye mched lhar bskyed pa bsgom pa kha bskang ste grub pa'o //
translated: Here, the body mandala is the creation and meditation of the aggregates, constituents, and sense bases as deities.

original: sgrub pa chen po las kyi rgyal mchog ni snga ma bzhin du ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs nas /
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po las kyi rgyal mchog ni snga ma bzhin du ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs nas /
translated: The great accomplishment, the supreme activity, is as follows: Having invited the awareness beings as before,

original: de nam mkhar byon pa mthong nas /
analyzed: de nam mkhar byon pa mthong nas /
translated: they are seen arriving in the space above.

original: phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa dang bstod pa snga ma bzhin du byas nas /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba dang / mchod pa dang bstod pa snga ma bzhin du byas nas /
translated: Then, as before, one performs prostration, offering, and praise.

original: bum pa thogs pa'i lha mos gtso bo dang 'khor la dbang gsum bskur nas rang dang 'khor dang dur khrod kyi bar du ye shes sems dpa' dang dam tshig @153b sems dpa' ro gcig par byas nas /
analyzed: bum pa thogs pa'i lha mos gtso bo dang 'khor la dbang gsum bskur nas rang dang 'khor dang dur khrod kyi bar du ye shes sems dpa' dang dam tshig @153b sems dpa' ro gcig par byas nas /
translated: The goddess holding the vase bestows the three empowerments on the principal one and the retinue, and one makes the gnosis being and the commitment being of oneself and the retinue and the charnel grounds one taste.

original: don dam par 'dus ma byas chos thams cad bdag med pa'i go 'phang la gnas nas /
analyzed: don dam par 'dus ma byas chos thams cad bdag med pa'i go 'phang la gnas nas /
translated: Ultimately, one abides in the stage of the unconditioned, the state of selflessness of all phenomena.

original: 'dod pa'i don dngos grub kun sgrub par byed pa'i thugs kyi 'khor lo snying gar bsgom pa dang / lkog mar gsung gi 'khor lo bsgom pa dang / dpral bar sku'i 'khor lo bsgoms la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don dngos grub kun sgrub par byed pa'i thugs kyi 'khor lo snying gar bsgom pa dang / lkog mar gsung gi 'khor lo bsgom pa dang / dpral bar sku'i 'khor lo bsgoms la /
translated: Meditate on the mind wheel that accomplishes all desired attainments at the heart, the speech wheel at the throat, and the body wheel at the forehead.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo gsum lus la rnam par bkod nas sangs rgyas kyi mchog sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo phyogs bcur spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo gsum lus la rnam par bkod nas sangs rgyas kyi mchog sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo phyogs bcur spro bar bya'o //
translated: Having thus arrayed the three wheels of body, speech, and mind in the body, emanate the supreme wheel of body, speech, and mind into the ten directions.

original: de ltar bsgom pas skyo na bum pa bzhi'i steng gi thod pa las /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pas skyo na bum pa bzhi'i steng gi thod pa las /
translated: If one becomes weary through meditating in that way, then from the skull cup on the four vases,

original: ye shes lnga'i bdud rtsi'i chus bza' ba'i dam tshig rtag tu bskyang ba dang / lha thams cad kyi bdud rtsi'i dam tshig gi mchod pa byas pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i bdud rtsi'i chus bza' ba'i dam tshig rtag tu bskyang ba dang / lha thams cad kyi bdud rtsi'i dam tshig gi mchod pa byas pa'i rjes la /
translated: The pledge of always maintaining the pledge of food, which is the water of the elixir of the five awarenesses, and the pledge of offering the elixir offering of all deities,

original: spro bsdu'i rnal 'byor bsams nas /
analyzed: spro bsdu'i rnal 'byor bsams nas /
translated: after which one should imagine the yoga of emanating and gathering.

original: gtso bo nas 'khor gyi bzlas pa byas so //
analyzed: gtso bo nas 'khor gyi bzlas pa byas so //
translated: One should perform the recitation from the principal deity to the retinue.

original: bzlas pa'i sngags ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i sngags ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The mantra for the recitation is the same as before.🔽By the stage of emanating and gathering through meditation and recitation, the mantra practitioner will quickly accomplish the attainments, and will attain the pledge of being equal to Vajrasattva.

original: bsgom pa dang bzlas pas spro bsdu'i rim gyis sngags pa la dngos grub myur du 'grub pas rdo rje sems dpa' dang mnyam pa'i dam tshig thob pa dang mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i sems la dmigs pa'i rig 'dzin thob nas mkha' spyod 'og min gyi
analyzed: bsgom pa dang bzlas pas spro bsdu'i rim gyis sngags pa la dngos grub myur du 'grub pas rdo rje sems dpa' dang mnyam pa'i dam tshig thob pa dang mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i sems la dmigs pa'i rig 'dzin thob nas mkha' spyod 'og min gyi
translated: Having attained the vidyādhara stage of mind focused on the five higher perceptions, one will become a sky-goer, the lord of Akaniṣṭha,

original: bdag po rnal 'byor ba mchog khams gsum gyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag po rnal 'byor ba mchog khams gsum gyi bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: the supreme yogin, the lord of the three realms.

original: mchod pa dang bstod pa dang gtor ma gtang ba gsum kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: mchod pa dang bstod pa dang gtor ma gtang ba gsum kha bskang ngo //
translated: One should fulfill the three: offering, praise, and bali offering.

original: sdang ba'i dus su go cha drug gis bsrung ba dang / khams gsum pa'i gnas pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa thugs kyi 'khor lo mchog gi ngo bor shes pa dang / stong gsum gzhal yas khang 'gro ba rigs drug lha dang gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor 'di'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ngar 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: sdang ba'i dus su go cha drug gis bsrung ba dang / khams gsum pa'i gnas pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa thugs kyi 'khor lo mchog gi ngo bor shes pa dang / stong gsum gzhal yas khang 'gro ba rigs drug lha dang gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor 'di'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ngar 'dzin pa dang /
translated: In this yoga, the billion-world universe is the immeasurable mansion, and the six types of migrating beings are nondual with the deity.

original: nga yir 'dzin pa med pas bdag tu snang ba med pa'i gzung ba snod bcud bdag gir snang ba yang mi dmigs pa las mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa med pas bdag tu snang ba med pa'i gzung ba snod bcud bdag gir snang ba yang mi dmigs pa las mi g-yo'o //
translated: Since one has no grasping at “I” and “mine,” one does not waver from the nonobservation of the appearance of a self and the appearance of the environment and its inhabitants as “mine.”

original: de'i don 'di skad yin te /
analyzed: de'i don 'di skad yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: sngon 'gro rnal 'byor lnga dang dngos gzhi dang po sbyor ba dgu dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog drug dang / las rgyal mchog brgyad dang / rjes rnam pa brgyad dang / thun mtshams kyi cho ga bcu gnyis te bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad thugs kyi 'khor lo la mos pa'i rnal 'byor pas zhib mo rnam par 'thag pa'i sgrub thabs bsgom par bya'o //🔽le'u drug pa'i @154a * //
analyzed: sngon 'gro rnal 'byor lnga dang dngos gzhi dang po sbyor ba dgu dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog drug dang / las rgyal mchog brgyad dang / rjes rnam pa brgyad dang / thun mtshams kyi cho ga bcu gnyis te bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad thugs kyi 'khor lo la mos pa'i rnal 'byor pas zhib mo rnam par 'thag pa'i sgrub thabs bsgom par bya'o // le'u drug pa'i @154a * //
translated: The yoga of the five preliminaries, the nine preliminaries of the main practice, the six supreme royal maṇḍalas, the eight supreme royal activities, the eight concluding rites, and the twelve rites of the session breaks—the practitioner who is devoted to the mind wheel should meditate on the manual of the fine detailed explanation.

original: 'grel pa'o / //
analyzed: 'grel pa'o / //
translated: The commentary on the sixth chapter.

original: / de ltar thugs kyi 'khor lo bshad nas dam tshig gi bde mchog ston par bzhed pas /
analyzed: / de ltar thugs kyi 'khor lo bshad nas dam tshig gi bde mchog ston par bzhed pas /
translated: Having explained the mind wheel in that way, in order to teach the sacred pledge Cakrasaṃvara,

original: de nas zhes bya ba smos te dam tshig gi 'khor lo la dga' ba'i ngor dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ston pas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba smos te dam tshig gi 'khor lo la dga' ba'i ngor dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor ston pas /
translated: it is said, “Next, the sacred pledge wheel is taught for the sake of those who delight in the sacred pledge maṇḍala.”

original: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba //
translated: Next, I will explain

original: zhes bya'o // dang po tshad med pa'i rnal 'byor dang / byin gyis brlab pa'i rnal 'byor dang / bsrung ba'i rnal 'byor dang / tshogs sogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang / stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor sngon du 'gro ba byas nas /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // dang po tshad med pa'i rnal 'byor dang / byin gyis brlab pa'i rnal 'byor dang / bsrung ba'i rnal 'byor dang / tshogs sogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang / stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor sngon du 'gro ba byas nas /
translated: Having performed the yoga of the immeasurables, the yoga of consecration, the yoga of protection, the yoga of gathering the accumulations, and the yoga of emptiness beforehand,

original: ldang ba'i rnal 'byor 'byung ba bzhi dang ri rab dang / bhr'um las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad gyur pa las gzhal yas khang bskyed pa'i rjes thogs la /
analyzed: ldang ba'i rnal 'byor 'byung ba bzhi dang ri rab dang / bhr'um las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad gyur pa las gzhal yas khang bskyed pa'i rjes thogs la /
translated: the yoga of arising is the arising of Vairocana from the four elements, Mount Meru, and the syllable bhrūṃ, and the generation of the celestial mansion after that.

original: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bshad bya ba // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Next, I will explain🔽the supreme mandala of commitment.

original: dkyil 'khor gang zhe na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mandala?

original: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor mchog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor mchog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said to be the supreme mandala of commitment.

original: dam tshig ni sgom brgyad do //
analyzed: dam tshig ni sgom brgyad do //
translated: Commitment refers to the eight meditations.

original: sku gsung thugs spangs pa'i lha mo bcu /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs spangs pa'i lha mo bcu /
translated: The ten goddesses who abandon body, speech, and mind

original: gnyis kyis bskor ba'i zag pa med pa'i dkyil 'khor mchog ni brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis bskor ba'i zag pa med pa'i dkyil 'khor mchog ni brjod par bya'o //
translated: are surrounded by two, and the supreme undefiled mandala should be described.

original: de'i 'bras bu 'jig rten gyi dngos grub dang thun mong gi dngos grub ni 'dod pa'i gsang ba kun ster ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu 'jig rten gyi dngos grub dang thun mong gi dngos grub ni 'dod pa'i gsang ba kun ster ba'o //
translated: The result of that is the mundane and common accomplishments, which are the bestowal of all the secret desires.

original: mchog gi dngos grub ni sbas pa'i chos kyi sku dang / gsang ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku'i dngos grub stsol ba'o //
analyzed: mchog gi dngos grub ni sbas pa'i chos kyi sku dang / gsang ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku'i dngos grub stsol ba'o //
translated: The supreme accomplishment is the bestowal of the secret dharmakāya, the secret saṃbhogakāya, and the nirmāṇakāya.

original: dgos pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: dgos pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose?

original: sgrub pa po dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor la dga' ba la thos bsam gyis phan pa'i phyir de khong du chud pa'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub pa po dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor la dga' ba la thos bsam gyis phan pa'i phyir de khong du chud pa'i don to //
translated: For the sake of the practitioner who delights in the maṇḍala of samaya, it is for the benefit of hearing and contemplating, and for the sake of understanding that.

original: phan pa gang zhe na dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor sgrub pa'i thabs kyi don bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: phan pa gang zhe na dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor sgrub pa'i thabs kyi don bshad par bya'o //
translated: What is the benefit? The meaning of the method of accomplishing the maṇḍala of samaya should be explained.

original: sgrub pa'i don gyi dkyil 'khor gyi snga ma bzhin du sgo bzhi sgo khyud dang rta babs dang rdo rje'i ra ba me 'od kyis bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i don gyi dkyil 'khor gyi snga ma bzhin du sgo bzhi sgo khyud dang rta babs dang rdo rje'i ra ba me 'od kyis bskor bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the maṇḍala of accomplishment is as before, with four doors, door panels, architraves, and a vajra fence surrounding it, with a ring of firelight.

original: de'i dbus su 'khor lo gsum spangs pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo shar gang pa /🔽lho ser ba /
analyzed: de'i dbus su 'khor lo gsum spangs pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo shar gang pa / lho ser ba /
translated: In the center of that, the maṇḍala of pristine consciousness, which is free from the three maṇḍalas, is white in the east,🔽yellow in the south,

original: nub dmar ba /
analyzed: nub dmar ba /
translated: red in the west,

original: byang ljang ba /
analyzed: byang ljang ba /
translated: The north is green.

original: mtshams phyed gzugs sna tshogs kyi mdog can ge sar dang bcas pa'i dbus su zla ba dang / nyi ma'i steng du yi ge h'um dang phyag mtshan spro bsdu dang mngon bar byang chub pa'i rim pas rgyu'i rdo rje sems dpa' zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa sku mdog dkar po mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa rang snang ba'i yum dang 'khyud pa'i dgyes pa
analyzed: mtshams phyed gzugs sna tshogs kyi mdog can ge sar dang bcas pa'i dbus su zla ba dang / nyi ma'i steng du yi ge h'um dang phyag mtshan spro bsdu dang mngon bar byang chub pa'i rim pas rgyu'i rdo rje sems dpa' zhal bzhi phyag bcu gnyis pa sku mdog dkar po mtshan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa rang snang ba'i yum dang 'khyud pa'i dgyes pa
translated: In the center of the multicolored lotus with a yellow pistil, upon a moon and sun, the syllable hūṃ and the insignia emanate and reabsorb, and through the process of manifest enlightenment, the white causal Vajrasattva with four faces and twelve arms arises.🔽The great joy of the union with the self-appearing consort is the method. The buddhas of the ten directions enter into the mouth and emerge from the space and secret places as the twelve goddesses generated through the process of womb birth.

original: chen po sbyor bas @154b phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhal du zhugs nas mkha' gsang nas lha mo bcu gnyis mngal skyes kyi rim pas bskyed pa ni yab yum gnyis su med pa las lha mo bcu gnyis su med pa'i 'bras bu mchog bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: chen po sbyor bas @154b phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhal du zhugs nas mkha' gsang nas lha mo bcu gnyis mngal skyes kyi rim pas bskyed pa ni yab yum gnyis su med pa las lha mo bcu gnyis su med pa'i 'bras bu mchog bskyed pa'o //
translated: The supreme result is generated from the nondual father and mother and the twelve goddesses.

original: de nas yab yum byang chub kyi sems nyi zla'i thig le zhu ba'i tshul ni byang chub sems dri ma med pa chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de nas yab yum byang chub kyi sems nyi zla'i thig le zhu ba'i tshul ni byang chub sems dri ma med pa chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Then the method of the melting of the bodhicitta of the father and mother as the vital drops of the sun and moon is the bodhicitta without stains, the dharmakāya.

original: mngal skyes kyi 'od zer gyis bslang ba lha mo bcu gnyis kyi glu lnga po 'dis chos kyi skur zhu ba la skul byed do //
analyzed: mngal skyes kyi 'od zer gyis bslang ba lha mo bcu gnyis kyi glu lnga po 'dis chos kyi skur zhu ba la skul byed do //
translated: The twelve goddesses who are aroused by the light rays of the womb-born [buddha] are urged to dissolve into the dharmakāya by these five songs.

original: dga' ba ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i sgo nas bstod pa ni /
analyzed: dga' ba ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i sgo nas bstod pa ni /
translated: The praise from the perspective of the wheel of exalted wisdom of joy is as follows.

original: h'um rol cig rol cig dgyes pa ho ni ye shes kyi lha mo bzhi la rol cig pa'o //
analyzed: h'um rol cig rol cig dgyes pa ho ni ye shes kyi lha mo bzhi la rol cig pa'o //
translated: Play, play, delight, ho! means play with the four goddesses of exalted wisdom.

original: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rgyud las ye shes kyi padmo'i gnas 'di nyid du lha mo bzhi'i bdag mor bzhengs su gsol na /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rgyud las ye shes kyi padmo'i gnas 'di nyid du lha mo bzhi'i bdag mor bzhengs su gsol na /
translated: The great bliss vajra is the exalted wisdom of uniformity. In this very place of the lotus of exalted wisdom, please arise as the mistress of the four goddesses.

original: aa la la la ho dgyes pa che /
analyzed: aa la la la ho dgyes pa che /
translated: A la la la ho! is great delight.

original: da ni thugs kyi 'khor lo chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni thugs kyi 'khor lo chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa ni /
translated: Now, the praise from the perspective of the exalted wisdom of the dharmadhātu of the wheel of mind is as follows.

original: khyod ni bde ba mchog yin te ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: khyod ni bde ba mchog yin te ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: You are supreme bliss is the exalted wisdom of emptiness.

original: khyod kyi sprul pa'i sku'i zhal khums ba tsam gyis bdag cag thugs kyi 'khor lo'i lha mo rnams kyis bde ba stong pa nyid kyi ro gcig pa rnyed pas kye ma bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i rigs kyi bde ba chen po dgyes pa rdo rje sems dpa' khyod
analyzed: khyod kyi sprul pa'i sku'i zhal khums ba tsam gyis bdag cag thugs kyi 'khor lo'i lha mo rnams kyis bde ba stong pa nyid kyi ro gcig pa rnyed pas kye ma bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i rigs kyi bde ba chen po dgyes pa rdo rje sems dpa' khyod
translated: Oh Bhagavān, great bliss of the vajra family, Hevajra, Vajrasattva,

original: kyis nyams dgu /
analyzed: kyis nyams dgu /
translated: you have the nine experiences🔽and the supreme experience of the four joys.

original: dga' ba bzhi'i nyams kyi mchog gis rdo rje'i rigs kyi dgyes pa'i bde ba rnams dus rtag tu dngos grub kun gyi phyir bdag thugs kyi lha mo rnams la dga' ba bzhi pa rol cig rol cig par mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi'i nyams kyi mchog gis rdo rje'i rigs kyi dgyes pa'i bde ba rnams dus rtag tu dngos grub kun gyi phyir bdag thugs kyi lha mo rnams la dga' ba bzhi pa rol cig rol cig par mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: Always for the sake of all powers, play with us, the goddesses of mind, in the bliss of the joy of the vajra family.

original: thugs kyi 'khor lo'i lha mo brgyad po thams cad dang / bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dbang po brgyad sprul nas /
analyzed: thugs kyi 'khor lo'i lha mo brgyad po thams cad dang / bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dbang po brgyad sprul nas /
translated: All eight goddesses of the mind wheel and the eight sense faculties of Bhagavān Great Vajradhara emanate.

original: lha mo padma la dgyes par rol /
analyzed: lha mo padma la dgyes par rol /
translated: They play in the lotus of the goddess.

original: h'um aa la la la ho dgyes pa che //
analyzed: h'um aa la la la ho dgyes pa che //
translated: Hum ah la la la ho great joy.

original: de ltar thugs kyi sgo nas bstod nas //
analyzed: de ltar thugs kyi sgo nas bstod nas //
translated: Having thus praised from the perspective of the mind,

original: gsung gi sgo nas bstod pa ni /
analyzed: gsung gi sgo nas bstod pa ni /
translated: The praise from the perspective of speech is:

original: bcom ldan 'das so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs kyis sems can 'dod pa la khyod dgyes pas 'dod pa'i dngos grub gsol ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs kyis sems can 'dod pa la khyod dgyes pas 'dod pa'i dngos grub gsol ba de'i phyir /
translated: Bhagavat, with the assembly of the wisdom of discernment, you are pleased with the desires of sentient beings, and you request the spiritual power of desire.

original: gsung gi 'khor lo'i lha mo brgyad kyi padma mchog la dgyes par rol /
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor lo'i lha mo brgyad kyi padma mchog la dgyes par rol /
translated: Therefore, you enjoy the supreme lotus of the eight goddesses of the wheel of speech.

original: h'um aa la la la ho dgyes pa che /
analyzed: h'um aa la la la ho dgyes pa che /
translated: Hum ah la la la ho, great joy!

original: gsung gi 'khor lo'i sgo nas /
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor lo'i sgo nas /
translated: From the perspective of the wheel of speech.

original: sku'i 'khor lo'i bstod pa ni /
analyzed: sku'i 'khor lo'i bstod pa ni /
translated: The praise from the perspective of the wheel of body is:

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bde bas sems can la dus rtag @155a * //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bde bas sems can la dus rtag @155a * //
translated: With the bliss of the assembly of mirrorlike wisdom, you always hold the supreme vajra, the spiritual power of the body, for sentient beings.

original: tu rdo rje mchog sku'i dngos grub 'dzin pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i 'khor lo'i lha mo brgyad kyi kha sbyor gyi bde bas padma la dga' ba bzhi'i rol par mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: tu rdo rje mchog sku'i dngos grub 'dzin pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i 'khor lo'i lha mo brgyad kyi kha sbyor gyi bde bas padma la dga' ba bzhi'i rol par mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: With the bliss of the union of the eight goddesses of the wheel of the body of Vairocana, enjoy the lotus of the four joys.

original: dpe ji lta bu zhe na zhe na zhes pa'i dpe ni bung ba'o //
analyzed: dpe ji lta bu zhe na zhe na zhes pa'i dpe ni bung ba'o //
translated: What is the example? The example is a bee.

original: bde ba stong pa'i dpe ni sbrang rtsi'o //
analyzed: bde ba stong pa'i dpe ni sbrang rtsi'o //
translated: The example of bliss and emptiness is honey.

original: lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i dpe ni padma'o //
analyzed: lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo'i dpe ni padma'o //
translated: The example of the navel emanation wheel is a lotus.🔽The example of the body wheel is the eight goddesses who play with the lotus.

original: sku'i 'khor lo'i dpe ni lha mo brgyad ni padma la rol pas kye ma ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: sku'i 'khor lo'i dpe ni lha mo brgyad ni padma la rol pas kye ma ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Kye ma is amazing.

original: grogs po ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen no //
analyzed: grogs po ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen no //
translated: A friend is a spiritual friend.

original: dgyes chen ni bde ba stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dgyes chen ni bde ba stong pa nyid do //
translated: Great joy is bliss-emptiness.

original: 'dir ni bha ga'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni bha ga'o //
translated: Here it is the bhaga.

original: rdo rje mchog ni sa bcu gcu gcig pa'i bde ba la sbyar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mchog ni sa bcu gcu gcig pa'i bde ba la sbyar bya'o //
translated: The supreme vajra is the bliss of the eleventh stage.

original: dus thams cad du bde ba stong pa nyid kyis sems can la pan par mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du bde ba stong pa nyid kyis sems can la pan par mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: Always, with bliss-emptiness, you should benefit sentient beings.

original: dus da lta nyid du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyu'i rkyen 'dus pa las skye bar mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: dus da lta nyid du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyu'i rkyen 'dus pa las skye bar mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: Now, at this very time, you should generate the conditions for the cause of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: aa la la la ho dgyes pa che //
analyzed: aa la la la ho dgyes pa che //
translated: A la la la ho is great joy.

original: sku'i 'khor lo'i bstod pa bshad nas /
analyzed: sku'i 'khor lo'i bstod pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the praise of the body wheel,

original: dam tshig gi 'khor lo la bstod pa ni /
analyzed: dam tshig gi 'khor lo la bstod pa ni /
translated: the praise of the commitment wheel is:

original: bde chen ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: bde chen ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
translated: Great bliss is the gnosis of purposeful activity.

original: kun du ni phyogs thams cad du'o //
analyzed: kun du ni phyogs thams cad du'o //
translated: Everywhere is in all directions.

original: dgyes pa mchog ni bde ba stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dgyes pa mchog ni bde ba stong pa nyid do //
translated: The supreme joy is the emptiness of bliss.

original: rol zhes pa ni dam tshig gi lha mo brgyad kyi bdag po mdzod cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: rol zhes pa ni dam tshig gi lha mo brgyad kyi bdag po mdzod cig ces pa'o //
translated: The play is the request to the Lord of the eight pledge goddesses to be the master.

original: aa la la la ho //
analyzed: aa la la la ho //
translated: A la la ho.

original: aa ni don dam byang chub sems so //
analyzed: aa ni don dam byang chub sems so //
translated: A is the ultimate mind of enlightenment.

original: la gsum ni dga' ba mchog dga' ba mchog dga' lhan skyes dga' ba'o //
analyzed: la gsum ni dga' ba mchog dga' ba mchog dga' lhan skyes dga' ba'o //
translated: The three la are the supreme joy, the supreme joy, and the innate joy.

original: ho dgyes pa chen po ni rnam pa thams cad kyi 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: ho dgyes pa chen po ni rnam pa thams cad kyi 'od gsal lo //
translated: The ho is the great joy, the clear light of all aspects.

original: 'dir sku gsung thugs med na ci'i phyir bstod snyam na /
analyzed: 'dir sku gsung thugs med na ci'i phyir bstod snyam na /
translated: Here, if there is no body, speech, and mind, why is there praise?

original: gtso bo'i dpral ba dang / lkog ma dang / snying ga na sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo dang ldan no //
analyzed: gtso bo'i dpral ba dang / lkog ma dang / snying ga na sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo dang ldan no //
translated: The principal one has the body, speech, and mind wheels in the forehead, throat, and heart.

original: 'khor lo lnga la bstod par rin chen rdo rjes bshad do //
analyzed: 'khor lo lnga la bstod par rin chen rdo rjes bshad do //
translated: Ratnavajra explains that the praise is to the five wheels.

original: glu 'dis bskul ma thag tu mngon bar byang chub pa lnga las bzhengs pa'i bcom ldan 'das dam tshig gi bde ba mchog 'khor lha mo bcu gnyis kyis bskor ba dang bcas par rang nyid blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: glu 'dis bskul ma thag tu mngon bar byang chub pa lnga las bzhengs pa'i bcom ldan 'das dam tshig gi bde ba mchog 'khor lha mo bcu gnyis kyis bskor ba dang bcas par rang nyid blta bar bya ste /
translated: Immediately after being invoked by this song, the Bhagavān, the supreme pledge bliss, who has arisen from the five manifest enlightenments, should be seen by oneself, together with the retinue of twelve goddesses.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das ni zhal mdun ma sngo ba /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das ni zhal mdun ma sngo ba /
translated: The Bhagavān has a blue face in front,

original: g-yas pa ser ba /
analyzed: g-yas pa ser ba /
translated: a yellow right face,

original: rgyab ma dmar ba /
analyzed: rgyab ma dmar ba /
translated: a red back face,

original: g-yon ljang ba /
analyzed: g-yon ljang ba /
translated: and a green left face.

original: thugs kyi 'khor lo bzhin du g-yas skor yin par nges so //
analyzed: thugs kyi 'khor lo bzhin du g-yas skor yin par nges so //
translated: It is certain that the faces are in a clockwise direction, like the mind wheel.

original: zhal bzhi ni gdul bya lus kyi dkyil 'khor bsgom pa la mos pa la sa chu me rlung bzhi'i rtsa bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhal bzhi ni gdul bya lus kyi dkyil 'khor bsgom pa la mos pa la sa chu me rlung bzhi'i rtsa bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: The four faces show the meditation on the four nāḍīs of earth, water, fire, and wind for those interested in meditating on the maṇḍala of the body of the disciple.

original: spyan gsum ston pa ni rtsa gsum sgoms shig pa'o //
analyzed: spyan gsum ston pa ni rtsa gsum sgoms shig pa'o //
translated: The display of three eyes is the meditation on the three nāḍīs.

original: phyag bcu gnyis bstan pa ni rtsa bcu gnyis @155b sgoms shig pa'o //
analyzed: phyag bcu gnyis bstan pa ni rtsa bcu gnyis @155b sgoms shig pa'o //
translated: The display of twelve arms is the meditation on the twelve nāḍīs.

original: 'jigs byed dus mtshan mnan pas ni 'og sgo gnyis kyi rtsa dgag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs byed dus mtshan mnan pas ni 'og sgo gnyis kyi rtsa dgag pa'o //
translated: The supine Bhairava and Kālarātri are the blocked lower two doors.

original: rdo rje dril bu bsnams pas mig dang gzugs kyi rtsa 'gegs pa'o //🔽gnyis kyis tshogs bdag gi pags pa 'dzin pa ni rna ba dang sgra'i rtsa 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu bsnams pas mig dang gzugs kyi rtsa 'gegs pa'o // gnyis kyis tshogs bdag gi pags pa 'dzin pa ni rna ba dang sgra'i rtsa 'gegs pa'o //
translated: The vajra and bell block the eye and form nāḍīs.🔽The two holding the skin of Gaṇeśa block the ear and sound nāḍīs.

original: cang te'u dang kha tv'am ga rnams ni sna dang dri'i rtsa 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: cang te'u dang kha tv'am ga rnams ni sna dang dri'i rtsa 'gegs pa'o //
translated: The ḍamaru and khaṭvāṅga block the nose and smell nāḍīs.

original: dgra sta dang zhags pa ni lce dang ro'i rtsa 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: dgra sta dang zhags pa ni lce dang ro'i rtsa 'gegs pa'o //
translated: The axe and noose block the tongue and taste channel.

original: gri gug dang ka p'a la ni lus dang reg bya'i rtsa 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: gri gug dang ka p'a la ni lus dang reg bya'i rtsa 'gegs pa'o //
translated: The curved knife and skull block the body and touch channel.

original: mdung rtse gsum pa dang bdud bzhi'i mag bo ni yid dang chos kyi rtsa 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: mdung rtse gsum pa dang bdud bzhi'i mag bo ni yid dang chos kyi rtsa 'gegs pa'o //
translated: The trident and the heads of the four demons block the mind and dharma channel.

original: ral pa'i cod pan ni spyi gtsug gi rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: ral pa'i cod pan ni spyi gtsug gi rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis ston to //
translated: The topknot and diadem show the thirty-two channels of the crown.

original: thod pa'i phreng ba 'phyang bas ni spyi gtsug gi byang chub kyi sems babs pas ye shes lnga bskyed par ston to //
analyzed: thod pa'i phreng ba 'phyang bas ni spyi gtsug gi byang chub kyi sems babs pas ye shes lnga bskyed par ston to //
translated: The hanging garland of skulls shows the descent of bodhicitta from the crown, generating the five awarenesses.

original: zla ba phyed pas ni spyi gtsug gi byang chub kyi sems ston to //
analyzed: zla ba phyed pas ni spyi gtsug gi byang chub kyi sems ston to //
translated: The half-moon shows the bodhicitta of the crown.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje ni spyi gtsug gi rtsa dz'a landha ra na gnas par ston to //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje ni spyi gtsug gi rtsa dz'a landha ra na gnas par ston to //
translated: The crossed vajra shows the jālandhara channel at the crown.

original: mche ba gtsigs pa ni sna bug gnyis kyi rtsa 'gegs par ston go //
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs pa ni sna bug gnyis kyi rtsa 'gegs par ston go //
translated: The bared fangs show the blocking of the two nostrils’ channels.

original: nyams dgu ni 'byung ba lda dang bdud rtsi lnga'i rtsa ston to //
analyzed: nyams dgu ni 'byung ba lda dang bdud rtsi lnga'i rtsa ston to //
translated: The nine expressions show the channels of the five elements and five amṛtas.

original: nam mkha' dang byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa gcig yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsa gcig yin no //
translated: Space and the channel of bodhicitta are one.

original: stag gi bags pas ni lte ba sprul ba'i 'khor lo'i drug cu rtsa bzhi ston to //
analyzed: stag gi bags pas ni lte ba sprul ba'i 'khor lo'i drug cu rtsa bzhi ston to //
translated: The tiger skin shows the sixty-four [channels] of the emanation cakra at the navel.

original: mgo bo'i phreng bas ni ras n'a dang la la n'a'i rtsa gnyis ston to //
analyzed: mgo bo'i phreng bas ni ras n'a dang la la n'a'i rtsa gnyis ston to //
translated: The garland of heads shows the two channels rasanā and lalanā.

original: dbang po drug gi rtsa bkag pas phyag rgya drug gi rtsa ston to //
analyzed: dbang po drug gi rtsa bkag pas phyag rgya drug gi rtsa ston to //
translated: The six sense organs blocked shows the six channel goddesses.

original: rdo rje phag mo ni rtsa aa wa dh'u t'i'i gtum mo drod ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo ni rtsa aa wa dh'u t'i'i gtum mo drod ston pa yin no //
translated: Vajravārāhī shows the heat of the caṇḍālī of the central channel.

original: yum gyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni rgyud na gsal lo //
analyzed: yum gyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshan ni rgyud na gsal lo //
translated: The colors and implements of the mother are clear in the tantra.🔽The abode of all phenomena is bliss.

original: chos kun gnas ni bde ba yin// zhes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i he ru ka dang 'khor rnams mngon par byang chub pa lnga las skyes par ston te /
analyzed: chos kun gnas ni bde ba yin// zhes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i he ru ka dang 'khor rnams mngon par byang chub pa lnga las skyes par ston te /
translated: This shows that the causal and resultant Herukas and the retinue are born from the five manifest awakenings.

original: a'a li me long lta bu dang / k'a li mnyam pa nyid dang / chos kun gzhi yig 'bru dang / phyag mtshan so sor rtog pa'i dge ba dang / 'od zer spro bsdu bya ba nan tan rtog pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: a'a li me long lta bu dang / k'a li mnyam pa nyid dang / chos kun gzhi yig 'bru dang / phyag mtshan so sor rtog pa'i dge ba dang / 'od zer spro bsdu bya ba nan tan rtog pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: The vowels are the mirror-like [wisdom], the consonants are the wisdom of equality, all phenomena are the wisdom of discrimination, the seed syllables and hand implements are the wisdom of striving, and the emission and re-absorption of light rays are the wisdom of reality just as it is.

original: chos dang chos nyid spangs pa'i ye shes lnga pa sku bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos nyid spangs pa'i ye shes lnga pa sku bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The fifth, the wisdom that abandons phenomena and dharmatā, is the accomplishment of the body.

original: padma'i 'dab ma la gnas pa'i lha mo bzhi dang / ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i bum pa bzhi dang / thod pa ni rgyud na gsal bsam bshad do //
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma la gnas pa'i lha mo bzhi dang / ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i bum pa bzhi dang / thod pa ni rgyud na gsal bsam bshad do //
translated: The four goddesses abiding on the lotus petals, the four vases of the gnosis wheel, and the skull cups are explained in the tantra.

original: gri gug gi phreng bas bskor ba kha bskang ngo //🔽khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i sgo ma bzhi zhal gyi kha dog dang mthun pa dang / mtshams kyi lha @156a * //

original: spyi bor aom las sku'i 'khor lo //
analyzed: spyi bor aom las sku'i 'khor lo //

original: nu ma gnyis su he las ye shes kyi 'khor lo //
analyzed: nu ma gnyis su he las ye shes kyi 'khor lo //

analyzed: lte bar kham las dam tshig gi 'khor lo //

analyzed: de'i steng du @156b dpa' bo dang yum gyi sngags dang lha mo rnams kyi sngags zhi ba la dkar po //
